title: UGK 4 Life
info: With the death of Pimp C in 2007, this is the last album for the UGK.

title: A Piece Of What You Need
info: The fourth album for the London-born artist was produced by Marius de Vries.

title: Don't Do Anything
info: This is the first album not produced by T-Bone Burnett for the California-born singer-songwriter Sam Phillips.

title: Vieux Farka Toure
info: This is the debut album for the son of the late Mali musician Ali Farka Toure.

title: The Letting Go
info: Jim White and Paul Oldham are among the guests on prolific songwriter Will Oldham's latest Bonnie "Prince" Billy studio recording.

title: The Royal Society
info: Chris Goss (Kyuss) produced this second album for the UK rockers.

title: Modern Apprentice
info: The London art rockers have changed their lineup for this sophomore release, dropping bassist Jon Ball for Tracy Bellaries. Alex Newport (At The Drive In, Icarus Line) produces.

title: Inches
info: 'Inches' compiles A- and B- sides from nine different singles (originally released on nine different labels) dating back to the Rhode Island band's inception in 1995.

title: The Violet Hour
info: The London-based band follow their singles collection ('Suburban Light') with this, their first true studio LP, which continues their hazy, 60s-influenced sound developed in those earlier songs.

title: The Fine Art of Self-Destruction
info: Frontman of New York-based glam-rockers D Generation throughtout the 1990s, singer-songwriter Jesse Malin enlisted pal Ryan Adams to produce and play on this solo debut, which quickly garnered plaudits from the UK music press upon its fall 2002 release.

title: Cobblestone Runway
info: The Canadian singer-songwriter's fifth album finds Sexsmith experimenting with electronica for the first time.

title: Lift Your Skinny Fists Like Antennas to Heaven
info: The second proper album from the Canadian instrumentalists consists of four independent works(each 18-22 minutes long).... yes, that's 2 songs per CD.

title: Nixon
info: The 13-piece outfit from Nashville (that isn't a country band) returns with a concept album about the former president (that really isn't about the former president). It's one of those things that you have to hear to understand.

title: Heal
info: The fourth full-length release (and the first on Dead Oceans) from Indiana singer-songwriter Tim Showalter features contribution from J. Mascis and was produced by Ben Vehorn.

title: Two Dancers
info: The second album for the quartet was produced with Richard Formby.

title: Memories Are Now
info: The fourth full-length solo release for singer-songwriter the was produced by Blake Mills.

title: Carrion Crawler/The Dream
info: This is the second album in 2011 for the alternative rock band led by John Dwyer.

title: Autobiography
info: The electronic producer worked with choreographer Wayne McGregor to create this score for his contemporary dance piece of the same name.

title: Fantasize Your Ghost
info: The second full-length release for the Chicago duo of Sima Cunningham and Macie Stewart was recorded over six days with producer Chris Cohen.

title: The Excitement Plan
info: The latest album for the alt-country singer was produced by Don Was.

title: Petals for Armor
info: The debut full-length solo release for the Paramore singer was produced by Taylor York.

title: Slaughterhouse
info: This is the first album Ty Segall has recorded with his touring band.

title: Soft Sounds From Another Planet
info: The second full-length release for Michelle Zauner solo project was produced with Craig Hendrix.

title: DJ-Kicks
info: The latest DJ-Kicks mix series features 11 exclusive edits from Detroit's Kenny Dixon, Jr. (aka Moodymann).

title: Senjutsu
info: The 17th full-length studio release for the British metal band is its first in nearly six years and was produced by Kevin Shirley.

title: One Kind Favor
info: The blues legend releases his latest album produced by T Bone Burnett.

title: Need to Feel Your Love
info: The full-length debut release for the Philadelphia rock quintet was produced by the band's bassist Hart Seely.

title: Harmonicraft
info: The third full-length album for the metal quartet from Miami was produced by the band's guitarist, Kurt Ballou.

title: Aviary
info: The fifth full-length release for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter was inspired in part by a 2009 short story by Lebanese-American poet and essayist Etel Adnan.

title: In The 7th Moon, The Chief Turned Into A Swimming Fish And Ate The Head Of His Enemy By Magic
info: The latest album for the supergroup of 25 musicians from the Democratic Republic of the Congo features both traditional and contemporary instruments.

title: I've Been Trying to Tell You
info: The 10th full-length release for the British trio of Sarah Cracknell, Bob Stanley and Pete Wiggs was recorded remotely with field recordings and samples from 1997-2001.

title: TNGHT [EP]
info: The five-track EP is the debut release from the collaboration between Hudson Mohawke and Lunice.

title: Patch the Sky
info: The latest solo release from the former Husker Dü singer was written in solitude.

title: Turn Out the Lights
info: The second full-length studio release for the Memphis singer-songwriter was self-produced and mixed by Craig Silvey.

title: Circles
info: The sixth and final studio release for the rapper was completed with the help of Jon Brion.

title: Your Life Is a Record
info: The third full-length studio release for the country singer-songwriter was produced by Jay Joyce.

title: Out of Season
info: The first solo outing for Portishead's Beth Gibbons finds her teaming up with former Talk Talk bassist Paul "Rustin' Man" Webb on a largely acoustic, melodic collection of 10 tracks.

title: Truly She Is None Other
info: A former member of Billy Childish's band Thee Headcoatees, Holly Golightly has gained a wider following in recent months due to her guest appearance on The White Stripes' 'Elephant.' New devotees will have a lot to discover: this is her ninth solo album since 1995.

title: July
info: The sixth studio release for the Boston singer-songwriter is her first on the Sacred Bones label.

title: uknowhatimsayin¿
info: The fifth full-length studio release from the Detroit rapper features guest appearances from Blood Orange, JPEGMAFIA, Obongjayar, and Run The Jewels.

title: Lament
info: The latest full-length studio release for the Los Angeles post-hardcore quintet was produced by Ross Robinson.

title: Y Dydd Olaf
info: The debut solo release for the Pipettes' Gwenno Saunders is sung in Welsh except for one track in Cornish.

title: Us
info: The fourth album for the Minnesota-based artist features guests David "Stokley" Williams, Chuck D, Freeway, and Joell Ortiz.

title: Clark
info: The seventh release for Berlin-based IDM producer Chris Clark was recorded in a barn in rural England.

title: Hinterland
info: The second full-length release for Julie Campbell as LoneLady is her first in five years.

title: My Father Will Guide Me Up a Rope to the Sky
info: Releasing their first album in 1983, the New York City post-punk band's new album picks up where they left off with the dark vision, intense rhythms and musical intensity that made them trailblazers for the industrial music movement.

title: Anticlines
info: The sixth full-length release for the Colombian experimental producer features spoken-word sections she created with Henry Andersen.

title: Live in Paris
info: The first live release for the indie rock band was recorded at Paris' La Cigale on March 20th, 2015.

title: Looping State of Mind
info: Stockholm-based Alex Willner continues his ambient techno style on his third album.

title: The Bright Mississippi
info: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame producer/musician from New Orleans releases his first major jazz album produced by Joe Henry.

title: The Odds
info: The third full-length release for the Washington DC punk duo of Amy Farina and Ian MacKaye is their first album in six years.

title: Ugly
info: Steve Albini produced the fifth album for the New Jersey punk trio.

title: Look Now
info: The first album for Costello with the Imposters since 2008's Momofuku was co-produced Sebastian Krys and features a guest appearance from  Burt Bacharach.

title: Food & Liquor
info: Championed by Jay-Z and Kanye West, the Chicago MC finally makes his full-length debut with this 16-track disc.

title: The Navigator
info: The sixth full-length release for the folk-blues band is a concept album focuses on a young woman named Navita as she travels through a burning city and learns who she really is.

title: Real Animal
info: The ninth solo album for the former punk rocker was produced by Tony Visconti.

title: Dose Your Dreams
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Canadian punk band continues the story of David Eliade (the character in the song "David Comes to Life") and features contributions from Jennifer Castle, J Mascis, Owen Pallett, and Lido Pimienta.

title: Old
info: The third full-length release for the Detroit rapper features Ab-Soul, A$AP Rocky, Charli XCX, Freddie Gibbs, Purity Ring, Schoolboy Q, Scrufizzer, and Zelooperz as guests.

title: I Hate Music
info: The tenth full-length studio release for the North Carolina Alternative rock band led by Mac McCaughan is said to be a darker album than 2010's Majesty Shredding.

title: Trust in the Lifeforce of the Deep Mystery
info: The second full-length release for the London-based jazz trio of Max Hallett, Shabaka Hutchings and Dan Leavers features a guest appearance from Kate Tempest.

title: Silver Bell
info: Originally recorded in 2000 for A&M Records, the "lost" album (including "Top of the World" and "Truth #2" covered by the Dixie Chicks on its 2002's release) is newly mixed by Glyn Johns and features Emmylou Harris on "Truth #2".

title: Hospice
info: This is the second album for the Peter Silberman-led band.

title: Like the River Loves the Sea
info: The seventh full-length solo release for the Kentucky-based singer-songwriter was produced with Sir James Elkington and recorded in Iceland.

title: A Color of the Sky
info: the third full-length release for the New York indie rock band was self-produced and recorded.
The surprise release for Donald Glover features guest appearances from 21 Savage, Ariana Grande, and SZA.

title: We Rose from Your Bed with the Sun in Our Head [Live]
info: Originally released as a limited 1,000 copy run, the live album features recordings from the band's 2010-11 tour for its 2010 release, My Father Will Guide Me up a Rope to the Sky.

title: Game Theory
info: The hip-hop collective's eighth album is their first for Def Jam records, and also features the return to the group of rapper Malik B.

title: Konnichiwa
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the  British grime artist features guest appearances from BBK, D Double E, ASAP Nast, JME, Novelist, Wiley, Pharrell Williams and Young Lord.

title: Faith in Strangers
info: The fourth full-length solo release from the Manchester-based electronic producer features Alison Skidmore on vocals.

title: Sorrow: Reimagining of Gorecki's 3rd Symphony
info: The saxophonist worked with a 12-piece band that included such artists as Arcade Fire's Sarah Neufeld, Saltland's Rebecca Foon, Greg Fox of Liturgy, Megan Stetson on his reimagination of Górecki's Symphony No. 3.

title: Isolation Drills
info: The latest release from GBV is a continuation of the band's new, more polished sound introduced on 1999's 'Do The Collapse.'

title: Tempest
info: Produced by Jack Frost, the 35th studio album from the singer-songwriter was released in 2012, the 50th anniversary of his debut album.

title: Heavy Lifter
info: The third full-length release for the Austin duo of Charlie Martin and Will Taylor was produced with Ben Littlejohn.

title: Whole New Mess
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter features new sparser recordings with just her voice and guitar of several tracks from 2019's All Mirrors.

title: The Party
info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was self-produced.

title: Control System
info: The rap album for the Black Hippy member is his debut full-length solo release on the Top Dawg Entertainment label.

title: Blunderbuss
info: With the end of The White Stripes, Jack White releases his debut solo album about love and relationships gone wrong.

title: Light Upon the Lake
info: The debut full-length release from the band that includes Smith Westerns' Max Kakacek and Julien Ehrlich as well as Will Miller, Malcolm Brown, Print Chouteau, Josiah Marshall and Charles Glanders was produced by Foxygen’s Jonathan Rado.

title: Apologies To The Queen Mary
info: The Montreal band's Sub Pop debut was co-produced by Modest Mouse's Isaac Brock.

title: Love
info: If the concept of "The Beatles, remixed" saddens you, know that original Beatles producer George Martin was at the helm for this project, which serves as the soundtrack to the Vegas-based Cirque du Soleil show of the same name. The 26 mashed-up tracks here were augmented with additional instrumentation and vocals performed by The Beatles themselves, culled from hours of original demo and master tapes, with pieces of 130 songs ultimately represented in some form.

title: Until the Quiet Comes
info: Erykah Badu, Laura Darlington, Niki Randa, Thundercat, and Thom Yorke guest on the fourth release for the California electronic producer.

title: While I'm Livin'
info: The first full-length album of new material in 17 years from the country legend was produced by Brandi Carlile and Shooter Jennings.

title: Stranger Things, Vol. 1 [Original Television Series Soundtrack]
info: The first volume of the soundtrack to the Netflix show from Kyle Dixon & Michael Stein feature 36 tracks.

title: Amygdala
info: The first solo releases in nine years from electronic producer Stefan Kozalla features guest appearances from Caribou, Apparat, Hildegard Knef, Matthew Dear, Ada, Milosh, and Dirk von Lotzow.

title: Foil Deer
info: The second full-length major studio release for the Massachusetts indie rock band led by Sadie Dupuis was produced with Nicolas Vernhes.

title: Open Your Heart
info: The third album from the Brooklyn quartet includes influences from country, psych, and rock music.

title: Attack On Memory
info: The second album for Cleveland's Cloud Nothings was produced by Steve Albini.

title: Like Red On A Rose
info: The country singer's second 2006 album is another change-of-pace: a disc full of love songs produced by Alison Krauss.

title: Southern Air
info: The eighth full-length release from the rock band led by Ryan Key and produced with Neal Avron features guest appearances from  Alex Gaskarth of All Time Low, Tay Jardine of We Are The In Crowd, and Cassadee Pope of Hey Monday.

title: Skeleton
info: The third album for the Los Angeles-area punk-rock band.

title: Nonagon Infinity
info: The eighth full-length release for the Australian psychedelic rock group was created to flow seamlessly to each following track and be able to be played in a infinite loop.

title: case/lang/veirs
info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Neko Case, k.d. lang and Laura Veirs was produced by Tucker Martine.

title: Saturn
info: The second full-length release for the British R&B artist features guest appearances from Kwabs and SiR.

title: Still Brazy
info: The second full-length studio release for the Compton rapper features guest appearances from Bricc Baby, Burnt Out, Drake, The Homegirl, Kamaiyah, Lil Wayne, Joe Moses, Nipsey Hussle, Sad Boy, and Slim 400.

title: Gargoyle
info: The latest release for the alternative rock artist features guest appearances from Josh Homme, Greg Dulli and Duke Garwood.

title: Wildflower
info: The second full-length release for the Australian electronic band comes 16 years after its debut album Since I Left You with features guest appearances from Ariel Pink, David Berman, Jean-Michel Bernard, Biz Markie, Danny Brown, Camp Lo, Jonathan Donahue, Warren Ellis, Jennifer Herrema, Father John Misty, MF Doom, Paris Pershun and Toro y Moi.

title: Deserted
info: The first full-length studio release in eight years for the British punk collective was recorded near the Joshua Tree desert.

title: The Prodigal Son
info: The first new full-length solo release in six years for the guitarist was produced with his son, Joachim Cooder.

title: EX EYE
info: This is the debut four-track release for black metal/post-metal project that includes Colin Stetson, Liturgy's Greg Fox, Shahzad Ismaily, and Toby Summerfield.

title: Ill Manors
info: The third release for the British musician is a companion piece to the film he wrote and directed, also named Ill Manors.

title: Hot Sauce Committee, Pt. 2
info: The Brooklyn-based hip-hop legends return with their eighth studio album.

title: Ø (Disambiguation)
info: The Christian rockers return with their fifth album of metalcore, the first release without founding member Aaron Gillespie.

title: Faking The Books
info: This is the third LP for the German electro-pop outfit led by vocalist Valerie Trebeljahr and guitarist Markus Acher (also of The Notwist).

title: The Remote Part
info: The third album for the Scottish rockers is already a big hit with UK music fans, helped by the success of lead single "You Held the World in Your Arms."

title: White Men Are Black Men Too
info: The follow-up for the Edinburgh trio's Mercury-winning debut release was recording while on tour.

title: Visions of Us on the Land
info: The 12th release for the Seattle indie singer-songwriter is the final album in his trilogy of albums that began with 2012's Maraqopa and was produced by Richard Swift.

title: Black Encyclopedia of the Air
info: The fifth full-length release for Philadelphia artist features guest appearances from BFLY, Black Quantum Futurism, Brother May, Elucid, Antonia Gabriela, Dudù Kouate, lojii, Maassai, Elaine Mitchener, Nappy Nina, Pink Siifu, Saydah Ruz, Orion Sun, and Yatta.

title: Between My Head and the Sky
info: The first album credited to the Yoko Ono Plastic Ono Band since 1975 features Keigo "Cornelius" Oyamada, Yuka Honda (of Cibo Matto), and her son/producer Sean Lennon.

title: Unflesh
info: The second full-length release for Elizabeth Bernholz as Gazelle Twin includes production from Benge.

title: Loner
info: The third full-length release for the singer-songwriter features influences from electronic, folk, pop, surf and punk music and was co-produced with Paul Butler.

title: No Answer: Lower Floors
info: The latest release for the Michigan noise rock band includes contributions from former members Aaron Dilloway, Mike Connelly, and new guitarist James Baljo.

title: Sour
info: The debut full-length release for the pop singer-songwriter features production from Dan Nigro, Alexander 23, and Jam City.

title: Skying
info: The third album for the British rock quintet was produced and recorded by the band.

title: As the Love Continues
info: The 10th full-length studio release for the Scottish post-rock band was produced by Dave Fridmann and features contributions from Atticus Ross and Colin Stetson.

title: Beyondless
info: The fourth full-length release for the Danish post-punk band features a guest appearance from Sky Ferreira and was produced by Nis Bysted.

title: In Search of Harperfield
info: The third solo release for the former Delgados band member was produced by her husband, Paul Savage.

title: Dead
info: This is the second full-length studio release for the Edinburgh-based hip-hop trio of Alloysious Massaquoi, Kayus Bankole, and Graham Hastings.

title: Nothing Feels Natural
info: The debut full-length release for the Washington, DC punk band was produced by Kevin Erickson.

title: The Besnard Lakes Are The Dark Horse
info: Album number two for the Canadian indie-rockers is their first for Jagjaguwar.

title: Grinderman 2
info: Nick Cave brings the experiences and sounds of his 30-year career to the table with the second release from his latest musical project since the Bad Seeds, with more of the trademark soaring piano, crunchy guitar, violins and mandolins to create an experimental new album.

title: Out of My Province
info: The third full-length release for the New Zealand singer-songwriter was produced by Trey Pollard and Matthew E. White.

title: The Return
info: The debut full-length studio release for the Australian rapper features guest appearances from Alien, Blue Lab Beats, Boadi, Jace XL, Krown, Lori, Mandarin Dreams, SILENTJAY, Steam Down, Sunburnt Soul Choir, Thando, Mwanje Tembo, Theresa Mutale Tembo, Whosane, and Ecca Vandal.

title: Devour
info: The fourth full-length release for Margaret Chardiet as Pharmakon was recorded live in studio by Uniform's Ben Greenberg.

title: Eyes on the Lines
info: The latest solo release for the singer-songwriter is his first on the Matador label.

title: Whelm
info: The debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced with Fabian Prynn.

title: Special Affections
info: Originally released in 2010 on Secret City Records, the debut full-length album for John O'Regan of the D'Urbervilles is rereleased on Astralwerks.

title: Hidden
info: The British rock band uses a vast variety of musical instruments and styles for its second album.

title: Uproot
info: After several years in Spain, Jace Clayton returns to New York with his latest album of electronic mixes.

title: New Amerykah: Part One (4th World War)
info: Erykah Badu's latest album was produced by 9th Wonder, Madlib, Mike "Chav" Chavarria, and Bilal.
After both rapping and producing on other artists' records, double-threat Blueprint finally combines his talents on his first solo disc. Aesop Rock, Illogic and Vast Aire guest.

title: Sung Tongs
info: The Brooklyn-based collective (on this release, reduced to the duo of Avey Tare and Panda Bear) combine vocal harmonies, a pair of acoustic guitars, and diverse influences into a unique sound on this latest release.

title: Escondida
info: 'Escondida' marks the first solo studio disc for the Texas-born folk singer-songwriter who also co-founded the Canadian group The Be Good Tanyas.

title: Good News For People Who Love Bad News
info: Produced by Dennis Herring (Camper Van Beethoven), the latest release from the Seattle-based indie rockers sees a return of guitarist Dann Gallucci (last with the band on Sad Sappy Sucker) and a new drummer (Benjamin Weikel) as well as a guest spot from the Dirty Dozen Brass Band.

title: Once In A Lifetime
info: This 3-disc attractively-packaged retrospective on the groundbreaking New York band includes completely remastered tracks from each of their studio LPs as well as the same previously-unreleased-on-CD demos and new tracks included on the earlier 2-disc Sand In the Vaseline complilation. Also included are never-before-released alternate versions of five songs. The set also contains a DVD with an updated version of the Talking Heads music video compilation Storytelling Giant, with three additional videos not found on the original VHS release.

title: Red Dirt Road
info: The duo of Kix Brooks and Ronnie Dunn return with a follow-up to 2001's 'Steers and Stripes.'

title: Me & Giuliani Down By the School Yard (A True Story) [EP]
info: Search engines hate them, but !!! (pronounced "Chik Chik Chik," of course) are popular with live audiences for their funkier, dancier (yes, that's a word--trust us) approach to indie music. The Sacramento band shares three members with Out Hud, and this is their 2-song debut for Touch And Go (with a full album to follow in 2004).

title: In Search Of... [Second Version]
info: This is the debut album for in-demand hip-hop production duo The Neptunes, recording with Shay under the name N.E.R.D. (for "No One Ever Really Dies"). Note that there are two different versions of this album in circulation. The original version, featuring mainly electronic instrumentation, was intended for release in August 2001 but was shelved by the band (only to be released in the UK over the band's objection). This new version, released March 2002, was completely rerecorded, and features live instrumentation by Minneapolis funk band Spymob.

title: lilac6
info: Brothers Nick and Stephen "Tin Tin" Duffy return for the Lilac Time's sixth LP. The Barenaked Ladies' Stephen Page also contributes to the album.

title: All Melody
info: The ninth full-length studio release for the German electronic composer/producer was recorded in his studio in the East Berlin Funkhaus building.

title: Wounded Rhymes
info: Sweden's Lykke Li continues to disarm listeners with her distinctive voice on her second album, keeping in tune with her tough sensuality and pop whimsy.

title: Mozart's Mini-Mart
info: The third full-length release for the indie rock band led by Lawrence (frontman for Felt and Denim) was produced with Papernut Cambridge's Ian Button.

title: Tryptych
info: Released separately in 2010 as three vinyl records, Forest of Evil, Liberation Through Hearing, and Voices of Dust are released together with additional tracks as a three-CD set for 2011.

title: Fear Fun
info: J. Tillman, the former drummer for Fleet Foxes releases his debut solo album as Father John Misty.

title: Follow Them True
info: The second full-length release for the British folk quintet led by singer Nicola Kearey was produced by the band's guitarist Ian Carter.

title: Majesty Shredding
info: This is the first studio album in nine years for the Chapel Hill, North Carolina, indie rock band Superchunk.

title: And Then Nothing Turned Itself Inside-Out
info: Aside from the noisy "Cherry Chapstick," the tracks on And Then Nothing showcase a mellower sound for the Hoboken, NJ three-piece, which disappointed some long-time fans but certainly won over critics.

title: Placeholder
info: The second full-length release for the Meg Duffy project was produced with Brad Cook.

title: Significant Changes
info: The debut full-length release for the Canadian DJ/producer features a guest appearance from Alexa Dash.

title: Reloaded
info: The New York rapper produced ten of the 15 tracks on his second full-length solo album that also features production from The Alchemist, The Arch Druids, Q-Tip, and Ray West.

title: L.A Witch
info: This is the debut full-length release for the Los Angeles trio of Sade Sanchez, Ellie English and Irita Pai.

title: Moodymann
info: The Detroit techno artist's latest release includes guest appearances from Amp Fiddler, Andres, and José James.

title: Be
info: The rapper's follow-up to 2002's love-it-or-hate-it 'Electric Circus' was produced largely by Kanye West. For some reason, John Mayer guests.

title: Megafaun
info: This is the fourth album for the North Carolina rock trio who at one time were in a band with Justin Vernon named DeYarmond Edison.

title: Typical System
info: This is the second full-length studio release for the Melbourne, Australia-based post-punk band formed by Dan Stewart and Mikey Young.

title: Night Network
info: The eighth full-length studio release for the British indie rock trio was recorded at the Foo Fighters' Los Angeles studio and was self-produced.

title: Working Men's Club
info: The debut full-length release for the British band led by Sydney Minsky-Sargeant was produced by Ross Orton.

title: Something About April II
info: The sequel to 2011's Something About April features guest appearances from Bilal, Karolina, Raphael Saadiq, and Stereolab's Laetitia Sadier.

title: Blaqkout
info: This is the first album to feature DJ Quik and Kurupt together.

title: Centralia
info: The sixth release of acoustic instrumentation and electronics for the Brooklyn-based duo was self-recorded, edited, and mixed.

title: Never Will
info: The second full-length release on Warner Music Nashville for the country artist was produced by Jay Joyce.

title: Brighter Than Creation's Dark
info: This is the first album since Jason Isbell left the band to pursue a solo career.

title: The Hunter
info: The Atlanta metal band's first album that is not a concept release was produced by Mike Elizondo.

title: A Winged Victory for the Sullen
artist: A Winged Victory for the Sullen
info: The duo of Dustin O'Halloran and Stars of the Lid's Adam Wiltzie release their debut album as A Winged Victory for the Sullen.

title: Scandalous
info: The retro-soul rock quartet, featuring an eight-piece horn section, offers up a funky blend of R&B and blues reminiscent of early J. Geils Band, James Brown, and Otis Redding.

title: Future Me Hates Me
info: The debut full-length release for the indie pop/rock quartet formed at the University of Auckland was produced by the band's guitarist Jonathan Pearce.

title: Surrounded by Time
info: The latest full-length covers release from the Welsh artist was co-produced by Ethan Johns and Mark Woodward.

title: Pangs
info: The second full-length release for the Scottish singer-songwriter was recorded by Julie McLarnon.

title: The Narrows
info: The eighth solo release for the Nashville-based California singer-songwriter was self-produced and was recorded at Dan Auerbach's Easy Eye Studio.

title: Music in Exile
info: The debut full-length release for the Malian band was co-produced by Yeah Yeah Yeahs’ Nick Zinner and Marc-Antoine Moreau.

title: Wild Flag
info: The indie supergroup, featuring Carrie Brownstein and Janet Weiss of Sleater-Kinney, releases its debut power pop album.

title: Blackjazz
info: The Norwegian band led by Jorgen Munkeby has a sharper metal edge than Jaga Jazzist, which was Munkeby's previous band.

title: Swim
info: The Canadian electronic artist releases his follow-up to his Polaris Music Prize-winning album Andorra.

title: Harlem River Blues
info: The third album for the son of Steve Earle was produced with Skylar Wilson.

title: Identity Crisis
info: Don't be fooled by the title: While 'Identity Crisis' would have perfectly suited her poorly-received predecessor, 2001's Glen Ballard-produced 'Love, Shelby,' that's not the case here, as these 12 self-produced tracks are more likely to connect with fans of her breakthrough disc 'I Am Shelby Lynne.'

title: Shine A Light
info: The Ontario, Canada band makes its Sub Pop (and U.S.) debut with this, their second LP, which mixes alternative rock with punk and soul.

title: Think Tank
info: The veteran Britpop outfit's first new album in four years is the result of tumultuous recording sessions in Morocco with producer Fatboy Slim, which saw a growing dispute between co-founders Damon Albarn and Graham Coxon culminate in Coxon's departure from the band. Fatboy Slim only wound up producing two tracks, with William Orbit handling some of the others.

title: Master And Everyone
info: Don't know Bonnie "Prince" Billy? You may know him better by his given name, Will Oldham, who recorded under his name as well as Palace Music throughout the 1990s. This is his third album under the Billy moniker, and features contributions from members of Lambchop.

title: Midnite Vultures
info: Beck's "official" follow-up to 'Odelay' is an even more eclectic mix of soul, electro, funk, folk, rock, and hip-hop, including more than one song that sounds an awful lot like Prince.

title: Bang Bang Rock & Roll
info: The London-based art-rockers led by Eddie Argos make their official debut with this 12-song effort.

title: Grinderman
info: This self-titled disc is the first release for the new project from Nick Cave, who adds "guitar player" to his CV. Seeing as how most of the Bad Seeds join in as well, we're still not sure why the new name was necessary. (Actually, it sounds even more like their earlier band, The Birthday Party.)

title: Love vs Money
info: The second album for the producer/singer was produced with Chrstopher "Tricky" Stewart and features guest appearances by Kanye West, Mariah Carey, and Lil Jon.

title: Hopelessness
info: The debut solo release for the lead singer of Antony And The Johnsons was produced by Oneohtrix Point Never and Hudson Mohawke.

title: Choral
info: The third album for the Brooklyn-based duo who met at the School of the Arts Institute of Chicago.

title: Down Where the Spirit Meets the Bone
info: Produced with Tom Overby and Greg Leisz, the 11th studio release for singer-songwriter includes a song based on a poem by her father, Miller Williams.

title: Blackbirds
info: The eighth studio release from the Nashville singer-songwriter was co-produced with Doug Lancio and Barry Walsh.

title: Chatma
info: The third release for the Malian Tuareg group features former Tinariwen's singer Wonou Walet Sidati.

title: Look Around the Corner
info: This is the first release of Latin soul with Alice Russell and Quantic.

title: Clockdust
info: The second full-length solo release for Talk Talk's Paul Webb as Rustin Man contains music from the same sessions as Drift Code.

title: The Afterlife
info: The second full-length release in 2019 for the British jazz trio was recorded at the same sessions as Trust In The Lifeforce Of The Deep Mystery and features a guest appearance from poet Joshua Idehen.

title: Twenty-Five for the Rest of Our Lives
info: This is the second full-length album for the Los Angeles rock band led by brothers Andy and Joey Siara.

title: Black Noise
info: The third album for the German techno artist features Animal Collective's Noah Lennox (aka Panda Bear) and !!!/LCD Soundsystem's Tyler Pope as guest artists.

title: You Could Have It So Much Better
info: The Scottish band's eagerly-awaited follow-up to their acclaimed self-titled debut is preceded by yet another insanely catchy single, "Do You Want To."

title: The Universe Inside
info: The latest release for the band led by Steve Wynn features a guest appearance from The Long Ryders' Stephen McCarthy and was recorded in an 80-minute studio session.

title: Under Color of Official Right
info: The second full-length release for the Detroit post-punk band was recorded in one weekend by Bill Skibbe and Jessica Ruffins.

title: Eyes & Nines
info: The Bronx's Joby Ford produces the Sacramento-based hard rock band's third full-length album.

title: It Still Moves
info: The Southern rockers make their major-label debut with this 12-track effort.

title: Electric Messiah
info: The eighth full-length studio release for the Oakland, California-based metal band led by Matt Pike was produced by Kurt Ballou.

title: SVIIB
info: Alejandra Deheza and Benjamin Curtis were working on the Brooklyn  band's fourth (and now final) album when Curtis died from lymphoma in December 2013.

title: We're New Here
info: Remixed by Jamie XX, R&B and hip hop samples are added to Gil Scott-Heron's 2010 album I'm New Here, creating this latest release.

title: The Sunset Tree
info: John Darnielle recorded this 13-track Mountain Goats disc with the help of musicians John Vanderslice, Peter Hughes, Franklin Bruno and Scott Solter.

title: Arpo
info: The second full-length release for Berlin-based experimental electronic artist Joe Seaton features the clarinet and oboe played by his father, David Seaton.

title: Outer Heaven
info: The second full-length release for the the Toronto-based rock band led by Shehzaad Jiwani was produced by Mike Rocha.

title: Nikki Nack
info: The third full-length release for the music project of Merrill Garbus was produced by John Hill and Malay.

title: Nashville
info: The soul singer tackles 14 country tunes with the help of producer Buddy Miller and guests Emmylou Harris, Gillian Welch, Dolly Parton, Patty Loveless And Patti Griffin.

title: Songs of Praise
info: This is the debut full-length release for the British post-punk quintet that includes Charlie Steen, Sean Coyle-Smith, Eddie Green, Josh Finerty, and Charlie Forbes.

title: Soused
info: The second collaboration between Scott Walker and Sunn O))) is a five-track album produced by Scott Walker and Peter Walsh.

title: Idiology
info: The German electro-experimenters return with a follow up to last year's 'Niun Niggung.'

title: High
info: The second and final full-length release for the Australian garage punk band with its lead singer Shogun, who left the band in 2014, but agreed to finish this sophomore album.

title: Seventeen Going Under
info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock singer-songwriter was produced by Bramwell Bronte.

title: Age Of
info: The ninth full-length release for producer Daniel Lopatin features contributions from Anohni, James Blake, Eli Keszler, Kelsey Lu, and Prurient.

title: A  Brief Inquiry into Online Relationships
info: The third full-length release for the British rock band was produced by the band's own Matthew Healy and George Daniel.

title: Four the Record
info: The aptly titled fourth album for the country singer features a duet with her husband, Blake Shelton.

title: Abysskiss
info: The latest full-length solo release for the Big Thief frontwoman was produced by Luke Temple.

title: PUP
info: The debut full-length release for the Toronto punk band that originally was named Topanga (a reference to the Boy Meets World character).

title: Carboniferous
info: The Italian trio that mixes metal, jazz, and punk influences in its music releases its first album on the Ipecac label.

title: Forevher
info: The second full-length release for the British pop artist was inspired by her own long-distance relationship.

title: Loom
info: The debut full-length studio release for the British indie pop trio of Jessica Weiss, Daniel Falvey (Guitar), and Michael Miles is a follow-up to its 2012 single compilation, "Early Fragments."

title: The Long Goodbye
info: The first full-length release not credited under the actor/rapper's MC name was produced by Swet Shop Boys' Redinho.

title: New Hymn to Freedom
info: The second full-length release for the British trio that includes producer Luke Abbott, Triosk/PVT's Laurence Pike and Portico Quartet's Jack Wyllie was improvised and recorded live.

title: We Are King
info: This is the debut full-length release for the electro-soul trio of Anita Bias, and sisters Paris and Amber Strother.

title: Futurology
info: The 12th full-length release for the Welsh alternative rock trio was recorded at the same time as 2013's Rewind the Film and features guest appearances from Cian Ciaran, Green Gartside, Nina Hoss, and  Georgia Ruth.

title: What a Time to Be Alive
info: The 11th full-length studio release for the indie rock band led by Mac McCaughan features guest appearances from David Bazan, Katie Crutchfield, Sabrina Ellis, Skylar Gudasz, and Stephin Merritt.

title: Seek Shelter
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Danish post-punk band was produced with Nis Bysted and Sonic Boom.

title: Spare Ribs
info: The 11th full-length studio release for the British punk duo features Billy Nomates and Amyl and The Sniffers' Amy Taylor.

title: Clarity
info: The debut full-length release for the German pop artist was produced by Dr. Luke, Aaron Joseph and Brandon Hamlin.

title: Party
info: The second full-length release for the New Zealand singer-songwriter was produced by John Parish.

title: M
info: The debut full-length black metal solo release for Ex Cops' Amalie Bruun was produced by Kristoffer Rygg.

title: Mr Twin Sister
info: The second full-length release for the New York indie pop band previously known as Twin Sister was produced by Jonathan Low.

title: Angels of Darkness, Demons of Light, Vol. 2
info: The second volume in the Angels of Darkness, Demons of Light series from the Seattle-based quartet led by Dylan Carlson comprises five songs.

title: Lianne La Havas
info: The third full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced with Matt Hales, Beni Giles, and Mura Masa.

title: Circumambulation
info: The third full-length release for the Texas self-described-"stone gaze" trio was produced by Matt Pence and is its first on the Relapse label.

title: Love Behind The Melody
info: The sophomore album already has one Grammy-nominated single, "Woman."

title: For Their Love
info: The fourth full-length release for the Oklahoma indie rock band was recorded in Oregon and was self-produced.

title: Blue Sky Noise
info: The rock quintet moves to Atlantic Records for its third album, which was produced by David Bottrill.

title: All That Reckoning
info: The first full-length studio release in six years for the Canadian alt-country/folk rock band led by Michael Timmins.

title: Luck In The Valley
info: The final album for the Pelt member, who passed away in December 2009, contains 10 instrumental tracks.

title: Star Wars
info: Produced by Jeff Tweedy and Tom Schick, the ninth release was a surprise free release on the Chicago band's website for a limited time.

title: Safe
info: This is the debut full-length release for grime producer Louis Carnell.

title: Music Tapes for Clouds & Tornadoes
info: Julian Koster used a variety of antique and unusual recorders to achieve his unique sounds.

title: Goths
info: The 16th full-length release for the John Darnielle indie project features no guitars and was produced by Brandon Eggleston.

title: Island
info: The surprise release for the Canadian artist is his first solo release in six years and was recorded at Abbey Road Studios with the London Contemporary Orchestra.

title: Stubborn Persistent Illusions
info: The first new release in eight years for the Canadian instrumental post-rock band was self-produced and mixed.

title: Severant
info: Jamie Teasdale of Vex'd releases his debut solo album as Kuedo.

title: American Gangster
info: Jay-Z's 10th studio album features Beyonce, Lil Wayne, Kayne West, Beanie Sigel, Nas, Bilal, and Pharrell Williams.

title: Slave Vows
info: The fifth full-length release from the Los Angeles post-hardcore band led by Joe Cardamone is the first with new drummer Ben Hallett.

title: How to Stop Your Brain in an Accident
info: The fourth studio release for the Welsh alternative rock band was funded by fan donations through PledgeMusic.

title: Homesongs
info: This is the solo debut for Adem Ilhan of the English electronica/post-rock band Fridge (whose lineup also includes Four Tet's Kieran Hebden). Unlike in Fridge (which is an instrumental outfit), Adem sings over these ten quiet, folksy tracks.

title: Morph The Cat
info: This is the Steely Dan vocalist's first solo disc in over a dozen years.

title: Field Songs
info: The Iowa songwriter releases a full-length album of alt-rock, blues, and folk.

title: Primrose Green
info: This is the second full-length release for the Chicago singer-songwriter.
This Alan Moulder-produced disc from the Kazu Makino-fronted band follows three years after 'Misery Is A Butterfly.'

title: Collapsed in Sunbeams
info: The debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Gianluca Buccellati.

title: Heaux Tales
info: The 14-track release for the Philadelphia R&B singer features guest appearances from Anderson .Paak, H.E.R. and Ari Lennox.

title: Likewise
info: The debut full-length solo release for the Hop Along singer was recorded with her Hop Along bandmate, Joe Reinhart.

title: Drone Logic
info: The debut full-length release for the British techno producer includes influences from acid house, drone, IDM, and shoegaze music.

title: Hubris
info: The latest release from the Australian composer features guest appearances from such artists as Mark Fell, Jim O'Rourke, and Ricardo Villalobos.

title: America's National Parks
info: The six-movement suite from the composer/trumpeter was inspired in part by Ken Burns' documentary series "The National Parks: America's Best Idea" and Smith's own research.

title: Drift
info: This is the debut full-length album for the Los Angeles producer/DJ.

title: Life Will See You Now
info: Produced by Ewan Pearson, the fourth full-length studio release for the Swedish singer-songwriter features bossa nova, disco, and samba rhythms.

title: Even in Exile
info: The second full-length solo release for the Manic Street Preachers singer/guitarist features lyrics based on poems by Patrick Jones about Chilean activist/poet Victor Jara.

title: Infinite Dissolution
info: The latest release for the Chicago-based experimental rock band was inspired by Elizabeth Kolbert's book "The Sixth Extinction: An Unnatural History" and was produced by Greg Norman.

title: Black Up
info: The Seattle-based project, including Ishmael Butler of Digable Planets, is Sub Pop's first hip-hop signing.

title: If You See Me, Say Yes
info: The debut full-length release for the Jenn Wasner solo project was self-produced and mixed by mixing John Congleton.

title: Whole & Cloven
info: This is the third full-length solo release for the banjo player who worked with Steve Gunn and was part of Black Twig Pickers.

title: Toumani & Sidiki
info: The release of unaccompanied kora duets from the father and son duo of Toumani Diabaté and Sidiki Diabaté was produced by Nick Gold, Jerry Boys, and Lucy Duran.

title: Hive Mind
info: The fourth full-length release for the R&B band that includes Syd, Matt Martians, Steve Lacy, Patrick Paige II, and Christopher Smith was self-produced.

title: Andorra
info: Previously known as Manitoba, Daniel Snaith returns with his latest album.

title: Royal Toast
info: The experimental jazz quintet led by Grammy-nominated John Hollenbeck invites Gary Versace for its fifth album.

title: A Boot And A Shoe
info: Husband T Bone Burnett produced this latest effort for the singer-songwriter, her first in three years.

title: Skyscraper National Park
info: Toronto-based singer/songwriter Hayden (Paul Hayden Desser) returns to his bedroom-recording indie-label roots, after two previous releases for Geffen.

title: Unreasonable Behavior
info: The third full release from French DJ Garnier consists of original compositions mixing techno and jazz.

title: Come to Where I'm From
info: The second album from Ohio singer-songwriter Joseph Arthur, who was originally discovered and signed by Peter Gabriel.

title: B'lieve I'm Goin' Down
info: The sixth full-length solo studio release for the Philadelphia-based indie rock singer was recorded in several places including Joshua Tree.

title: Boy
info: Described by Evangelista singer as her pop album, the first solo  release in six years under her real name was co-produced with John Eichenseer.

title: Nearer the Fountain, More Pure the Stream Flows
info: The second full-length solo release for Blur/Gorillaz's Damon Albarn was inspired by Icelandic and was originally planned as an orchestral project for Lyon's Fête des Lumieres.

title: Midnight Manor
info: The second full-length release for the North Carolina rock sextet was produced by Oakley Munson of the Black Lips.

title: The Whole Love
info: The Chicago alternative rock band releases its eighth studio album on its own label dBom.

title: Bubblegum
info: One of two Kickstarter-funded releases [Bulldozer was also released on the same day] for the Brooklyn indie rock singer includes his backing band, The Goddamn Band and was produced by Brand New's Jesse Lacey.

title: Transgender Dysphoria Blues
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the punk band led by Laura Jane Grace (who came out as transgendered in 2012) explores gender dysphoria.

title: Ice Cream Spiritual
info: The third full-length for the quartet from Baltimore was produced by J Robbins.

title: Rejoice
info: The posthumous release of the collaboration between Tony Allen and Hugh Masekela was recorded by Nick Gold in 2010.

title: I'm a Dreamer
info: Produced by Andrija Tokic, the latest release for the Colorado singer-songwriter was recorded in Nashville with Micah Hulscher, Victor Herrero, Tommy Perkinson, and Chris Scruggs.

title: Whatever People Say I Am, That's What I'm Not
info: Not only the most-hyped band of early 2006, Sheffield, England's Arctic Monkeys (led by 19-year-old Alex Turner) managed to accomplish what the likes of Franz Ferdinand and The Libertines couldn't do before them: set the UK record for fastest-selling debut album of all time.

title: Pang
info: The debut full-length release for the Former Chairlift singer under her own name features production from A.G. Cook, Danny L Harle, and Valley Girl.

title: This Is Country Music
info: The country star's ninth studio album features the legendary group, Alabama, as well as other special guests.

title: Overpowered
info: The former Moloko singer returns with her second solo album.

title: East Of Eden
info: Dan Lissvik produces the second solo album for the Concretes' former lead singer.

title: Home Sweet Home
info: The 19-year-old East London "grime" MC makes his debut with this LP which features contributions from Mike Skinner (The Streets), Diplo and Paul Epworth.

title: G_d's Pee AT STATE'S END!
info: The seventh full-length studio release for the Canadian post-punk band was produced by The Besnard Lake's Jace Lasek.

title: Shattered
info: The first release since 2009's Love and Curses for the garage rock band led by Greg Cartwright is also its first on the Merge label.

title: METZ
info: The debut full-length release for the Canadian hard rock band was recorded in a barn by Graham Walsh and Alexandre Bonenfant.

title: The House Is Burning
info: The first full-length release in five years for the Tennessee rapper features guest appearances from 4r Da Locals, 6LACK, Amindi, Kal Banx, Duke Deuce, Iamdoechii, Lil Uzi Vert, Jay Rock, Smino, SZA, Jay Worthy, and YGTUT.

title: A Steady Drip, Drip, Drip
info: This is the 24th full-length studio release for the sibling art-rock duo of Ron and Russell Mael.

title: Everything's For Sale
info: The debut full-length studio release for the Compton rapper features guest appearances from 6LACK, Snoh Aalegra, Christian Scott aTunde Adjuah, Eminem, and JID.

title: Years
info: The second full-length release for the North Carolina-based alt-country band is a follow-up to her 2015 self-released debut (that was re-released in 2017 by Bloodshot).

title: Pretty Girls Like Trap Music
info: The fourth full-length release for the rapper features guest appearances from  Jhené Aiko, Drake, Gucci Mane, Swae Lee, Migos, Nicki Minaj, Monica, Pharrell, Quavo, Travis Scott, Trey Songz, and Ty Dolla Sign.

title: Daniel Bachman
info: The seventh full-length solo studio release for the guitarist was recorded by Brian Haran.

title: The Peace & Truce of Future of the Left
info: The fifth full-length release for the Welsh alternative rock band was also funded through PledgeMusic like its 2013 release, How To Stop Your Brain In An Accident.

title: No One Deserves Happiness
info: The fourth full-length release for the Portland, Oregon-based metal duo of Chip King and Lee Buford features contributions from Maralie Armstrong and Providence's Assembly of Light Choir.

title: The Miraculous
info: The third full-length release for the Swedish singer-songwriter features a 9,000-pipe organ.

title: Servant of Love
info: The tenth full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced with Craig Ross.

title: Homeland
info: Laurie Anderson, the performance artist, releases her first album of new material in nearly a decade, which was produced with her husband, Lou Reed, and Roma Baran.

title: Watershed
info: The Swedish metal band's ninth album is the first with Martin Axenrot and Fredrik Akesson, who replaced Martin Lopez and Peter Lindgren.

title: American V: A Hundred Highways
info: The fifth and final of Cash's sessions with producer Rick Rubin was recorded shortly before the singer's 2003 death. Included among two Cash originals are covers of songs by Bruce Springsteen, Hank Williams, and more.

title: Pyramid Electric Co.
info: The Songs: Ohia leader offers seven new tracks on this completely solo release, the first he has recorded under his own name. It is the result of a  single session in Omaha with engineer Mike Mogis (who worked with Molia on the 'Ghost Tropic' album).

title: Deliverance
info: Linebacker large, white, and very country, Bubba Sparxxx nevertheless became an overnight success with his 2001 hip-hop debut 'Dark Days, Bright Nights,' which was co-produced by Timbaland. This follow-up LP was also helmed by Timbaland and Organized Noize.

title: The Mess We Made
info: Recording under his own name for the first time rather than his usual Third Eye Foundation (definitely not to be confused with Third Eye Blind), Bristol, England's Matt Elliott returns with a dark, moody collection of lo-fi, sample-based electronica.

title: 1st Born Second
info: The debut album from 22-year-old Bilal Oliver features production work from Raphael Saadiq, Dr. Dre, Mike City and James Poyser. The first single is "Soul Sista," which originally appeared on the Love and Basketbal soundtrack.

title: Poses
info: The follow-up to his 1998 self-titled debut (which gained the Canadian singer-songwriter "Best New Artist" honors from Rolling Stone), 'Poses' contains 12 new tracks from sessions with five different producers. He also has songs on the soundtracks for "Shrek" and "Moulin Rouge."

title: Mermaid Avenue Vol. II
info: Following 1998's successful collaboration Mermaid Avenue, Billy Bragg and Wilco have reunited to bring more of Woody Guthrie's unrecorded lyrics to life.

title: When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go?
info: The debut full-length debut for the 17-year-old Los Angeles pop singer-songwriter was produced by her brother Finneas O'Connell (who also co-wrote).

title: Utopia
info: The ninth full-length studio release for the Icelandic artist was produced with Arca and Rabit.

title: Never Hungover Again
info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles pop-punk band formed by Barry Johnson and Chase Knobb was produced by Joe Reinhart.

title: Epic
info: The second album for the singer-songwriter from New Jersey is just seven tracks long.

title: Peasant
info: The lives of those who lived during the early middle ages in the Anglo-Saxon kingdom of Bryneich is the concept behind the sixth full-length solo release for British singer-songwriter.

title: Brick Body Kids Still Daydream
info: The sixth full-length release for the Chicago rapper was inspired by the low income public housing projects he once lived in and was finally demolished in 2007.

title: White Lunar
info: A collection of scores Nick Cave and Warren Ellis have recorded for The Proposition (2005), The Assassination Of Jesse James By The Coward Robert Ford (2007), The Road (2010), The Girls of Phnom Penh, and The English Surgeon as well as theatrical music for Woyzeck (2005) and Metamorphosis (2006).

title: Crack The Skye
info: The fourth album from the Atlantia, Georgia rock band features songs about the murder of Rasputin.

title: Saves the World
info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles-based indie pop trio was co-produced by Dan Grech-Marguerat.

title: Texas Piano Man
info: The fifth full-length release for the Texan singer-songwriter features piano-driven songs that recall such artists as Billy Joel, Elton John or Leon Russell.

title: New History Warfare, Vol. 2: Judges
info: The second album from the Polaris prize-nominated saxophonist was recorded solo, live, and in a single take. Stetson employed circular breathing and used approximately two dozen microphones, placing them on the studio walls, throughout his bass saxophone, and on his throat to produce this otherworldly-sounding album.

title: Gang Signs & Prayer
info: The debut full-length studio release for the British grime artist features guest appearances from Ghetts, J HUS, Kehlani, MNEK, Raleigh Ritchie and Wretch 32.

title: The  Electric Lady
info: The second release for the Atlanta R&B singer continues the story of her alter-ego Cindi Mayweather with guest appearances from Erykah Badu, Big Boi, Cee Lo Green, Solange Knowles, Miguel, Prince, and Esperanza Spalding.

title: Resonant Body
info: The third full-length release for Brooklyn-based electronic artist Maya Bouldry-Morrison was recorded in New Hampshire.

title: Lavender
info: The second full-length release for the Nandi Rose Plunkett project that includes two of her Pinegrove bandmates was co-produced with David Tolomei.

title: Life
info: The third solo release for the Parts & Labor co-founder was written after the birth of his son.

title: Panda Bear Meets the Grim Reaper
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Animal Collective co-founder was co-produced with Peter Kember.

title: Weird Little Birthday
info: The debut full-length release for the British indie rock trio was self produced.

title: ...Like Clockwork
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Josh Homme-led rock band includes Dave Grohl on drums as well as guest vocals from Brody Dalle, Alain Johannes, Elton John, Mark Lanegan, Trent Reznor, Jake Shears, Alex Turner, and former bassist Nick Oliveri.

title: Yellow & Green
info: The third studio full-length release from the hard rock/metal band from Virginia was produced by John Congleton.

title: Sepalcure
info: This debut album is a collaboration between dance veterans Praveen Sharma and Travis Stewart.

title: Stonechild
info: The fifth full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced by John Parish and features guest appearances from Justis, Lucius and Kate Stables.

title: Freetown Sound
info: The third full-length release for Dev Hynes was self-produced and released three days ahead of its scheduled release date.

title: In Conflict
info: The fourth solo studio release for the Canadian composer features contributions from Brian Eno and the Czech FILMharmonic Orchestra.

title: Singles
info: The Baltimore trio's first release on the 4AD label was produced by Chris Coady.

title: The Week That Was
info: Peter Brewis wrote the songs as part of an imaginary crime thriller for his debut concept album.

title: Bright Yellow Bright Orange
info: After taking 12 years off prior to 2000's 'The Friends of Rachel Worth,' the legendary Australian indie-pop band is suddenly undergoing a bout of creativity as evidenced by yet another release this very same decade.

title: Red Devil Dawn
info: Crooked Fingers is a side project for Archers of Loaf frontman Eric Bachmann. This third album follows in the dark, drunken-blues/Americana tradition of the first two, which drew Bachmann comparisons to Tom Waits and Leonard Cohen, among others.

title: Blacklisted
info: Alt-country singer-songwriter Neko Case returns with her third solo album, after last appearing on the New Pornographers' acclaimed 'Mass Romantic" album. Here, the moody, cinematic music is provided by members of Calexico and Giant Sand.

title: Cookie: The Anthropological Mix Tape
info: The fifth album (and first in three years) for the bassist/singer features 16 new tracks (including a bonus remix of "Pocketbook" by Missy Elliot and Rockwilder) in an eclectic mix of styles.

title: Internal Wrangler
info: This debut LP brought the much-hyped Liverpool band frequent comparisons to (and a tour with) Radiohead.

title: I Made a Place
info: The first full-length release of new material from the singer-songwriter in eight years features contributions from Nathan Salsburg, Mike Hyman and Joan Shelley.

title: Qualm
info: The second full-length release for the German DJ/electronic producer features less layers and instruments than previous releases.

title: Babelsberg
info: The fifth full-length solo release for the Super Furry Animals/Neon Neon member was self-produced and features Stephen McNeff and the National Orchestra of Wales.

title: How to Socialise & Make Friends
info: The second full-length release for the Australian trio of Georgia McDonald, Kelly-Dawn Hellmrich and Sarah Thompson was recorded in two-and-a-half days.

title: Our Shadows Will Remain
info: The singer-songwriter recorded this fourth LP in New Orleans.

title: Blood Bunny
info: The second full-length release for the Michigan indie pop artist features production and writing from Jake Aron, David Pramik, and Keith Varon.

title: Superwolves
info: Matt Sweeney and Bonnie "Prince" Billy reunite after 16 years for a follow-up to 2005's Superwolf features contributions from Mike Coltun,  Souleyman Ibrahim, Ahmoudou Madassane, and Mdou Moctar.

title: We're Your Friends, Man
info: This is the 25th full-length studio release for British psychedelic rock band led by Nick Saloman.

title: Southern Blood
info: The final release for the singer-songwriter who passed away in May 2017 was produced by Don Was.

title: Nothing More to Say
info: Three months before the full-length album for the New York reggae group produced by Victor Axelrod was released, lead singer Dan Klein passed away from ALS.

title: Luminiferous
info: The seventh full-length release for the Oakland heavy metal trio was produced by Kurt Ballou.

title: Nothing Violates This Nature
info: The second full-length release for the Massachusetts hardcore band including members of Bloodhorse, Converge, and The Hope Conspiracy was produced by Kurt Ballou.

title: Ty Segall (2017)
info: The second self-titled (2008's was the first) release for the garage rock artist was recorded as a live band that included Ben Boye, Mikal Cronin, Emmett Kelly, and Charles Moothart.

title: The Innocents
info: This is the second release for former Jackie-O Motherfucker member Natalie Mering as Weyes Blood.

title: Europe
info: Simon Trought returns to produce the second album for the London-based indie pop band led by Elizabeth Morris.

title: Forever Blue
info: The debut full-length release for the London-based artist features guest appearances from Johannes Persson, Fredrik Kihlberg and Tom Fleming.

title: Dark Matter
info: The first new studio release for the pop singer-songwriter in nine years was produced by Mitchell Froom, Lenny Waronker, and David Boucher.

title: Love Streams
info: The eighth release for the Los Angeles-based Canadian composer features contributions from Kara-Lis Coverdale, Grímur Helgason, The Icelandic Choir Ensemble, and Jóhann Jóhannsson.

title: Canary
info: The latest release for the rock band is a concept album about a family going through the Depression in Ohio.

title: Broken Social Scene
info: K-OS, Jason Tate (The Weakerthans) and Murray Lightburn (The Dears) guest on the Canadian collective's follow-up to 'You Forgot It In People.'

title: When I Have Fears
info: The debut full-length release for the Irish post-punk band was produced by Flood.

title: Shackles Gift
info: The second full-length release for the Bristol-based rock band was produced by Andrew Hung of Fuck Buttons.

title: The Outsiders
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the country rock artist was produced by Jay Joyce.

title: Nothing Great About Britain
info: The debut full-length release for the British grime rapper features guest appearances from Jaykae, Mura Masa and Skepta.

title: Polymer
info: This is the 10th full-length studio release for the electronic duo of Ed Handley and Andy Turner.

title: Heaven
info: The second full-length release for the Toronto-based rock band was recorded in Los Angeles with producer Rob Schnapf.

title: Temple Beautiful
info: San Francisco, the hometown for the country rock singer-songwriter, was the inspiration behind Chuck Prophet's 10th studio album.

title: Weather
info: The ninth album for the singer was produced by Joe Henry and features appearances by Chris Connelly and Benji Hughes.

title: Mesabi
info: The singer-songwriter's latest album was coproduced by Barry Walsh and features Calexico, Augie Meyers, Van Dyke Parks, and Lucinda Williams as guest singers.

title: Curse Your Branches
info: This is the debut solo album for the former Pedro The Lion/Headphones singer-songwriter.

title: All American Made
info: The second full-length studio release for the Nashville-based country artist features a guest appearance from Willie Nelson.

title: Niño Rojo
info: Nino Rojo, the eccentric singer-songwriter's second release of 2004, was recorded during the same sessions that produced 'Rejoicing In The Hands.'

title: Stephen Malkmus
info: The debut solo release from the former leader of indie-rock legends Pavement.

title: Mad for Sadness
info: This live recording features 10 tracks, mainly consisting of material from the band's first two albums.

title: Angels of Darkness, Demons of Light, Vol. 1
info: The pioneers of drone doom return with part one of its latest concept album (Volume 2 is scheduled for 2012).

title: Jaguar
info: The debut full-length release for the R&B singer-songwriter features contributions from Khalid and SG Lewis.

title: Demon Days
info: When the comic supergroup's 2001 debut sold an astounding 6 million copies worldwide, a sequel became necessary. Hence 'Demon Days.' Returning leader Damon Albarn (Blur) and new producer Danger Mouse are joined by guests Shaun Ryder (Happy Mondays), Ike Turner, MF Doom, De La Soul and Dennis Hopper.

title: Football Money
info: The debut full-length release for the Canadian indie rock band was produced by Aaron Goldstein and mixed by Holy Fuck's Graham Walsh.

title: Sun Racket
info: This is the first full-length studio release in seven years for the Boston alternative rock trio of Kristin Hersh, David Narcizo and Bernard Georges.

title: Towards Language
info: The ninth full-length solo release for the Norwegian trumpeter under his name was recorded live in a studio.

title: We are Beautiful, We Are Doomed
info: The second release for the Welsh indie-pop band was recorded in two weeks.

title: America
info: The latest album from Dan Deacon is his first on Domino and was inspired by his travels across America and as an American in Europe.

title: Burning the Threshold
info: The latest release for the Ben Chasny project features contributions from Chris Corsano, Haley Fohr, Alex Nielsen, Ryley Walker and Damon and Naomi.

title: Fearless (Taylor's Version)
info: The first of a planned re-recording of the singer-songwriter's six albums released on the Big Machine Label features six tracks not on the 2008 album and a track for the 2010 film, Valentine's Day.

title: Companion Rises
info: The latest full-length release for the Ben Chasny project was was self-recorded.

title: Animal
info: This is the second full-length release for the collaboration between Tunng's Mike Lindsay and Laura Marling.

title: A Softer Focus
info: The latest full-length release for the Texas-based experimental artist features contributions from Ben Baker Billington, Alex Cunningham, Lia Kohl, Macie Stewart, and Dani Toral.

title: Construction Time & Demolition
info: The sixth full-length solo release for Eric Goulden under the Wreckless Eric name is his first in three years.

title: The Glass Bead Game
info: The latest album for the British artist features singer Lavinia Blackwell, John Contreras on cello and Joolie Wood on violin.

title: Favourite Worst Nightmare
info: The ultrahyped British rockers return with a quick successor to their Mercury Prize-winning 2006 debut.

title: Back to Love
info: The fourth release for the soul singer features production from Babyface, James Poyser, Kelvin Wooten, and Salaam Remi.

title: Now Only
info: The ninth full-length release for Phil Elverum as Mount Eerie was written soon after the release of 2017's A Crow Looked At Me.

title: Oh No
info: The second full-length release for the Canadian electronic artist was produced with Junior Boys' Jeremy Greenspan.

title: Floating Coffin
info: The latest release from the San Francisco rock band led by John Dwyer is its first on the Castle Face label.

title: Theatre Is Evil
artist: Amanda Palmer & the Grand Theft Orchestra
info: The third solo studio album for the former Dresden Doll singer is her first with her new band, The Grand Theft Orchestra and was recorded in Australia with producer John Congleton.

title: Clash Battle Guilt Pride
info: The rock band's third album was produced by Brian McTernan.

title: You're A Woman, I'm A Machine
info: 'You're A Woman' is the first album for the Canadian duo of vocalist/drummer Sebastien Grainger and bassist Jesse F. Keeler. It's a drum 'n' bass album in the literal sense of the term, as those are the only two instruments (aside from a very infrequent synthesizer) on the record.

title: I Had a Dream That You Were Mine
info: This is the debut full-length release from the collaboration between the Walkmen's Hamilton Leithauser and ex-Vampire Weekend's Rostam Batmanglij.

title: Don't Lose This
info: The unfinished recordings from the blues guiatrist was completed with the help of his daughter Mavis Staples and producer Jeff Tweedy.

title: Immunity
info: The fourth solo release for the electronic artist/producer includes a guest appearance by King Creosote.

title: A Love Surreal
info: Pianist Robert Glasper guests on the Philadelphia singer's jazz, soul, and funk-infused third full-length studio album.

title: Salad Days
info: This is the second full-length solo release for the Canadian singer-songwriter.

title: Anak Ko
info: The third full-length release for Melina Duterte as Jay Som was written after her move to Los Angeles.

title: The Monitor
info: The first full-length album on XL Recordings for the rock band from New Jersey was named after a warship that fought during the American Civil War.

title: The Lookout
info: The 10th full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Tucker Martin and features contributions from Jim James and Sufjan Stevens.

title: Wide Awake!
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the New York rock band was produced by Danger Mouse.

title: Love Will Be Reborn
info: The latest full-length studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Pierre Marchand.

title: Don't Shy Away
info: The second full-length release for the indie rock trio was self-produced except for one Brian Eno-produced track.

title: Frozen Niagara Falls
info: Dominick Fernow's latest release as Prurient is a double album produced by Arthur Rizk and Kris Lapke.

title: Anxiety's Kiss
info: The fifth full-length release for the Kentucky hardcore trio was produced by J. Robbins.

title: Tomorrow Was the Golden Age
info: This is the second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based seven-piece instrumental group.

title: We Get By
info: The latest full-length solo studio release for the soul singer was produced by Ben Harper.

title: Wolfgang Amadeus Phoenix
info: The fourth album for the French rock band was produced with Philippe Zdar.

title: 8 Million Stories
info: This is the full-length debut for the Ohio-based duo of acclaimed hip-hop producer RJD2 and emcee Blueprint.

title: Dressy Bessy
info: This is the third studio album for the Denver-based indie pop band led by Tammy Ealom.

title: Burn Piano Island, Burn
info: Known for their loud, angry, and extreme take on metal (well, even more so than your average metal band), The Blood Brothers return with their third album in as many years.

title: You Are Free
info: Chan Marshall's first album of new material since 1998 was recorded in Los Angeles with Adam Kasper (Queens of the Stone Age, Foo Fighters, Pearl Jam), who in turn brought in friends such as Dave Grohl and Eddie Vedder.

title: The Rising
artist: Bruce Springsteen & The E Street Band
info: The Boss' first studio album with the E Street Band since 1984's 'Born In The U.S.A.,' 'The Rising' contains 15 new Springsteen songs produced by Brendan O'Brien.

title: Come Away With Me
info: Pop/jazz vocalist and pianist Norah Jones, the daughter of Ravi Shankar, picked up 5 Grammy awards for this debut album, produced by Arif Mardin.

title: Stag
info: The solo debut from The Indigo Girls' Amy Ray is a bit of a departure from her band's folk sound, instead offering a harder, punk-rock edge. Joan Jett is among the guests appearing on the album.

title: Our Raw Heart
info: The eight full-length release for the Oregon metal trio was co-produced with Billy Barnett and written after frontman Mike Scheidt recovered from a near fatal illness caused by the intestinal disease, acute diverticulitis.

title: Everybody Works
info: The second release (but first major label album) for San Francisco Bay Area artist Melina Duterte was self-recorded and produced.

title: Field of Reeds
info: The third full-length release for the British art rock band experiments with avant garde and classical music elements arranged with conductor André de Ridder and featuring guest appearances by Henry Lowther, Adrian Peacock, Elisa Rodrigues, and Michel van der Aa.

title: The Renaissance
info: Q-Tip returns to release his first solo album in nine years with guests such as D'Angelo, Amanda Diva, Norah Jones, and Raphael Saadiq.

title: Anime, Trauma and Divorce
info: The fifth full-length release for the Los Angeles-based rapper was executive produced by Jacknife Lee.

title: Sometimes I Wish We Were An Eagle
info: Previously known as Smog, Bill Callahan releases only the second album under his real name.

title: Antiphonals
info: the latest full-length release for the Los Angeles-based Canadian artist was self-produced and mixed.

title: Limbo
info: The latest solo album from the Black Dice band member continues his experimental electronic sounds over six tracks.

title: Heartleap
info: Said to be the final album from the British singer-songwriter, the third full-length studio release was produced by Joe Boyd.

title: Rammstein
info: The first studio release in 10 years for the German metal band was produced with Olsen Involtini.

title: Shadows in the Night
info: Produced by Jack Frost, the 36th studio release for the singer-songwriter features pop standards popularized by Frank Sinatra.

title: Steingarten
info: Experimental electronica artist Stefan Betke returns with his first full-length in four years.

title: For All We Know
info: The debut full-length release for the London singer-songwriter features influences R&B and electronic music.

title: A Few Stars Apart
artist: Lukas Nelson & Promise of the Real
info: The latest full-length release for the country rock band was produced by Dave Cobb.

title: how i'm feeling now
info: The fourth full-length release for the pop artist was created with executive producers A. G. Cook and BJ Burton through Zoom calls and asking fans for their preferences.

title: Guerrilla
info: The debut full-length release for the Manchester-based Angolan artist was inspired by his visits to his homeland and his father's memoirs about the Angolan civil war.

title: Midnight
info: The second full-length release for the Detroit-based indie rock artist was produced by Car Seat Headrest's Will Toledo.

title: Sirens
info: The first release for the artist better known as The Bug under his real name was influenced by the birth of his son and the subsequent life-threatening complications that followed.

title: With Animals
info: The second full-length collaboration between Mark Lanegan and Duke Garwood was recorded in Los Angeles, Pasadena and Joshua Tree.

title: Ten Freedom Summers
info: The four-disc set from the jazz trumpeter was inspired by the Civil Rights Movement.

title: Fetch the Bolt Cutters
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the alternative singer-songwriter was self-produced and features contributions from Davíd Garza, Sebastian Steinberg, and Amy Aileen Wood.

title: SMiLE
info: Well, better 37 years late than never. Originally intended to be the Beach Boys' 1967 follow-up to their legendary 'Pet Sounds,' 'Smile' was finally recorded as originally intended in April 2004 by Wilson and his current band, including co-songwriter Van Dyke Parks.

title: Van Lear Rose
info: It's been over 40 years since she released her first album (and four since her last, 2000's 'Still Country'), but the coal miner's daughter returns to the spotlight with this 13-track effort (all Lynn-penned originals), produced by The White Stripes' Jack White.

title: To Pimp A Butterfly
info: The third full-length studio release from the hip hop artist features guest appearances from Bilal, George Clinton, James Fauntleroy, Ronald Isley, Rapsody, Snoop Dogg, Thundercat, and Anna Wise.

title: Ghosteen
info: The 17th full-length studio release for Australian rock band is influenced in part by the accidental death of Nick Cave's 15-year old son in 2015 and is considered the third and final part of trilogy of albums that includes 2013's Push the Sky Away and 2016's Skeleton Tree.

title: Histoire de Melody Nelson
info: The US release of Serge Gainsbourg's 1971 album featuring Jane Birkin in the classic Ballade de Melody Nelson.

title: DAMN.
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Compton rapper features guest appearances from Rihanna, U2, and Zacari.

title: Stankonia
info: Featuring the hit singles "B.O.B." and "Ms. Jackson," 'Stankonia' was a commercial and critical hit for the innovative Atlanta hip-hop duo of Dré and Big Boi.

title: Rough and Rowdy Ways
info: The first new studio release of new music for the singer-songwriter in eight years.

title: Black Messiah
info: The first release in 14 years for the R&B singer features songs co-written with Q-Tip and Kendra Foster as well as co-production from James Gadson, Pino Palladino,and Questlove.

title: Conflict Of Interest
info: The third full-length studio release for the British grime artist features guest appearances from BackRoad Gee, Dave, Giggs, Hamzaaand, Jaykae, Aida Lae, Miraa May, Pa Salieu, Emeli Sande, Moonchild Sanelly, Ed Sheeran, Skepta, Stormzy, and Wretch 32.

title: Skeleton Tree
info: Nick Cave's 15-year-old son died in an accident while he was working on the alternative rock band's 16th album. The recording sessions were filmed for Andrew Dominik's documentary, One More Time With Feel.

title: Savane
info: 'Savane' is the final album from the acclaimed guitarist from Mali, who died in March 2006 after a three-decade recording career which found him injecting American blues into traditional African music.

title: My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy
info: Breaking traditional mainstream hip-hop guidelines, Kanye West's latest release features epic raps and long instrumental variations for his most innovative album to date.

title: Madvillainy
info: 'Madvillainy' is a collaboration between rapper MF Doom and producer Madlib.

title: A Crow Looked at Me
info: The eighth full-length release for the music project of Phil Elverum was written after the death of his wife from cancer in July 2016.

title: Room 25
info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based Chicago rapper was self-released.

title: Live At Reading
info: The entire performance by Nirvana at 1992's Reading Festival is released both as a CD and DVD.

title: Love And Theft
info: Picking up where 1997's resurgent 'Time Out of Mind' left off, 'Love And Theft' finds the 60-year-old Dylan self-producing the album's 12 tracks.

title: My Dusty Road
info: The four-disc set includes Woody Guthrie's recordings from the mid-1940s in a definitive collection.

title: On the Impossible Past
info: The third full-length release from the punk rock band from Pennsylvania is its first on Epitaph Records.

title: Prioritise Pleasure
info: The second full-length solo release for Slow Club's Rebecca Taylor was produced by Johan Karlberg.

title: Lemonade
info: The sixth solo studio album for the singer premiered as an hour-long HBO special before streaming on Tidal. A physical release is set for May 6.

title: Pull Up Some Dust and Sit Down
info: The Grammy-award winning musician returns with a concept album about corruption in America.

title: Sunbather
info: The second full-length studio release for the San Francisco-based black metal band formed by George Clarke and Kerry McCoy was produced by Jack Shirley.

title: Glow On
