info: The third full-length release for the Baltimore hardcore punk band features a guest appearance from Blood Orange and was recorded with producer Mike Elizondo.

title: Orphans: Brawlers, Bawlers & Bastards
info: Unlike typical rarities compilations, this 3-disc set includes 30 brand-new recordings--in addition to the usual mix of covers, soundtrack selections, and other previously uncompiled material. It's like getting three new Waits albums at once.

title: Time Will Die and Love Will Bury It
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the British rock band was recorded and mixed by Lewis Johns.

title: Boy In Da Corner
info: This is the debut disc for the 18-year-old London-based rapper (born Dylan Mills), who has been heralded by (among others) Uncut magazine as "good as any MC currently active on Earth."

title: You Want It Darker
info: The 14th full-length studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by his son.

title: Channel Orange
info: Love and life in Los Angeles is the theme of the debut release on Def Jam for Frank Ocean, who earlier this month posted online the liner notes for this album describing a relationship he had with a man.

title: The Satanist
info: The tenth studio release for the Polish black/death metal band was produced with Daniel Bergstrand, Slawek Wieslawscy and Wojtek Wieslawscy.

title: Elephant
info: For their major label debut (and fourth LP overall), the Detroit-based duo of Jack and Meg White offer up 14 new tracks, all recorded in London and (fortunately) showing absolutely no trace of major label production values. Meg White takes a rare turn behind the microphone on a couple of tracks, as does guest Holly Golightly on the closing "It's True That We Love One Another."

title: Red (Taylor's Version)
info: The new recording of Taylor Swift's fourth studio album features nine previously unreleased songs that include guest appearances from Phoebe Bridgers, Ed Sheeran, and Chris Stapleton.

title: We're All Alone In This Together
info: The second full-length studio release for the British rapper features guest appearances from Snoh Aalegra, James Blake, Boj, Stormzy, and WizKid.

title: Titanic Rising
info: The fourth full-length release for Natalie Mering was co-produced with Foxygen's Jonathan Rado.

title: Carnage
info: The surprise release for the latest full-length collaboration between Nick Cave and Warren Ellis was recorded over a week.

title: Melodrama
info: The second full-length release for the New Zealand pop singer-songwriter was produced with Jack Antonoff.

title: Speakerboxxx/The Love Below
info: This Grammy-winning follow-up to their smash 2000 hit 'Stankonia' is an OutKast album in name only, as it is structured in the form of two solo discs: one each for Big Boi (Speakerboxxx) and Andre 3000 (The Love Below).

title: Set My Heart on Fire Immediately
info: The fifth full-length release for Mike Hadreas as Perfume Genius was produced with Blake Mills.

title: Home, Like Noplace Is There
info: This is the second full-length release for the Massachusetts indie rock quartet formerly known as The Hotel Year.

title: Good Kid, M.A.A.D City
info: The official major label debut studio album for the Compton rapper features guest appearances from Dr. Dre, Drake, Jay Rock, And MC Eiht.

title: A Grand Don't Come For Free
info: Mike Skinner returns with the inenviable job of following up his genre-smashing debut 'Original Pirate Material,' which was an enormous critical and commercial hit in the UK and paved the way for the success of later acts such as Dizzee Rascal.

title: Canto
info: The second release from the Latin-folk supergroup, featuring members of Los Lobos.

title: Grey Area
info: The third full-length release for the British rapper Simbi Ajikawo features a guest appearances from Cleo Sol.

title: Sex, Death & The Infinite Void
info: The second full-length release for the British punk rock band led by Will Gould was produced by Xandy Barry.

title: The ArchAndroid
info: The second full-length album for the singer born in Kansas City is a continuation of the story of Cindi Mayweather, the android introduced in the 2007 EP, "Metropolis Suite I of IV: The Chase."

title: Gold & Grey
info: The fifth full-length release for the hard rock/metal band is the first with new guitarist Gina Gleason (Peter Adams left the band in 2017).

title: Blue Weekend
info: The third full-length release for the British rock band was produced by Markus Dravs.

title: The  Guitar Song
info: Jamey Johnson's latest album is a 25-track double album with the first half, The Black Album, devoted to dark emotions and the other half, the White Album, devoted to more positive songs.

title: Is This It?
info: This is the debut album from New York indie-rockers The Strokes, who have been hyped by the British music press following the release of "The Modern Age" EP in early 2001. It almost goes without saying, but the group is frequently compared to the Velvet Underground, among others, thanks in part to singer-songwriter Julian Casablancas' Lou Reed-esque vocals.

title: We Got It From Here...Thank You 4 Your Service
info: Phife Dawg passed away in March 2016 before the final studio release for the rap group that includes guest appearances from such artists as Anderson Paak, Andre 3000, Busta Rhymes, Consequence, Elton John, Talib Kweli, Kendrick Lamar, and Jack White.

title: From Here We Go Sublime
info: This is the full-length debut for Stockholm, Sweden trance producer Axel Willner.

title: Illinois
info: The folk singer-songwriter's ambitious attempt to chronicle all 50 states in song continues with this second installment, dedicated to the Prairie State.

title: Carrie & Lowell
info: The seventh full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter features contributions from Thomas Bartlett, Sean Carey, Casey Foubert, Ben Lester, Nedelle Torrisi, and Laura Veirs.

title: Jimmy Lee
info: The first full-length release of new material from the R&B artist/producer was inspired by his late brother's struggle with drug addiction and features guest appearances from Rob Bacon, Reverend E. Baker, Ernest Turner, and Daniel J. Watts.

title: No Cities to Love
info: The first release in ten years for the indie rock trio of Carrie Brownstein, Corin Tucker, and Janet Weiss was produced by John Goodmanson.

title: Eve
info: The third full-length studio release for the North Carolina rapper features guest appearances from J. Cole, D'Angelo, GZA, JID, Leikeli47, Mereba], PJ Morton, Queen Latifah, K.Roosevelt, SiR, and Elle Varner.

title: Punisher
info: The second full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter features contributions from Julien Baker, Lucy Dacus, Christian Lee Hutson, Jim Keltner, Warpint's Jenny Lee Lindberg, Blake Mills, Conor Oberst, Bright Eyes' Nathaniel Walcott, and the Yeah Yeah Yeahs' Nick Zinner.

title: Send Them To Coventry [Mixtape]
info: The debut mixtape from the British rapper features guest appearances from Mahalia, M1llionz, BackRoad Gee, Boy Boy, Eight9FLY, Lz Dinero, Ni Santora, Shakavellie, and Stizee.

title: Original Pirate Material
info: This is the debut album by the London garage (or in this case, bedroom) band, which consists solely of 21-year-old Mike Skinner. Whether or not this style of music (very English rapping over garage/house beats) will translate well overseas remains to be seen, but garage (and especially Skinner) is the current flavor of the month with the UK music press.

title: Candi Staton
info: This 26-track disc compiles (for the first time on CD) songs from the acclaimed soul singer's 1969-1973 Muscle Shoals period when she recorded for Fame Records--a period that netted her 12 consecutive Billboard R&B hits.

title: Alice
info: One of two Waits releases in May 2002 ('Blood Money' is the other), 'Alice' was originally written as an opera and actually performed live during an 18-month engagement in Hamburg in the early 1990s. However, this is the first recording of these 15 tracks, culled from recent studio sessions.

title: Funeral
info: The Montreal band founded by husband and wife Win Butler and Régine Chassagne make their full-length debut with this highly anticipated disc.

title: Holy Hell
info: The eighth full-length release for the British metalcore band is its first without Tom Searle, who passed away in August 2016.

title: London Zoo
info: The third album for the artist/music producer Kevin Martin as The Bug.

title: Jama Ko
info: The third release for Bassekou Kouyate introduces a new group of ngoni players and was co-produced with Howard Bilerman.

title: Sir Lucious Left Foot: The Son of Chico Dusty
info: OutKast's Big Boi goes solo with an album featuring guest appearances from such artists as Jamie Foxx, Janelle Monae, B.o.B., Gucci Mane, Too Short, and George Clinton.

title: Psychodrama
info: The debut full-length studio release for the British rapper features guest appearances from Burna Boy and J Hus.

title: Untrue
info: The second album for the London-based anonymous dubstep artist.

title: græ
info: The double album (released also as two separate EPs] for the experimental artist features a guest appearance from Jill Scott and elements of folk, jazz, indie rock, pop, and soul music.

title: XTRMNTR
info: Bobby Gillespie & co. expand on the harder-edged punk/electronica sound of their previous effort, 'Vanishing Point,' with their most violent effort to date, earning rave reviews in the process and perhaps matching the success of their classic 'Screamadelica.' Contributors here include David Holmes, Bernard Sumner, Kevin Shields and the Chemical Brothers.

title: Spaces
info: Described as a field recording, this latest release from the Berlin-based composer was recorded over two years at various locations with different methods including cassette recordings.

title: Z
info: For their fourth album, produced by John Leckie, the Kentucky band sports a new keyboardist and guitarist.

title: St. Vincent
info: The fourth full-length release for the indie artist was produced by John Congleton and includes contributions from Dap-Kings drummer Homer Steinweiss and Midlake's McKenzie Smith.

title: The Dusk in Us
info: The ninth full-length release for the Massachusetts metalcore band was mixed by the band's guitarist, Kurt Ballou.

title: Like a Rose
info: The second solo album for the Pistol Annies member includes songs co-written with such artists as Sally Barris, Guy Clark, Vince Gill, Lori McKenna, and Jon Randall.

title: RTJ2
info: The latest release from Killer Mike and El-P features collaborations with Travis Barker of Blink-182, Diane Coffee, and Zack de la Rocha formerly of Rage Against the Machine.

title: Rounds
info: The sample-based indietronica LP 'Rounds' is the third solo effort for Fridge's Kieran Hebden.

title: Neon Golden
info: This breaktrhough sixth album for the German band combines a variety of disparate elements, most notably moody indie rock and glitchy electronica (think Hood's Cold House), to great effect.

title: Since I Left You
info: This sample-driven Austrialian dance outfit scored a hit in its homeland with this, its debut full-length release (following three EP releases since 1997). The UK music press created a publicity avalanche for the band in the Spring of 2001, as the album picked up strong reviews (quotes from some appear below) and was featured in numerous articles. Packed with over 600 samples of recordings dating from the 1950's to the present (each one credited in the liner notes!) as well as original instrumentation, 'Since I Left You' is a varied and unique record.

title: Honey
info: The first full-length release in eight years for the Swedish  artist features contributions from with Joseph Mount of Metronomy, Klas Åhlund, Adam Bainbridge, Mr. Tophat, and Zhal.

title: Eternity, In Your Arms
info: The debut full-length release for the British punk rock band is a concept album about a paranormal investigator.

title: Kiwanuka
info: The third full-length release for the indie singer-songwriter was produced by by Danger Mouse and Inflo.

title: Modern Times
info: Dylan's first studio release since his 2001 hit 'Love And Theft' is his 44th album overall.

title: LEGACY! LEGACY!
info: The second full-length release for the Chicago R&B artist features guest appearances from Jasminfire, Nitty Scott, Saba, Nico Segal, and theMIND.

title: Apex Predator - Easy Meat
info: The 15th studio release for the British grindcore band was produced by Russ Russell.

title: HoboSapiens
info: Produced by Nick Franglen of Lemon Jelly, 'Hobo Sapiens' finds the 61-year-old Cale still willing to explore new musical territory. Note that none of the 12 songs here were on the "5 Tracks" EP released earlier in 2003.

title: Miss E... So Addictive
info: This is the third album for Missy "Misdemeanor" Elliott, and it again features the acclaimed production work of Timbaland. Guests include Busta Rhymes, Redman, Method Man, Ludacris, Eve, Jay-Z, and Ginuwine.

title: Bloodmoon: I
info: The debut full-length collaboration between Converge, Chelsea Wolfe, Ben Chisholm, and Steve Brodsky began recording in 2019 but was completed remotely due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: RTJ4
info: Released a few days early (for free on their website), the fourth full-length studio album for the rap duo features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Zack de la Rocha, DJ Premier, Josh Homme, Greg Nice, Mavis Staples, and Pharrell Williams.

title: Sawayama
info: The debut full-length studio release for the Japanese-British pop artist features production from Clarence Clarity, Nate Company, Bram Inscore, and Nicole Morier.

title: Black Origami
info: The second full-length release for the electronic producer features contributions from William Basinski, Dope Saint Jude, Fawkes, and Holly Herndon.

title: Bachelor No. 2 (or, the last remains of the dodo)
info: The third solo release from the former 'Til Tuesday leader finally made it to record stores in May 2000, after a long journey that saw Interscope refuse to release the album and Mann issue it on her own SuperEgo label (after selling it through mail order and at her live performances). All's well that ends well, though, as Mann gained widespread acclaim for her soundtrack to P.T. Anderson's film "Magnolia" and even better reviews for this album, which contains four of the tracks from the soundtrack as well as nine additional songs.

title: All Mirrors
info: The fourth full-length studio release from the North Carolina-based indie folk singer-songwriter features arrangements and production by Ben Babbitt, Jherek Bischoff, and John Congelton.

title: For Those I Love
info: This is the debut full-length release for the solo project of Dublin-based producer David Balfe.

title: Shortly After Takeoff
info: The final release for Brian Christinzio's "Manchester Trilogy" features contributions from Adam Dawson and Francesca Pidgeon.

title: Safe In The Hands Of Love
info: The surprise release from the experimental artist from Tennessee features a guest appearance from James K.

title: Hand.Cannot.Erase.
info: The fourth solo release for the British artist was inspired by a news article about the discovery of a young woman's dead body in her apartment three years after her death.

title: Coloring Book [Mixtape]
info: The third mixtape from the Chicago rapper (an Apple Music exclusive for two weeks) features gospel elements as well as guest appearances from such artists as 2 Chainz, Justin Bieber, Francis and the Lights, Future, Jay Electronica, Lil Wayne, Kanye West, and Young Thug.

title: Big Fish Theory
info: The second full-length studio release for the rapper features contributions from such artists as A$AP Rocky, Damon Albarn, Kilo Kish, Juicy J, Ty Dolla Signn, and Bon Iver’s Justin Vernon.

title: Ignorance
info: The fifth full-length studio release Tamara Lindeman project was co-produced with Marcus Paquin, who also mixed the record.

title: The  Order of Time
info: The fifth full-length release for the Brooklyn-based singer-songwriter features guest vocals from Norah Jones.

title: Fed
info: Originally released in Japan, the sophomore album for Liam Hayes as Plush is finally released wide.

title: Golden Hour
info: The seventh full-length release for the country singer-songwriter was co-produced with Daniel Tashian and Ian Fitchuk.

title: Chris
info: The second full-length release for the French pop artist features a guest appearance from Dâm-Funk.

title: A Seat at the Table
info: The third full-length studio release for the R&B singer features guest appearances from Nia Andrews, BJ The Chicago Kid, The Dream, Kelela, Lil Wayne, Q-Tip, Kelly Rowland, Sampha and

title: Last Exit
info: This is the first full-length release from the hard-to-pin down Canadian synth-pop trio led by Jeremy Greenspan.

title: Pink Noise
info: The third full-length studio release for the British artist features a guest appearance from Simon Neil.

title: When I Get Home
info: The fourth full-length album for the R&B singer is a surprise release.

title: We Are Not Your Kind
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the metal band was produced by Greg Fidelman.

title: The Idler Wheel Is Wiser than the Driver of the Screw and Whipping Cords Will Serve You More than Ropes Will Ever Do
info: The singer-songwriter began recording her fourth studio album in secret in 2008 or 2009.

title: Merriweather Post Pavilion
info: The ninth album from the rock group was produced by Ben Allen.

title: Songs For The Deaf
info: Stoner metal is back in the form of the third LP from Queens of the Stone Age, who are supplemented for this release (and supporting tour) by drummer Dave Grohl (Foo Fighters, Nirvana) and former Screaming Trees vocalist Mark Lanegan.

title: Bright Green Field
info: The debut full-length release for the British post-punk band was produced by Dan Carey and features a guest appearance from Martha Skye Murphy.

title: Wearemonster
info: Frankfurt, Germany IDM artist Rajko Mueller (who records under the name Isolee) drew critical acclaim for this, his second LP and first in five years.

title: Ali & Toumani
artist: Ali Farka Toure And Toumani Diabate
info: Recorded in 2005, this is the second album from Ali Farka Toure and Toumani Diabate, who won a Grammy for their previous effort together. Ali Farka Toure passed away from cancer in 2006.

title: They're Calling Me Home
info: The second full-length release from Rhiannon Giddens with Francesco Turrisi was recorded over six days in Ireland during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Hell Hath No Fury
info: This long-delayed second album for Virginia brothers Malice and Pusha T was produced in full by The Neptunes.

title: The Greatest Story Never Told
info: The long-awaited debut album by the Brooklyn-based rapper is produced by Just Blaze and features guest appearances from Q-Tip, Jay-Z and other notable artists.

title: Push Barman To Open Old Wounds
info: This 2-disc set collects 25 non-LP tracks that previously appeared on the band's early singles and EPs for Jeepster.

title: Women in Music, Pt. III
info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles trio of sisters was produced with Rostam Batmanglij, Ariel Rechtshaid and Buddy Ross.

title: Same Trailer Different Park
info: After three self-released albums, the country singer releases her first major label debut produced by Shane McAnally and Luke Laird.

title: We're New Again: A Reimagining by Makaya McCraven
info: The final release of Gil Scott-Heron is reimagined by Makaya McCraven with contributions from Jeff Parker, Junius Paul, Brandee Younger, as well as samples from Agnes Zimondi and the Stephen McCraven Quartet.

title: folklore
info: The 16-track surprise release from the pop artist features contributions from Jack Antonoff, Bon Iver, William Bowery, and Aaron Dessner of the National.

title: Chutes Too Narrow
info: Phil Ek produced this sophomore effort for the Albuquerque-based group led by James Mercer (also of Flake), who wowed critics in 2001 with their 1960s-flavored debut 'Oh, Inverted World.'

title: Yours, Mine & Ours
info: Joe Pernice and company return with ten new indie-pop gems.

title: To Be Kind
info: The third release since the Michael Gira-led band reformed in 2010 was recorded by John Congleton and has a run time of over two hours.

title: Valentine
info: The second full-length release for the Lindsey Jordan's indie rock project was co-produced by Brad Cook.

title: War Music
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Swedish hardcore punk band was produced by Martin Ehrencrona.

title: American Band
info: The 11th full-length release for the Southern rock band formed by Mike Cooley and Patterson Hood features songs about such topics as immigration, gun violence, politics, and race.

title: Hypermagic Mountain
info: The abrasive bass/drums duo of Brian Gibson and Brian Chippendal return with a follow-up to 2003's 'Wonderful Rainbow.'

title: Only Built 4 Cuban Linx... Pt. II
info: The Wu-Tang Clan-member releases his fourth solo album featuring such artists as his fellow Wu-Tang Clan members, Jadakiss, Beanie Sigel, Lyfe Jennings, Styles P, Busta Rhymes, and Slick Rick.

title: Memorial
info: The fifth full-length release for the Chicago post-rock trio features a guest appearance from Chelsea Wolfe.

title: Song for Our Daughter
info: The seventh full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter was produced with Ethan Johns and Dom Monks.

title: Future Nostalgia
info: The second full-length release for the British pop singer-songwriter features contributions from such artists as Ghosted, Stuart Price, Shakka, Tove Lo, and samples INXS's "Need You Tonight."

title: The Witmark Demos: 1962-1964
info: The ninth volume from Bob Dylan's Bootleg Series contains the 47 songs he recorded in 1962-64.

title: Divers
info: The fourth full-length release for the singer-songwriter features the Prague Philharmonic Orchestra and arrangements by Nico Muhly and David Longstreth.
The first full-length release from Adele in six years features production from Ludwig Göransson, Inflo, Tobias Jesso Jr., Greg Kurstin, Max Martin, and Shellback.

title: 69 Love Songs
info: The title says it all. This 3-disc set indeed contains 69 love songs, all penned by Stephin Merritt (whose other projects include The 6ths, Future Bible Heroes, and the Gothic Archies). The Magnetic Fields have evolved into a real "band," including keyboardist Claudia Gonson (also Merritt's manager) and multi-instrumentalist John Woo, and Merritt alternates on vocals with Gonson and additional singers. Despite the almost encyclopedic variety of styles and huge volume of songs, there is surprisingly little filler here.

title: Caligula
info: The third full-length release for Rhode Island artist Kristin Hayter was mixed by Seth Manchester features contributions from Mike Berdan, Lee Buford, Ted Byrnes, Noraa Kaplan, Sam McKinlay, and Dylan Walker.

title: Ta Det Lugnt
info: This is the third album of psychedelic-rock tunes from Swedish multi-instrumentalist/vocalist Gustav Ejstes.

title: Long Lost
info: The fourth full-length release for the Los Angeles-based indie folk band features a duet with Allison Ponthier.

title: Loud City Song
info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles artist was influenced in part by the film "Gigi."

title: Charity Starts at Home
info: The latest album for the rapper who also is a member of Little Brother and The Foreign Exchange features guest appearances by 9th Wonder, Big K.R.I.T., Evidence, Elzhi, and Pharoahe Monch.

title: Bad as Me
info: The latest album for the singer-songwriter is the first album of all new songs since 2004's Real Gone.

title: A Moon Shaped Pool
info: This is the surprise release of the ninth full-length studio album from the British rock band. A physical release is scheduled for 17 Jun 2016.

title: Masseduction
info: The fifth full-length release for the Grammy-winning singer-songwriter was co-produced with Jack Antonoff and features contributions from Tuck & Patti Andress, Thomas Bartlett, Rich Hinman, Greg Leisz, Jenny Lewis, Sounwave, and Kamasi Washington.

title: Accelerando
info: The third album from pianist Vijay Iyer with bassist Stephen Crump and drummer Marcus Gilmore includes several original compositions as well as cover songs from jazz, disco, R&B, and electronic music.

title: Saint Cloud
info: The fifth full-length release for the indie music project of Katie Crutchfield was produced by Brad Cook.

title: Dear Science,
info: The fourth album for the New York band was produced by Dave Sitek.

title: Sometimes I Might Be Introvert
info: The fourth full-length release for the British rapper was produced by Inflo and features guest appearances from Obongjayar and Cleo Sol.

title: Return To Cookie Mountain
info: David Bowie guests on the highly-anticipated second LP (and major-label debut) from the distinctive NYC band.

title: Sometimes I Sit And Think, And Sometimes I Just Sit
info: This is the debut full-length release for the Australian indie singer-songwriter.

title: Run the Jewels 3
info: Available as a free download, the third LP (not including cat-related material) from the duo of El-P and Killer Mike includes contributions from Danny Brown, Zack de la Rocha, Tunde Adebimpe (TV on the Radio), Boots, and Kamasi Washington. Originally scheduled for release in January 2017, it arrived as a surprise on Christmas Day in 2016.

title: Persona
info: The latest release for the British electronic artist was inspired by Ingmar Bergman's film of the same name.

title: Call Me If You Get Lost
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from 42 Dugg, Daisy World, Domo Genesis, Brent Faiyaz, Fana Hues, Lil Uzi Vert, Lil Wayne, NBA YoungBoy, Teezo Touchdown, Ty Dolla $ign, and Pharrell Williams.

title: POST-
info: The third full-length solo release for the Long Island singer-songwriter features contributions from Chris Farren, Dan Potthast, PUP, Laura Stevenson, and Antarctigo Vespucci.

title: Up In Flames
info: The second LP from Canadian electronic artist Dan Snaith is more song-oriented (and quite a bit more psychedelic) than efforts from similar artists, with Snaith even providing vocals on some tracks. [This release was originally credited under the name Manitoba before being re-released under the name Caribou after the name change]

title: Wicked Grin
info: Tom Waits produced the album and wrote 12 of the 13 tracks.

title: Stories from the City, Stories from the Sea
info: PJ Harvey's fifth, and possibly best, album sees her venturing away from the electronic experimentation of 1998's 'Is This Desire?' and returning to the purer rock sound prevalent on her early releases. Radiohead's Thom Yorke guests on the duet "This Mess We're In." Winner of the 2001 Mercury Music Prize.

title: Heaven to a Tortured Mind
info: The fourth full-length studio release for Sean Bowie as Yves Tumor was co-produced by Justin Raisen.

title: Alfredo
info: The latest collaboration between Freddie Gibbs and The Alchemist features guest appearances from Benny the Butcher, Conway the Machine, Rick Ross, and Tyler, The Creator.

title: That's the Spirit
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the British metal band was produced by band members Oli Sykes and Jordan Fish.

title: Black America Again
info: The 11th full-length studio release for the hip hop artist features guest appearances from Marsha Ambrosius, Bilal, BJ the Chicago Kid, Tasha Cobbs, John Legend, PJ, Syd tha Kyd, and Stevie Wonder.

title: Destroyer's Rubies
info: Dan Bejar's seventh Destroyer record is as lyrically dense as ever, but marks a shift to a full-band, guitar-oriented sound after 2004's more eclectic 'Your Blues.'

title: Designer
info: The third full-length release for the New Zealand singer-songwriter was produced by John Parish.

title: Magdalene
info: The second full-length studio release for the British experimental R&B artist Tahliah Barnett features a guest appearance from Future.

title: Where Shall You Take Me
info: The fifth full-length for the Seattle-based singer-songwriter returns with ten new mostly-acoustic tales about America's heartland, including live favorite "Texas to Ohio."

title: Letter to You
info: The 20th full-length studio release for the rock artist was recorded over five days with the E Street Band and producer Ron Aniello.

title: Undun
info: The 13th studio album is a concept album about the life of Redford Stephens, a fictional character who gets involved with drugs.

title: From A Basement On The Hill
info: The late singer-songwriter was nearly done with this highly anticipated album at the time of his death in 2003.

title: Rejoicing In The Hands
info: The second LP from the New York-based artist/musician/crazy hippie Devendra Banhart (who studied at the San Francisco Art Institute) includes 16 of the 32 lo-fi tracks recorded in the living room of veteran recording engineer Lynn Bridges. The remaining 16 will be released on a separate album later in 2004.

title: Vespertine
info: Bjork's follow-up to 1997's 'Homogenic' and last year's soundtrack to Dancer In The Dark is closer in sound and mood to the latter, taking a quieter, more ambient approach. Produced by San Francisco-based electronic artists Matmos, 'Vespertine' utilizes mainly electronic instrumentation, much of which was recorded by Bjork in Iceland. The lead single is "Hidden Place."

title: Jubilee
info: The third full-length release for Michelle Zauner was inspired in part by Bjork's Homogenic and Wilco's Summerteeth.

title: The Blueprint
info: The now-legendary Brooklyn rapper follows 2000's 'The Dynasty Roc la Familia' with this 13-track disc.

title: Nine
info: The fourth full-length release for the UK group is only available online for 99 days and features guest appearances from Little Simz and Michael Ofo.

title: From Kinshasa
info: After leaving Staff Benda Bilili in 2013, Coco Ngambali and Theo Nsituvuidi started a new group and released this debut release produced by Liam "Doctor L" Farrell.

title: In Rainbows
info: Radiohead releases their latest with a pay-what-you-want price.

title: The Woods
info: The ubiquitous Dave Fridmann produced this latest outing for the veteran indie rockers, their first album for Sub Pop.

title: Lonerism
info: The second release for the Perth, Australian band led by Kevin Parker was co-produce with Dave Fridmann.

title: Kill The Moonlight
info: The Austin, Tex. indie rockers return with their fourth album, following 2001's critically acclaimed 'Girls Can Tell.'

title: Monoliths & Dimensions
info: The metal band worked with composer Eyvind Kang on its seventh album, which features Australian guitar player Oren Ambarchi, vocalists Attila Csihar, Jessika Kenney, Earth's Dylan Carlson, and trombonists Julian Priester and Stuart Dempster as guest artists.

title: Jaime
info: The debut full-length solo release for the Alabama Shakes frontwoman features contributions from Zac Cockrell, Shawn Everett, Robert Glasper, and Nate Smith.

title: Bandana
info: The second full-length studio collaboration between Freddie Gibbs and Madlib features guest appearances from Anderson .Paak, Yasiin Bey, Black Thought, Killer Mike, and Pusha T.

title: Foundations of Burden
info: The second full-length release for the doom metal band was produced by Billy Anderson.

title: The Graceless Age
info: Co-produced with Tim Mooney, the debut full-length release for the San Francisco-based, Mississippi-born singer-songwriter speaks of his struggle against dug addiction.

title: Crown and Treaty
info: The third full-length release for the British rock band is its first since adding American Jana Carpenter to the group and winning a Mercury Prize for its 2009 album, Twice Born Men.

title: All We Love We Leave Behind
info: This is the eigth studio release from the Boston metalcore band led by Kurt Ballou.

title: Joy As an Act of Resistance
info: The second full-length release for the British punk band was produced by Space and mixed by Adam Greenspan and Nick Launay.

title: Art Angels
info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian artist was self-produced and features guest appearances from Aristophanes and Janelle Monáe.

title: Black Tambourine
info: The compilation, which includes six unreleased songs, as well as tracks released earlier on 1999's "Complete Recordings," for the Washington, D.C.-area indie pop band which was originally formed as a side project for members of Whorl and Velocity Girl with Pam Berry as the lead singer.

title: Abattoir Blues / The Lyre Of Orpheus
info: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds' 13th album actually spans two separate discs, each produced by Nick Launay. And speaking of the Bad Seeds, longtime member Blixa Bargeld has been replaced by James Johnston (Gallon Drunk).

title: I Am A Bird Now
info: The androgynous singer Antony is backed by the likes of Lou Reed, Devendra Banhart, Boy George and Rufus Wainwright on his sophomore release.

title: Fishscale
info: MF Doom, Madlib and Pete Rock lend their production talents to the Wu-Tang member's fifth solo outing, which includes a collaboration with Ne-Yo.

title: Cadillactica
info: The second full-length studio release for the Mississippi rapper features such guests as Bun B, Devin the Dude, E-40, Lupe Fiasco, Rico Love, Raphael Saadiq, and Wiz Khalifa.

title: Arular
info: This short but wildly eclectic debut album from Maya Arulpragasam, a Sri Lankan-born, London-based artist and daughter of a Tamil Tiger revolutionary, is preceded by enormous buzz in both the U.K. and the U.S.

title: Negative Capability
info: The 21st full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter features contributions from such artists as Warren Ellis, Nick Cave, Rob Ellis, Ed Harcourt and Mark Lanegan.

title: You're Dead!
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles-based artist/producer features guest appearances from Captain Murphy, Angel Deradoorian, Kendrick Lamar, Niki Randa, Snoop Dogg, and Thundercat.

title: Science Fiction
info: The fifth full-length release for the Long Island rock band was a surprise digital release and was produced by Mike Sapone. A physical release is expected in October.

title: Remedy
info: This long-awaited debut LP from the London, England house production duo of Simon Ratcliffe and Felix Buxton has since been recognized as one of the better dance recordings of all time. It was named by Spin as one of the 90 Best Albums of the 90's.

title: Homegrown
info: The previously unreleased album for the singer-songwriter was originally set to be released in 1975 before it was cancelled. It features contributions from Tim Drummond, Emmylou Harris, Levon Helm, Karl T Himmel, Ben Keith, and Robbie Robertson.

title: Shepherd in a Sheepskin Vest
info: The first new release in six years for the Austin-based singer-songwriter was recorded and mixed by Brian Beattie.

title: Exit
info: The latest album from the Japanese musician includes more than 50 instruments.

title: For Emma, Forever Ago
info: The debut album from ex-DeYarmond Edison member Justin Vernon.

title: Complicated Game
info: The first studio release in six years for the singer-songwriter was co-produced by C.C. Adcock and Mike Napolitano.

title: Pacific Ocean Blue [Reissue]
info: Beach Boy Dennis Wilson's solo album is rereleased with songs from his unreleased "Bambu" album and one unfinished track sung by the Foo Fighters' Taylor Hawkins.

title: Plunge
info: The second full-length solo release for Karin Dreijer is her first in over eight years.

title: Leaves Turn Inside You
info: The first album in three years for the indie rockers is an epic 2-CD set.

title: Have You in My Wilderness
info: The fourth full-length release for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter was recorded with Cole M. Greif-Neill.

title: Fleet Foxes
info: This is the debut album from the Seattle area quintet.

title: Dirty Computer
info: The third LP (and first in five years) from the actress and recording artist features appearances by Brian Wilson, Pharrell Williams, Zoë Kravitz, and Grimes, plus musical contributions from Prince just prior to his death.

title: Fetch
info: The four tracks combine elements from jazz and dub-techno with the help of guest artists Marc Muellbauer, Jonas Schoen, and Sebastian Studnitzky for the Moritz Von Oswald Trio's latest release.

title: Blue Record
info: The second full-length album for the Georgia-based rock band is its first with new guitarist Peter Adams.

title: Person Pitch
info: The third solo album from Animal Collective's Noah Lennox (aka Panda Bear) is completely unlike its predecessor, as it is both upbeat and electronic, sounding like a spacey, 21st century Beach Boys album.

title: College Dropout
info: The in-demand Chicago-based producer makes his debut with the help of guests Ludacris, Jay-Z, Mos Def, Dirt McGirt, and more.

title: Twin Fantasy
info: Will Toledo re-recorded songs from his Bandcamp-released 2011 album of the same name with a full-band for this release.

title: Music For the Quiet Hour/The Drawbar Organ EPs
info: The box set contains three vinyl LPs featuring sounds made from an Italian drawbar organ and a CD with an hour of experimental electronic music featuring Vengeance Tenfold.

title: Upland Stories
info: The latest release for the singer-songwriter features contributions from Shad Cobb, Flatlanders guitarist Robbie Gjersoe, Alex Hall, Wayne Horvitz, Fats Kaplin, Todd Phillips, Jenny Scheinman, and was recorded by Steve Albini.

title: Blackstar
info: The 25th full-length studio release for the art-rock artist is a seven-track album featuring contributions from Mark Guiliana, Jason Lindner, Donny McCaslin, Ben Monder, LCD Soundsystem's James Murphy, and Tedeschi Trucks Band's Tim Lefebvre.

title: Something More Than Free
info: The fifth full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Cobb.

title: M B V
info: The long-awaited follow-up to My Bloody Valentine's 1991 classic shoegaze album Loveless was made available on its website.

title: U.F.O.F.
info: The third full-length release for the Brooklyn indie rock band led by Adrianne Lenker was produced by Andrew Sarlo.

title: My Woman
info: The third full-length release for the North Carolina-based singer-songwriter was produced by Justin Raisen.

title: In These Silent Days
info: The seventh full-length release for the singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Lucius and was co-produced by Dave Cobb and Shooter Jennings.

title: Microshift
info: The third full-length release for the British rock band features electronic elements such as samples, loops, and synths.

title: Flock
info: The latest full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter is said to be inspired by "Lebanese torch songs, 1980s Russian Aerobics records, and Australian Punk."

title: A Billion Heartbeats
info: The sixth full-length release for the British indie rock band was inspired by recent protests and produced with Matt Twaites.

title: Laila’s Wisdom
info: The second full-length release for the North Carolina rapper feature guest appearances from  BJ The Chicago Kid, Black Thought, Gwen Bunn, Busta Rhymes, GQ, Kendrick Lamar, Lance Skiiiwalker, Terrace Martin, Moonchild, Musiq Soulchild,  Amber Navran, and Anderson .Paak.

title: John Howard & the Night Mail
info: This is the latest release from the British singer-songwriter with Andy Lewis and Ian Button.

title: Ten Love Songs
info: The fifth studio release for the Norwegian singer-songwriter features contributions from Anthony Gonzalez of M83, Lars Horntveth of Jaga Jazzist, Svein & Torbjorn from Röyksopp, and the Trondheimsolistene Chamber Ensemble.

title: The Wonder Years
info: The fourth solo album for the hip-hop producer features such guests as Erykah Badu, Khrysis, Talib Kweli, Kendrick Lamar, Murs, Phonte, Raekwon, and Warren G.

title: Silent Movies
info: The guitarist's latest solo album is inspired by film scores he had written for others or for himself.

title: Microphones in 2020
info: The first album in 17 years for Phil Elverum under the name The Microphones features one track that is nearly 45 minutes long.

title: Decoration Day
info: The Southern rock band led by Patterson Hood  follow up their 2-disc concept album about Lynyrd Skynyrd ('The Southern Rock Opera') with this less conceptual but equally rocking LP.

title: The Argument
info: Though Washington D.C. hard rockers Fugazi have been together for almost 15 years, this is just their eighth full-length release.

title: Showtime
info: The UK rapper follows his Mercury Music Prize-winning debut 'Boy In The Corner' with this sophomore release.

title: Blonde
info: Just a a day after he released his Visual album Endless, Ocean releases a 17-track album on Apple Music (and a 12-track version at pop-up stores included a Boys Don't Cry artbook/magazine) featuring contributions from Beyonce, Jonny Greenwood of Radiohead, Kendrick Lamar, Rick Rubin, and Kanye West.

title: Cusp
info: The sixth full-length release from the singer-songwriter features contributions from Peter Broderick, Heather Woods Broderick, Rob Burger, Ryan Francesconi, Daniel Hunt, and Luke Ydstie.

title: Dig!!! Lazarus Dig!!!
info: The latest album for the alternative rock band from Australia was inspired by the story of Lazarus rising from the dead, as well as Harry Houdini.

title: Angel Tears in Sunlight
info: The posthumously released album was the first new music in over 30 years for the San Francisco-based composer.

title: The Thin Black Duke
info: The seventh full-length release for the San Francisco experimental rock band is its first in a decade.

title: Choose Your Weapon
info: This is the second full-length release for the Grammy-nominated Australian band led by Nai Palm.

title: Cocoon Crush
info: This is the second full-length release for Berlin-based electronic producer TJ Hertz.

title: Southeastern
info: Produced by David Cobb, the latest solo release for former Drive-By Truckers guitarist includes guest appearances by Kim Richey and his wife, Amanda Shires.

title: Reward
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Welsh singer-songwriter features contributions from Huw Evans, Sweet Baboo's Stephen Black, Samur Khouja, Josh Klinghoffer, and Warpaint's Stella Mozgawa, and Josiah Steinbrick.

title: You Won't Get What You Want
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Rhode Island noise-rock band is its first since the quartet reunited in 2013.

title: The Dirty South
info: No, the Drive-By Truckers haven't gone all gangsta rap on us; the title is just one example of the southern rockers' playful side. Founders Patterson Hood and Mike Cooley remain, although their surrounding cast has changed a bit since the acclaimed 'Decoration Day.'

title: The River & the Thread
info: The first release of new material in eight years for the singer-songwriter was inspired by her travels in the South.

title: Painted Shut
info: Originally a solo project Frances Quinlan under the name Hop Along, Queen Ansleis, the second full-length release sees the addition of three members, a shorter name, and co-production from John Agnello.

title: Historicity
info: Pianist Vijay Iyer debuts his first album as part of a classic trio of jazz musicians.

title: An Overview on Phenomenal Nature
info: The second full-length solo release for the New York folk artist was produced by Josh Kaufman.

title: Pain Olympics
info: The latest release for the post-punk Canadian collective was self-produced.

title: Too Bright
info: The third full-length release from Seattle singer-songwriter Mike Hadreas as Perfume Genius was co-produced with Adrian Utley and John Parish.

title: Guppy
info: This is the debut full-length release for the New York pop rock band led by Eva Hendricks.

title: The Town And The City
info: The follow-up to 2004's 'The Ride' is a timely 13-track song cycle about American immigration.

title: Workaround
info: The debut full-length solo release for the London-based electronic producer features contributions from such artists as Batu, Kuljit Bhamra, Laurel Halo, Kadialy Kouyaté, Jonny Lam, Lucy Railton, and Untold.

title: World Without Tears
info: Recorded live in studio with her band and co-produced by Mark Howard, 'World Without Tears' marks the follow-up to Williams' acclaimed 2001 release 'Essence.'

title: Cold House
info: This is the Leeds, England indie-rock band's first American LP release in four years. Akin to recent Radiohead, this disc incorporates experimental electronica elements, and also adds guest vocals from members of hip-hop outfit cLOUDDEAD.

title: Things We Lost In The Fire
The Seer
info: The second full-length studio release for the Michael Gira project includes the 32-minute title track and guest appearances by Akron/Family), Karen O, Alan Sparhawk, and Mimi Parker of Low

title: Purple Mountains
info: Just over 10 years after Silver Jews' David Berman announced his retirement, he returns with a new project produced by Jarvis Taveniere and Jeremy Earl of Woods.

title: Puberty 2
info: The fourth full-length release for the New York indie artist was produced by Patrick Hyland.

title: Arca
info: The third full-length release for the London-based electronic producer is the first to feature him singing in Spanish.

title: You Will Never Be One of Us
info: The third full-length release for the California metal trio was produced by Kurt Ballou.

title: Summertime '06
info: The debut full-length studio release for the Long Beach rapper features production from Clams Casino, DJ Dahi, Brian Kidd, No I.D., and Christian Rich.

title: Raising Sand
info: The Led Zeppelin singer pairs up with Bluegrass singer Alison Krauss.

title: Now, More Than Ever
info: The third solo disc from the Canadian singer-songwriter and member of Royal City features members of Hidden Cameras, Royal City and The Constantines.

title: And Their Refinement Of The Decline
info: The Austin-based duo releases its first new album in six years.

title: Let's Stay Friends
info: The New York City-based band's fourth studio album.

title: Vulnicura
info: Originally scheduled for a March release, the ninth studio release for the Icelandic singer-songwriter was released early on iTunes after an illegal leak of the songs was available.

title: Edna
info: The debut full-length studio release for the British rapper features guest appearances from Aitch, Bugsey, Haile, M Huncho, Ivorian Doll, Mahalia, Kaash Paige, Skepta, Stormzy, AJ Tracey, Young Adz, and Young T.

title: Reaching for Indigo
info: The sixth full-length release for Haley Fohr as Circuit des Yeux was co-produced with Cooper Crain.

title: Airtight's Revenge
info: The soul singer returns with his first release on indie label Plug Research after Interscope Records shelved what would have been his second album, Love for Sale, in 2006.

title: Franz Ferdinand
info: The most hyped band to come out of the UK in early 2004 is Glasgow, Scotland's Franz Ferdinand, an art-rock quartet who make their full-length debut with this self-titled release, the winner of the UK's coveted Mercury Music Prize in 2004.

title: I Love You, Honeybear
info: The second full-length release from Josh Tillman as Father John Misty was co-produced with Jonathan Wilson.

title: Virgins
info: The seventh full-length release for the Canadian experimental electronic producer was recorded live in Montreal, Reykjavik, and Seattle.

title: Be the Cowboy
info: The fifth full-length release for the New York City indie rock artist was recorded with producer Patrick Hyland.

title: xx
info: This is the debut album for the South London quartet.

title: Let Me Do One More
info: The latest full-length release for the Sarah Tudzin project features guest appearances from Buck Meek and Alex Menne.

title: World Music
info: This is their debut album for the seven-man collective hailing from the tiny village of Korpilombolo in northern Sweden.

title: Ohms
info: The ninth full-length studio release for the Sacramento alternative metal band was produced by Terry Date.

title: Ágætis Byrjun
info: This sophomore effort from Icelandic quartet Sigur Ros (which translates to "Victory Rose") appeared on numerous year-end Best Of lists in 2000, despite not receiving an official release in the United States until the following year. Imagine one of Radiohead's recent albums -- or better yet, Spiritualized or My Bloody Valentine -- but with everything sung in Icelandic. This album garnered the band the 2001 Shortlist Prize for Artistic Achievement In Music.

title: Random Access Memories
info: The fourth studio release for the electronic duo features guest appearances by Julian Casablancas, Todd Edwards, Panda Bear, Paul Williams, and Pharrell Williams.

title: Soil
info: The debut full-length release for the New York-based alternative R&B artist features production from Clams Casino, Paul Epworth, and Katie Gately.

title: Neon Bible
info: One of the most anticipated releases of 2007 is this second album from Montreal's Arcade Fire, the Win Butler- and Regine Chassagne-led band that won over bloggers, critics, and, ultimately, fans with their 2004 debut 'Funeral.'

title: Remembering Mountains: Unheard Songs By Karen Dalton
info: Isobel Campbell, Diane Cluck, Sharon Van Etten, Josephine Foster, Patty Griffin, Larkin Grimm, Laurel Halo, Julia Holter, Marissa Nadler, Tara Jane O'Neil, and Lucinda Williams give voice to lyrics and poems written by folk singer-songwriter Karen Dalton.

title: Yankee Hotel Foxtrot
info: The long wait for this fourth album from Jeff Tweedy & co. is partially the result of the tumultuous recording process that left the band without its guitarist (Jay Bennett) and its record label (Warner/Reprise). Fellow Chicagoan Jim O'Rourke mixed the 11 tracks.

title: Norman Fucking Rockwell!
info: The sixth full-length release for the pop singer-songwriter was produced with Jack Antonoff and features contributions from Louis Bell, Zach Dawes, Rick Nowels, and Andrew Watt.

title: Congotronics
info: The first installment of a series of "Congotronics" releases features seven tracks by 30-year old Kinshasa-based band Konono No. 1, whose unconventional, homemade amplification brings an almost experimental edge to traditional African trance music.

title: Stumble Into Grace
info: Still going strong at 57, the Grammy-winning artist offers 12 new tracks, with some A-list backing from the likes of Linda Ronstadt, Jill Cunniff, Jane Siberry, and Kate and Anna McGarrigle.

title: Phrenology
info: The groundbreaking Philadelphia rap outfit returns with 13 new tracks and guest contributions from Jill Scott, Nelly Furtado, Talib Kweli and Musiq.

title: Celestial Lineage
info: The Washington state metal band's fourth studio album seeks to envision a place full of cedar trees for the listeners.

title: Shall We Go on Sinning So That Grace May Increase?
info: The latest release for Drew Daniel project features vocals from Angel Deradoorian, Jana Hunter and Colin Self.

title: Annie Up
info: The second release for the country trio of Miranda Lambert, Ashley Monroe, and Angaleena Presley was produced by Frank Liddell, Glenn Worf, and Chuck Ainlay.

title: Is Survived By
info: The third full-length release for the five-piece hardcore band led by Jeremy Bolm was produced by Brad Wood.

title: Innocence is Kinky
info: Produced by John Parish, the Norwegian artist's latest release was influenced by a sound and light installation commissioned in 2011.

title: Cocoa Sugar
info: The third full-length release for the Edinburgh-based trio was recorded in the band's studio.

title: The Suburbs
info: The Montreal band return with their third studio album of soaring anthems and varied instrumentation, a pairing that has successfully secured their place as indie rock royalty.

title: Beautiful Africa
info: John Parish produced the Malian–born singer-songwriter's fifth release featuring songs sung in English, French, and Bambara.

title: In Colour
info: The debut full-length solo release for the xx's Jamie Smith features guest appearances from Popcaan, Young Thug, as well as his xx bandmates Romy Croft and Oliver Sim.

title: Gone Away Backward
info: The 11th release for the Chicago-based singer-songwriter was produced by Steve Albini.

title: Favourite Colours
info: The Toronto, Canada country-surf-rockers led by the Good brothers (Dallas and Travis) return with a self-produced effort. Robyn Hitchcock guests on one track.

title: The Creek Drank The Cradle
info: Written, recorded and performed entirely by Miami, Fla-based Samuel Beam, 'The Creek Drank The Cradle' is the debut album for Iron & Wine, a largely lo-fi, acoustic affair with a darker take on folk and bluegrass.

title: Children Running Through
info: Mike McCarthy produced this fifth studio album for the singer-songwriter, her first in three years.

title: House of Balloons
info: The mixtape by Canadian artist Abel Tesfaye was released as a free download.

title: Shore
info: The surprise release of the fourth full-length album for the indie folk band led by Robin Pecknold was recorded in California, New York and Paris, France.

title: Seven Swans
info: The indie singer-songwriter's fourth solo album, produced by Danielson Famile's Daniel Smith, follows on the heels of his critically-lauded 2003 effort 'Greetings From Michigan.'

title: Kala
info: The UK rapper returns with her second album, which was recorded in several countries.

title: Bouger le Monde!
info: The second album from the Congolese band with four paraplegic members sees the addition of a new drummer and lead guitarist.

title: Freedom
info: The fifth full-length release for Damon McMahon features contributions from Delicate Steve, Parker Kindred, Gus Seyffert , Jordi Wheeler,  Nick Zinner and was produced by Chris Coady.

title: V
info: The fifth full-length release for the British rock band was produced with Paul Epworth.

title: Sound Ancestors
info: The latest full-length release for the Los Angeles-based hip-hop artist was edited, arranged and mastered by Kieran Hebden (Four Tet).

title: Use Me
info: The third full-length release for the Massachusetts band led by Lynn Gunn was produced with JT Daly.

title: Isolation
info: The debut full-length studio release for the Virginia artist features guest appearances from BIA, Bootsy Collins, Steve Lacy, Reykon, Jorja Smith and Tyler, The Creator as well as production from BadBadNotGood, Gorillaz, Greg Kurstin, Kevin Parker, Dave Sitek, and Thundercat.

title: Death of a Cheerleader
info: The debut full-length release for the Brooklyn-based quartet led by Mia Berrin was produced and mixed by Sarah Tudzin.

title: 22, A Million
info: The third full-length release for Justin Vernon was produced by Chris Messina.

title: Phantom Power
info: The quirky Welsh quintet's sixth album was produced by Mario Caldato Jr. (Beastie Boys).

title: Colfax
info: This is the debut release for the new band formed by Richmond Fontaine's Willy Vlautin with Amy Boone and Sean Oldham.

title: Springsteen on Broadway
info: The two-CD set features the complete audio of Springsteen's one-man Broadway show at Walter Kerr Theatre recorded on July 17 and 18, 2018 for Netflix.

title: Nashville Obsolete
info: The second full-length release for the guitarist features Paul Kowert, Brittany Haas, Jordan Tice, Willie Watson, and Gillian Welch (who also co-wrote the songs and sings with Rawlings).

title: DFA Remixes: Chapter 1
info: This volume collects 9 remixes by the production team The DFA (the duo of Tim Goldsworthy and James Murphy) of songs by Gorillaz, Hot Chip, Chemical Brothers, Le Tigre, Radio 4 and more.

title: Mass Romantic
info: This Vancouver, Canada-based indie-rock supergroup features members of Limblifter, Zumpano and Destroyer and is fronted by Neko Case.

title: Let England Shake
info: Polly Jean Harvey takes a political approach on her latest album, as a singer-songwriter speaking on the casualties of war, the cruelty of life and the condition of being human.

title: Sound Of Silver
info: Dance-punk producer (and one-half of The DFA) James Murphy returns with his second LCD Soundsytem album.

title: CTRL
info: The debut full-length release for the New Jersey alternative R&B artist features guest appearances from James Fauntleroy, Kendrick Lamar, Isaiah Rashad, and Travis Scott.

title: Nightmare Logic
info: The second full-length studio release for the Texas trash metal band was produced by Arthur Rizk.

title: Róisín Machine
info: The fifth full-length solo studio release for the Irish electro-pop artist was recorded with Richard Barratt (also known as DJ Parrot or Crooked Man).

title: Body Talk
info: The Swedish singer-songwriter's album is part of her 2010 Body Talk trilogy, containing five new tracks and another handful of songs with different versions from her previously released first and second parts.

title: Oil Of Every Pearl's Un-Insides
info: The debut full-length solo release for the Los Angeles-based Scottish electronic pop artist features songs co-written with Calia Thompson-Hannant (aka Cecile Believe).

title: Hollowed
info: This is the fifth full-length for British electronic producer Alan Myson.

title: Bécs
info: The sixth full-length solo release for the Austrian  electronic producer Christian Fennesz is considered a conceptual follow-up to 2001's Endless Summer.

title: Who Kill
info: Oakland experimental artist Merill Garbus returns with a second album of lo-fi sounds and eclectic noise-pop.

title: This Is Still It
info: This is a 19-track collection of songs from the rock band who were contemporaries from the Athens, Georgia, music scene that also included such artists as R.E.M., The B-52s, and Pylon.

title: One Word Extinguisher
info: Underground producer Scott Herren (aka Prefuse 73) offers his second LP for Warp, which mixes experimental glitchtronica with more accessible hip-hop elements (including vocals on a few tracks provided by guests such as Mr. Lif).

title: Time (The Revelator)
info: This is the third album for the California native. David Rawlings has replaced T-Bone Burnett as producer.

title: Comicopera
info: The English singer's latest includes Brian Eno, Paul Weller, and Phil Manzanera as guests.

title: Remind Me Tomorrow
info: The fifth full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced by John Congleton.

title: thank u, next
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the pop singer features production from Charles Anderson, Tommy Brown, Michael Foster, Max Martin, Happy Perez, Ilya Salmanzadeh, and Andrew "Pop" Wansel.

title: Far from Over
info: The latest release for the jazz pianist includes Stephan Crump, Graham Haynes, Steve Lehman, Mark Shim, and Tyshawn Sorey to form a sextet.

title: Welcome To Mali
info: The African duo met at a school for the blind and have since written a song for the 2006 World Cup and their latest album features production by Damon Albarn.

title: A Sailor's Guide to Earth
info: The third full-length release for the Grammy-nominated country artist features a cover of a Nirvana song and was self-produced.

title: Natalie Prass
info: The debut full-length release for the singer-songwriter was co-produced by Matthew E. White and Trey Pollard.

title: Mirrored
info: The unique New York four-piece math-rock outfit (that includes members of Helmet and Don Caballero) follows a string of three acclaimed 2004 EPs with this debut full-length, which adds (heavily processed) vocals into their mix of live and programmed instrumentation for the first time.

title: For Sale: Live at Maxwell's 1986
info: The unreleased live recording of the Minneapolis rock band's concert in Hoboken, New Jersey with its original line-up (Bob Stinson would be fired toward the end of that year).

title: Are We There
info: The fourth full-length release for the singer-songwriter was self-produced.

title: Bon Iver
info: The Wisconsin-based indie folk band, fronted by singer-songwriter Justin Vernon, follows up its highly acclaimed For Emma, Forever Ago with a new album.

title: How I Got Over
info: The legendary Philadelphia posse returns with its first release since playing with Late Night With Jimmy Fallon's house band. Staying true to its roots with acoustic jazz grooves and elements of rock and soul, The Roots continue its reign as one of hip-hop's most innovative acts.

title: Afrique Victime
info: The latest full-length release for the Tuareg guitarist is his first on the Matador label.

title: Love & Hate
info: The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Danger Mouse.

title: Sparrow
info: The fourth full-length release for the country singer-songwriter was produced with Dave Cobb.

title: New Energy
info: The ninth full-length release for British electronic artist Kieran Hebden features contributions from Kaitlyn Aurelia Smith and Field Day co-founder Tom Baker.

title: From the Sea to the Land Beyond [OST]
info: The indie band reworked some of its songs for the soundtrack to the Penny Woolcock's film about the history of the British coastline.

title: The  Blackest Beautiful
info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles-based post-hardcore quartet was self-produced by the band with Kit Walters.

title: Book Burner
info: The fifth full-length release for the Virginia grindcore/death metal band is its first with new drummer, Adam Jarvis.

title: Dead Cities, Red Seas & Lost Ghosts
info: The second release from French electronica duo M83 takes shoegaze classics such as 'Loveless' as an inspiration, with synths taking the place of guitars.

title: Hercules And Love Affair
info: The debut album for the electronic group from New York.

title: Minute by Minute
info: The first release in five years for the British soul singer was produced by Gabriel Roth.

title: Syro
info: This is the first full-length studio release from Richard D. James as Aphex Twin in over 13 years.

title: Tracyanne & Danny
info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Camera Obscura's Tracyanne Campbell and Crybaby's Danny Coughlan was produced by Edwyn Collins.

title: blackSUMMERS'night (2016)
info: The fifth full-length release for the R&B singer is his first in seven years and was co-produced with Hod David.

title: Jericho Sirens
info: The first new release for the San Diego post-hardcore band in 14 years was self-recorded and produced.

title: Young Man In America
info: The singer-songwriter scales back from her 20-track 2010 album Hadestown with 11 folk tunes on her fifth album.

title: Centres
info: The ninth full-length release for the Canadian artist who uses cassette players, reel-to-reel machines and synthesizers to create his sound was recorded in a variety of places in Vancouver.

title: Life Is People
info: The first new studio release from the British singer-songwriter in over 40 years was produced by Joshua Henry and features guest appearances by Wilco's Jeff Tweedy, Matt Armstrong, Matt Deighton, Mike Rowe, Ray Russell and Alan Rushton.

title: Teens of Denial
info: The second full-length release (and the first recorded with a full band and studio production) for the indie rock band led by Will Toledo was produced by Steve Fisk.

title: Without a Net
info: The third live release from the Wayne Shorter Quartet was recorded during the group's 2011 tour.

title: Midsommar [Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]
info: The first solo film score for The Haxan Cloak's Bobby Krlic is for Ari Aster's 2019 horror film and features a 16-piece orchestra.

title: Narkopop
info: This is the first full-length studio release in 17 years for Wolfgang Voigt's ambient techno project.

title: Estudando o Pagode
info: Experimental Brazilian artist Tom Ze, now nearing 70 years old, continues to challenge with this concept album about the struggles of women in a male-dominated world.

title: King's Disease II
info: The sequel to the rappers 2020 King's Disease album features guest appearances from A Boogie Wit da Hoodie, Blxst, Eminem, EPMD, Lauryn Hill, Hit-Boy, Charlie Wilson, and YG.

title: Robyn
info: The fourth album for the Swedish singer was released in 2005 in her native Sweden.

title: Process
info: The debut full-length release for the British R&B singer/producer was produced with Rodaidh McDonald.

title: Separation Sunday
info: This is the second album from the New York City band led by Craig Finn.

title: The Decline Of British Sea Power
info: Oft-compared to Joy Division, this unique British four-piece sports single-word names (Hamilton, Noble, Yan, and Wood), dons military apparel for their live shows, and tackles dark, weighty themes in their lyrics (Czech history, anyone)? 'The Decline' marks their full-length debut, drawing critical praise on both sides of the Atlantic.

title: You Forgot It In People
info: The Toronto, Canada indie-rock collective generated a great deal of praise for this 2002 sophomore effort, which was released in the U.S. in June, 2003 for the first time.

title: Quicksand / Cradlesnakes
info: Featuring basically the same lineup as the defunct Chicago band Red Red Meat, Califone makes their Thrill Jockey debut with this mix of country, blues, folk, and electronic elements.

title: Rings Around The World
info: This is the fifth album (and a return to English-lanugage songs) for the well-regarded Welsh indie band, now signed to a major label (Epic). It is the first album ever to be released simultaneously on DVD and CD (with the DVD containing a movie and a remix for each track on the album). Paul McCartney and John Cale have cameo appearances on the album.

title: The Night Chancers
info: The sixth full-length solo release for the British indie artist was co-produced with Craig Silvey.

title: Deacon
info: The second full-length release for the New York experimental R&B artist features a guest appearance from NAO.

title: Big Conspiracy
info: The second full-length studio release for the British rapper features guest appearances form Burna Boy, iceè tgm, and Koffee.

title: Run the Jewels
info: El-P and Killer Mike's latest collaboration was released as a free download features guest appearances from Big Boi, Prince Paul, and Until The Ribbon Breaks.

title: Minimum-Maximum [Live]
info: This 2-disc set was recorded during the band's 2004 world tour.

title: Once I Was an Eagle
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Ethan Johns.

title: Kaleidoscope Dream
info: The second full-length release for the R&B singer includes six songs from two EPs released earlier in the year and features guest appearances from Alicia Keys and Wiz Khalifa.

title: Thunder, Lightning, Strike
info: The fun, energetic collage of danceable, mainly instrumental music (genre names don't really apply here) on this debut disc from England's The Go! Team recalls, if only somewhat, the debut from The Avalanches.

title: Heart's Ease
info: The latest full-length release for the British singer-songwriter features four non-traditional songs.

title: 50 Song Memoir
info: Each song represents one year in frontman Stephin Merritt's life in this 50-song, five-disc set from the indie pop band.

title: Heaven & Earth
info: The second full-length release for the Los Angeles jazz saxophonist features contributions from Tony Austin, Ronald Bruner, Jr., Brandon Coleman, Cameron Graves, Terrace Martin, Miles Mosley, Patrice Quinn, and Thundercat.

title: Halcyon Digest
info: The Atlanta-based quartet's fourth album combines calm shoegaze pop and noisy punk rock to create a dreamy, psychedelic sound.

title: Dissociation
info: The sixth and final full-length studio release for the New Jersey mathcore band.

title: Dark Energy
info: This is the debut full-length release for the Gary, Indiana electronic producer.

title: Fatigue
info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based experimental artist was  produced with Andrew Lappin.

title: Radyo Siwèl
info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian-born artist was influenced by her Haitian heritage.

title: Floreat
info: The British singer-songwriter's second album produced by Dan Carey was delayed for three years after EMI took over her previous record label.

title: 'Sno Angel Like You
info: The Giant Sand leader is backed by an eight-member gospel choir on this 14-track set.

title: Beautifully Human: Words And Sounds Vol. 2
info: The soul singer returns with a follow-up to her Grammy-nominated debut.

title: Welcome Interstate Managers
info: The New York-based indie-pop band, led by Adam Schlesinger and Chris Collingwood, returns with a long-awaited third LP.

title: Midwest Farmer's Daughter
info: The debut full-length release for the country singer-songwriter was recorded at Sun Studios in Memphis.

title: Assume Crash Position
info: The Democratic Republic of Congo group releases its latest album featuring such guests as Kasai All stars and guitarist Manuaku Pepe Felly.

title: Luxury Problems
info: After two EPs last year, the Manchester producer releases a full-length electronic release featuring the operatically trained vocalist Alison Skidmore.

title: Space Is Only Noise
info: The electronic producer who attends Brown University releases the first full-length album of his brand of sub-100-bpm house music.

title: Midlife: A Beginner's Guide To Blur
info: The two-disc set contains some biggest hits, band favorites, and rare singles.
Originally conceived for Nike as a workout mix and released on iTunes, the physical release includes three songs previously available only in the UK.

title: Platinum
info: The fifth full-length release for the country singer features guest appearances from Little Big Town, the Time Jumpers (a Grammy-nominated western swing ensemble that includes Vince Gill), and Carrie Underwood.

title: Far In
info: The seventh full-length studio release for Roberto Carlos Lange under the name Helado Negro features guest appearances from Benamin, Buscabulla and Kacy Hill.

title: Dogrel
info: The debut full-length release for the Irish indie rock band was produced and mixed by Dan Carey.

title: LCD Soundsystem
info: Hipsters, rejoice! James Murphy, one-half of the in-demand indie-rock production duo The DFA (The Rapture, et al), finally makes his full-length debut as an artist as LCD Soundsystem.

title: A Kind Revolution
info: The 13th full-length solo studio release for the British singer-songwriter was co-produced with Jan "Stan" Kybert and features guest appearances from PP Arnold, Madeleine Bell, Boy George, The Strypes' guitarist Josh McClorey, and Soft Machine's Robert Wyatt.

title: Elwan
info: The seventh full-length release for the Tuareg blues-rock band features guest appearances from Alain Johannes, Mark Lanegan, Matt Sweeney, and Kurt Vile.

title: Double Negative
info: The 12th full-length release for the indie rock trio was produced by B.J. Burton.

title: The Blade
info: The second full-length release for the country singer-songwriter (who is also a member of Pistol Annies) was produced by Vince Gill and Justin Niebank.

title: This Is Where I Live
info: The first release in 10 years for the soul artist was produced by John Leventhal.

title: It's Great to Be Alive! [Live]
info: The three-disc live album collects 35 tracks from its three-night stand at the San Francisco's Fillmore Auditorium in November 2014.

title: 3 Pears
info: The first studio album in seven years for the country singer-songwriter features two songs produced by Beck and a song co-written with Robert Ritchie (aka Kid Rock).

title: Every Bad
info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Dana Margolin is its first on the Secretly Canadian label.

title: Black Sheep Boy
info: This is the fourth album for the Austin band led by singer-songwriter Will Sheff.

title: Seek Magic
info: This is the debut album for Dayve Hawk as Memory Tapes.

title: Cosmogramma
info: Thom York, Ravi Coltrane, and Laura Darlington appears as a guests on the experimental producer/artist's third full-length album.

title: Close Ties
info: The latest release for the country singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Rosanne Cash, Sheryl Crow and John Paul White.

title: Koi No Yokan
info: The seventh studio release for the Sacramento alternative metal group was produced by Nick Raskulinecz.

title: Shields
info: The fourth album for the Brooklyn rock band was recorded in New York after a recordings session in Texas was largely scrapped.

title: Beyond the Pale
info: This is the debut full-length release for the band that includes Pulp's Jarvis Cocker, Serafina Steer, Emma Smith, Andrew McKinney, Jason Buckle and Adam Betts.

title: Off Off On
info: The fifth full-length release for the Kate Stables-led band was produced by Josh Kaufman.

title: U Kin B The Sun
info: The third full-length solo release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced with John Raham.

title: Joy of Living: A Tribute to Ewan Maccoll
info: The two-disc tribute to the British folk artist features such artists as Paul Brady, Bombay Bicycle Club, Billy Bragg, Paul Buchanan of the Blue Nile, Eliza Carthy, Martin Carthy, Jarvis Cocker of Pulp, Steve Earle, David Gray, Dick Gaughan, The Unthanks, Norma Waterson and Rufus & Martha Wainwright.

title: LP1
info: This is the debut full-length release for the British experimental R&B artist Tahliah Barnett.

title: Throes of Joy in the Jaws of Defeatism
info: The 16th full-length studio release for the British grindcore band was produced by Russ Russell.

title: Stone Rollin'
info: The soul singer continues his 1960's-inspired music with a fourth album, blending vintage R&B sounds and smooth soul-pop.

title: What Does It All Mean? 1983-2006 Retrospective
info: The two-disc set includes the 28-track "Nothing to Fear" on disc two.

title: Feast of Wire
info: The Tucson, Arizona-based duo of Joey Burns and John Convertino return with their fourth full-length album.

title: The Futureheads
info: This debut LP from the English band certainly recalls English bands from the early 80s, most notably XTC.

title: From All Purity
info: The fifth full-length release for the Chicago doom metal band was produced by Sanford Parker.

title: To the Sunset
info: The sixth full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Cobb.

title: Locked Down
info: The latest album for Mac Rebennack, the multiple Grammy-winning singer-songwriter from New Orleans, was produced by Dan Auerbach of the Black Keys.

title: The Earth Is Not A Cold Dead Place
info: This five-song album is the second release from the Austin, Texas instrumental quartet known for their fierce live shows.

title: Soul of a Woman
info: The final album for Sharon Jones (who passed away in 2016 from cancer) & The Dap-Kings was recorded on eight-track tape in Brooklyn.

title: Kitchen Sink
info: The fourth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Ben Hillier.

title: (After) [Live]
info: The live recording of some of Phil Elverum's songs from A Crow Looked At Me and Now Only performed in a 13th century Gothic church during 2017's Le Guess Who? festival in the Netherlands.

title: DAYTONA
info: The third full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Rick Ross and Kanye West.

title: Phantom Thread [Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]
info: The ninth soundtrack from the Radiohead guitarist is his fourth for a Paul Thomas Anderson film.

title: Present Tense
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the British four-piece was co-produced by Lexxx and Leo Abrahams.

title: Empros
info: The fourth full-length album for the Chicago instrumental metal band was produced by Brandon Curtis of The Secret Machines.

title: I See The Sign
info: The singer-songwriter worked with Nico Muhly on his album of traditional and untraditional songs reworked into folk music.

title: Harps And Angels
info: The first studio album for the singer-songwriter since 1999's "Bad Love" was produced by Mitchell Froom and Lenny Waronker.

title: Fortress
info: The sophomore album for the post-hardcore/metal band from Whitby, Ontario, Canada.

title: Chavez Ravine
info: The guitarist's latest is a concept album about the residents of 1940's Chavez Ravine, a Mexican-American community near downtown Los Angeles that was famously bulldozed to make way for Dodger Stadium.

title: Boxer
info: Sufjan Stevens is among the guests on the Brooklyn band's follow-up to their acclaimed 2005 release 'Alligator.'

title: Some Rap Songs
info: The third full-length studio release for the Los Angeles-based rapper features guest appearances by Navy Blue and Standing On The Corner as well as vocal samples of his parents: Cheryl Harris and (the late) Keorapetse Kgositsile.

title: Reflection
info: The second full-length release for the British electronic producer features guest appearance from Baths, Iceboy Violet, Le3 bLACK, Nova, Eden Samara, and Xzavier Stone.

title: Simple Songs
info: This is the first solo release for the experimental artist since 2009's The Visitor.

title: Popular Problems
info: The 13th studio release for the Hall of Fame singer-songwriter was co-written with Patrick Leonard, who also produced the album.

title: White Blood Cells
info: The Detroit-based "brother-sister" (or, if you don't believe everything you read, ex husband and wife) indie duo of Jack (guitars) and Meg (drums) White continue their stripped-down sound on this, their third full-length.

title: In Time
info: This is the first release in nearly ten years from the country rock band from Miami.

title: Ravedeath, 1972
info: The latest release for the Montreal-based artist was recorded in a church in Iceland.

title: American Dream
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the rock band led by James Murphy is its first in five years (seven years for a studio album).

title: Cee-Lo Green Is The Soul Machine
info: Like fellow Atlanta hip hoppers OutKast, Cee-Lo has trouble sticking to a single genre, as he mixes up styles throughout this sophomore release. Timbaland, The Neptunes and Ludacris guest.

title: The Lemon Of Pink
info: The experimental collage artists combine samples, vocals (courtesy of Anne Doerner) and acoustic instrumentation on this second release.

title: The Wind
info: Diagnosed with terminal lung cancer in 2002, veteran singer-songwriter Warren Zevon decided to record one final album. This 11-track effort includes contributions from numerous Zevon friends, including Ry Cooder, Bruce Springsteen, Jackson Browne, Don Henley, Tom Petty, and Dwight Yoakam.

title: All Hands On The Bad One
We Will Always Love You
info: The third full-length release for the Australian electronic duo features guest appearances from such artist as Blood Orange, Leon Bridges, Vashti Bunyan, Neneh Cherry, Rivers Cuomo, Perry Farrell, Karen O, Jamie xx, Mick Jones, Sananda Maitreya (formerly known as Terence Trent D'Arby), Johnny Marr, MGMT, Oroño, Sampa the Great, Pink Siifu, Tricky, and Kurt Vile.

title: Punk
info: This is the second full-length release for the Japanese quartet that includes Mana, Kana, Yuna and Yuki.

title: Acid Rap
info: The second mixtape for the Chicago rapper features guest appearances from Action Bronson, Ab-Soul, BJ The Chicago Kid, and Childish Gambino.

title: All We Know of Heaven, All We Need of Hell
info: The second full-length release for the Massachusetts alternative rock band led by Lynn Gunn was produced by Blake Harnage.

title: Surf
