info: The the sixth full-length solo release for the guitarist features some original songs and was mixed by Chuck Johnson.

title: Make Way for Love
info: The second full-length solo release for the New Zealand singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Aldous Harding and was produced by Noah Georgeson.

title: Wild Mountain Nation
info: The Portland-based indie band releases its third album.

title: Parallax
info: The third studio album under the Atlas Sound name was produced by Bradford Cox himself and Nicholas Vernhes.

title: Jet Plane And Oxbow
info: The ninth full-length release for the indie rock band was produced by Danny Reisch and features contributions from such artists as Howard Draper, Jesca Hoop, Lucas Oswald, Brian Reitzell, Abram Shook, Cully Symington, and Wye Oak's Jenn Wasner.

title: Lodestar
info: The first new solo studio release for the British folk singer since 1978 was recorded in her home and was produced by Ian Kearey.

title: Pale Green Ghosts
info: Produced with Biggi Veira, the synth-pop second release for the former Czars singer includes guest vocals from Sinead O’Connor.

title: Familiars
info: The fourth album from Brooklyn indie band led by Pete Silberman was influenced by the Eastern philosophy books Silberman was reading.

title: Sister Cities
info: The sixth full-length release for the Philadelphia pop-punk band was produced by Joe Chiccarelli.

title: Cruel Optimism
info: The latest release for the Australian artist features contributions from Chris Abrahams, Tony Buck, Mats Gustafsson, Thor Harris, Heinz Riegler, and Norman Westberg.

title: Running out of Love
info: The first release in over six years for the Swedish dream pop band was influenced by the frustrations at the direction they felt Sweden is heading toward.

title: Slowdive
info: The first new release in 22 years for the British rock band was mixed by Chris Coady.

title: The Monster Who Hated Pennsylvania
info: The latest full-length release for the singer-songwriter from Seattle was self-produced.

title: L.W.
info: The latest full-length release for the Australian psych rock band is the third album in its "Explorations into Microtonal Tuning" volumes.

title: A Beautiful Thing: Idles Live at Le Bataclan
info: The first live release for the British post-punk band features the live recording from its 3 December 2018 set at the Le Bataclan in Paris.

title: Caution
info: The 15th full-length studio release for the pop singer features guest appearances from Blood Orange, Gunna, Slick Rick, and Ty Dolla Sign.

title: I Know I'm Funny Haha
info: The latest full-length release from the Atlanta-based indie folk artist features a guest appearance from Mei Ehara.

title: Doomin' Sun
info: The debut full-length release for the project formed by Palehound's Ellen Kempner and Jay Som's Melina Duterte was written and recorded over two weeks in Jan 2020.

title: Field Report
info: Before the release of this debut solo album, Chris Porterfield was a member of DeYarmond Edison with Justin Vernon (aka Bon Iver) and Megafaun (Brad Cook, Phil Cook, and Joe Westerlund).

title: Black Times
info: The fourth full-length release from the youngest son of Fela Kuti features a guest appearances from Carlos Santana and was produced by Robert Glasper.

title: Unfollow the Rules
info: The 10th full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Mitchell Froom and is his first album of original songs in eight years.

title: Honeys
info: The fourth full-length release from the Pennsylvania noise rock band was produced by Alex Newport.

title: The Magic Place
info: The Brooklyn-based singer is minimalist in her music, using piano, drums, and her voice to make haunting songs--often drawing comparisons to Enya.

title: Bubba
info: The second full-length release for the Montreal artist features guest appearancesa from Durand Bernarr, Eight9fly, Estelle, GoldLink, Mick Jenkins, Masego, Teedra Moses, Iman Omari, Ari PenSmith, SiR, Tinashe, Kali Uchis, VanJess, Pharrell Williams, and Charlotte Day Wilson.

title: Get Tragic
info: The fifth full-length release for the British alternative rock duo features guest appearances from Clarence Clarity, Ed Harcourt, and The Wytches.

title: Me
info: The full-length debut release for Lorely Rodriguez was largely recorded in Mexico and self-produced.

title: Compton
info: Released exclusively on Apple Music/iTunes, the third full-length studio album for the rapper features guest appearances from such artists as Marsha Ambrosius, BJ the Chicago Kid, Eminem, The Game, Ice Cube, Justus, Kendrick Lamar, Craig Owens, Jill Scott, Snoop Dogg, and Xzibit.

title: Africa Express Presents...Terry Riley's In C Mali
info: Co-produced and mixed by Mouse on Mars' Andi Toma, Africa Express reinterprets Terry Riley's In C Mali.

title: From Africa With Fury: Rise
info: The youngest son of Fela Kuti teams up with his father's band, Egypt 80, on this album produced by Brian Eno and John Reynolds.

title: Fear of a Blank Planet
info: The ninth album from the British progressive-rock band.

title: The Ride
info: The Los Angeles band celebrates 30 years in the music business with this 12th studio recording, the first the band has self-produced. Guests include Café Tacuba, Dave Alvin, Tom Waits, Ruben Blades and Elvis Costello.

title: Mouthfuls
info: Yet another experimental indie band to arise out of the Chicago scene, the Fruit Bats are the brainchild of multi-instrumentalist and songwriter Eric Johnson, who has played with Ugly Casanova, I Rowboat, and Califone. On this second Fruit Bats LP, he is joined by Gillian Lisee and producer Brian Deck.

title: Transfiguration Of Vincent
info: A former member of the San Luis Obispo, Calif. trio Rodriguez, singer-songwriter M. Ward gained a bit of a following while supporting Bright Eyes on tour in 2002, and has drawn comparisons to Giant Sand, Tom Waits, and Grandaddy. This is his third solo release.

title: The Coast Is Never Clear
info: San Francisco's Beulah, part of the Elephant 6 collective of indie-pop bands, returns with a follow-up to their well-received 1999 effort 'When Your Heartstrings Break.'

title: Townes
info: Steve Earle covers songs by the late Townes Van Zandt for his latest album.

title: Not Even Happiness
info: The second full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Eric Littman and was recorded at her childhood home in upstate New York.

title: Pattern + Grid World
info: The California producer/artist releases a seven-track EP four months after Cosmogramma, his third full-length album.

title: The Dreaming Room
info: The second full-length release for the British artist features guest appearances from Nile Rodgers and Wretch 32.

title: Drunk Tank Pink
info: The second full-length release for the British post-punk band was produced by James Ford.

title: Rocket
info: The eighth full-length release is the first under the expanded name for the Philadelphia-based artist previously known as Alex G.

title: Silent Alarm
info: This multiculti London four-piece (making their full-length debut with 'Silent Alarm') has been heralded in seemingly every music magazine in the world as 2005's answer to Franz Ferdinand.

title: Epic Jammers and Fortunate Little Ditties
info: This is the debut full-length release for the collaboration between Bonnie "Prince" Billy and Bitchin Bajas.

title: Easy Pain
info: The fourth full-length release for the noise rock trio from Kentucky was produced by Kevin Ratterman.

title: Love What Survives
info: The third full-length release for the British electronic duo of Dominic Maker and Kai Campos features guest appearances from Andrea Balency, James Blake, King Krule, and Micachu.

title: Ghosts of West Virginia
info: The latest full-length release for the singer-songwriter and his band features songs used in the Jessica Blank and Erik Jensen play Coal Country, about the deadly West Virginia mine disaster in 2010 that killed 29 people.

title: Adore Life
info: The second full-length release for the post-punk quartet was produced by Johnny Hostile.

title: Mid Air
info: The Blue Nile frontman's debut solo album is his first record in eight years.

title: Painted Ruins
info: The fifth full-length release for the Brooklyn indie rock quartet was produced by the band member, Chris Taylor.

title: Everything's Getting Older
info: Arab Strap's Aidan Moffat and composer Bill Wells collaborated for more than eight years before releasing their debut album.

title: Love Songs For Patriots
info: 'Love Songs' is the first new studio album in ten years for a reunited Mark Eitzel & co.

title: For the Ghosts Within
info: The distinguished British musician returns with another solo effort showcasing his ability to reimagine classic jazz standards as well as revitalize a few from his own catalogue.

title: Reunions
info: The latest full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter with his band was produced by Dave Cobb and features contributions from Rival Sons' Jay Buchanan and David Crosby.

title: Nothing Is Still
info: The debut full-length studio release for the British electronic producer features contributions from Sam Beste, Finn Peters and a ten-piece string section arranged by Amy Langley.

title: The Kid
info: The sixth full-length release for the Los Angeles-based electronic artist is a concept album about the four stages of life.

title: These Days
info: This 43-song, 4-disc set is composed of all new recordings in roughly four different styles (one per disc): rock, country, acoustic bluegrass, and ballads.

title: De-Loused In The Comatorium
info: 'De-Loused' is the heavily anticipated debut LP from the group formed by former At The Drive-In members Cedric Bixler and Omar Rodriguez.

title: Grassed Inn
info: This is the fourth full-length release for the Australian indie band formed by siblings and a friend in Brisbane.

title: Father of the Bride
info: After a six-year break and the departure of Rostam Batmanglij, the New York indie-rock band is finally back with a fourth studio album, produced by Ariel Rechtshaid and frontman Ezra Koenig. Guests include Dave Longstreth (Dirty Projectors), Steve Lacy (The Internet), Danielle Haim, and Jenny Lewis.

title: One Day I'm Going To Soar
info: Dexys Midnight Runners returns with the shortened name Dexys for its first studio album in 27 years.

title: Alphabetland
info: The Los Angeles punk band returns with its first album in 35 years featuring the original lineup of D. J. Bonebrake, Exenne Cervenka, John Doe, and Billy Zoom.

title: Ventura
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Southern California artist features guest appearances from André 3000, Brandy, Nate Dogg, Sonyae Elise, Lalah Hathaway, Smokey Robinson, and Jazmine Sullivan.

title: The Future and the Past
info: The second full-length release for the Virginia singer-songwriter was produced with Mathew E. White.

title: Little Seeds
info: The fifth full-length release for the indie-folk husband-and-wife duo of Michael Trent and Cary Ann Hearst was recorded at their home studio in South Carolina.

title: Furnaces
info: The seventh full-length release fore the British singer-songwriter was produced by Flood.

title: Bears, Mayors, Scraps & Bones
info: This is the third full-length album for the Canadian punk rock band.

title: Doomsdayer's Holiday
info: The latest album on the Temporary Residence label for the Oregon quartet.

title: Electric Version
info: The Vancouver, Canada indie supergroup attempts to duplicate the success of 2000's 'Mass Romantic' with this sophomore release. Neko Case returns to handle vocal duties.

title: Point
info: This is the second international release for Japanese producer/remixer/artist/recording star Cornelius (Keigo Oyamada), following his 1998 breakthrough debut for Matador, 'Fantasma.' A bit less cut-and-paste than its predecessor, 'Point' still showcases a range of musical styles in its 11 tracks.

title: The Facts Of Life
info: You take the good, you take the bad, you take them both and then you have... the second album from the UK outfit featuring members of the Auteurs and Jesus and Mary Chain. The title track was a Top 20 hit in the UK.

title: The Stage Names
info: The fourth studio album from the Austin, Texas-based band mixes it up with the help of Jim Eno of Spoon.

title: Sunshine Rock
info: The 13th solo release for the Hüsker Dü and Sugar frontman was inspired in part by his recent move to Berlin.

title: Sauna
info: The double album release from Phil Elverum as Mount Eerie includes a ten-minute song.

title: Nijimusi
info: The eighth full-length release for the Japanese experimental rock band is its first with new drummer, Mishina.

title: Silence Yourself
info: The debut full-length release for the all-female British post-punk quartet was produced by Johnny Hostile and Rodaidh McDonald.

title: Overgrown
info: The second release for the British electronic artist includes a track produced by Brian Eno and another track with RZA as a guest performer.

title: City of Refuge
info: The artist combines the sounds of Americana and Asia for her first album on the Rounder label.

title: Final Transmission
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Massachusetts alt-metal band is its final album with bassist Caleb Scofield, who died in a car accident in 2018.

title: At Night We Live
info: This is the first album in over 12 years for the Sacramento rock band who is cited as an influence by such bands as Thursday and Blink 182.

title: The Magic Position
info: Quirky, flamboyant, and young, English multi-instrumentalist Wolf makes his major-label debut with this third album of electro-folk-glam-rock. Marianne Faithfull guests.

title: Mutilator Defeated at Last
info: The latest full-length release for the San Francisco garage rock band led by John Dwyer was recorded and mixed by bandmember Chris Woodhouse.

title: Past Life Martyred Saints
info: Erika M. Anderson of Gowns returns with her debut solo full-length album.

title: We Shall Overcome: The Seeger Sessions
info: The Boss' first all-covers album contains 13 tracks associated with folkie Pete Seeger.

title: Engine of Hell
info: The latest full-length solo studio release for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter was written while staying in Wales.

title: Where You Go I Go Too
info: The Norwegian producer's album has only three tracks, but one is nearly 29 minutes long.

title: Lowedges
info: Named after a suburb of his native Sheffield, England, 'Lowedges' is the third solo release for the Pulp guitarist.

title: Alligator
info: This is the third LP for the Brooklyn five-piece fronted by deep-voiced Matt Berninger.

title: Why Hasn't Everything Already Disappeared?
info: The eighth full-length release for the Atlanta indie rock band was co-produced with Ben H. Allen, Cate Le Bon, and Ben Etter.

title: Ultimate Success Today
info: The fifth full-length release for the Detroit post-punk band was produced by David Tolomei.

title: What We Say in Private
info: The debut full-length release for the Canadian artist was co-produced by Tim Gowdy.

title: Funeral Mariachi
info: This is the final album for the rock trio who decided to end the band after the death of drummer Charles Gocher in 2007.

title: Cut the World [Live]
info: Antony Hegarty and his band recorded live in Denmark with the Danish National Chamber Orchestra some of the songs from the group's four previous releases with new arrangements.

title: Universal Audio
info: The fifth and final album from The Delgados (released on the band's own Chemikal Underground label) was co-produced with Tony Doogan. It ditches the strings of its orchestral predecessor, 'Hate,' to take a much poppier approach.

title: II Trill
info: UGK's Bun B sophomore solo album's featured guests include Sean Kingston, Pimp C, Lupe Fiasco, Lil Wayne, Mya, Chamillionaire, and Juvenile.

title: Valdez
info: The fourth full-length release for the Philadelphia noise-rock trio of Mike Polizze, Jason Killinger and Ben Leaphart was recorded in 2014.

title: Rap Or Go To The League
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Marsha Ambrosius, Chance the Rapper, E-40, Ariana Grande, Kodak Black, Kendrick Lamar, Lil Wayne, Travis Scott, Ty Dolla Sign, and Young Thug.

title: Fallen Trees
info: The latest full-length release for the Ukrainian pianist/composer features contributions from David Allred, Anne Müller, and Hatis Noit.

title: Songs You Make at Night
info: The sixth full-length release for the British folktronica collective feature the original line-up.

title: Now That I'm a River
info: The debut full-length solo release for the Slow Club/The Surfing Magazines member was self-produced.

title: What If
info: The eighth full-length release for German pianist/composer Volker Bertelmann under the name Hauschka features player pianos (also known as pianolas).

title: A Cosmic Rhythm with Each Stroke
info: The debut full-length release for the duet between Vijay Iyer and Wadada Leo Smith was produced by Manfred Eicher.

title: Cortar Todo
info: The latest release for the Italian experimental jazz-metal band is its first with new drummer Gabe Serbian.

title: Impossible Spaces
info: The second album under his real name combines the sounds of electronic, folk and rock music.

title: Love Is Overtaking Me
info: The album features 21 tracks never before released by the late singer/songwriter Arthur Russell.

title: La Foret
info: The experimental indie-rockers led by Jamie Stewart return with album number four.

title: Couple Tracks: Singles 2002-2009
info: The two-disc collection of the punk rock band's singles plus five unreleased tracks (demos, outakes, and session versions).

title: Front Row Seat to Earth
info: The latest full-length release for singer-songwriter Natalie Mering was co-produced with Chris Cohen.

title: An Empty Bliss Beyond This World
info: British producer/experimental artist Jim Kirby releases his latest album under The Caretaker name.

title: Love Me Back
info: The Philadelphia-born R&B singer/songwriter who has written songs for such artists as Christina Milian, Monica, and Jennifer Hudson, releases her second solo album.

title: By The Throat
info: Classical-minimalist composer Ben Frost makes eerie, ambient-electronic noise in By the Throat.

title: Midnight At The Movies
info: The second album for the son of Steve Earle was produced by RS Field and Steve Poulton.

title: Rather Ripped
info: This self-produced 20th album finds the New York band back down to a four-piece, with Jim O'Rourke dropping out after two albums.

title: Great Spans of Muddy Time
info: The latest full-length release for the British artist previously known under the name East India Youth was completed from cassette recordings after a hard-drive failure.

title: Desertshore/The Final Report
info: The two-disc set includes a reworking of the incomplete "reversion" of Nico's Desertshore album with guest vocalists taking over lead vocals from Genesis P-Orridge, who left Throbbing Gristle in 2007. The Final Report contains songs by Chris Carter, Peter Christopherson, and Cosey Fanni Tutti before Christopherson passed away in 2010.

title: True Love Cast Out All Evil
info: The 13th Floor Elevators founder returns with his first album of new music in more than 10 years, and Okkervil River joins him as his backing band.

title: It's Blitz
info: The third album for the New York band was produced by Nick Launay and Dave Sitek.

title: Midnight Sun
artist: The Ghost of a Saber Tooth Tiger
info: The latest release from the duo of Sean Lennon and Charlotte Kemp Muhl was self-produced (except for one Mark Ronson-produced track) and mixed by Dave Fridmann.

title: Absolute Zero
info: The fourth full-length solo studio release for the singer-songwriter features guest appearances by Jack DeJohnette, Blake Mills, Rob Moose, Justin Vernon, and yMusic.

title: American Love Call
info: The second full-length release for the Indiana R&B/soul band sees drummer Aaron Frazer taking the lead on six songs.

title: Blank Project
info: The Swedish pop singer worked with producer Kieran Hebden and RocketNumber Nine on her first solo release in over 18 years.

title: Tara Jane O'Neil
info: The latest full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Chris Cohen, Carolyn Pennypacker-Riggs and Joan Shelley.

title: Up to Anything
info: This is the debut full-length release for the indie pop trio from Brisbane, Australia.

title: No Way There from Here
info: The fifth studio release for the the country singer was recorded in Nashville and is her first album of original material since 2005’s Humming By The Flowered Vine.

title: Dig Thy Savage Soul
info: The second release since the reformation of the rock and R&B band (with new drummer Andy Jody and saxophonist Tom Quartulli) in 2010, is its first on the Bloodshot label.

title: Condors
info: Named after a character in Jurassic Park, the British trio releases their debut album, with band member Ayu Okakita's voice as a looped instrument.

title: There Is Love In You
info: The fifth album from Kieran Hebden is his first full-length release in five years.

title: Childqueen
info: The second full-release for the Los Angeles-based artist was self-produced and mixed.

title: Hold On!
info: The fourth full-length release for the R&B/soul singer and his band was recorded live with producer Gabriel Roth.

title: Heavy Light
info: The latest full-length release for the solo project for Meghan Remy was recorded live in Montreal with 20 session musicians.

title: Birth of Violence
info: The sixth full-length release for the California singer-songwriter was recorded by Ben Chisholm.

title: Brothers
info: The latest album for the duo of Daniel Auerbach and Patrick Carney features two tracks produced with Danger Mouse.

title: The  Dream Is Over
info: The second full-length release for the Toronto punk band was recorded despite a diagnosis of a possible end of Stefan Babcock's singing career due to a hemorrhaging cyst on his vocal cords if he continued.

title: Jarvis
info: Pulp frontman Jarvis Cocker makes his solo debut with this 14-song disc (which includes recent single "Running The World" as a secret bonus track).

title: Post-Nothing
info: This is the debut full-length album for the indie-rock duo from Vancouver, Canada.

title: Pain Is Beauty
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the experimental California singer-songwriter was produced with Ben Chisholm.

title: Saturation III
info: The third and final release of the trilogy of albums from the California-based alternative hip hop group.

title: Zoy Zoy
info: The second full-length release for the group based in Niger was recorded by Jamie Carter.

title: Stitches
info: The seventh release for the indie experimental rock band led by Tim Rutili was recorded in Arizona, California, and Texas.

title: Wildcard
info: The seventh full-length release for the country singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Maren Morris and was produced by Jay Joyce.

title: ATAXIA
info: This is the debut full-length release for the British electronic producer.

title: Cry Cry Cry
info: The first full-length release in seven years for the indie-rock band led by Spencer Krug and Dan Boeckner was produced by John Goodmanson.

title: Primary Colours
info: The second album for the British rock band was produced by Portishead's Geoff Barrow.

title: Album Of The Year
info: The Good Life is a side project for Cursive's Tim Kasher, and this third full-length release (following the 'Lovers Need Lawyers' EP) finds him joined by Stefanie Drootin, Ryan Fox and Roger Lewis.

title: Venice
info: Vienna's Christian Fennesz, who creates ambient electronica based on processed guitar sounds, returns with his first solo studio effort in four years. David Sylvian guests on one track.

title: Haha Sound
info: This is just the second full-length recording for the Birmingham, England experimental pop outfit founded in 1995. Included here is the track "Pendulum" from the recent EP of the same name.

title: band red
info: This is the sophomore disc for the Norwich, England rock band (led by excitable vocalist Nikki Colk) who at times recall a harder-rocking Electrelane or a UK version of the Yeah Yeah Yeahs.

title: Good Looking Blues
info: The third release from the trip-hop/indie/rock/electronic/jazz/pop band named after the first dog in outer space.

title: SIGN
info: This is the 14th full-length studio release for the British electronic duo of of Sean Booth and Rob Brown.

title: The Million Masks of God
info: The latest full-length studio release for the Atlanta indie rock band was produced with Ethan Gruska and Catherine Marks.

title: Solo
info: The pianist's follow-up to last year's Historicity, where he worked as part of a trio, is a solo album of originals and covers.

title: Other You
info: The latest full-length solo release for the indie singer-songwriter was recorded in Los Angeles with producer Rob Schnapf.

title: Help Us Stranger
info: The first new studio release in 11 years for the Detroit rock band features a cover of Donovan's "Hey Gyp (Dig the Slow)" and was self-produced with Joshua V. Smith.

title: Blood
info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based singer-songwriter and cellist features production from Jamie xx, Rodaidh McDonald, Skrillex, and Adrian Younge.

title: Le Kov
info: The singer-songwriter worked with Rhys Edwards on her second full-length release sung entirely in the Cornish-language.

title: Sempiternal
info: The fourth release for the British metalcore band was produced by Terry Date and is its first with Worship's Jordan Fish.

title: color theory
info: The fourth full-length release for the Nashville singer-songwriter was produced by Gabe Wax and mixed by Lars Stalfors.

title: About Farewell
info: The folk singer-songwriter's divorce from Tom Bevitori was an influence on the John Askew-produced fourth full-length release.

title: Apollo XXI
info: The debut full-length solo studio release for The Internet guitarist features guest appearances from Daisy and Amandla Stenberg.

title: False Readings On
info: This is the eighth full-length studio release for Matthew Cooper under the name Eluvium.

title: Honor Found In Decay
info: The tenth full-length studio album for the Oakland, California metal band was produced with Steve Albini.

title: Beware of the Dogs
info: The debut full-length release for the Australian singer-songwriter was  produced by Dean Tuza.

title: Fading Frontier
info: The seventh full-length studio release for the Atlanta indie rock band was produced with Ben H. Allen III.

title: Of the Sun
info: The latest full-length release for the Polish alternative band led by Grzegorz Kwiatkowski was recorded, produced and mixed by Michal Kupicz.

title: Love Remains
info: The debut album for Tom Krell, a singer from Germany, includes tracks that were previously released on EPs.

title: Written In Chalk
info: Married couple Buddy and Julie Miller release their latest album together featuring guest artists including Robert Plant, Emmylou Harris, Patty Griffin, the McCrary Sisters, and Larry Campbell.

title: The Midnight Sun
info: The second full-length release for the Scottish artist was again self-recorded and produced.

title: Irisiri
info: The third full-length release for the Queens-based experimental artist Alexandra Drewchin features guest appearances by Moor Mother and Odwalla1221.

title: The Next Day
info: In the works for over two years with producer Tony Visconti, this is the first new studio release from David Bowie in ten years.

title: Holy Ghost
info: The third full-length release for the Philadelphia quartet features Jacob Ewald and Brendan Lukens splitting songwriting duties between themselves with production by Hop Along's Joe Reinhart.

title: Banga
info: Patti Smith's first album since 2004's Trampin' features guest appearances by her children Jesse and Jackson, Tom Verlaine, and Jack Petruzzelli.

title: New Multitudes
info: Unreleased songs from folk legend Woody Guthrie are interpreted by Son Volt's Jay Farrar, Centro-matic's Will Johnson, Anders Parker, and My Morning Jacket's Jim James.

title: This Land
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Austin singer-guitarist was co-produced with Jacob Sciba.

title: Never Were the Way She Was
info: The debut full-length collaboration between Arcade Fire's saxophonist Colin Stetson and violinist Sarah Neufeld was produced by Hans Bernard.

title: Tirtha
info: Vijay Iyer collaborates with Prasanna and Nitin Mitta to combine their different styles of music to create this jazz album.

title: Tramp
info: The third album for the singer-songwriter was produced by The National's Aaron Dessner, who also guests on the release with fellow band member Bryce Dessner, Julianna Barwick, Zach Condon of Beirut, Matt Barrick of The Walkmen, and Jenn Wasner of Wye Oak.

title: Get Yer Ya-Ya's Out! The Rolling Stones In Concert [40th Anniversary Deluxe Box Set]
info: The rerelease of the two-night concert at Madison Square Garden in 1969 features five unreleased tracks and tracks from the opening acts: BB King and Ike & Tina Turner.

title: Not Your Muse
info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-born, London-based singer-songwriter who won the BBC Sound of 2020 features production from Josh Crocker, Jamie Hartman and John Hill.

title: New Breed
info: The fifth full-length solo release for Dawn Richard was influenced by her hometown of New Orleans and features contributions from Cole M.G.N, Hudson Mohawke and Kaveh Rastegar.

title: Bellowing Sun
info: The latest full-length release for Jaime Fennelly's solo project was originally Commissioned by the  Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago and was produced by Tortoise's John McEntire.

title: Under Construction
info: Missy Elliott reunites once again with super-producer Timbaland on this, her fourth studio album. The lead single is "Work It," a huge success even before the album's release. Guests on the disc include Jay-Z, Ludacris, Beyonce Knowles, TLC and Method Man.

title: Songs In Red And Gray
info: Singer-songwriter Suzanne Vega fills her sixth studio album with 13 new compositions. Former producer (and former husband) Mitchell Froom is gone, replaced by Rupert Hine, who creates an overall sound that is more like Vega's earliest recordings than her Froom-produced output during the 1990s.

title: Ivy Tripp
info: The third full-length release for the New York-based Alabama singer-songwriter Katie Crutchfield was co-produced with Kyle Gilbride and Keith Spencer.

title: Atlanta Millionaires Club
info: The third full-length release for the Atlanta-based indie singer-songwriter was co-produced with Drew Vandenberg.

title: True Meanings
info: The 14th full-length solo studio release for British singer-songwriter was recorded in just over three weeks and features contributions from Rod Argent, Martin Carthy, Erland Cooper, Connor O’Brien, and Danny Thompson.

title: Tears Of The Valedictorian
info: This is the fourth full-length for the Canadian indie-rock band led by Carey Mercer (also of Swan Lake).

title: More Faithful
info: The third full-length release for the Canadian indie band led by Jasamine White-Gluz was produced by Jorge Elbrecht.

title: Shelly's on Zenn-La
info: The third full-length solo release for the British cellist and producer features guest appearances from Chrysanthemum Bear, Malibu and Kathryn Williams.

title: Lay It Down
info: Al Green's latest album includes guests John legend and Anthony Hamilton. It was also produced in part by Willie Mitchell and Ahmir "?uestlove" Thompson.

title: Aerial
info: This double-disc set is the influential singer-songwriter's first album in a dozen years.

title: Straight Songs of Sorrow
info: The latest solo release for the former Screaming Trees lead singer features contributions from such artists as Greg Dulli, the Bad Seeds’ Warren Ellis, Ed Harcourt, Led Zeppelin’s John Paul Jones, Lamb of God’s Mark Morton, and Portishead’s Adrian Utley.

title: Lala Belu
info: The first new release in 15 years for the Ethiopian keyboard and accordion player features contributions from Tony Buck and Mike Majkowski.

title: Expect Delays
info: The second full-length release for the London indie rock band was produced by Rory Atwell.

title: Parting the Sea Between Brightness and Me
info: Recorded over five days with producer Ed Rose, the second album for the Los Angeles post-hardcore band is its first on the Deathwish label.

title: Angels of Death
info: The third full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was written in a 19th century church near Lake Erie.

title: Chosen Lords
info: This ten-track album compiles versions of songs first released in 2005 as AFX's "Analord" series of (quite expensive) vinyl singles.

title: After
info: The second full-length release for Aly Spaltro as Lady Lamb was co-produced by Nadim Issa.

title: AJ Tracey
info: The debut full-length release for the British rapper features guest appearances from Jay Critch, Giggs, and Not3s.

title: Ungodly Hour
info: The second full-length studio release for the R&B sister duo of Chloe and Halle Bailey features guest appearances from Swae Lee and Mike Will Made-It.

title: Onion
info: The fifth full-length release for the Oakland, California quartet was produced by the Black Keys' Dan Auerbach.

title: Ojalá
info: The debut full-length release from Cocteau Twins' bassist Simon Raymonde and Dif Juz's drummer Richie Thomas features guest appearances from such artists as Ghostpoet, Marissa Nadler, Horse Thief's Cameron Neal, The Innocence Mission's Karen Peris, Hilang Child/Ed Riman, ex-Midlake frontman Tim Smith, Sharon Van Etten, and Lanterns On The Lake's Hazel Wilde.

title: Now You Are One Of Us
info: The experimental Dallas, Texas outfit led by John Congleton returns with a spooky, noisy fourth album.

title: Somewhere Else
info: The Ohio country-rock singer is backed by Nick German, Ben Lamb, and Todd May on her third full-length release.

title: Bark Your Head Off, Dog
info: The third full-length release for the Philadelphia indie rock band led by Frances Quinlan was self-produced and recorded.

title: TSOL
info: The latest album for the Canadian rapper was nominated for a Polaris Music Prize.

title: Love Travels At Illegal Speeds
info: This is the fifth solo disc for the former Blur guitarist.

title: 13 Rivers
info: The latest full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter was self-produced.

title: Fever Ray
info: The Knife's Karin Dreijer Andersson releases her solo album under the name Fever Ray.

title: AM
info: Produced by James Ford and Ross Orton, the fifth full-length studio release for the indie rock band includes guest appearances by Josh Homme, Bill Ryder-Jones, and Pete Thomas.

title: Contra
info: The second album for the rock band was produced by band member, Rostam Batmanglij.

title: Get Behind Me Satan
info: The duo's fifth long-player, destined to be known as GBMS in record reviews everywhere, was recorded in their Detroit studio. While not a total departure from previous efforts, it does find them expanding their sound away from their usual guitar+drums formula.

title: Consequences
info: The latest full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was self-recorded and produced.

title: Love Is the King
info: The fourth full-length solo release for the Wilco singer was produced with Tom Schick and features his sons Spencer and Sammy.

title: Keleketla!
info: The collaborative project brought together by Coldcut and Keletetla! Library founders Rangoato Hlasane and Malose Malahlela features appearances from such artists as Tony Allen, Antibalas, Shabaka Hutchings, Nono Nkoane, Tamar Osborn, Afla Sackey, Dele Sosimi, Tenderlonious, Thabang Tabane, The Watts Prophets, and Sibusile Xaba.

title: UNLOCKED
info: The eight-track soundtrack to the short film of the same name is a collaboration between Denzel Curry and Kenny Beats.

title: You Will Not Die
info: The second full-length release for the South African actor/singer was produced by Ben Christopher.

title: Dead Magic
info: The fourth full-length release for the Swedish singer-songwriter features a 20th century pipe organ and was produced by Randall Dunn.

title: By the Way I Forgive You
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was co-produced by Dave Cobb and Shooter Jennings.

title: Damned Devotion
info: The fifth full-length release for Joan Wasser was produced with Thomas Bartlett and Parker Kindred.

title: Open Here
info: The sixth full-length release for the British alternative rock band features contributions from Liz Corney, Ed Cross, Simon Dennis, Pete Fraser, Sarah Hayes, Ele Leckie, Jo Montgomery, and Chrissie Slater.

title: Visions of a Life
info: The second full-length release for the British alternative rock band was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.

title: Green Twins
info: The debut full-length release for the New York City-based artist was recorded over a three year period with guest appearances from Jesse & Forever and Onyx Collective.

title: Play What They Want
info: The third release for the John Colpitts project features guest appearances by Laurie Anderson, David Byrne, Nick Hallett, Trans Am's Phil Manley, Quince Contemporary Vocal Ensemble, TIGUE, and Yo La Tengo.

title: IV
info: This is the first full-length studio release since 2009's Thriller for the British noise rock band.

title: Closure
info: This is the 12th and final release for the British collective led by Glen Johnson.

title: Jardín
info: This is the debut full-length release for the Brooklyn R&B singer best known for being sample on Drake's "Jungle" track.

title: Bonito Generation
info: This is the debut full-length release for the London-based J-pop-influenced trio.

title: Eric Bachmann
info: This is the second full-length solo release for the former frontman of Archers of Loaf and Crooked Fingers under his name.

title: If I've Only One Time Askin'
info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian alt-country singer-songwriter was self-produced.

title: Last Dance
info: The second release of jazz classic from Keith Jarrett and Charlie Haden are from the same 2007 sessions as those on 2010's Jasmine.

title: Settle
info: The debut release for the British electronic duo of Guy and Howard Lawrence  features guest appearances from AlunaGeorge, Eliza Doolittle, Sasha Keable, London Grammar, Ed Macfarlane, Sam Smith, Jesse Ware, and Jamie Woon.

title: Ohnomite
info: The latest solo album for producer/MC Oh No utilizes sound samples from the soundtracks of Rudy Ray Moore's blaxpoitation films.

title: Last
info: The fourth album for the Northumberland folk group was produced by Adrian McNally.

title: Marnie Stern
info: The more emotional third album for the New York-based singer/songwriter has a much simpler title than her 2008 release.

title: Avi Buffalo
info: This is the debut album for the Long Beach, California-based rock band led by Avigdor Zahner-Isenberg, who also goes by the name Avi Buffalo.

title: Signal Morning
info: The second album for the W. Cullen Hart-led indie rock band is its first in eight years.

title: Help
info: The San Francisco-based band led by John Dwyer releases its follow-up to last year's "The Masters Bedroom is Worth Spending a Night In."

title: Cross
info: The French dance duo known for remixing songs from the likes of Franz Ferdinand emerge with their debut album.

title: The Mouse And The Mask
info: This collaboration between MF Doom and Danger Mouse includes voices and skits from Cartoon Network's Adult Swim shows. Non-animated folks like Ghostface Killah, Cee-Lo & Talib Kweli also lend a hand.

title: Weightlifting
info: The fourth album for the veteran Scottish band is their first album release in eight years and first U.S. release since 1993's 'I've Seen Everything.'

title: Movement
info: This is the second full-length for the Olympia, Wash-based indie-punk trio led by powerful singer Beth Ditto.

title: Morning Phase
info: The 12th studio release for the singer-songwriter includes contributions from  Jason Falkner, Smokey Hormel, Roger Joseph Manning Jr., Justin Meldal-Johnsen, and Joey Waronker.

title: Researching the Blues
info: The first release in over 15 years for the Los Angeles rock quartet was produced by band co-founder, Steven McDonald.

title: Capacity
info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn indie rock band led by Adrianne Lenker was produced by Andrew Sarlo.

title: The Inheritors
info: This is the follow-up to the British electronic producer's 2006's The Idiots Are Winning.

title: Benjamin Booker
info: The debu full-length release for the New Orleans based singer-songwriter was produced by Andrija Tokic.

title: The Talkies
info: The second full-length release for the Irish noise rock band was recorded at Ballintubbert House.

title: Life is Good
info: Mary J. Blige, Anthony Hamilton, Miguel, Rick Ross, Swizz Beatz, and the late Amy Winehouse are guests on the tenth release for the rapper.

title: RR7349
artist: S U R V I V E
info: Fresh off scoring Netflix's Stranger Things, Michael Stein and Kyle Dixon and the other three members of the Austin synth band return with its self-recorded second full-length album on new label, Relapse Records.

title: Picaresque
info: Chris Walla produced this third album for the literary Portland, Ore.-based five-piece led by Colin Meloy.

title: Zeros
info: The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was recorded in Nashville with Jay Joyce and mixed by Spike Stent.

title: Diviner
info: The debut full-length solo release for former frontman of Wild Beast was produced by Leo Abrahams.

title: From a Room, Vol. 1
info: The first of two releases in 2017 for the award-winning country singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Cobb.

title: Take Me to the Alley
info: The fourth full-length release for the soul-jazz singer-songwriter was produced by Kamau Kenyatta.

title: Psychic Chasms
info: This is the debut album for the Alan Palomo-led band.

title: They Want My Soul
info: The eighth studio full-length release for the indie rock band is its first with new member Alex Fischel and was produced by Joe Chicarelli and Dave Fridmann.

title: Strands
info: The fourth full-length release for the electronic artist was inspired by river moments and is "about cosmogony and creation/destruction myths."

title: Deep Politics
info: This is the first album in three years for the Portland, Oregon-based instrumental post-rock quartet.

title: AZD
info: The fifth full-length studio release for electronic artist Darren Cunningham was inspired by such things as Blade Runner, Rammellzee, and Gabriel Fauré’s Requiem.

title: Public Strain
info: The second album for the indie Canadian quartet was produced by Chad VanGaalen.

title: A Fever Dream
info: The fourth full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced by James Ford.

title: So Runs The World Away
info: The fifth album for the singer-songwriter was produced by Sam Kassirer.

title: Burst Apart
info: The Brooklyn band return with a follow-up to their indie-rock landmark album, Hospice.

title: Kaani
info: The third release for the Nigerian ensemble was recorded with the help of producer Jamie Carter.

title: Nuclear Daydream
info: The singer-songwriter's fifth studio album is the first for his new record label, Lonely Astronaut.

title: Starting Over
info: The fourth full-length release for the country singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Cobb.

title: Careful
info: This is the second full-length release for the Massachusetts-based electronic duo of Jae Matthews and August Miller.

title: Avatar
info: This seven-song follow-up to 2004's 'Blue Cathedral' adds a bit more melody and cleaner sound to the band's usual noise assault.

title: Motion Graphics
info: This is the debut release for the experimental electronic project of Joe Williams (who also releases albums under the name White Williams).

title: Blue Smoke
info: The 42nd studio release for the country singer features duets with Kenny Rogers and Willie Nelson.

title: Platform
info: The third full-length release for the San Francisco-based experimental electronic-pop artist features vocals from Claire Tolan.

title: IGOR
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles-based rapper features guest appearances from ASAP Rocky, Dev Hynes, Frank Ocean, Playboi Carti, Santigold, Kanye West, Pharrell Williams, and Charlie Wilson.

title: Your Future Our Clutter
info: Continuing with the same lineup as 2008's "Imperial Wax Solvent," the British rock band led by Mark E. Smith releases its 28th studio album on new label Domino records.

title: Punish, Honey
info: This is the second full-length electronic release for producer Sebastian Gainsborough as Vessel.

title: Goon
info: The debut full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter features production from Black Keys' Patrick Carney, Ariel Rechtshaid, and Girls' Chet White.

title: R Plus Seven
info: The fifth release for experimental electronic artist Daniel Lopatin is his first disc with Wrap Records as Oneohtrix Point Never.

title: Push the Sky Away
info: The 15th release for Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds was produced by Nick Launay and is its first without Mick Harvey, who left in 2009.

title: The Avalanche
info: The latest full-length release for the Mike Kinsella solo musical project features a guest appearance from KC Dalager and was produced by Sean Carey.

title: Medicine Songs
info: The latest release from the Canadian Cree singer-songwriter features two new songs with 11 rerecorded versions of her older songs.

title: Sea Island
info: The latest full-length release for Canadian artist Scott Morgan as Loscil features contributions from Josh Lindstrom, Ashley Pitre, Elaine Reynolds, Kelly Wyse, and Jason Zumpano.

title: Quixotism
info: The five piece album from the experimental Australian composer features contributions from such artists as Matt Chamberlain, Thomas Brinkmann, Crys Cole, the Icelandic Symphony Orchestra, Eyvind Kang, Jim O' Rourke, John Tilbury, and U-zhaan.

title: Lese Majesty
info: This is the second full-length release from the Seattle-based experimental hip-hop group led by Ishmael Butler.

title: L'Ami du Peuple
info: The seventh solo release for Mike Kinsella as Owen was produced by  Neil Strauch.

title: The Violence
info: The third and final part of the British singer-songwriter's Essex trilogy of albums is about the seventeenth century Essex Witch Trials.

title: Imperial Wax Solvent
info: The latest album from the British group is with yet another different lineup from 2007's "Reformation Post TLC."

title: Fur & Gold
info: The debut album was nominated for the Mercury Prize for best British album this year.

title: Wilderness
info: This is the fourth solo disc for the illustrator and Sea And Cake guitarist.

The debut full-length studio release for the Canadian electronic producer under the name Kaytranada (he has six credited under Kaytradamus) features guest appearances from such artists as AlunaGeorge, BadBadNotGood, Craig David, Little Dragon, Vic Mensa, Anderson .Paak, Phonte, and Syd tha Kyd.

title: Let It All In
info: The latest full-length release for the Baltimore folk rock band led by Dave Heumann was recorded by  Steve Wright and features guest appearances from Hans Chew and David Bergander.

title: Fever
info: The debut full-length release for the Houston rapper features guest appearances from DaBaby and Juicy J.

title: Lateness of Dancers
info: The fifth full-length release for M.C. Taylor features Phil and Brad Cook of Megafaun, William Tyler, Scott Hirsch, and Alexandra Sauser-Monnig of Mountain Man.

title: Pushin' Against a Stone
info: The fourth full-length release for the Tennessean country singer was produced by Kevin Agunas and Dan Auerbach.

title: The  Man Who Died in His Boat
info: The latest release from Liz Harris contains songs unreleased from her recording session for 2008's Dragging A Dead Deer Up A Hill.

title: Movement
info: Using a computer, the Tennessee-born musician manipulated her vocals to form her experimental electronic debut full-length release.

title: New Leaves
info: Mike Kinsella's latest solo album under the name Owen was recorded over two years.

title: I Speak Because I Can
info: The second album for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Ethan Johns.

title: You're Not As _____ As You Think
info: The third full-length release for the Connecticut-based indie rock band led by Cam Boucher was produced and mixed by Mike Sapone.

title: Sycamore Meadows
info: The producer/singer/songwriter releases his lastest solo album.

title: Leaving Songs
info: Leaving Songs is the Nashville-recorded second solo disc for Tindersticks frontman Stuart Staples, who is joined by Maria McKee on one track.

title: Moms
info: The fifth album for the indie rock band is its first as a duo (Justin Harris and Danny Seim) after the departure of Brent Knopf, who left to concentrate on his solo project, Ramona Falls.

title: Potential
info: The second full-length release for Brooklyn-based electronic producer James Hinton used vocal samples he found on YouTube.

title: How the West Was Won
info: The debut full-length solo release for former frontman of The Only Ones was produced by Chris Kimsey.

title: Redemption
info: The third full-length studio release for the Southern California rapper features guest appearances from J. Cole, Future, Jeremih, Kendrick Lamar, and SZA.

title: Bright Like Neon Love
info: This debut by Australian Dan Whitford mixes retro-synth pop with some guitars and live instrumentation.

title: Sprinter
info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based singer-songwriter was co-produced with Rob Ellis.

title: Paramore
info: Paramour returns without Josh and Zac Farro to release its fourth full-length release produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.

title: The BBC Sessions
info: The two-disc set includes track recorded by the BBC between 1996 and 2001.

title: Monomania
info: Produced by Nicolas Vernhes, the sixth release for the Atlanta indie rock band led by Bradford Cox includes two new band members: bassist Josh McKay (taking over from Joshua Fauver) and guitarist Frankie Broyles.

title: All 6's and 7's
info: Born Aaron Dontez Yates, the Kansas City rapper releases his latest LP on Strange Music, featuring appearances from Busta Rhymes, E-40, T-Pain, and more.

title: Armchair Apocrypha
info: The Chicago-based singer-songwriter returns with his tenth album of literate and eclectic indie rock.

title: The Long Goodbye
info: The Brooklyn-based Elephant 6-style band (which shares some members with Ladybug Transistor) returns with a second LP.

title: Lost Horizons
info: While the first full-length for the English chill-out duo, 'LemonJelly.KY,' was a collection of previously released singles, 'Lost Horizons' represents their first true album, with eight new tracks clocking in at precisely one hour in length.

title: Turn On The Bright Lights
info: You won't read very many reviews of this New York band without seeing the words Joy Division pop up, and although there are some similarities, Interpol has something new to offer as well. This debut LP includes the tracks "PDA" and "NYC" from the group's well-received first single for Matador.

title: The Private Press
info: The Bay Area's Josh Davis (aka DJ Shadow) finally returns with a proper full-length follow-up to 1996's groudbreaking 'Endtroducing,' which achieved near-legendary status for its imaginative use of samples (a style that would later be adopted by acts such as The Avalanches).

title: Chemtrails Over the Country Club
info: The latest full-length studio release for the pop singer-songwriter artist was produced by Jack Antonoff and features guest appearances from Zella Day and Weyes Blood.

title: The Way Out
info: This is the first album in over five years for the electronic duo from New York City.

title: Going Places
info: This the final album for Pete Swanson and Gabriel Mindel Saloman. The experimental music duo from Portland, Oregon broke up in 2008.
The singles collection for the Brooklyn, New York, electronica duo, which was previously released on the digital music site eMusic, is released physically via Thrill Jockey.

title: Source
info: The debut full-length studio release for the British jazz saxophonist was produced with Kwes.

title: Meet the Humans
info: The third solo release for the former Beta Band frontman was recorded with producer Craig Potter.

title: Short Movie
info: The fifth full-length release for the British folk singer-songwriter was self-produced.

title: Indian Ocean
info: The second full-length solo release from the former member of Be Good Tanya features Al Green's back up band, Hi Rhythm Section.

title: LUMP
info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Laura Marling and Mike Lindsay was recorded in London.

title: McCartney III
info: The latest full-length release for the Beatles artist was self-recorded and produced during the COVID-19 pandemic lockdown.

title: I Learned The Hard Way
info: The fourth album for the funk/soul group from New York was produced by Bosco Mann.

title: Mutant
info: The second full-length release for the electronic producer who worked on Kanye West's Yeezus, FKA twigs' LP1, Björk's Vulnicura and Kelela's Hallucinogen EP.

title: Late Night Tales
info: Sam Shepherd is the latest electronic producer to add to the Late Night Tales mix series.

title: Strike a Match
info: The debut full-length release for the duo of Eilidh Rodgers and Rachel Aggs was produced by Tony Doogan.

title: 'Allelujah! Don't Bend! Ascend!
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Canadian post-rock collective is its first album in a decade.

title: Key Markets
info: The third full-length release for the British duo was self-produced.

title: Prequelle
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Swedish metal band was produced by Tom Dalgety.

title: Palo Santo
info: The second full-length release for the British electronic pop trio led by Olly Alexander features contributions from such artist as Greg Kurstin, Steve Mac, Julia Michaels, Justin Tranter, and Two Inch Punch.

title: Room Inside the World
info: The third full-length release for the Canadian post-punk band was produced by Nicolas Vernhes.

title: Boy from Michigan
info: The fifth full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Cate Le Bon.

title: Extralife
info: The third full-length release for the Massachusetts alt-folk band was co-produced with Dan Cardinal.

title: Maraqopa
info: Richard Swift, who worked on Damien Jurado's 2010 release, St. Bartlett, returns to produce on this live recorded album.

title: Here's The Tender Coming
info: The British folk band changed its name from Rachel Unthank & the Winterset to its current (shorter) name after a lineup change.

title: Boca Negra
info: Originally a quintet known as the Chicago Underground Orchestra, the duo of Chris Taylor and Rob Mazurek releases its fifth album.

title: James Blake
info: Following positive reviews for his EPs, James Blake releases his first full-length album.

title: Guidance
info: The sixth full-length release for the Chicago instrumental rock trio was produced by Kurt Ballou.

title: I Don't Like Shit: I Don't Go Outside
info: The second full-length studio release for the Los Angeles rapper features guest appearances from Dash, Na'kel, Vince Staples, and Wiki.

title: The Sophtware Slump
info: The Modesto, CA band returns with a concept album reminiscent of Radiohead's 'OK Computer.'

title: On Time Out of Time
info: The two tracks from the experimental artist were originally commissioned in 2017 for art installations by Evelina Domnitch and Dmitry Gelfand features the sounds of two black holes merging together that captured by the LIGO (Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory).

title: FM!
info: The third full-length studio release for the California rapper features guest appearances from E-40, Jay Rock, Kamaiyah, Kehlani, Earl Sweatshirt, Ty Dolla $ign, and Tyga.

title: Someone To Drive You Home
info: This is the first LP for the Sheffield, England co-ed five-piece fronted by Kate Jackson. Steve Mackey (Pulp) produced.

title: Highly Deadly Black Tarantula
info: This is the fourth full-length release for the British experimental/post-rock group.

title: Devour
info: The second full-length solo release for the former Loved Ones frontman includes contributions from David Hidalgo Jr. of Social Distortion, Bo Koster of My Morning Jacket, Scott Hutchison of Frightened Rabbit, Matt Skiba of Alkaline Trio/The Watson Twins, and Bob Thomson of Big Drill Car.

title: Letters Home
info: The third full-length release for the Massachusetts hardcore quintet tells the story of the father of the characters introduced in the band's previous albums.

title: Devils & Dust
info: Brendan O'Brien produced (and plays bass on) the singer's 19th album, which finds Springsteen backed by a variety of guests. Several of the 12 tracks here have previously surfaced in live performances, including two dating back to 1995.

title: Three
info: The 21st release for the Australian instrumental trio of Chris Abrahams, Tony Buck, and Lloyd Swanton features three 20+-minute long tracks.

title: Torres
info: The debut album for Nashville's Mackenzie Scott was recorded live to tape over five days.

title: A Friend Of A Friend
info: The singer-songwriter's latest album was recorded with the help of Gillian Welch, Old Crow Medicine Show, Benmont Tench, and Nate Walcott.

title: Magnificent City
info: 'City' finds veteran underground rapper Aceyalone backed by beats from RJD2.

title: Atomos
artist: A Winged Victory for the Sullen
info: The second full-length release for the ambient duo of Adam Wiltzie and Dustin O'Halloran was a score for a dance piece by Wayne McGregor.

title: Kannon
info: The seventh studio release for the Seattle doom metal is a 30 minutes three-track album.

title: Chemistry Lessons Volume 1
info: The first new full-length solo release for the Carter Tutti/Throbbing Gristle artist in 17 years was influenced in part by the death of Throbbing Gristle's Peter Christopherson, British folk music and the BBC Radiophonic Workshop.

title: Ego Death
info: The third release for the Los Angeles jazz/R&B/soul project begun by Syd tha Kyd and Matt Martians features guest appearances from James Fauntleroy, Kaytranada, Steve Lacey, Vic Mensa, Janelle Monae, and Tyler, the Creator.

title: The Boxing Mirror
info: Escovedo's first solo disc since 2000 was produced by John Cale.

title: Androgynous Mary
info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based rock band was produced by Norm Block.

title: Lost & Found
info: The debut full-length release for the British R&B singer-songwriter features contributions from Dizzee Rascal, Amanda Ghost, and Tom Misch.

title: The Sounds of Crenshaw, Vol. 1
info: Producer Terrace Martin brought together a group of musicians that included Chachi, Robert Glasper, Rose Gold, Trevor Lawrence Jr., Brandon Owens, Wyann Vaughn, and Marlon Williams for this album of music inspired by the west coast jazz, R&B and hip-hop.

title: The Phosphorescent Blues
info: The fourth full-length release for the progressive bluegrass band was produced by T Bone Burnett.

title: Divide and Exit
info: The follow-up to 2013 release "Austerity Dogs" from the British punk duo of Jason Williamson and Andrew Fearn.

title: The Money Store
info: The debut release on Epic for Death Grips is the first of two albums released this year by the Sacramento alternative rap trio.

title: Paradise
info: The second album for the indie pop band was produced by Clor's Luke Smith.

title: Waiting For You
info: The project consisting of The Bug, Roger Robinson and Hitomi releases its first album together.

title: Los Angeles
info: The first full-length album on the Warp label for Steven Ellison.

title: Fantasy Black Channel
info: The debut album for the British quartet was produced by Erol Alkan.

title: Set Yourself On Fire
info: Boasting a somewhat higher profile after a tour supporting Broken Social Scene, fellow Canadians Stars return with a third LP, produced by Tony Hoffer.

title: Allas Sak
info: The seventh release for the Swedish band led by Gustav Ejstes is its first in five years.

title: That's How Rumors Get Started
info: The third full-length studio release for the Nashville-based country singer-songwriter was produced by Sturgill Simpson.

title: Damaged
info: This is the tenth album for the very large Nashville band led by Kurt Wagner.

title: Old Flowers
info: The latest full-length release for the Nashville-based singer-songwriter  was written after the end of a long-term relationship and was produced by Andrew Sarlo.

title: The Obliterati
info: While the trio of Roger Miller, Clint Conley and Peter Prescott typically wait a few decades between albums, this third LP follows just two years after their second.

title: The Lion's Roar
info: Mike Mogis produces the second album for the Swedish sisters.

title: AmERICa
info: The first solo release in over ten years for the British rock artist was recorded in upstate New York with contributions from his wife Amy Rigby, Brian Dewan, Jane Scarpantoni, and Alexander Turnquist.

title: Post-War
info: The singer-songwriter's fifth release finds him backed for the first time by a full band, which includes Rachel Blumberg (The Decemberists) and Jordan Hudson (The Thermals). Neko Case and My Morning Jacket's Jim James guest.

title: Carry on the Grudge
info: The third full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Cenzo Townshend.

title: Live in Marciac
info: The two-CD and DVD set features the recording of Brad Mehldau at the 2006 Marciac Jazz Festival.

title: Med Sud I Eyrum Vid Spilum Endalaust
info: The fifth album for the group was was co-produced by Flood and its first recorded in less than a year.

title: Crush
info: The first full-length in four years for Sam Shepherd as Floating Points features strings and woodwinds in additional to classic electronica synths.

title: Manipulator
info: The 17-track release from the California garage rocker was produced by Chris Woodhouse.

title: Ruff Draft [Reissue]
info: The second posthumous release from the acclaimed hip-hop producer, this double-disc set is actually a greatly-expanded resissue of his hard-to-find 2003 EP of the same name.

title: You Are There
info: Steve Albini returns as engineer for this fifth album from the Japanese post-rock outfit.

title: Ultraviolet
info: The first release on the Warp label for the Brooklyn-based composer, producer and multi-instrumentalist features influences from black metal, classical, dream pop, and jazz music.

title: Hippopotamus
info: The 23rd full-length studio release for the Los Angeles rock duo of Ron and Russell Mael is the first new material in eight years (not including 2015 collaborative album FFS).

title: private LIFE
info: This is the fourth full-length release for the British trio of Alice Merida Richards, Sam Pillay and Christopher Duffin.

title: Why Make Sense?
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the British electronic band was produced with Mark Ralph. On every CD and LP release, the artwork will feature a color variation of a design due to a bespoke printing technique.

title: Back To Black
info: Mark Ronson and Salaam Remi produced the British soul singer's second album, which was released to great acclaim in the UK in 2006.

title: Your Queen Is A Reptile
info: The third full-length release for the jazz quartet led by the tenor saxophonist Shabaka Hutchings features contributions from Josh Idehen and Congo Natty.

title: Untouchable
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the rock band led by Emmett Kelly features contributions from Ty Segall.

title: Max Richter: Three Worlds – Music from Woolf Works
info: Wayne McGregor commissioned the German-born British composer to create a score for his ballet production based on the three novels by Virginia Woolf (Mrs. Dalloway, Orlando, and The Waves).

title: Heart like a Levee
info: The sixth full-length release for M.C. Taylor was self-produced with Bradley Cook.

title: Melody A.M.
info: This is the debut album for the downbeat electronica duo from Norway, which has drawn comparisons to bands such as Air, Groove Armada, and Boards of Canada. Erlend Oye (Kings of Convenience) provides vocals on several tracks.

title: Be More Kind
info: The seventh full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Joshua Block, Austin Jenkins and Charlie Hugall.

title: Mangy Love
info: The eighth full-length release for the California singer-songwriter features contributions from Angel Olsen and Blake Mills, with production by Rob Schnapf and Dan Horne.

title: Goldenheart
info: The debut full-length release from the former Danity Kane/Diddy Dirty Money singer was produced by Andrew "Druski" Scott, The Fisticuffs, and Deonte. It is the first of a planned trilogy of albums about love, loss, and redemption.

title: Black Forest
info: This is the sophomore album for the indie-rock band from Madison, Wisconsin.

title: Strange to Explain
info: The 11th full-length studio release for the folk rock band was recorded in Stinson Beach, California.

title: Deceiver
info: The third full-length release for the Brooklyn-based indie rock band was inspired by lead singer Zachary Cole Smith's recovery from drug addiction.

title: Time & Space
info: The second full-length release for the Baltimore hardcore band was produced by Will Yip.

title: Mind Control
info: The third full-length release for the British metal band was inspired by 1970s exploitation films.

title: If...
info: The debut solo album from the former lead guitarist of The Coral was written as a musical adaptation of Italo Calvino's 1979 novel, If on a Winter's Night a Traveler and features The London Philharmonic.

title: Logos
info: This is the second album for Bradford Cox's solo project.

title: Jay Stay Paid
info: The 28-track collection of unreleased tracks from the rapper/producer, who passed away three years ago, was produced by his mother and arranged by Pete Rock.

title: Now Soon Someday [EP]
info: The former Anti-Pop Consortium member's second solo release is a nine-song EP, with six new tracks and three remixes by Kings, Prefuse 73 and El-P.

title: Sing The Sorrow
info: This is the major-label debut for the Bay Area punk rockers (whose initials stand for "A Fire Inside"), who got their start in Ukiah, Calif. in 1991. Garbage's Butch Vig produces.

title: These Are The Vistas
info: This is not your ordinary jazz trio. For their major-label debut, The Bad Plus work with alt-rock producer Tchad Blake, and include covers of  Nirvana's "Smells Like Teen Spirit," Blondie's "Heart of Glass," and Aphex Twin's "Flim" among their seven original tracks.

title: The Noise Made By People
info: Although the Birmingham, England band has been recording and performing since 1995, 'The Noise Made By People' marks their official full-length debut (following 1997's singles compilation 'Work And Non-Work'). In the UK, the group is signed to Warp Records (although they don't sound too much like the other bands on Warp's all-electronic roster).

title: Metamodern Sounds in Country Music
info: The second full-length release for the country singer was produced by Dave Cobb.

title: Blume
info: The debut full-length release for the British jazz collective was produced by Kwes.

title: Ode To Joy
info: The 11th full-length studio release for the Chicago alternative rock band was produced by Jeff Tweedy.

title: Modern Country
info: The fourth full-length release for the Nashville singer-songwriter was written mostly while staying in a cabin in Mississippi.

title: Sore
info: The debut full-length release for the Canadian punk quartet was produced by  Josh Korody and Leon Taheny.

title: The Rose Has Teeth In The Mouth Of A Beast
info: M.C. Schmidt and Drew Daniel's latest Matmos album includes contributions from Bjork and Antony. Each of the ten tracks focuses on a specific person who has influenced the group in some way, such as William S. Burroughs and Valerie Solanas.

title: The Animal Spirits
info: The latest release for electronic artist James Holden was recorded with his band The Animal Spirits in single takes.

title: Sentenced to Life
info: The Seattle heavy metal band's second album was produced by Kurt Ballou.

title: Barbara Barbara, We Face a Shining Future
info: The ninth full-length studio release for the British techno duo was co-produced with High Contrast.

title: I Am What I Am
info: The newest release for the California-born country singer-songwriter is his first on Vanguard Records.

title: 12 Songs
info: Producer Rick Rubin attempts to do for Neil Diamond what he did for Johnny Cash, resulting in a rare stripped-down, intimate set for the veteran performer. (Don't expect any Nine Inch Nails covers, though; these are all Diamond originals.)

title: Loma
info: This is the debut full-length release for the project formed by Shearwater's Jonathan Meiburg, and Emily Cross and Dan Duszynski of Cross Record.

title: Fake It Flowers
info: This is the debut full-length release for the British-Filipino alternative rock artist.

title: On&On
info: The latest full-length solo release for the former Yuck member was recorded by Peter Walsh.

title: A Distant Call
info: The second full-length release for the Philadelphia punk quartet was recorded by by the band's bassist Hart Seely.

title: Oh My God
info: The fifth full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Sam Cohen.

title: Sing the Delta
info: The first release of original songs from the singer-songwriter in 16 years focuses on life on the Arkansas delta.

title: Fits
info: This is the second album for the Austin, Texas indie rock band.

title: Metals
info: This is the fourth full-length studio album for the Canadian singer.

title: The Horses and the Hounds
info: The first new full-length studio release for singer-songwriter in seven years was recorded in Santa Monica with producer Ross Hogarth.

title: Butterfly 3000
info: The second release in 2021 for the Australian rock band was recorded remotely at home during the COVID-19 pandemic lockdown.

title: Fat Pop, Vol.1
info: The 16th full-length solo release for the British rock artist features contributions from Andy Fairweather Low, Lia Metcalfe, Hannah Peel and his daughter Leah.

title: Banana Skin Shoes
info: The first new release in over eight years for British singer-songwriter Damon Gough features production from Gethin Pearson, Youth, Keir Stewart, and Seadna McPhail.

title: Revel in the Drama
info: The first full-length release in seven years for the British singer-songwriter was written and produced with Romeo Stodart of the Magic Numbers.

title: Ribbons
info: The latest release from the British producer Stephen Wilkinson features a variety of stringed instruments including the mandolin and fiddle.

title: I'm a Harmony
info: The California folk singer-songwriter worked with such artists as Devendra Banhart, Nels Cline, Julia Holter, Wilco's Glenn Kotche, and Mark Pritchard on her third full-length release that was produced with Pat Sansone and Fernando Perdomo.

title: Impressions
info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock band was self-recorded.

title: The Unborn Capitalist From Limbo
info: This is the debut full-length solo release for the Wand frontman.

title: Don't Let the Kids Win
info: The debut full-length release for the Australian singer-songwriter was recorded in New Zealand with producer Ben Edwards.

title: Unseen
info: The 10th full-length studio release for the husband-and-wife duo of Brett and Rennie Sparks features contributions from David Gutierrez, Alex McMahon, and Jason Toth.

title: GLA
info: The fourth full-length release for the Scottish alternative rock band was inspired by its hometown of Glasgow.

title: Eve
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the indie rock guitarist was recorded and mixed by Andy Hong.

title: No Man's Sky: Music for an Infinite Universe [Original Video Game Soundtrack]
info: The soundtrack from the British post-rock band features six tracks of soundscapes along with 10 originals for the first-person survival video game released on Playstation 4 and Windows PC in August.

title: West Kirby Country Primary
info: The third full-length solo release for the ex-The Coral guitarist was written and recorded in the house he grew up in.

title: Strangers
info: The second solo release for the former drummer of the Felice Brothers was co-produced with David Baron.

title: Crimson/Red
info: This is the first new release of recently recorded songs in over 10 years for the British singer-songwriter Paddy McAloon.

title: Ask the Dust
info: The second full-length electronic release from Marcos Ortega as Lorn and his first on the Ninja Tune label.

title: Origin: Orphan
info: The Canadian indie band's fifth album is its first on the Arts & Crafts label.

title: Dragonslayer
info: The third album for the Spencer Krug-led project is its first with newest member Mark Nicol.

title: Animals In The Dark
info: The Iowan-born singer-songwriter releases his first album on the Anti label.

title: Gold And Green
info: Originally released in Japan in 2000, 'Gold And Green' finally reaches U.S. shores at a non-import price on Thrill Jockey. Yuko Honda and Sean Lennon guest.

title: It's a Wonderful Life
info: This is the third album for Mark Linkous and Sparklehorse.

title: Can Our Love...
info: The bands fifth studio album (and first for Beggars Banquet), 'Can Our Love...' features eight new tracks produced by the band with Ian Caple. It expands on the more-soul-based sound that appeared on 1999's 'Simple Pleasure.'

title: Double Figure
info: The release notes say that this is the third installment in the trilogy that began with "Not For Threes" and "Rest Proof Clockwork" and that it deals with the "duality of the ear." Hey, as long as it sounds good.

title: WIXIW
info: The Liars go more electronic on their sixth album that includes production with Mute Records founder Daniel Miller.

title: Raw Honey
info: Michael Collins is joined by a full band--plus guests like Natalie Mering of Weyes Blood--on his second album as Drugdealer.

title: Yawn
info: The fourth full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter was self-produced and features guest vocals from The Orielles and Our Girl.

title: Downey to Lubbock
info: The debut full-length collaboration between Dave Alvin and Jimmie Dale Gilmore features 10 covers and two originals, including the title track co-written by the duo.

title: Mutt
info: The third album for Nashville-based singer-songwriter is his first on Bloodshot Records.

title: The Raging Wrath Of The Easter Bunny Demo
info: The Northern California experimental rock band reunite Mike Patton, Trey Spruance, and Trevor Dunn, with Anthrax's Scott Ian, and ex-slayer Dave Lombardo to re-record its trash metal-influenced demo.

title: Nearer the Fountain, More Pure the Stream Flows
info: The second full-length solo release for Blur/Gorillaz's Damon Albarn was inspired by Icelandic and was originally planned as an orchestral project for Lyon's Fête des Lumieres.

title: Cavalcade
info: The second full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced with John "Spud" Murphy (and one track by Marta Salogni).

title: 1000 gecs & the Tree of Clues
info: The remix album from the experimental pop duo of Dylan Brady and Laura Les features guest appearances from Tommy Cash, Charli XCX, Count Baldor, Hannah Diamond, Nicole Dollanganger, Dorian Electra, Fall Out Boy, GFOTY, Kero Kero Bonito, Lil West, Craig Owens, Rico Nasty, and Tony Velour.

title: Torture
info: The eleventh album for the upstate New York death metal band was produced by Erik Rutan.

title: Engineers
info: This debut album showcases the British band's symphonic, shoegaze-y sound.

title: Alasdair Roberts
info: This is the eighth solo full-length studio release for the Scottish singer-songwriter.

title: About the Light
info: The fourth full-length solo release for the former Beta Band frontman was recorded with producer Stephen Street's live band.

title: Tanglewood Numbers
info: Will Oldham and members of the Jesus Lizard and Lambchop guest on David Berman's country-tinged fifth Silver Jews disc, which also sees the return of on-again, off-again band member Stephen Malkmus.

title: Anniemal
info: This debut full-length by the Norwegian singer is preceded by quite a bit of critical buzz on both sides of the Atlantic.

title: New History Warfare, Vol. 3: To See More Light
info: The final volume to the saxophonist's New History Warfare series was produced by Ben Frost and features guest vocals Bon Iver's Justin Vernon on four tracks.

title: Borders
info: The fifth release for the experimental electronic British duo of James Ginzburg and Paul Purgas was recorded live.

title: Put Your Back N 2 It
info: The second album from Mike Hadreas under the Perfume Genius name was recorded in England and Washington.

title: Patience (After Sebald)
info: Leyland Kirby used Austrian composer Franz Schubert's music to create the soundtrack to Grant Lee's film of the same name.

title: July Flame
info: The Portland, Oregon-based singer-songwriter included more strings on her seventh album produced by Tucker Martine.

title: Wilderness
info: This is the debut full-length for the Baltimore four-piece whose frontman (James Johnson) bears a strong vocal resemblance to John Lydon.

title: Bonfires On The Heath
info: The British indie rock band releases its fifth full-length studio album.

title: St. Elsewhere
info: This is the highly-anticipated debut release for the pairing of Danger Mouse and Cee-Lo.

title: No Home of the Mind
info: The third full-length release for the David Moore project finds it streamlined to a five person ensemble.

title: Drums And Guns
info: The slowcore trio (including new bassist Matt Livingston) reunites with producer Dave Fridmann.

title: Gore
info: The eight full-length studio release for the Sacramento alternative metal band features a guest appearance from Alice in Chain's Jerry Cantrell.

title: War & Leisure
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the R&B singer-songwriter features guest appearances from J. Cole, Salaam Remi, Rick Ross, Travis Scott, and Kali Uchis.

title: Beware the Fetish
info: This is the latest release from the Congolese collective produced by Vincent Kenis.

title: Rebirth
info: Tim Armstrong returns to produce the reggae singer's first release in over seven years.

title: Through The Windowpane
info: This full-length debut for the UK-based indie-pop band led by Fyfe Dangerfield includes the previously-released single "Trains To Brazil."

title: The Magic Whip
info: The British rock band's first studio release in 12 years was recorded while on tour in Asia and produced with Stephen Street.

title: Distance Inbetween
info: The first full-length release in six years for the British rock band features Paul Molloy on guitar (filling in for Lee Southall) was produced with Richard Turvey.

title: The London Sessions
info: The final album for the electronic artist is an in-studio collection of nine songs the LCD Soundsystem's career.

title: Somersault
