info: The third full-length release for the Brooklyn indie rock band led by Dustin Payseur features guest appearances from Cities Aviv and Slowdive's Rachel Goswell.

title: Hold On Now, Youngster
info: The debut album for the Cardiff, Wales-based indie rock band was produced by David Newfeld.

title: The Neon Skyline
info: The sixth full-length release for the Canadian pop singer-songwriter was mixed by Rob Schnapf.

title: The Horizon Just Laughed
info: The latest full-length release for the Seattle-based indie singer-songwriter was self-produced.

title: The Plot Against Common Sense
info: This is the third full-length album for the Welsh alternative rock band.

title: Major Arcana
info: The debut full-length debut for the Massachusetts indie rock band led by Sadie Dupuis was produced by Justin Pizzoferrato.

title: Penelope Three
info: This is the Brighton-based Australian singer's third and final release in her Penelope trilogy of albums.

title: En Yay Sah
info: The Sierra Leone artist Janka Nabay is backed by Boshra AlSaadi, Doug Shaw, the Skeletons' Jon Leland, Michael Gallope, and Jason McMahon as the Bubu Gang on his debut full-length release.

title: Live At Shea Stadium [Live]
info: The official release of The Clash's second performance at Shea Stadium in 1982.
The fifth album from the Nebraska-born singer-songwriter is indeed influenced by the music of 1972 (the year Rouse was born).

title: Summer Of The Shark
info: Portastatic is a side project for Superchunk's Mac McCaughan (who also is part owner of Merge Records). On this, his first Portastatic LP since 1997, he is joined by Sleater-Kinney's Janet Weiss as well as members of Sparklehorse and Lambchop.

title: The Covers Record
info: Singer-songwriter Chan Marshall is Cat Power, and on this album she reinterprets (sometimes drastically) the works of some of her favorite artists, including Smog, the Rolling Stones, the Velvet Underground, and Bob Dylan.

title: Carter Girl
info: The first release in six years for the laughter of June Carter and stepfather Johnny Cash was produced by Don Was and features guest appearances from Vince Gill, Kris Kristofferson and Willie Nelson.

title: Let The Blind Lead Those Who Can See But Cannot Feel
info: The debut solo album from the lead singer of Deerhunter.

title: Yours Truly
info: The debut release for the Nickelodeon actress from Victorious and Sam & Cat was produced by Kenneth "Babyface" Edmonds and includes guest appearances from Big Sean, Mac Miller, Mika, and the Wanted's Nathan Sykes.
The second album for the duo was produced by the two artists with John Leckie coproducing one song.

title: Less Than Human
info: The latest DFA artist to create a buzz in the music press is former Six Finger Satellite guitarist John Maclean, whose "Less Than Human" is his full-length debut as The Juan Maclean.

title: Yuck
info: The London-based band’s debut is full of fuzzy noise rock and guitar-heavy anthems, seemingly influenced by the ‘90s grunge era.

title: Savage Mode II
info: The second full-length release for the collaboration between 21 Savage and Metro Boomin features guest appearances from Drake, Morgan Freeman, Young Nudy, and Young Thug.

title: Kill the Lights
info: This is the third full-length solo release for the San Francisco Bay Area artist.

title: Infinite Love
info: The solo album for Ponytail's Dustin Wong was composed almost entirely with only a guitar.

title: A  Weird Exits
info: The latest release for the garage rock band led by John Dwyer is its first with drummers Ryan Moutinho and Dan Rincon.

title: English Tapas
info: The fourth full-length release for the British post-punk duo was recorded in London at Steve Mackey's studios.

title: Thirstier
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the indie singer-songwriter was co-produced with Rob Ellis and Peter Miles.

title: Song Machine, Season One: Strange Timez
info: The latest full-length studio release for the Damon Albarn and Jamie Hewlett's virtual band features music that was part of its web series and features guest appearances from 6lack, Roxani Arias, Beck, Fatoumata Diawara, Georgia, Peter Hook, Elton John, Leee John, Kano, Octavian, ScHoolboy Q, Slaves, slowthai, Robert Smith, and St. Vincent.

title: On All Fours
info: The second full-length release for the British post-punk band was produced by Dan Carey.

title: Congotronics 2: Buzz'N'Rumble From The Urb'N'Jungle
info: Following on the heels of one of 2005's best-reviewed world music discs is this second installment in the Congotronics series of electronica-esque African music, this time featuring the work of Konono No. 1 plus six additional (but similar) artists from Kinshasa.

title: Engravings
info: This is the debut full-length release for the British electronic producer Matthew Barnes.

title: Microcastle
info: The rock group from Georgia recorded the album in a week in Brooklyn, New york.

title: You Are Not Alone
info: You Are Not Alone finds Mavis Staples teaming up with Wilco's Jeff Tweedy, who produced the album and penned several of the songs, and while Tweedy may seem an odd fit, he obviously knew what he was up to, crafting material that fits Staples' gospel-fueled vocals.

title: a ghost is born
info: When you record one of the most acclaimed albums of the decade, what do you do for an encore? If you are Jeff Tweedy & co., you return with both old (Jim O'Rourke again producing) and new (yet another lineup change) for your fifth studio LP.

title: Crack-Up
info: The third full-length release for the indie folk quintet from Seattle was co-produced by the band's Robin Pecknold and Skyler Skjelset.

title: Colourgrade
info: The second full-length studio release for the British artist was co-produced by Mica Livi and Coby Sey.

title: Lamb of God
info: The 10th full-length studio release for the heavy metal band features guest appearances from Chuck Billy and Jamey Jasta.

title: Superstar
info: Self-produced and recorded, the fourth full-length release for the New York indie-pop artist is a concept album about a person taking off for Los Angeles to seek fame.

title: Giant Swan
info: This is the debut full-length release for the British experimental electronic duo of Harry Wright and Robin Stewart.

title: Someday Everything Will Be Fine
info: The fifth full-length release for the garage punk band features guest appearances from Matthew Hoopengardner of the Golden Boys, Jana Misener, Seth Moody, Jack Oblivian, Patrick Stickles of Titus Andronicus, John Whittemore, and Krista Wroten-Combest of the Memphis Dawls.

title: Goin' Platinum!
info: The second full-length release from the Louisiana-based blues singer-songwriter was produced by Dan Auerbach.

title: Lilies
info: The third full-length release for the Belgian jazz singer was self-produced.

title: A Deeper Understanding
info: The fourth full-length release for the Philadelphia indie rock band led by Adam Granduciel is its first on the Atlantic label.

title: Love
info: The third full-length release for the folk project for Damon McMahon features guest appearance from Elias Bender Rønnenfelt of Iceage and was produced by Dave Bryant and Efrim Menuck.

title: A Wonder Working Stone
info: The latest release from the Glasgow-based folk artist includes contributions from such artists as Olivia Chaney, Rafe Fitzpatrick, Ben Reynolds, and music ensemble Concerto Caledonia.

title: Reverie
info: Marc Ribot, Jean McClain, Lisa Hannigan, and Patrick Warren appear as guests on Henry's home-recorded acoustic album.

title: Micah P. Hinson and the Pioneer Saboteurs
info: This is the fourth album for the Texas-based singer-songwriter.

title: Black Dialogue
info: The Perceptionists feature Boston-based MCs Mr. Lif and Akrobatik backed by the beats of DJ Fakts One. El-P also shows up on one track.

title: I Am Easy to Find
info: The eighth full-length release for the indie rock band includes guest appaearnces from the Brooklyn Youth Choir, Gail Ann Dorsey, Lisa Hannigan, Kate Stables, Mina Tindle, and Sharon Van Etten.

title: Rainbow
info: The third full-length studio release for the pop artist features guest appearances from The Dap-Kings Horns, Eagles Of Death Metal, Dolly Parton.

title: New View
info: The third full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was produced with Clemens Knieper and recorded live to tape in upstate New York.

title: Pastoral
info: The latest full-length release for the British electronic artist Elizabeth Bernholz features elements of folk music, as well as the harpsichord and recorder.

title: Rhythm
info: The fourth full-length release from the Swedish husband-and-wife duo of Mariam Wallentin and Andreas Werliin was self-recorded and produced.

title: Ghosts V: Together
info: The eight-track surprise release is one of the two new albums (Ghosts VI: Locusts being the other) that continues Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross' instrumental Ghosts series.

title: You're Better Than This
info: The third full-length release for the Boston rock band led by Rick Maguire was produced by Ben Brodin.

title: Going Out In Style
info: The blue-collar Boston punk band's newest release is just in time for St. Patrick's Day--staying true to its Irish roots with its traditional punk-folk anthems.

title: Easy Wonderful
info: Straightforward pop songs are this Boston band's specialty, and its latest release builds around its trademark sound with melodious guitars, sweeping vocal harmonies, and hook-filled songs.

title: Sweetener
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the pop singer features guest appearances from Nicki Minaj, Missy Elliott and Pharrell Williams.

title: Sweet Heart Sweet Light
info: The seventh album for the space rock band was produced by frontman Jason Pierce.

title: The Crossing
info: The latest release for the Texas-based singer-songwriter is a concept album about two men, one from Italy and the other from Mexico, as they seek to immigrate to the United States.

title: Flashmob
info: This is the second full-length studio album for the French-born electronic artist.

title: MM..Food
info: MF Doom drops his first solo record (under the MF Doom name) since 1999's 'Operation Doomsday.'

title: Villains
info: The seventh full-length studio release for the rock band led by Josh Homme was produced by Mark Ronson.

title: III
info: The third full-length release for the rock band that includes Ty Segall, Charles Moothart and Chad Ubovich was recorded with Steve Albini.

title: Victim of Love
info: The soul singer worked with producer Thomas Brenneck on his second release on Daptone Records.

title: The Evangelist
info: Robert Forster's first album in 11 years also features songs written by his now-deceased Go-Between partner.

title: Penance Soiree
info: Alan Moulder mixed this sophomore disc for the hard-rocking Los Angeles band, known for their black and red "uniforms" and strong live sets.

title: The Old Kit Bag
info: On an indie label for the first time in almost two decades, the veteran British folk-rocker returns with a stripped-down sound, courtesy of producer John Chelew.

title: I Phantom
info: Indie Boston rapper Mr. Lif returns with his fourth album.

title: Something Wicked This Way Comes
info: This is the fourth Ninja Tune release for the innovative London-based hip-hop outfit, mixing somewhat more traditional rap cuts with acid-jazz and trip-hop instrumental pieces.

title: Insignificance
info: The Chicago-based avant-garde musician (best known for his work in Gastr Del Sol) offers up seven new tracks in his follow-up to 1999's 'Eureka.' Wilco's Jeff Tweedy adds guitar.

title: The Coral
info: This debut effort from Liverpool's The Coral is an inventive mix of numerous musical styles.

title: Nightmare Ending
info: The seventh studio release for Matthew Cooper is a double LP with a guest appearance by Ira Kaplan of Yo La Tengo.

title: We're Not Talking
info: The second full-length release for the Australian indie pop trio was produced with Architecture In Helsinki's James Cecil and Cameron Bird.

title: Melt Yourself Down
info: The debut release for the avant-garde jazz group that includes Kushal Gaya, Ruth Goller, Shabaka Hutchings, Satin Singh, Tom Skinner, and Pete Wareham was produced by Leafcutter John.

title: Kveikur
info: The seventh full-length studio release for the Icelandic band is its first on XL Recordings and as a trio (Kjartan Sveinsson left in 2012).

title: Twelve Nudes
info: The eighth full-length release for indie singer-songwriter was recorded by Trevor Brooks and mixed by John Congleton.

title: Hissing Fauna, Are You The Destroyer?
info: Kevin Barnes injects atypically autobiographical subject matter into his danceable indie-pop tunes on his latest Of Montreal release.

title: Devotion
info: The debut full-length release for the British alternative R&B artist was written/produced with Mica Levi.

title: The Bravest Man in the Universe
info: The fist album of new material from Bobby Womack since 1994 was co-produced by Damon Albarn and Richard Russell.

title: The Weather
info: The seventh full-length studio release for the Australian psychedelic rock band was produced by Tame Impala's Kevin Parker.

title: The  Age of Adz
info: Known for his genre-bending instrumentation and soulful lyricism, the Detroit-born indie rocker returns five years after his last proper album with an experimental variety of electro-orchestral folk pop songs.

title: From Scotland with Love
info: The latest release for Kenny Anderson as King Creosote was created for a documentary film of the same name, to be released for the Commonwealth Games.

title: Master
info: The third full-length release for the British post-rock band was influenced by works from Byetone, Powell, Prurient, Raime, and Pete Swanson.

title: The  Blind Hole
info: The debut full-length release for the Atlantic grindcore three-piece was produced by Andy Nelson.

title: True Hallucinations
info: Produced by John Siket, the New York duo of Brian Harding and Amalie Bruun expands into a indie rock quintet on its debut full-length release.

title: Break It Yourself
info: Andrew Bird self-produced his seventh collection of songs featuring a duet with Annie Clark (St. Vincent).

title: Replica
info: The sixth album for Brooklyn-based electronic artist Daniel Lopatin utilizes samples of 1980's commercials.

title: Flux
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Boston-born artist was produced by Justin Meldal-Johnsen.

title: Howl
info: This is the third full-length release for British electronic artist Ryan Lee West as Rival Consoles.

title: The  Wilderness
info: This is the seventh full-length studio release and the first non-soundtrack album since 2011 for the Texan post-rock quartet.

title: If All I Was Was Black
info: The 16th full-length studio release for the soul singer was written and produced by Jeff Tweedy.

title: Sorry To Bother You
info: The sixth release from the Oakland, California, hip hop group led by Boots Riley features guests such as Das Racist, Joe Henry, Jolie Holland, Japanther, Killer Mike, and Justin Sane of Anti-Flag.

title: How Many Times
info: The third full-length release for the New Orleans-based singer-songwriter was produced by Video Age's Ross Farbe.

title: Hair
info: Ty Segall and Strange Boys' Tim Presley (under the name White Fence) collaborated on the eight-track release recorded in San Francisco.

title: Native Sons
info: The 17th full-length studio release for the Los Angeles rock band includes covers of songs about Los Angeles or were written by fellow natives of the City of Angels.

title: Modus Vivendi
info: The debut full-length studio release for the rapper from New Jersey features The Ebonys on one track.

title: She Remembers Everything
info: The 15th full-length release for the singer-songwriter features contributions from such artists as T Bone Burnett, Elvis Costello, Kris Kristofferson, John Leventhal, Lera Lynn, Tucker Martine, and Sam Phillips.

title: Freedom Highway
info: The second solo release for the Grammy-winning folk singer includes nine original songs.

title: Traditional Techniques
info: The latest full-length solo release for the Pavement co-founder features a 12-string acoustic guitar.

title: The  Argument
info: The latest solo album from the Hüsker Dü founding member was inspired by John Milton's Paradise Lost.

title: Bloodsports
info: The first release from the Britpop band in 11 years was produced by Ed Buller.

title: Guy
info: The tribute album to Guy Clark features contributions from such artists as Terry Allen, Shawn Camp, Rodney Crowell, Emmylou Harris, Jim McGuire, Gary Nicholson, Mickey Raphael, Verlon Thompson and Jerry Jeff Walker.

title: Ventriloquism
info: The covers album from the singer-songwriter features such 1980-90s songs as George Clinton's "Atomic Dog 2017," Janet Jackson's "Funny How Time Flies (When You're Having Fun)," Prince's "Sometimes It Snows in April," Sade's "Smooth Operator," Tina Turner's "Private Dancer," and "TLC's "Waterfalls."

title: I Need To Start a Garden
info: The debut full-length release for the Portland, Oregon singer-songwriter was produced by Zak Kimball.

title: The  No-Hit Wonder
info: The fourth full-length release for the alt-country-rock singer-songwriter features features guest appearances from Tim Easton, Craig Finn, Jason Isbell, Austin Lucas, Caitlin Rose, and Steve Selvidge.

title: Murdering Oscar (And Other Love Songs)
info: The second solo album for the Drive-By Truckers lead singer features his father (bassist with the Muscle Shoals) and his DBT bandmates.

title: Heart
info: This is the second LP for the Montreal-based indie-pop quartet featuring actor Torquil Campbell, Evan Cranley (also a member of Broken Social Scene), Amy Millan and Chris Seligman.

title: Let Go
info: One-hit wonders, you say? Well, the New York trio did score an MTV hit with "Popular," from their 1996 debut album, but it is a more mature and less commercial Nada Surf that returns now with a third LP, their first for indie label Barsuk.

title: Blue Boy
info: Canadian singer-songwriter Ron Sexsmith returns with his fifth album, produced by Steve Earle and Ray Kennedy.

title: Kid A
info: Seemingly unwilling to stick to a successful formula, Radiohead follow their breakthrough album 'OK Computer' with this much more experimental work (recorded during sessions that also spawned the later-released 'Amnesiac' album), which ventures even further away from conventional song structure and embraces electronica more fully (even sounding at times like Aphex Twin).

title: Music
info: The follow-up to Madonna's hit 'Ray of Light' was produced by 'Light's producer William Orbit and French electronica artist Mirwais.

title: The Louder I Call, The Faster It Runs
info: The sixth full-length release for the Baltimore duo of Jenn Wasner and Andy Stack was mixed by John Congleton.

title: Pulse/Quartet
info: The latest release for the composer features two pieces: Pulse includes winds, strings, piano and electric bass with the International Contemporary Ensemble and Quartet includes two vibraphones and two pianos with the Colin Currie Group.

title: I Liked It Better When You Had No Heart
artist: Butch Walker And The Black Widows
info: The producer-singer-songwriter returns with his first album to be credited with his new backing band, The Black Widows.

title: Akron/Family
info: The latest neo-folk outfit under the tutelage of Michael Gira are the Brooklyn quartet Akron/Family, who make their debut with this self-titled release.

title: Have We Met
info: The 12th full-length release for the Canadian indie rock band led by Dan Bejar was produced and mixed by John Collins.

title: Ratchet
info: The debut full-length release for the Las Vegas dance-pop artist was produced by Nick Sylvester.

title: Aw C'Mon
info: Recorded at the same time and released on the same day, 'Aw C'Mon' and 'No, You C'Mon' are actually intended as separate albums, rather than two parts of a double album. The Nashville String Machine lends strings to each.

title: Real Life Is No Cool
info: Norway's Lindstrom and singer Christabelle join up to release their first album of disco-influenced music together.

title: Wink
info: The third full-length release for the Japanese rock band features guest appearances from Mndsgn, Ric Wilson, and YMCK.

title: Fortitude
info: The seventh full-length release for the French metal band was produced by Joe Duplantier and mixed by Andy Wallace.

title: Giver Taker
info: The debut full-length release for the Boston-based singer-songwriter was produced by Justine Bowe of Photocomfort and Gabe Goodman.

title: Mirror Traffic
info: The Pavement frontman releases his latest rock album with The Jicks, produced by Beck.

title: Return To The Sea
info: The debut disc for the new band from former Unicorns members Nick Diamonds and J'aime Tambeur includes appearances from members of Royal City, Wolf Parade and Arcade Fire.

title: Cedars
info: This sophomore LP (and U.S. debut) for the English band was produced by the Cocteau Twins' Simon Raymonde.

title: Noonday Dream
info: The third full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was recorded in England and France with Mickey Smith.

title: Humming By The Flowered Vine
info: Members of Calexico guest on the singer-songwriter's Matador debut.

title: Band of Joy
info: The title of Plant's new album revives the name of his pre-Zeppelin psychedelic band from the '60s and combines folksy rock with his own solo work.

title: The New OK
info: The surprise digital release from the alternative country band includes songs from recording sessions from the recently released, The Unraveling plus a few songs written while under the pandemic quarantine.

title: Three Chords and the Truth
info: The 41st full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter features contributions from Jay Berliner and The Righteous Brothers' Bill Medley.

title: I Shall Die Here
info: The experimental doom band worked with Bobby Krlic (also known as the Haxan Cloak) on its fourth full-length release.

title: Destroy Rock & Roll
info: This debut LP for Scotland cut-and-paste artist Myles MacInnes was released in the UK in 2004 and finally hit American shores in early 2006.

title: One True Vine
info: Wilco's Jeff Tweedy returns to produce the singer's latest release that includes songs written by Alan Sparhawk of Low, Nick Lowe, and Tweedy.

title: American Head
info: The 16th full-length studio release for the experimental rock band features a guest appearance from Kacey Musgraves

title: Gorilla Manor
info: The Los Angeles band's debut album is the latest to incorporate afropop to its sound.

title: Goes West
info: The fourth full-length solo release for the Nashville guitarist was produced by Bradley Cook and Tucker Martine.

title: Life, and Another
info: The sixth full-length release for Erin Birgy as Mega Bog features contributions from Matt Bachmann, Zach Burba of iji, Andrew Dorset of Lake, Meg Duffy of Hand Habits, James Krivchenia of Big Thief, Alex Liebman, Aaron Otheim, Will Segerstrom, and Jade Tcimpidis,

title: Stellular
info: The ex-Pipettes singer worked with Oli Bayston (aka Boxed In) on her second full-length solo release.

title: Retribution
info: The fourth release for the Polaris Prize-winning Inuit throat-singer features a guest appearance from Shad.

title: Suckfish
info: Audion is the dirty-minded techno alter-ego of Matthew Dear.

title: Tragedy and Geometry
info: The debut solo album from Steve Hauschildt, member of the Cleveland-based electronica trio Emeralds, was named for the Greek muses of tragedy (Melpomene) and geometry (Polyhymnia).

title: KoKoro
info: The fifth full-length release for Sarah Assbring features influences from music and instruments from around the world including Africa,  the guzheng (a Chinese string instrument) and the Japanese shakuhachi flute.

title: Koch
info: This is the third full-length release for the British electronic producer.

title: Kenny Dennis LP
info: Produced by Odd Nosdam, the Chicago rapper's latest full-length release is a follow-up to his Kenny Dennis EP as his mustached alter ego.

title: April
info: This is the third album for the group led by Mark Kozelek, who also wrote and produced the album.

title: For Those That Wish to Exist
info: The ninth full-length release for the British metalcore band features guest appearances from Mike Kerr, Winston McCall, and Simon Neil.

title: The Loves of Your Life
info: The second full-length solo release for The Walkmen frontman was self-produced and mixed.

title: No Future
info: The second full-length release for the London-based electronic producer features guest appearances from DRS and James Massiah.

title: Bleeds
info: The sixth full-length release for the British rapper features production from Four Tet and Adrian Sherwood.

title: Bad Magic
info: The 22nd studio release for the British metal trio was produced by Cameron Webb and features a cover of The Rolling Stones' Sympathy For The Devil.

title: Fin
info: This is the debut full-length release for the Barcelona-based house producer John Talabot.

title: Section.80
info: The California rapper who worked on Dr. Dre's Detox album releases his third independent album, featuring Colin Munroe, GLC, RZA, Schoolboy Q, Ashtro Bot, BJ the Chicago Kid, and Ab-Soul as guests.

title: Emmaar
info: Saul Williams, Matt Sweeney and Josh Klinghoffer appear as guests on the sixth release for the desert blues rock band from Mali.

title: Snakes For The Divine
info: The fifth studio album for the metal band from Oakland, California, was produced by Greg Fidelman.

title: Black Panther: The Album
info: The soundtrack to the Black Panther film was curated by Kendrick Lamar (and he features on five songs) includes appearances from such artists as 2 Chainz, Ab-Soul, Anderson .Paak, James Blake, Future, Jay Rock, Swae Lee, Mozzy, ScHoolboy Q, Travis Scott, Vince Staples, the Weeknd, and Zacari.

title: Hairless Toys
info: The first release in eight years for the Irish electronic artist who was one-half of Moloko was produced by Eddie Stevens.

title: Sanddollars [EP]
info: Well over to the indie-rock side of anticon's indie-rap -- indie-rock continuum, Why? (aka Yoni Wolf) returns with an eight-song EP.

title: Total Freedom
info: The first full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter in eight years was co-produced by Jim Bryson and Ian Fitchuk.

title: Crystal Fairy
info: The debut full-length release for the supergroup that includes Le Butcherettes' Terri Gender-Bender, The Mars Volta/At The Drive-In's Omar Rodriguez-Lopez, the Melvins' King Buzzo and Dale Crover was produced by Rodriguez-Lopez.

title: Julia with Blue Jeans On
info: The fourth full-length release for Spencer Krug as Moonface is simplified with only piano and vocals.

title: Thursday
info: The second of a trilogy of mixtapes from Canadian artist The Weeknd was produced by Doc McKinney and Illangelo.

title: La Vita Nuova
info: The first full-length solo release for Lone Justice singer in 13 years features a 19-piece orchestra.

title: Fool
info: The debut full-length release for the Dutch producer Mitchel van Dinther features contributions from such artists as Steve Kuhn, Thundercat, and Arthur Verocai.

title: In Between
info: The sixth full-length release for the New Jersey indie rock band is its first album in six years.

title: Fetch
info: This is the first studio release for the Japanese noise rock duo of Yako and Agata since 2007's Bambi's Dilemma.

title: Honest
info: The second full-length studio release for the Atlanta rapper features guest appearances from Andre 3000, Casino, Drake, Pharrell, Pusha T, Kanye West, and Wiz Khalifa.

title: The Tigers Have Spoken
info: The New Pornographers singer (and accomplished solo artist) offers up a live set of originals and eclectic covers, backed by The Sadies.

title: Kill For Love
info: The fourth full-length album for the band led by Johnny Jewel features 17 tracks.

title: Pleasure
info: The fifth full-length solo studio release for the Canadian indie pop artist features a guest appearance from Jarvis Cocker and was produced with Mocky and Renaud LeTang.

title: Wyatt at the Coyote Palace
info: The 10th solo release for the Throwing Muses lead singer was released as a book of essays and stories.

title: Music for the Age of Miracles
info: This is the first new release of music in seven years for the British indie rock/pop band.

title: Invisible Cities
artist: A Winged Victory for the Sullen
info: The latest full-length release from the duo of Dustin O'Halloran and Stars of the Lid's Adam Wiltzie was originally created for a Leo Warner-directed multimedia stage production based on Italo Calvino's 1972 novel Invisible Cities.

title: The Ooz
info: This is the second full-length release for British singer-songwriter Archy Marshall under the name King Krule.

title: Heron Oblivion
info: The debut full-length release for the psychedelic folk rock band formed by Meg Baird, Ethan Miller, Noel Von Harmonson, and Charlie Saufley was recorded by Eric Bauer in San Francisco.

title: Since We Last Spoke
info: The underground hip-hop producer (also a member of Soul Position) returns with a follow-up to his acclaimed 2002 Def Jux Debut, 'Dead Ringer.'

title: Tasty
info: Kelis' third LP (second in the States) features production from the Neptunes, Dallas Austin and Andre 3000.

title: New York Noise
info: This 16-track compilation offers an impressive sampling of the New York underground scene from the late 1970s and early 80s, including cuts from "no-wave," post-punk, experimental and hip-hop artists such as ESG, Material, DNA, Defunkt, and Liquid Liquid.

title: A Little Deeper
info: A former member of UK hip-hop outfit So Solid Crew, Ms. Dynamite (aka Niomi McLean-Daley) earned Britain's Mercury Music Prize for this debut effort.

title: Bill Orcutt
info: This the first solo studio release to feature the guitarist on an electric guitar.

title: Comma
info: The fifth full-length solo release for the The Sea and Cake band member is his first in five years.

title: Wraith
info: The fifth full-length release for the London-based experimental/post-rock band was produced by Erol Alkan.

title: Another Life
info: The debut full-length release for the Berlin-based Finnish experimental electronic duo of Ville Haimala and Martti Kalliala features guest appearances from Pan Daijing and Oracle.

title: Face Your Fear
info: The second full-length release for the Atlanta-based R&B/soul artist was produced with Danger Mouse and Sam Cohen.

title: Lost Time
info: The follow-up to Dave and Phil Alvin's Grammy-nominated Common Grounds release is another covers album that includes songs from such artists as James Brown, Thomas Dorsey, Lead Belly, and Big Joe Turner.

title: Hoodoo
info: The swamp rock veteran's latest release is his first on the Yep Roc label.

title: Hello Cruel World
info: The Grammy-nominated singer-songwriter's ninth album features Rodney Crowell as a guest singer.

title: Superwolf
info: 'Superwolf' is the first collaboration between singer-songwriter Will Oldham (aka Bonnie Prince Billy) and Zwan's Matt Sweeney.

title: Le Noise
info: The legendary socially conscious rocker joins forces with producer Daniel Lanois, creating an album full of self-proclaimed folk-metal music.

title: The Power Of Negative Thinking: B-Sides & Rarities
info: The four-disc collection of B-sides and rare recordings from the Scottish band.

title: Swisher
info: A year after the release of the self-titled compilation albuum from the Brooklyn-based electronic duo of Sam Haar and Zach Steinman comes its follow-up full-length with nine new tracks.

title: Year Of Meteors
info: This is the fifth album for the Seattle-based singer-songwriter.

title: Tones Of Town
info: This second studio LP for the Sunderland, England trio once again finds the band being compared to XTC.

title: Let the Good Times Roll
info: The second full-length release for the Oklahoma-born singer-songwriter was produced with Mark Neill.

title: The Morning Star
info: The 12th full-length release for the Virginia six-string and lap guitarist features contributions from Forrest Marquisee and Ian McColm.

title: Lucky Shiner
info: UK producer Gold Panda's debut is a fusion of psychedelic pop, samples and dance beats.

title: Dirt Farmer
info: Former The Band drummer/singer returns with a solo album.

title: Overload
info: The latest release for the Los Angeles R&B artist features guest appearances from Shana Jenson and Dudley Perkins.

title: Bottomless Pit
info: Released digitally, the instrumentals and vocals for the fifth full-length studio release for the Sacramental experimental hip-hop band was also released as a free download. A physical release of the entire album is scheduled for July.

title: A Beginner's Mind
info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Sufjan Stevens and Angelo De Augustine was inspired by such films as All About Eve, Bring It On Again, Night of the Living Dead, Mad Max, Point Break, Silence of the Lambs, and The Thing.

title: From a Room, Vol. 2
info: The third full-length release for the award-winning country singer-songwriter was produced with Dave Cobb.

title: American Football (LP3)
info: The third full-length release for the Illinois emo band features guest appearances from Rachel Goswell, Elizabeth Powell and Hayley Williams.

title: Tassili
info: The Tuareg group releases their fifth studio album, fusing blues and styles of the nomadic people of the Sahara.

title: Black Sun
info: Steve "Kode9" Goodman, the London-based electric artist, collaborates with Stephen "The Spaceape" Gordon for a second album of dubstep and techno jams.

title: Night Falls Over Kortedala
info: The Swedish singer's second studio album features guest singers Frida Hyvonen and El Perro del Mar.

title: Jim Noir
info: The Manchester, England, native wrote, produced, recorded, and mixed his sophomore album.

title: Give My Love to London
info: The 20th studio release for the British singer-songwriter features contributions from such artists as Anna Calvi, Nick Cave, Steve Earle, Ed Harcourt, Tom McRae, Portishead's Adrian Utley, and Pink Floyd's Roger Waters.

title: Power
info: The debut full-length release for the Houston-born and Berlin-based electronic producer J'Kerian Morgan was inspired partly by marching bands and Ta-Nehisi Coates' "Between The World And Me."

title: The Book of Souls
info: The 16th full-length release from the British heavy metal band was produced by Kevin Shirley.

title: Believers
info: The third solo album for the folk singer was produced by Rob Schnapf.

title: Street Horrrsing
info: The debut album for the Bristol, England experimental music duo.

title: After Hours
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Canadian artist features contributions from such artists as Belly, Max Martin, Metro Boomin, Oneohtrix Point Never, and Tame Impala.

title: Oshin
info: Formerly known as Dive, this is the debut album for the rock-pop quartet led by Z. Cole Smith of Beach Fossils.

title: #NAME?
info: The sixth full-length release for the Haley Fohr project is the first on the Matador label.

title: Good Woman
info: Produced by John Congleton, the latest full-length release for the trio of sisters was influenced in part by the death of their mother and the birth of Emily's first child.

title: Someone New
info: The debut full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter features contributions from Valentin Ignat, Jake Portrait and Gabe Wax.

title: Quickening
info: The debut full-length solo release for The Maccabees frontman was produced by Markus Dravs.

title: Sideways to New Italy
info: The second full-length release for the Australian indie rock band was produced by Burke Reid.

title: Mind Hive
info: The latest full-length studio release for the British post-punk band features an eight-minute-long track.

title: Admission
info: The fifth full-length release for the Florida metal band is its first with new new bassist Eric Hernandez of Wrong.

title: Dog Whistle
info: The second full-length studio release for the New York City-based hardcore punk trio was produced with Chris Coady and Gabriel Millman.

title: Future Ruins
info: The sixth full-length release for the British alternative rock band is its first with the Dangerbird (and Rock Action in the UK) label.

title: Vanished Gardens
info: The collaboration with Lucinda Williams, the saxophonist and the Marvels (Bill Frisell, Greg Leisz, Reuben Rogers, and Eric Harland) features new versions of Williams' songs “Dust,” “Ventura” and “Unsuffer Me,” as well as Thelonious Monk’s “Monk’s Mood,” Jim Hendrix’s “Angel,” and three original instrumentals.

title: I Love You Like a Brother
info: The debut full-length release for the Australian pop singer-songwriter was produced with Oscar Dawson.

title: The Incessant
info: The third full-length release for the Chicago post-punk band was recorded by Steve Albini.

title: Little Fictions
info: The seventh full-length studio release for the British alternative rock band is its first without drummer Richard Jupp, who left to pursue his own projects.

title: Wake in Fright
info: This is the second full-length release for the New York City-based industrial metal duo of vocalist Michael Berdan and Ben Greenberg.

title: Still
info: The 16th studio release for the British folk-rock singer was produced by Wilco's Jeff Tweedy.

title: The Fact Facer
info: This is the latest full-length release for Emil Amos' solo project Holy Sons.

title: Primitive and Deadly
info: The tenth studio release for the drone metal band led by Dylan Carlson, features guest appearances from Mark Lanegan, Brett Nelson of Built to Spill, Rabia Shaheen Qazi, and Jodie Cox.

title: Trouble & Love
info: The first full-length release in four years for the singer-songwriter includes contributions from Beth Nielsen Chapman, Ben Glover, Scott Nolan, Gretchen Peters, Darrell Scott, and the McCrary Sisters.

title: Drop
info: Garage/psych rocker John Dwyer moves to Los Angeles and worked with Casafis, Mikal Cronin, Greer McGettrick and Woodhouse on the his  latest studio release.

title: Wed 21
info: The first release in five years for the Argentinean singer-songwriter was written, recorded and produced by herself.

title: Reason to Believe: The Songs of Tim Hardin
info: Gavin Clark, Diagrams, Alela Diane, Mark Lanegan, Magnetic North, Okkervil River, Hannah Peel, Pinkunoizu, Smoke Fairies, The Phoenix Foundation, The Sand Band, and Sarabeth Tucek contributed to the tribute album to folk singer-songwriter Tim Hardin.

title: No Kings
info: This is the second all-crew release from the Minneapolis, hip-hop collective. Produced by Paper Tiger and Laserbeak, it features emcees: P.O.S., Sims, Cecil Otter, Mike Mictlan, and Dessa.

title: Random Axe
info: This is the debut release for the group that includes producer Black Milk, Guilty Simpson, and Sean Price.

title: Follow Me Down
info: The Texas-born singer-songwriter's second album features nine original songs and covers of Bob Dylan and Radiohead.

title: Revolutions Per Minute
info: Talib Kweli and Hi-Tek reunite for their second album together in ten years. It features guest appearnces by such artists as Mos Def, Bun B, Estelle, Bilal, Jay Electronica, and J Cole.

title: At The Cut
info: Silver Mt. Zion Orchestra return for the Athens, GA-based singer-songwriter's latest album, the first of two album released this year [the live album, "Skitter On Take Off" was released October 6th].

title: Rainwater Cassette Exchange
info: The latest EP for the Atlanta, Georgia indie-rock band was produced by Nicolas Vernhes.

title: Mystery [EP]
info: The South African indie-rock band releases its first EP produced by Secret Machines' Brandon Curtis.

title: One Day As A Lion [EP]
info: Rage Against the Machine's Zack De La Rocha releases his solo EP, which includes Mars Volta's Jon Theodore on drums.

title: What I Do
info: One of the rare country music stars who is both a critical and commercial success (and without crossing over into pop), Jackson returns with a follow-up to his huge 2002 hit 'Drive.'

title: Fabulous Muscles
info: This is the third full-length album for the challenging, intensely personal Bay Area post-punk outfit led by Jamie Stewart.

title: Me First
info: Rilo Kiley's Blake Sennett is the mastermind behind this collective, which includes contributions from members of Azure Ray and Ozma and production from Mike Mogis (Bright Eyes) and Jimmy Tamborello (DNTEL, Postal Service).

title: Dangerous Magical Noise
info: This is the third full-length for the Detroit garage rockers led by guitarist Mick Collins (ex of the Gories) and featuring a supersized rhythm section of two bass players and two drummers. Included in early versions are bonus covers of Brian Eno's "King's Lead Hat" and Robyn Hitchcock's "Executioner of Love."

title: Us
info: This is the second album for the quriky Scottish indie-pop duo of Colin MacIntyre and Alan Malloy.

title: Sharpen Your Teeth
info: Ugly Casanova is the alter ego of Modest Mouse singer/guitarist Isaac Brock, who makes his solo debut with this release. The 13 tracks were produced by Brian Deck (Tortoise, Sea and Cake), and the backing band includes Pall Jenkins (Black Heart Procession) and Tim Rutili (Red Red Meat), but it sounds a lot like a Modest Mouse release.

title: God Hates Us All
info: Produced by Matt Hyde, 'God Hates Us All' is the eighth studio album (and first in three years) for the Southern California thrash-metal band. Originally set for a July 2001 release, the album was delayed so that American Recordings head Rick Rubin and producer Sean Beavan could remix each of the tracks.

title: Changes
info: The third full-length release for the soul singer discovered by Daptone founder Gabriel Roth features a cover of Black Sabbath's track.

title: Drunk
info: The fourth full-length release for Stephen Bruner as Thundercat features guest appearances from Wiz Khalifa, Kendrick Lamar, Kenny Loggins, Michael McDonald, and Pharrell.

title: My Maudlin Career
info: The fourth album for the Scottish band was produced by Jari Haapalainen.

title: The Snake
info: The Swedish duo releases their second album.

title: Cupid's Head
info: The fourth full-length studio release for Axel Willner as The Field was created without computers.

title: Dragging A Dead Deer Up A Hill
info: The third album for the Portland, Oregon-based indie pop singer Liz Harris.

title: The Golden Age
info: The San Francisco band, now relocated to Los Angeles and with two new members, releases its latest album.

title: My Finest Work Yet
info: The 12th full-length solo studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Paul Butler.

title: Martha Wainwright
info: Daughter of Loudon and sister of Rufus, Martha becomes the third Wainwright to release an album in 2005. This self-titled effort is her full-length debut, following on the heels of her subtly-titled EP "Bloody Mother Fucking Asshole."

title: High Risk Behaviour
info: The debut full-length release for the Australian punk trio of Matt Boggis, Josh Price, and Eamon Sandwith was recorded in Geelong by Billy Gardner.

title: Rainford
info: The latest full-length release from the Jamaican dub artist was produced by Adrian Sherwood.

title: The Wild
info: The seventh full-length solo release for the rapper features guest appearances from Andra Day, G-Eazy, Cee Lo Green, Lil Wayne, and P.U.R.E.

title: Chants for Socialists
info: The British singer-songwriter's concept album was based on the poetry by socialist activist William Morris.

title: Spiderwebbed
info: The debut full-length release for the British producer features guest appearances by Steffaloo, Co Ma, and Birds Of Passage.

title: Wind In The Wires
info: The 21-year-old British singer-songwriter's second solo recording again sets his instrumentation against a moody electronic backdrop.

title: Mic Tyson
info: The third full-length studio release from the Brooklyn rapper includes such guests and producers as Pharoahe Monch, The Alchemist, 9th Wonder, and Khrysis.

title: The Hum
info: The second full-length release for the British psychedelic/noise rock quintet is its first with new drummer, JN.

title: Vessel
info: The latest release for the New York indie pop project of Greta Kline  is its first on the Sub Pop label.

title: Songs From The Year Of Our Demise
info: 'Songs' is the first solo LP for the co-founder of The Posies, who is also a member of the current lineup of Big Star.

title: Stay Gold
info: The third full-length release (and the first on the Columbia label) for the Swedish sister duo was produced by Mike Mogis.

title: The Return To Form Black Majick Party
info: A member of Ladytron's touring band as well as the trio Super Numeri, English multi-instrumentalist Jonathan Pop Levi (yes, Pop is indeed his middle name) makes his full-length solo debut with this eclectic disc.

title: Goodbye Bread
info: The San Francisco-based garage revivalist returns with a new record, the first on Drag City's label.

title: Earthly Delights
info: This is the fifth album for the rock band from Rhode Island.

title: The Wedding
info: This is the seventh album for the New York noise-rock three-piece. Phil Manley of Trans Am guests.

title: Street's Disciple
info: Nas co-produced this double album along with Salaam Remi, Q-Tip and L.E.S. Also stopping by to lend a hand (or a voice) are Busta Rhymes, Kelis, Ludacris and Maxwell.

title: Pig Lib
info: The second solo release for the former Pavement leader (although it is credited to "Stephen Malkmus & The Jicks"), 'Pig Lib' features 11 new tracks.

title: The Execution of All Things
info: This is the second full-length album for the Los Angeles-based indie band, who are now labelmates of Omaha's Bright Eyes. Fans of the TV program "Boy Meets World" (all three of you) may recognize guitarist Blake Sennett, who played Joey on that show. (Singer Jenny Lewis has also guested on numerous sitcoms over the years.)

title: With Ghost
info: Former Galaxie 500 members Damon Krukowski and Naomi Yang unite with Japanese outfit Ghost for an album of dreamy, contemplative folk-rock.

title: Modern Nature
info: The 12th studio release for the British alternative rock band is its first album without founding member Jon Brookes, who passed away in 2013 from brain cancer.

title: There Is a Hell, Believe Me I've Seen It, There is a Heaven, Let's Keep It a Secret
info: The British metal band's third album was produced by Fredrik Nordstrom and features guest appearances by Lights, You Me At Six's Josh Franceschi, and The Chariot's Josh Scogin.

title: Begin To Hope
info: The Russia-born, New York-based anti-folkie returns with a dozen new tracks produced by David Kahne (The Strokes).

title: Out in the Storm
info: The fourth full-length release for Katie Crutchfield's music project  was produced with John Agnello.

title: Everything in Between
info: This is the second studio album for the the indie rock duo from Los Angeles.

title: Reflektor
info: The double album from the Canadian indie rock band was produced with James Murphy and Markus Dravs.

title: IRM
info: The first daughter of modern French pop releases her third album, IRM (the album's title is French for the MRI machines), produced by Beck.

title: Two Men With The Blues
info: This is a recording of the special concert of Willie Nelson and Wynton Marsalis who performed together in January 2007 at Jazz at Lincoln Center.

title: Mourning in America and Dreaming in Color
info: Produced by Jake One, the fifth album for the Minnesota rapper features guest appearances from Dr. Cornell West, Amir Sulaiman, Choklate, and Tone Trezure.

title: C'mon
info: The swirling organ, hymn-filled group harmonies, and choral percussion from this Duluth band's latest album make it sound like it was recorded in a church, which it was: a converted Catholic church.

title: Red Sun Through Smoke
info: The latest full-length release for the Canadian experimental artist was written and recorded while starting a new long distance relationship, living in a city hit by forest fires and the death of his grandfather.

title: Jinx
info: This is the debut full-length release for the Brooklyn-based psych-pop jazz-influenced quartet of Lila Ramani, Brian Aronow, Jesse Brotter, and Jonathan Gilad.

title: Utopia Defeated
info: The debut full-length release for Australian Oliver Hugh Perry was self-produced and recorded in London.

title: Sun Coming Down
info: The second full-length release for the Canadian post-punk band led by Tim Darcy was recorded in Montreal.

title: Distractions
info: This is the second full-length release for the British quartet (that also perform as the band Monotony).

title: Revival
info: The fifth full-length release for the British folk ensemble was produced by Rupert Christie.

title: Warmer Corners
info: This is the seventh album from the Australian indie-pop group led by singing drummer Tali White.

title: Ancient Melodies Of The Future
info: The Boise, Idaho trio returns with a follow-up to 1999's 'Keep It Like A Secret.'

title: We Are the 21st Century Ambassadors of Peace & Magic
info: The second full-length release for the psychedelic rock duo was produced by Richard Swift.

title: The Greatest
info: Despite the misleading title, 'The Greatest' is not a best-of collection, but rather is Chan Marshall's first album of original songs in three years. It was recorded in Memphis and finds the singer backed by some of that city's legendary session musicians.

title: Cashmere
info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Heems and Riz MC was produced by Redinho.

title: Get to Heaven
info: The third full-length release for the British art rock band was produced by Stuart Price.

title: La Confusion
info: The ninth full-length release for the Malian Afro-pop duo was produced by Adrien Durand.

title: Candylion
info: Unlike his Welsh-language solo debut, the more accessible 'Candylion' finds the Super Furry Animals leader singing mainly in English.

title: Director's Cut
info: The British artist reworked and rerecorded some of her songs from 1989's The Sensual World and 1993's The Red Shoes albums.

title: White Chalk
info: The British singer's latest album was produced by John Parrish and Flood.

title: 4eva Is a Mighty Long Time
info: The third full-length studio release for the Mississippi rapper features guest appearances from Bilal, Robert Glasper, CeeLo Green, Keyon Harrold, Joi, Lloyd, Jill Scott, Sleepy Brown, T.I., Burniss Earl Travis II, UKG, and Kenneth Whalum.

title: Up On The Ridge
info: Grammy-nominated Dierks Bentley releases an all-acoustic bluegrass country album featuring guest appearances by Kris Kristofferson, Miranda Lambert, Jamey Johnson, the Del McCoury Band, and the Punch Brothers.

title: Prog
info: The rock-influenced piano trio's fifth album mixes originals with covers of songs by David Bowie ("Life On Mars"), Tears For Fears ("Everybody Wants To Rule The World") and Rush ("Tom Sawyer").

title: Mr. M
info: Dedicated to the late Vic Chesnutt, Mr. M is the latest album from the alt-country group led by Kurt Wagner and was recorded in Mark Never's studio.

title: Music for Psychedelic Therapy
info: The latest full-length release for British electronic producer Jon Hopkins was inspired by the Tayos Caves of Ecuador.

title: Green to Gold
info: The sixth full-length studio release for New York indie rock band led by Peter Silberman is its first album of new songs in seven years.

title: How Did I Find Myself Here?
info: The first studio release in 29 years for the rock band led by Steve Wynn was produced with Chris Cacavas.

title: Ouroboros
info: The sixth full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced with Jim James of My Morning Jacket.

title: Saturnalia
info: The Afghan Whigs' Greg Dulli and Screaming Trees' Mark Lanegan team up on their debut album as The Gutter Twins.

title: A Loud Bash of Teenage Feelings
info: The second full-length studio release for the Philadelphia pop-punk band led by James Alex was produced by Dave Downham.

title: Keep It Hid
info: This is the solo debut album for the Black Keys singer/guitarist.

title: Further
info: The eighth full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter was co-produced by Colin Elliot and Shez Sheridan.

title: Faithful Fairy Harmony
info: The latest release for the Colorado-based singer-songwriter features contributions from Jon Estes, Victor Herrero, Chris Scruggs, Gyða Valtýsdóttir, as well as members of The Cherry Blossoms.

title: Jaiyede Afro
info: The latest release from the Nigerian saxophonist Orlando Julius is a collaboration with the British funk ensemble The Heliocentrics.

title: Breaking Kayfabe
info: The debut album from the Canadian rapper, who has also remixed songs for Lady Sovereign and Ciara.

title: Beast Epic
info: The sixth full-length studio release for Sam Beam was recorded live by Tom Schick at The Loft in Chicago.

title: Bestial Burden
info: The second full-length release for Margaret Chardiet as Pharmakon was recorded with Sean Ragon.

title: Grid of Points
info: The 11th full length release for Liz Harris was written and recorded in Wyoming over a week-and--a-half.

title: Three Fact Fader
info: The second full-length album for the indie band was produced with Ken Thomas.

title: No Home Record
info: The debut full-length solo release for the Sonic Youth co-founder was produced by Justin Raisen with contributions from Shawn Everett and Jake Meginsky.

title: A Rush Of Blood To The Head
info: The UK quartet follows the critical and commercial success of their 2000 debut album 'Parachutes' with this long-awaited follow-up release, which the band has suggested may be their last.

title: Dark in Here
info: The latest full-length release for the John Darnielle-led band was recorded in March 2020.

title: The Childhood of a Leader [OST]
info: The soundtrack to Brady Corbet's 2015 film that was inspired by a short story by Jean-Paul Sartre about the childhood of a future Fascist leader is the second film score for the avant-garde artist.

title: Thank Your Lucky Stars
info: Produced with Chris Coady, the sixth studio album is the Baltimore duo's second album for 2015.

title: Mystery Glue
info: The second release since Parker and the Rumour reunited in 2011 was recorded in six days.

title: The Libertines
info: While some eponymous albums suggest a lack of creativity, the heralded UK rock outfit's sophomore disc is titled 'The Libertines' because it is indeed about The Libertines--or, more specifically, about the ongoing conflict between the band's two songwriters, Carlos Barat and Pete Doherty (the latter of whom was subsequently kicked out of the band after three failed rehab attempts). The Clash's Mick Jones returns as producer.

title: Atlas Vending
info: The fourth full-length release for the Toronto punk rock trio was co-produced with Uniform's Ben Greenberg.

title: The Sun's Tirade
info: The debut full-length studio release for the Tennessee rap artist features guest appearances from Deacon Blues, Kari Faux, Hugh Augustine, Kendrick Lamar, Jay Rock, SiR, Syd the Kid, SZA, and Zacari.

title: Twelfth
info: The 12th full-length studio release for the alt-country band was recorded in Nashville and was produced by Vance Powell.

title: Compliments Please
info: The debut full-length release for the solo project from former Slow Club member Rebecca Taylor was produced by The Very Best's Johan Karlberg.

title: Fixed Ideals
info: The second full-length release for the British pop-punk trio led by Lande Hekt was produced and mixed by Lewis Johns.

title: Good Time [Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]
info: The soundtrack by Daniel Lopatin for the 2017 film directed by Josh and Benny Safdie was awarded the Best Soundtrack Award at Cannes.

title: Gulag Orkestar
info: This Eastern European-sounding, multi-instrumental effort is actually the work of Albuquerque teenager Zach Condon. Members of A Hawk And A Hacksaw also lend a hand.

title: BE
info: The latest full-length studio release for the South Korean pop band features production from Brasstracks and Cosmo's Midnight.

title: The Way The Wind Blows
info: This is the third Hawk album for former Neutral Milk Hotel drummer Jeremy Barnes. Like previous efforts, it has an Eastern European flavor, although unlike previous efforts, it also includes contributions from Beirut's Zach Condon.

title: Nootropics
info: The second album for the Baltimore-based indie rock band led by Jana Hunter was produced Drew Brown.

title: My Krazy Life
info: The debut full-length studio release for the Los Angeles rapper features guest appearances from Drake, Jeezy, Kendrick Lamar, Jay Rock, Schoolboy Q, and Ty Dolla $ign.

title: Everything is Love
info: The debut full-length collaborative album for Beyonce and Jay-Z was a surprise release and features guest appearances from Migos, Offset, Quavo, Rory from Stone Love, and Ty Dolla $ign.

title: 3001: A Laced Odyssey
info: The debut full-length studio release for the Brooklyn-based rap trio of Meechy Darko, Zombie Juice and Erick “The Architect” Elliott features guest appearances from Diamante and Anthony Flammia.

title: 13 & God
info: 13+God is a collaboration between German rocktronica outfit The Notwist and American indie-rappers Themselves. Also guesting are members of Ms. John Soda, Lali Puna, and cLOUDDEAD; basically, if they're on Morr Music or Anticon, you'll find them here.

title: Are You Alone?
info: The second full-length release for Canadian duo Devon Welsh and Matthew Otto features contributions from Owen Pallett.

title: Assume Form
info: The fourth full-length release for the British electronic producer features guest appearances from André 3000, Metro Boomin, Rosalía, Travis Scott, and Moses Sumney.

title: All My Demons Greeting Me as a Friend
info: The Norwegian dark pop singer-songwriter worked with Odd Martin Skalnes and Magnus Skylstad on her debut full-length release.

title: Be Small
info: The fourth release for the quintet-turned duo of Luke Temple and Michael Bloch was self-produced.

title: Throw It to the Universe
info: The sixth release for the Swedish rock band is said to be its final album.

title: Side Effects
info: The ninth full-length studio release for the Austin rock band features some songs that were either demos, outtakes or were not included in previous albums.

title: Desperate Man
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Nashville-based country artist was produced by Jay Joyce.

title: Fresh Blood
info: The second full-length release from the indie rock artist was produced with Trey Pollard.

title: Tetsuo & Youth
info: The fifth studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from  Ab-Soul and Nikki Jean.

title: The Eldritch Dark
info: The third full-length release for the Canadian doom metal band was produced by Ian Blurton.

title: We The Vehicles
info: This second Maritime LP is the final one to feature former Dismemberment Plan bassist Eric Axelson, who left the group (which also includes former members of the Promise Ring) after its recording.

title: Django Django
info: This is the debut release for the indie London-based quartet that began at an Edinburgh art school.

title: Besnard Lakes Are the Last of the Great Thunderstorm Warnings
info: The latest full-length release for the Canadian psych-rock group was produced by the band's own Jace Lasek and Olga Goreas.

title: The Con
info: The Canadian twins' latest album features members of Death Cab for Cutie and AFI.

title: Nature Always Wins
info: The seventh full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by Ben Allen and features a guest appearance from Pauline Murray.

title: Performance
info: The eighth full-length studio release for the Texas rock band was recorded in Austin over eight weeks.

title: Lifeforms
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the alternative rock band led by Tom DeLonge is its first on the Rise label.

title: Black Age Blues
info: The first release in over 11 years for the doom band was produced by Nick Raskulinecz.

title: I Like to Keep Myself in Pain
info: The first solo album in over 11 years for the Georgia singer includes songs written for her by Andrew Bird, Vic Chesnutt, John Wesley Harding, Robyn Hitchcock, the Mekons' Jon Langford, Stephin Merritt, and M. Ward.

title: Losing Feeling [EP]
info: This is the latest four-track EP for the Los Angeles-based indie rock duo.

title: Feathers
info: This self-titled disc marks the debut for the Vermont freak-folk outfit.

title: Farmer's Corner
info: The latest release from James Jackson Toth as Wooden Wand was recorded over six different sessions.

title: Citrus
info: Their music sounds British and the vocals are sometimes in Japanese, but this four-piece shoegaze outfit (returning here with a second album) hails from Brooklyn.

title: Manic
info: The third full-length release for the alternative pop artist features guest appearances Dominic Fike, Alanis Morissette and BTS' Suga.

title: I, I
info: The fourth full-length release for the indie folk band led by Justin Vernon features contributions from such artists as James, Blake, the Brooklyn Youth Chorus, BJ Burton, S. Carey, Aaron & Bryce Dessner, Phil Cook, Moses Sumney and Bruce Hornsby, and Wye Oak's Jenn Wasner.

title: Abandon All Life
info: The second full-length release for the Southern California metal band was produced by Converge guitarist, Kurt Ballou.

title: The Black Swan
info: The veteran British folkie is joined by Espers, Devendra Banhart and Beth Orton on his latest release.

title: Awfully Deep
info: This is the third album for London-based rapper Rodney Smith.

title: Anna Calvi
info: The half-English, half-Italian singer's self-titled debut showcases her sophisticated songwriting abilities -- drawing comparisons to PJ Harvey -- and her musical prowess.

title: All a Man Should Do
info: The 11th full-length studio release from the Memphis alt-country punk rock band was produced by Ted Hutt.

title: Distant Satellites
info: The tenth full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by Christer-André Cederberg.

title: Here's My Song You Can Have It... I Don't Want It Anymore/Yours 4-Ever
info: The Swedish singer-songwriter and former soccer player is backed by Mercury Rev on his latest release (which originally emerged in 2004 in Europe).

title: Electric Brick Wall
info: This is the second release for the alternative rock band led by former Royal Trux member Jennifer Herrema.

title: Vivian Girls
info: The debut album for the Brooklyn trio is less than 22 minutes long.

title: Pawn Shoppe Heart
info: The Detroit garage rockers make their major-label debut with this sophomore album, which was produced by Jerry Harrison.

title: American III: Solitary Man
info: In his sixth decade of recording, Johnny Cash reunites with producer Rick Rubin for a third consecutive outing. Like its two predecessors, 'III' consists of a mix of Cash originals and covers, this time from the likes of Nick Cave ("The Mercy Seat"), Tom Petty ("I Won't Back Down"), and U2 ("One").

title: Thirteen Tales From Urban Bohemia
info: The third album from the Portland, Ore. indie-rock band failed to elevate their standing in their home country, although they continue to sell well (and receive favorable press) in Europe.

title: All Of A Sudden I Miss Everyone
info: The instrumental post-rock band from Texas returns after a four-year wait with this fourth studio album.

title: Give the People What They Want
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Brooklyn soul band was originally scheduled for an August release but was delayed due to the cancer diagnosis of singer Sharon Jones.

title: Denies The Day's Demise
info: The Los Angeles-based electronica artist's fifth album has a bit of a Brazilian feel.

title: Corsicana Lemonade
info: Produced by Jim Vollentine, The sixth full-length studio release for the Austin band includes two tracks produced by Wilco's Jeff Tweedy.

title: 12 Bit Blues
info: Samples from early blues records are used in the sixth studio album for the Canadian DJ.

title: DS2
info: The third full-length studio release for the Atlanta rapper was named after his 2011 mixtape Dirty Sprite and features a guest appearance from Drake.

title: Fall Heads Roll
info: Mark E. Smith & Co. return with their full-length follow-up to 'The Real New Fall LP.'

title: Ya-Ka-May
info: Heavily influenced by hip-hop, rock, blues, funk, and jazz, the New Orleans "Bounce" quintet Galactic enlists vocal legends for its sixth studio effort. These include Rebirth Brass Band and Irma Thomas, as well as such up-and-coming Bounce artists as Cheeky Blakk, Big Freedia, and Sissy Nobby.

title: The Angels Of Light Sing 'Other People'
info: Michael Gira's post-Swans project Angels Of Light returns with a fourth release of mostly acoustic folk/rock, backed by musicians from Akron/Family.

title: Animated Violence Mild
info: This is the fourth full-length studio release for the electronic solo project of Fuck Buttons' Benjamin John Power.

title: Small Town Heroes
info: The latest release for the folk ensemble led by Alynda Lee Segarra is its first on the ATO label.

title: Exai
info: The 11th full-length release from the British electronic duo of Sean Booth and Rob Brown is over two hours long.

title: Private Space
info: The third full-length studio release for the Indiana retro-soul group features synths and disco influences.

title: The Last Exit
info: This is the fifth full-length release for the duo of Tessa Murray and Greg Hughes.

title: Powers
info: The first full-length release in seven years for the British post-punk band was self-produced.

title: Horizon
info: The third full-length release for the British post-punk trio is its first in five years.

title: Black Friday
info: The third full-length release for the Boston-based indie rock trio led by Ellen Kempner was co-produced with Gabe Wax.

title: A Laughing Death in Meatspace
info: This is the debut full-length release for the Australian rock band that includes The Drones' Gareth Libbiard and Fiona Kitschin; High Tension's Lauren Hammel; and Harmony/Palm Springs' Erica Dunn.

title: Infinite Moment
info: This is the sixth full-length release for Swedish electronic producer Axel Willner as The Field.

title: Bad Contestant
info: The debut full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was recorded in 12 days with Alex Burey and Foxygen's Jonathan Rado.

title: Oneiric Formulary
info: The first full-length solo release for the Sun City Girls guitarist in five years.

title: The Take Off and Landing of Everything
info: The sixth full-length release for the British alternative rock band was again produced by Craig Potter.

title: Pretty Years
info: The fourth full-length release for the Staten Island rock band led by Joseph D'Agostino was produced by John Congleton.

title: Going Down in History
info: The first studio release of original songs since 2005's Freedom And Weep from the Chicago alt-country band led by Jon Langford was produced by Mike Hagler.

title: Aquarius
info: The debut full-length studio release for the R&B singer features guest appearances from A$AP Rocky, Future, Devonté Hynes, and ScHoolboy Q.

title: Tournament Of Hearts
info: The Canadian rockers follow 'Shine A Light' with this 10-track set.

title: Charli
info: The third full-length studio release for the British pop artist was produced by A.G. Cook and features guest appearances from Big Freedia, Brooke Candy, Christine and the Queen, Clairo, CupcakKe, Haim, Lizzo, Kim PetrasTroye Sivan, Sky Ferreira, Tommy Cash, Pabllo Vittar, and Yaeji.

title: Night Thoughts
info: The seventh full-length release for the British alternative rock band was produced by Ed Buller.

title: Hot Dreams
info: The fifth full-length release for the Canadian folk band led by Taylor Kirk and was produced by Simon Trottier.

title: If I Can't Have Love, I Want Power
info: Produced by Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross, the fourth full-length studio release for the alternative pop artist is a concept album about pregnancy and giving birth.

title: Pang!
info: The sixth full-length solo release for the Super Furry Animals frontman was produced and mixed by Muzi.

title: Club Meds
info: Canadian singer-songwriter Dan Mangan returns as Dan Mangan + Blacksmith for his fourth overall full-length album and it was produced by Colin Stewart.

title: Under The Skin
info: The Fleetwood Mac guitarist's first solo outing in over a dozen years features bandmates Mick Fleetwood and John McVie on two tracks of a largely acoustic set.

title: Still Life
info: The second solo full-length release for the Babies/Woods member was inspired by his move from New York to California.

title: Pale Young Gentlemen
info: The quintet from Madison, Wisconsin self-releases their debut album.

title: The Good Fight
info: The soul-influenced release for the Brooklyn-based rapper-producer features guest appearances from Gary Clark, Jr., Nick Hakim, Tranqill, and Maimouna Youssef.

title: Give a Glimpse of What Yer Not
info: The 11th full-length release for the rock trio features nine songs written by J. Mascis and two by Lou Barlow.

title: Boys Outside
info: The Beta Band's Steve Mason releases his first solo album under his name.

title: Quietly Blowing It
info: The latest full-length release for the MC Taylor indie folk project features contributions from Griffin and Taylor Goldsmith of Dawes, Josh Kaufman of Bonny Light Horseman, Buddy Miller, and Zach Williams of The Lone Bellow.

title: Carnival of Souls
info: This is the 15th studio release from the experimental Ohio rock band led by David Thomas.

title: Retrash
info: The is the debut full-length release for the Chicago trash metal trio.

title: {Awayland}
info: The second full-length release from the Irishman Conor J. O'Brien was self-produced and includes his touring band: James Byrne, Cormac Curran, Tommy McLaughlin, and Danny Snow.

title: Dive
info: This is the second album for San Francisco-based graphic design/electronic artist Scott Hansen as Tycho.

title: EP
info: The Gossip singer releases her solo EP produced by Simian Mobile Disco.

title: Monsters Of Folk
info: This is the debut album for the band formed by Conor Oberst, Jim James, Mike Mogis, and M. Ward.

title: Songs For Christmas
info: This five-EP box set collects holiday-themed lo-fi and impromptu tracks (a mix of standards and originals originally intended as gifts for his friends and family) recorded by Stevens over the past five years.

title: The Grind Date
info: The group's first release on its own AOI label features guests such as Ghostface, MF Doom, Sean Paul, Common and that noted MC Spike Lee. Production assistance comes from Madlib and 9th Wonder.

title: Miss Machine
info: The inventive but challenging hardcore outfit returns with their first full-length studio recording since 1999's 'Calculating Infinity.'

title: Wig In A Box: Songs From & Inspired By Hedwig & The Angry Inch
info: Exactly what the title says it is, this 16-track disc features songs from the Hedwig soundtrack (as well as new compositions inspired by the musical) interpreted by your favorite indie artists, including Yo La Tengo (with Yoko Ono!), Spoon, Robyn Hitchcock, The Polyphonic Spree, Frank Black, The Breeders, Bob Mould, and more.

title: O
info: This full-length debut for the Irish singer/songwriter has moved beyond his home country (where it was a massive hit) to attract critical praise and strong sales worldwide. Mostly self-produced and recorded, the disc also comes in specially-designed packaging including text, artwork and photographs.

title: Monday At The Hug & Pint
info: The dour Glasgow-based duo of Aidan Moffat and Malcom Middleton return for their fifth studio album, with guest contributions from members of Bright Eyes and Mogwai.

title: Electric Circus
info: On his fifth album, the underground rapper ventures more into the rock, soul, and jazz territory of his influences, with production help from the Soulaquarians. An eclectic array of guests includes Prince, Erykah Badu, Jill Scott, Bilal, Mary J. Blige, and Stereolab's Laetitia Sadier.

title: C'est La Vie
info: The seventh full-length studio release for the Alabama-born singer-songwriter was recorded in Nashville and self-produced.

title: I'll Be Lightning
info: The debut album for the son of Crowded House's Neil Finn.

title: Fading Lines
info: The debut full-length release for the Dutch indie-pop singer was produced by Ben Greenberg.

title: Yes Lawd!
info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Anderson .Paak and Knxwledge features two tracks from their 2015 EP.

title: The Center Won't Hold
info: The ninth full-length studio release for the rock trio was produced by St. Vincent and is the final one with drummer Janet Weiss, who announced her departure from the band in July 2019.

title: Pale Horses
info: The sixth full-length release for the Philadelphia indie rock band was produced by Will Yip.

title: Cascade
info: The latest release from the ambient artist is a 40-minute piano tape loop.

title: Leave Home
info: The Brooklyn four-piece (not to be confused with MEN, the JD Samson-led band) releases its third album on new label Sacred Bones.

title: Heaven
info: The seventh album for indie rock band was produced by Phil Ek.

title: Album
info: This is the debut album for the San Francisco-based duo of Christopher Owens and Chet White.

title: Exile in the Outer Ring
info: The third full-length solo release for Erika Anderson was co-produced with Unknown Mortal Orchestra's Jacob Portrait.

title: Run Fast
info: The debut release for Bikini Kill founder Kathleen Hanna's Julie Ruin project includes Carmine Covelli, Sara Landeau, Kenny Mellman of Kiki And Herb, and Kathi Wilcox of Bikini Kill.

title: The King of Limbs
info: Released a day earlier than expected as a digital download on February 18th, this is the eighth album from the epic, experimental UK five-piece.

title: Now Here Is Nowhere
info: This is the full-length debut for the Dallas, TX trio of brothers Benjamin and Brandon Curtis and Josh Garza.

title: The Highwomen
info: The debut full-length release for the country supergroup that includes Brandi Carlile, Natalie Hemby, Maren Morris, and Amanda Shires was produced by Dave Cobb.

title: Fabriclive 93
info: Dan Snaith brings 23 new tracks under his DJ alias for the latest Fabriclive mix release.

title: The Craft
info: The San Francisco rap duo of Gift of Gab (aka Timothy Parker) and Chief Xcel (Xavier Mosley) return with a third album.

title: Last Days Of Wonder
info: This is the first release in three years for the husband-and-wife duo of Brett and Rennie Sparks.

title: Twins
info: This is the San Francisco rock singer's third release in 2012 (the other two were: Hair with White Fence and Slaughterhouse with his own band).

title: K Bay
info: The first full-length solo release for the indie singer-songwriter features a guest appearance from Joseph "JoJo" Clarke.

title: Serfs Up!
info: The English rock band moves to Domino for their third album.

title: A  Flame My Love, a Frequency
info: The latest full-length release for the French artist known for using a viola da gamba changes to electronic instruments that include Moog effects pedals and Critter and Guitari synthesizers.

title: Apricity
info: The fourth full-length release for the British psychedelic rock band was produced by Jason Falkner.

title: Rewind the Film
info: Richard Hawley, Cate Le Bon, and Lucy Rose guest on the 11th full-length studio release from the Welsh alternative rock band.

title: Monkey Minds in the Devil's Time
info: The Beta Band singer self-produced 11 songs and Dan Carey worked on the other nine songs on Mason's politically-influenced second solo release.

title: Breaks in the Armor
info: The sixth album for the indie rock band led by Archer of Loaf's Eric Bachmann was recorded at The Bakery with Matt Yelton.

title: Nashville
info: The singer-songwriter follows his acclaimed effort '1972' with another album produced by Brad Jones. Don't be fooled by the title: it's not a country album, but rather, a farewell to the city Rouse has called home for the past decade (before moving to Spain).

title: The Wondershow Of The World
info: This is Will Oldham's first Bonnie "Prince" Billy album to credit the Cairo Gang, who performed on the previous three Billy albums.

title: Welcome to Bobby's Motel
info: The debut full-length release for the Montreal-based indie rock band was produced by Jonathan Schenke.

title: Butter
info: The Scottish electronic artist releases his debut full-length album.

title: Hey Mr Ferryman
info: The 10th full-length solo release for the former lead singer of American Music Club was produced by Bernard Butler.

title: Ruins
info: The tenth studio release from Liz Harris as Grouper was mainly recorded in Portugal in 2011 on a 4-track.

title: One Breath
info: The follow-up to the British singer-songwriter's Mercury Prize-nominated debut was produced by John Congleton.

title: Unglamorous
info: Faith Hill and Tim McGraw guest on Lori McKenna's first album with a major label.

title: Love Keeps Kicking
info: This is the third full-length release for the British indie punk band.

title: Reassemblage
info: The second full-length release for the ambient duo of Spencer Doran and Ryan Carlile features guest appearances from  Matt Carlson, Miyako Koda, and Motion Graphics.

title: Down Like Gold
info: The debut release for the Isle of Wight brother duo was recorded at a former water tower.

title: Tin Star
info: The third full-length studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Cobb.

title: I'll Sleep When You're Dead
info: El-P's long-anticipated second solo disc features collaborations with Cat Power, Trent Reznor, Matt Sweeney, Aesop Rock, and The Mars Volta.

title: Robyn Hitchcock
info: The latest solo release for the artist was produced with Brendan Benson with a full studio band that included Grant-Lee Phillips, Pat Sansone, Emma Swift, and Gillian Welch.

title: The Universal Want
info: The first full-length studio release for the British alternative rock band in over 10 years was produced with Dan Austin.

title: The Contino Sessions
info: Former London club DJ Richard Fearless (now working with Tim Holmes) returns for a follow-up to 1997's 'Dead Elvis.' Guest vocals are provided by Bobby Gillespie (Primal Scream), Jim Reid (Jesus And Mary Chain), Dot Allison (One Dove) and Iggy Pop.

title: Oh My God, Charlie Darwin
info: The first album on the Nonesuch label for the trio of Rhode Islanders.

title: Blue Banisters
info: The eighth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter features production from Zach Dawes, Mike Dean, Dean Reid, and Gabe Simon.

title: Happy New Year
info: They're either a bit early or a bit late with their new year's tidings, but the experimental Brooklyn band is back with 11 new tracks.

title: All This I Do for Glory
info: The sixth full-length solo release for the saxophonist was recorded live with no overdubs or loops and was self-produced.

title: Fun House
info: The third full-length release for the Meg Duffy project features a guest appearance from Perfume Genius and was produced by Sasami Ashworth and mixed by Chris Coady and Kyle Thomas.

title: King of Cowards
artist: Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs
