info: The second full-length release for the British rock band led by Matt Baty was recorded by John Martindale and Sam Grant.

title: Other
info: The ninth full-length solo studio release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Guy Sigsworth.

title: MeYouWeYou
info: The debut full-length release for the London-based brothers of Ben and Tom Page was self-produced.

title: Jake Bugg
info: The Nottingham artist was only 18 when this debut album was released.

title: MassEducation [2018]
info: The acoustic version of the singer-songwriter's 2017 Masseduction was recorded over two days and features just Clark's vocals and Thomas Bartlett on piano.

title: Holiday
info: This is the self-produced debut release (originally self-released in May 2012) for Brooklyn artist Nick Principe.

title: Nothing Is True & Everything Is Possible
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the British rock band was produced by ts lead singer, Rou Reynolds.

title: The Flower and the Vessel
info: The latest full-length release for the French poet and experimental artist was created largely while she was pregnant and on tour.

title: World's Strongest Man
info: The third full-length solo release for the former Supergrass frontman features some tracks co-produced with Ian Davenport.

title: I Tell a Fly
info: The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was self-recorded and produced.

title: The Invisible Way
info: The tenth release for the Minnesota indie rock band featuring Alan Sparhawk and Mimi Parker was produced by Jeff Tweedy of Wilco.

title: Existential Reckoning
info: The fourth full-length release for the trio led by Maynard James Keenan was mixed by Mat Mitchell.

title: Half The Perfect World
info: The jazz vocalist mixes originals with covers of songs by the likes of Tom Waits and Leonard Cohen for her third album, a follow-up to 2004's "Careless Love."

title: Gigaton
info: The first new studio release in nearly seven years for the Eddie Vedder-led rock band was produced with Josh Evans.

title: A Man Alive
artist: Thao & the Get Down Stay Down
info: The fourth full-length release for the San Francisco-based band was produced by Merrill Garbus of tUnE-yArDs.

title: Face Stabber
info: The latest full-length studio release for the Oh Sees features a 14-minutes and a 21-minutes long tracks.

title: Slow Focus
info: The third full-length release for the London electronic duo of Andrew Hung and Benjamin Power was self-produced.

title: Okonokos [Live]
info: This double-disc live set features 21 tracks (many from last year's 'Z') recorded at The Fillmore in San Francisco.

title: Mythopoetics
info: The fifth full-length release for the Nandi Rose solo project was produced with Zubin Hensler.

title: I've Seen All I Need to See
info: After several collaborative releases, the experimental metal duo returns with with a solo album with contributions from Chrissy Wolpert and Ben Eberle.

title: The Optimist
info: The 11th full-length studio release for the British rock band produced by Tony Doogan.

title: Pillars of Ash
info: The fifth full-length release for the Savannah, Georgia-based sludge metal band is its final album with bassist Jonathan Athon, who died in a motorcycle accident in November 2014.

title: Soul Power
info: The debut full-length release for the Atlanta-based singer was self-produced.

title: Return to Annihilation
info: The latest release for the Chicago experimental rock trio is its first on the Relapse label.

title: Behind the Parade
info: This is the latest album for the power pop singer-guitarist who has worked with Robert Pollard.

title: Antifogmatic
info: The second album for the bluegrass five-piece band led by Chris Thile is the first to feature Paul Kowert who replaced Greg Garrison in November of 2008.

title: The Coral Sea
info: Recorded in 2005-2006, the live set is based on a poem about the famed photographer, Robert Mapplethorpe, who was also Patti Smith's friend.

title: Rising Down
info: The latest studio album from the hip-hop group features Common, Malik B, Talib Kweli, Mos Def, Styles P, Wale, and DJ Jazzy Jeff, amongst others guest artists.

title: M.A.D.E.
info: The rapper from Houston releases his latest album, which features artists such as Lil Wayne, T.I., and Wacko.

title: Confessions On A Dance Floor
info: Stuart Price co-produced the 47-year-old Anglophile's latest dance-oriented effort.

title: Furr
info: The fourth album for the Portland, Oregon group is the first on the Sub Pop label.

title: Golden Sings That Have Been Sung
info: The third full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Wilco's Leroy Bach.

title: Works for Tomorrow
info: The 12th full-length release for the Chicago alternative rock band that includes Janet Bean, Mark Greenberg, Doug McCombs, and Rick Rizzo features the addition of guitarist Jim Elkington.

title: Draw Down the Moon
info: The fourth full-length release for the Connor Murphy-led trio was produced by Andy Hull of Manchester Orchestra.

title: Big Baby D.R.A.M.
info: The debut full-length studio release for the rapper from Virginia features guest appearances from Erykah Badu, Lil Yachty, and Young Thug).

title: Fever Dream
info: The third solo full-length release for the artist who was one half of Everything But the Girl features contributions from Bernard Butler, Martin Ditcham, and Rex Horan.

title: Colonial Patterns
info: The Kansas City electronic producer Brian Leeds releases his debut full-length release as Huerco S.

title: Black Sea
info: This is the fourth studio album for the electronic artist from Austria.

title: Broken Knowz
info: This is the debut full-length studio release for the Detroit techno producer.

title: The Animal Years
info: Brian Deck (Modest Mouse) produced the Idaho singer-songwriter's fourth album and major-label debut.

title: Yol
info: The third full-length release for the Turkish psych-folk band from Amsterdam was mixed by Jacco Gardner.

title: Viscerals
artist: Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs Pigs
info: The third full-length release for the British band began recording the album with the songs only about 80% complete.

title: Hollow Ground
info: The debut full-length release for Brooklyn-based Max Clarke was recorded in Los Angeles and New York.

title: I'm Not Your Man
info: The second full-length release for the British singer-songwriter features The Big Moon as her backing band and was again produced by Charlie Andrew.

title: Bobby Fuller Died for Your Sins
info: The latest release was inspired in part by the mysterious death of rock artist Bobby Fuller in Los Angeles in 1966 as well as songs about the death of David Bowie, and a San Francisco security guard named Alex Nieto.

title: In and Out of Youth and Lightness
info: The third full-length album for the hard rock band from Louisville, Kentucky, which began as mathcore band Breather Resist before its sound changed, was produced with Kevin Ratterman.

title: Paul's Tomb: A Triumph
info: The Canadian rock band led by Carey Mercer release its latest album on new label Dead Oceans.

title: Antics
info: The New York-based foursome of Paul Banks, Carlos D., Sam Fogarino and Daniel Kessler took indie rockers worldwide by storm (and made Matador a lot of money) with 2002's 'Turn On The Bright Lights,' which introduced their neck-stabbing guitar-rock mix of Joy Division, The Cure, The Smiths, and all of your other favorite 80s bands. That captivating sound returns on this sophomore release, which features many of the new tracks ("Narc," "Length Of Love," etc.) which first debuted live during their relentless touring over the past two years.

title: A Lifetime Of Temporary Relief
info: This three-disc box set, subtitled "10 Years of B-Sides and Rarities," is just that, collecting 56 tracks from the Duluth, MN slowcore trio. Also included in the set is a 32-page booklet and a DVD with videos, concert footage and documentaries.

title: Regard The End
info: The Americana collective founded and led by fronted by Robert Fisher returns with a fifth LP. Co-founder/guitarist Paul Austin is no longer a full-time band member, but he appears on some tracks, as do Kristin Hersh, Chris Eckmen (The Walkabouts) and a variety of other guests.

title: When I Pretend To Fall
info: The one constant in the Seattle indie band The Long Winters is Alaska native John Roderick, who is joined on this sophomore effort by a host of musicians including Peter Buck (REM), Scott McCaughey (Minus 5) and Sean Ripple (American Analog Set), with Chris Walla (Death Cab For Cutie) and Ken Stringfellow (The Posies) co-producing.

title: Twoism [EP]
info: Boards of Canada's very first release--once limited to just 100 self-released vinyl copies in 1995--has finally been reissued on CD. (So if you've been holding on to your 12-inch to sell on eBay, tough luck.)

title: Outside Closer
info: The Leeds, England band follow their acclaimed 2001 release 'Cold House' with this 10-track effort which, like its predecessor, combines acoustic guitars and some glitchy electronica elements into moody indie rock.

title: The Scene Of The Crime
info: LaVette's latest features the Drive-By Truckers as her backing band.

title: Fleeting
info: The sixth solo release for the Cul de Sac guitarist was recorded by Laura Baird.

title: Sleeper
info: The semi-acoustic release for the rock musician was written after the death of his father.

title: Georgia Blue
info: Inspired by the 2020 elections, the latest release from the guitarist and his band features songs by Georgia artists and includes guest appearances from Julien Baker, Brandi Carlile, Bela Fleck, Steve Gorman, Peter Levin, Brittney Spencer, Amanda Shires, Chris Thile, Sadler Vaden, Adia Victoria, and John Paul White.

title: OST
info: The soundtrack to the film about a hard-living country music singer (Jeff Bridges) features the Golden Globe-winning song "The Weary Kind."

title: The Further Adventures Of Lord Quas
info: Madlib's somewhat bizarre alter-ego returns with a 27-track set.

title: Keep It Like A Secret
info: This second major-label release from Doug Martsch and company (following 'Perfect From Now On') features shorter, cleaner-sounding songs than that previous release.

title: Physicalist
info: The third full-length release for the Brooklyn synth trio is its first with John Also Bennett and features acoustic instruments.

title: Psi
info: Named after the 23rd letter of the Greek alphabet, ψ, the third full-length release for the British experimental duo's album was inspired in part by industrial, club, '80s goth, pop, and British electronic music.

title: Well-Done
info: Producer Static Selektah and rapper/chef Action Bronson's second album together is liberally sprinkled with humorous food references and features guest appearances by both Nina Sky and Meyhem Lauren.

title: Vapours
info: The third album features the return of founding member, Jamie Thompson.

title: A Black Mile to the Surface
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the indie rock band led by Andy Hull and Robert McDowell was produced by Catherine Marks and John Congleton.

title: Psychic
info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between guitarist Dave Harrington and electronic producer Nicolas Jaar took two years to record.

title: ROADRUNNER: NEW LIGHT, NEW MACHINE
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles-based hip-hop collective features guest appearances from A$AP Rocky, A$AP Ferg, Baird, Danny Brown, JPEGMAFIA, SoGone SoFlexy, and Charlie Wilson.

title: Flight Of The Conchords
info: The first full-length album from the band is featured in the HBO series of the same name.

title: Tromatic Reflexxions
info: 'Reflexxions' marks the first full-length collaboration between The Fall's Mark E. Smith and Mouse On Mars' Andi Toma and Jan St. Werner.

title: Out Of The Shadow
info: Originally self-released by the band in 2003, this debut album for Rogue Wave (basically just namesake Zach Rogue, plus additional musicians on some songs) was remastered and re-released by Sub Pop in 2004.

title: The Ship
info: The latest solo release was inspired by the Titanic and features  experiments with "three dimensional recording techniques."

title: Lenses Alien
info: The second album for the indie rock band from Staten Island was produced by John Agnello.

title: God's Problem Child
info: The latest release for the country singer-songwriter was produced by Buddy Cannon and features guest appearances from Jamey Johnson, Leon Russell (in one of his final recordings), and Tony Joe White.

title: Long Island
info: The third release for the Brooklyn rock band led by Paul Major sees the addition of guitarist Matt Sweeney.

title: Deep Trip
info: The latest release for the psychedelic rock band originally formed by Ryan Rousseau with Jay Reatard and Alicja Trout, now features Rousseau, his brother Rusty, N. Nappa, J. Aurelius, and A. Flores.

title: In Advance Of The Broken Arm
info: New York guitarist Stern (who blends harder, experimental rock with more typical indie-rock tunes)  makes her debut with this 13-song set co-produced by Zach Hill (Hella).

title: Shlon
info: The latest release for the Syrian dabke artist features contributions from Hasan Alo, Moussa Al Mardood and Azad Salih.

title: A  World of Masks
info: The fourth full-length release for the British psychedelic jazz collective features the vocals of Barbora Patkova.

title: Near to the Wild Heart of Life
info: The third full-length release for the Canadian noise rock duo was mostly recorded/produced by Jesse Gander (track three was recorded/produced by Damian Taylor).

title: Beyond
info: 'Beyond' is the alt-rock band's first album with its original lineup--including J. Mascis and Lou Barlow--since 1988.

title: Vertigo
info: The 18th release for the Sydney-based experimental jazz trio features one 44-minute long track.

title: Travels With Myself And Another
info: This is the second album for the Welsh rock band.

title: Apocalypse, Girl
info: The fourth full-length release for the Norwegian artist was produced by Lasse Marhaug.

title: In Spades
info: The eighth full-length studio release for the Cincinnati alternative rock band led by Greg Dulli was recorded in New Orleans.

title: Noble Beast
info: This is the latest solo album for the singer/songwriter.

title: Son
info: The acclaimed Argentinean artist returns with her fourth album of moody, electronica-infused indie-folk.

title: Brill Bruisers
info: The first release in four years for the supergroup that includes Dan Bejar, Kathryn Calder, Neko Case, and AC Newman was produced by  Newman and John Collins.

title: Didn't He Ramble
info: The second full-length solo release for the Irish singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Sam Amidon, Sam Beam, and John Sheahan and was produced by Thomas Bartlett and David Odlum.

title: Already Free
info: The latest album for the nephew of the Allman Brothers Band drummer Butch Trucks features other blues artists such as Doyle Bramhall II, Oteil Burbridge, Susan Tedeschi, and Warren Haynes.

title: Ouliposaliva
info: The French band releases a concept album based on the sounds of brass and woodwind instruments.

title: The Grey Album
info: DJ Danger Mouse's bootleg hit, which mixes together vocals from Jay-Z's 'The Black Album' and music from The Beatles' 'The White Album,' has brought legal action from Beatles record label EMI, preventing record stores from selling the album.

title: Built On Squares
info: Another somewhat strange indie-pop band from Oklahoma (Flaming Lips, anyone?), the Starlight Mints return with 11 catchy new tunes on this sophomore release.

title: She Has No Strings Apollo
info: The Australian instrumental trio, known for their dark, minimalist, atmospheric sound, includes Bad Seeds' violinist Warren Ellis, guitarist Mick Turner, and drummer Jim White.

title: Sea Change
info: Which Beck is it? The party-loving Beck of 'Odelay' and 'Midnite Vultures,' or the more serious, singer-songwriter Beck of 'Mutations.' On this latest release, it is the latter, as Beck reunites with Mutations' producer Nigel Godrich (Radiohead) for a set of darker, atmospheric, more acoustically-oriented tracks.

title: Lux Prima
info: This is the debut full-length release for the collaboration between Yeah Yeah Yeahs' Karen O and Danger Mouse.

title: Older Than My Old Man Now
info: The 21st release for the singer-songwriter features songs about growing older, family and death. It includes guest appearances from his children (Rufus, Martha, Lucy Wainwright Roche, and Lexie Kelly-Wainwright), Ramblin' Jack Elliott, John Scofield, Suzzy Roche, Chaim Tannenbaum, Chris Smither, and Dame Edna Everage.

title: Liars
info: The band releases its self-titled fourth album before it heads out on tour with Interpol this fall.

title: The Magic
info: The latest release for the experimental rock band was recorded in seven days in an abandoned office space in New Mexico.

title: Chromatica
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the pop artist features guest appearances from BLACKPINK, Ariana Grande and  Elton John.

title: Sol Invictus
info: The first release from the San Francisco alternative metal band led by Mike Patton in 18 years was produced by Billy Gould.

title: I Am Very Far
info: After serving as Roky Erickson's backup band on True Love Cast Out All Evil, the Texas-based band return with their self-produced sixth studio album of indie-folk.

title: All That You Can't Leave Behind
Nothing's Real
info: The debut full-length release for the British pop artist was produced with Greg Kurstin and Joel Pott.

title: In Prism
info: The first studio album for the rock band in more than 12 years was produced by Brian Paulson.

title: Daze
info: The third full-length release for the London-based electronic producer is his first on the Tri Angle label.

title: House of Woo
info: This is the second release for the Washington, D.C. electronic producer Andrew Field-Pickering.

title: Lost Songs
artist: ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead
info: The eighth studio release from the Austin rock band was inspired by various social and political issues like war and apathy.

title: So This Is Goodbye
info: This is the second album for the acclaimed Canadian electronica outfit led by Jeremy Greenspan.

title: My Dinosaur Life
info: Blink-182's Mark Hoppus produces the punk band's fourth album.

title: Peacers
info: The debut release for Mike Donovan's mew music project was produced by Ty Segall.

title: All or Nothin'
info: The second full-length release for the Nashville-based singer-songwriter was produced by Dan Auerbach.

title: Band of Brothers
info: Produced by Buddy Cannon, the latest release for the country singer-songwriter features nine original songs and a duet with Jamey Johnson.

title: Seeds
info: For the first time, Georgia Anne Muldrow hands over the producing reins to someone else, in this case to rapper/producer Madlib.

title: Biophilia
info: The Icelandic actress/singer-songwriter's latest album of experimental music was partially recorded on an iPad.

title: Spook the Herd
info: The fourth full-length release for the British indie rock band led by Hazel Wilde was recorded in Yorkshire.

title: Intoxicated Women
info: The final Serge Gainsbourg covers release from the Bad Seeds member features guest appearances from Sophia Brous, Channthy Kak, Jess Ribeiro, Andrea Schroeder, Lyndelle-Jayne Spruyt and Xanthe Waite.

title: Blisters in the Pit of My Heart
info: The second full-length release for the British pop-punk band was produced by MJ from Hookworms.

title: Alternative Light Source
info: The third full-length studio release for the British electronic group is its first in over 16 years.

title: Grievances
info: This is the fourth full-length release for the British mathcore quintet.

title: Bahamas Is Afie
info: The third studio release for the Canadian indie band led by Afie Jurvanen was produced with Robbie Lackritz.

title: Feel It Like a Scientist
info: This is the first release in a dozen years for the San Francisco-based experimental rock band now led by guitarist Helios Creed with Anne Dromeda, Steve “Trash” Fishman, Tommy GrenasKeith Thompson, Aleph Omega, and Lux Vibratus.

title: The Moral of the Elephant
info: The debut release for the British folk father-daughter duo of Martin & Eliza Carthy was produced by Oliver Knight.

title: The Hope Six Demolition Project
info: The ninth full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter was drawn from Harvey's travels to Kosovo, Afghanistan and Washington, D.C.

title: Runner
info: For the indie band's 10th release, Sam Prekop used a synthesizer to develop some songs before the other band members contributed their own ideas.

title: Empire Builder
info: The fourth full-length release for the Oregon singer-songwriter features contributions from Peter Broderick, Death Cab for Cutie guitarist Dave Depper, Alela Diane, Neko Case drummer Dan Hunt, and Nate Query of the Decemberists.

title: Hold Time
info: The singer-songwriter releases his latest solo album featuring guests such as The Decemberists' Rachel Blumberg, Lucinda Williams, DeVotchKa's Tom Hagerman, and Zooey Deschanel.

title: No More Stories Are Told Today I'm Sorry They Washed Away No More Stories the World Is Grey I'm Tired Let's Wash Away
info: The fifth album for the Danish band was produced by Rich Costey.

title: Dedicated Side B
info: The surprise release from the Canadian pop artist features contributions from such artists as Jack Antonoff, Bleachers, JOhn Hill, Dev Hynes, and Ariel Rechtshaid.

title: Murray's Revenge
info: The rapper once again collaborates with producer 9th Wonder on this follow-up to 3:16.

title: I Am a Problem: Mind in Pieces
info: The Detroit experimental noise rock/trip metal band releases its latest album on Jack White's Third Man Records.

title: Bend Beyond
info: The latest full-length album for the Brooklyn band features the debut of new drummer Aaron Neveu.

title: The Unfairground
info: The ex-Soft Machines band member returns with his first solo studio album since 1992.

title: Three Futures
info: The third full-length release for Brooklyn-based Mackenzie Scott as Torres was produced by Rob Ellis.

title: Across the Multiverse
info: Written and recorded in Los Angeles, the fourth full-length release was produced by the Mississippi artist and features a guest appearance from Frankie Cosmos.

title: Desperation
info: This is the first release of new music from the Memphis garage rock trio of Jack Yarber, Greg Cartwright, and Eric Friedl in over 15 years.

title: The Unseen In Between
info: The latest full-length solo release for the Brooklyn-based singer-songwriter was produced by James Elkington.

title: III
info: The third full-length release for the Swedish dream pop band is its first without guitarist Gustav Andersson.

title: Cage Tropical
info: The fourth full-length release for the indie-pop artist was produced with Jorge Elbrecht.

title: Bandwagonesque
info: Death Cab For Cutie's Ben Gibbard covers all 12 tracks from Teenage Fanclub's 1991 album Bandwagonesque.

title: Cody
info: The fourth full-length release for the California pop-punk band led by Barry Johnson was produced by Rob Schnapf.

title: Same As You
info: The sixth full-length release for the British experimental jazz band led by Seb Rochford was produced by Ken Barrientos.

title: The Book of David
info: The eighth studio album for the rapper/producer from Compton features guest appearances by Bizzy Bone, BlakKazz K.K., Bun B, Dwele, Ice Cube, Kurupt, Jon B., Gift Reynolds, Gary Shider, and Suga Free.

title: Reconstruction Site
info: This is the third album for the Winnipeg, Canada-based group led by former Propagandhi member John K. Samson.

title: Stray
info: The fourth full-length release for the Brooklyn-based post-punk trio was produced by Drew Vandenberg.

title: Love King
info: Terius "The Dream" Nash has crafted countless hit songs, including Rihanna's "Umbrella," and returns with his third solo album of hip-hop hits.

title: Shake The Sheets
info: The latest stripped-down, somewhat political rock effort from Ted Leo was produced by Chris Shaw (Dashboard Confessional, Bob Dylan).

title: Retriever
info: Martin Terefe returns as producer for this sixth LP from the Canadian singer-songwriter, which includes appearances by Ed Harcourt and members of Travis.

title: Tio Bitar
info: "Ten Pieces" is the fourth album for Swedish psych-rocker Gustav Ejstes, who is joined here by guitarist Reine Fiske.

title: Change
info: The first full-length solo release since her self-titled debut in 2010 for Berlin-based artist was recorded with Martin Thulin.

title: Father, Son, Holy Ghost
info: The San Francisco-based duo releases their sophomore full-length album.
This is the fifth album for the Swedish rock band led by Gustav Ejstes.

title: Self Made Man
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the sister duo of Rebecca and Megan Lovell features a guest appearance from Tyler Bryant.

title: Astronaut Meets Appleman
info: The latest release from the solo project of Kenny Anderson was recorded in Ireland, the Isle of Mull and in Glasgow with co-producer Paul Savage.

title: Post Pop Depression
info: The 17th solo studio release for the rock artist was produced by Josh Homme of Queens of the Stone Age and features contributions from Homme, QOTSA's Dean Fertita, and the Arctic Monkeys' Matt Helders.

title: Year Of The Gentleman
info: The third album for the R&B singer features songs produced by Stargate, Stereotypes, and Polow da Don.

title: Before The World Was Big
info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based duo of Cleo Tucker and Harmony Tividad.

title: Alright, Still
info: This debut album from the British singer (and daughter of actor Keith Allen) mixes pop with ska and reggae.

title: Cooler Returns
info: The second full-length release for the Canadian quartet was self-produced and mixed by Graham Walsh.

title: The Godfather 3
info: The latest release for the London grime artist is said to be his last.

title: Reflections
info: The debut full-length release for the member of the PC Music collective was produced by A. G. Cook.

title: Feral Roots
info: The sixth full-length release for the California rock was produced by Dave Cobb and is its first on the Atlantic label.

title: Man vs. Sofa
info: The second full-length collaboration between Adrian Sherwood and Rob "Pinch" Ellis features guest appearances from Martin Duffy, Skip McDonald, Lee "Scratch" Perry, and Taz.

title: La  Vie Est Belle
info: The debut full-length release for South African singer Yannick Ilunga features influences from 80s pop, Afrobeat, house and rock music.

title: Brooklynati
info: The trio of rappers from Cincinnati, Ohio and Brooklyn, New York, releases its second full-length album.

title: Cripple Crow
info: Thom Monahan (Pernice Brothers) co-produced the singer-songwriter's fourth album, which finds him singing in Spanish on a few of the disc's 22 tracks.

title: His Hands
info: The gospel/soul singer attempts to capitalize on on her reemergence on the pop scene (thanks to a 2004 compilation) with this disc of a dozen brand-new tracks, one of which was written by Will Oldham. Lambchop's Mark Nevers produced.

title: Pedestrian Verse
info: The fourth studio release from the Scottish indie band led by Scott Hutchinson is its first on the Atlantic label.

title: The Allegory
info: The eighth full-length studio release for the Detroit rapper features guest appearances from Oswin Benjamin, Beny The Butcher, Cyhi The Prynce, Conway the Machine, G Perico, Grafh, Kid Vishis, KXNG Crooked, Ashley Sorrell, Sy Ari Da Kid,  T.I., Westside Gunn, White Gold, and YBN Cordae.

title: One of Us Is the Killer
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the New Jersey hardcore rock band was produced by Steve Evetts.

title: What We All Come To Need
info: This is the fourth album for the metal band from Chicago.

title: Backspacer
info: The ninth studio album for the Seattle-based alt rock band was produced with Brendan O'Brien.

title: Working With God
info: This is the latest full-length release for the Melvins line-up that includes Buzz Osborne, Dale Crover, and Mike Dillard (also known as "Melvins 1983").

title: The Caretaker
info: The first release on the Anti- label for the Nandi Rose project was co-produced with David Tolomei.

title: Come Over When You’re Sober, Pt. 2
info: The posthumous release of the New York rapper's second full-length album was completed with the help of his mother, Liza Womack and producer Smokeasac.

title: Sexwitch
info: The debut release for the collaboration between Bat For Lashes' Natasha Khan and the British rock band Toy features six 1970 psych and folk cover songs from different countries.

title: Take Me to the Land of Hell
info: The latest release for the widow of John Lennon/Japanese avant garde artist was produced with Sean Lennon and Yuka Honda. The album includes guest appearances from Nels Cline, Lenny Kravitz, Questlove, and Andrew Wyatt.

title: In Ghost Colours
info: The Australian group's sophomore album hit number one on the Australian charts when released in their home country.

title: Hip Hop Is Dead
info: Dr. Dre, Kanye West and will.i.am are among the producers for the rapper's follow-up to 'Street's Disciple,' which marks his first release for Def Jam.

title: Schmilco
info: The 10th full-length studio release for the Chicago alt-rock band was recorded during the same sessions for 2015's Star Wars.

title: Just Dropped In (To See What Condition My Rendition Was In)
info: The posthumous release features covers of songs by such artists as Bad Medicine, Woody Gutherie, Janet Jackson, Gladys Knight, Bob Marley, The Marvelettes, Shuggie Otis, Prince, Kenny Rogers, Dusty Springfield, and Stevie Wonder.

title: Tiny Changes: A Celebration of Frightened Rabbit's The Midnight Organ Fight
info: Recorded in 2018 before Scott Hutchison's death in May 2018, Julien Baker, Biffy Clyro, Daughter, Aaron Dessner, Craig Finn, Fiskur, Benjamin Gibbard, Katie Harkin, Inletts, Manchester Orchestra, Lauren Mayberry, Oxford Collapse, The Philistines Jr., Piano Bar Fight, Right On Dynamite, Josh Ritter, Sarah Silverman, The Twilight Sad, and Wintersleep cover all the tracks from the Scottish band's 2008 album.

title: I AKA I
info: This is the second full-length solo release for the London-based Iranian electronic artist.

title: Psychedelic Country Soul
info: The first new full-length release in over 30 years for the Alt-country/Americana band was produced by Ed Stasium.

title: Beast
info: The fifth album for the metal band from Santa Barbara was produced by Mark Lewis.

title: Last Summer
info: The Fiery Furnaces member makes her solo debut of emotionally-moving experimental pop.

title: Consummation
info: The latest full-length solo release for the Brooklyn-based indie artist was produced with Adam Brisbin and Julian Fader.

title: Walking Like We Do
info: The second full-length release for the British pop quartet led by Juliette Jackson was produced by Ben H. Allen.

title: So Much Fun
info: The debut full-length studio release for the Atlanta rapper features guest appearances from 21 Savage, J. Cole, Doe Boy, Future, Gunna, Juice WRLD, Lil Baby, Lil Duke, Lil Keed, Lil Uzi Vert, Machine Gun Kelly, NAV, Quavo, and Travis Scott.

title: D
info: The trio becomes a quartet with the addition of second guitarist Austin Jenkins on its latest album of indie rock.

title: Distortion
info: The latest album for the band led by singer/songwriter Stephin Merritt.

title: The End Is Near
info: This is the sophomore disc for the Texas five-piece featuring former Bedhead co-founders (and current brothers) Matt and Bubba Kadane. The album was recorded in Chicago with Steve Albini.

title: Killing Joke [2003]
info: The first album in seven years for the UK punk outfit founded in 1978 features newly reunited members Jaz Coleman, Youth and Paul Raven, with Dave Grohl filling in on drums.

title: Mary Star of the Sea
info: The new group led by Billy Corgan of The Smashing Pumpkins features a lineup including fellow Pumpkin Jimmy Chamberlin on drums and guitarists Matt Sweeney (Chavez, Skunk) and David Pajo (Slint, Tortoise).

title: Nextdoorland
info: The legendary (and quirky) English band fronted by Robyn Hitchcock follow their 2001 reunion tour with this, their first new studio recording in 22 years.

title: Live at Convocation Hall
info: Recorded live at a March 2002 show in Toronto, this 22-track, 2-disc set includes songs from Hayden's three previous albums, as well as three new tracks and a cover of Neil Young's "Tell Me Why."

title: Optometry
info: This latest installment in Thirsty Ear's Blue Series of progressive/experimental jazz recordings is the work of turntablist DJ Spooky (Tha' Subliminal Kid), whose own mixing, bass, and kalimba are joined by jazz notables such as Matthew Shipp, Guillermo Barreto Brown, William Parker, and Medeski, Martin & Wood's Billy Martin.

title: Italian Platinum
info: Steve Albini was behind the boards for the Chicago-by-way-of-Seattle band's third album for Touch & Go Records.

title: Visions of Bodies Being Burned
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Los Angeles experimental rap trio features guest appearances from Ted Byrnes, Cam, China, Michael Esposito, Ho99o9, Jeff Parker, SICKNESS, and Greg Stuart.

title: Brothers and Sisters of the Eternal Son
info: The Shins' Richard Swift returns to produce the sequel to Damien Jurado's 2012 album, Maraqopa.

title: Restarter
info: The fourth full-length release for the Miami metal band was mixed by Converge's Kurt Ballou.

title: Ultra Vivid Lament
info: The 14th full-length studio release for the Welsh rock band features guest appearances from Julia Cumming and Mark Lanegan.

title: Lost Wisdom pt. 2
info: This is the second full-length collaboration between Phil Elverum and  Julie Doiron.

title: Anoyo
info: The six-track release for the electronic producer was recorded during the same session as 2018's Konoyo.

title: Friends That Break Your Heart
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the British singer-songwriter features guest appearances from JID, Monica Martin, SwaVay, and SZA.

title: Skelethon
info: The sixth full-length studio solo release for the San Francisco-based rapper features guest appearances from the Moldy Peaches' Kimya Dawson, Allyson Baker of Dirty Ghosts, and Rob Sonic.
The second full-length studio release for the Black Hippy rapper features guest appearances from Black Hippy, Busta Rhymes, Kendrick Lamar, Isaiah Rashad, Sir, and Lance Skiiiwalker.

title: Oddfellows
info: The alternative rock supergroup comprised of Duane Denison, Mike Patton and John Stanier returns with its fourth release and a new member in Trevor Dunn, who takes over bass duties from Kevin Rutmanis.

title: Diaper Island
info: Chad VanGaalen returns from producing Women's 2010 album Public Strain to release his fourth full-length solo album.

title: Inji
info: This is the debut full-length solo release for Late Of The Pier's Sam Dust.

title: Shame
info: The fourth full-length release for the New York industrial metal trio was mixed by Randall Dunn.

title: Here Lies the Body
info: The debut full-length collaboration between Aidan Moffat and RM Hubbert features a guest appearance from Siobhan Wilson.

title: Teens of Style
info: The major label debut full-length release for the music project of Will Toledo features new recordings of his older songs previously released on Bandcamp.

title: Half Free
info: The latest release for the Meg Remy project was produced by Onakabazien and features guest appearances from Ben Cook, Amanda Crist, and Remy's husband Slim Twig.

title: Freeman
info: This is the first solo release of new songs from Aaron Freeman since leaving Ween.

title: Beautiful Rewind
info: The second release for British producer Kieran Hebden in 2013 as Four Tet is his first full-length since 2010's There Is Love in You.

title: Now We Can See
info: The band's first album on the Kill Rock Stars label was produced by John Congleton.

title: The Campfire Headphase
info: Well, they certainly aren't the most prolific of artists, but the acclaimed Scottish electronica duo of Michael Sandison and Marcus Eoin finally return with a third album.

title: Exploding Head
info: The second album for the Brooklyn rock band is its first on Mute Records.

title: Yesterday And Today
info: The follow-up to Axel Willner's 2007 album, "From Here We Go Sublime" features Battles drummer John Stanier.

title: Hokey Fright
info: Kimya Dawson teams up with Aesop Rock to combine their music styles on their debut music project together as The Uncluded.

title: What Makes Bob Holler
info: The tribute album to Bob Willis by the country-jazz trio from Austin, Texas, was recorded over three days in London.

title: Static Tensions
info: The latest album for the metal band from Savannah, Georgia is its second featuring two drummers.

title: Heba
info: The debut full-length release for the Danish indie pop band was co-produced with Anders Boll.

title: Love Letter for Fire
info: The debut release for the collaboration between Sam Beam and  Jesca Hoop was produced by Tucker Martine.

title: EarthEE
info: The second full-length release from the alternative R&B duo features guest appearances from Taylor Brown, Meshell Ndegeocello, Porter Ray, and Shabazz Palaces.

title: Love And Curses
info: This is the latest album for the North Carolina-based band led by Greg Cartwright.

title: See You Next Tuesday
info: In an attempt to avoid the "one-hit wonder" label, the Brooklyn five-piece that brought "Cameltoe" into the world returns with a second album.

title: Hollow Meadows
info: The eighth full-length studio solo release for the British rock singer-songwriter features contributions from Pulp's Jarvis Cocker, Nancy Kerr, Martin Simpson, and Slow Club's Rebecca Taylor.

title: Middle Cyclone
info: The singer's latest album produced with Darryl Neudorf features guests such as M. Ward and members of The New Pornographers, Los Lobos, Calexico, The Sadies, and Giant Sand.

title: First Taste
info: The latest solo release for the Los Angles-based rock artist features no guitars, instead instruments such as the bouzouki, drums (played by Charles Moothart and Segall), koto, harmonizer, mandolin, recorder, and saxophone were used.

title: Howlin'
info: The debut full-length release for the Australian electronic rock duo of Jono Ma and Gabriel Winterfield was recorded in France and mixed by Ewan Pearson.

title: The Something Rain
info: The British indie rock band led by Stuart Staples releases its ninth album.

title: Yellow House
info: This intricate second album for the Brooklyn-based band led by Edward Droste is their first for Warp Records.

title: American VI: Ain't No Grave
info: The last recordings of the country/rock legend features songs from 2006's "American V: A Hundred Highways" recording sessions and was again produced by Rick Rubin.

title: II
info: This is the appropriately-titled second release for the Philadelphia acid-folk group.

title: Blessed
info: The American rock, country, folk and blues singer-songwriter crosses genres and breaks from her traditional songs of heartbreak on her tenth studio offering.

title: Psychedelic Pill
info: The second release in 2012 for Neil Young and Crazy Horse is its first album of original music since 2003's Greendale.

title: Shadow of Fear
info: Richard H. Kirk returns solo for Cabaret Voltaire's first studio release in 26 years.

title: Are You in Love?
info: The fifth full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Jim James.

title: Through Water
info: The second full-length release for the British electronic pop artist was self-produced.

title: The Slow Rush
info: The fourth full-length studio release for Kevin Parker's project was recorded in Los Angeles and Australia.

title: Colorado
info: The 39th studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter with his Crazy Horse band is his first with Nils Lofgren since 1971 and was produced with John Hanlon.

title: Satis Factory
info: The second full-length release for the Atlanta-based singer-songwriter was co-produced by Randy Michael and Jonah Swilley.

title: I Need a New War
info: The third and final part of the The Hold Steady frontman's solo trilogy of albums that began with 2015's Faith In The Future was produced by Josh Kaufman.

title: What It Is
info: The sixth full-length release for the Nashville-based Texas-born singer-songwriter was co-produced by Brad Jones and Allison Moorer (who also co-wrote several songs).

title: Live in London
info: The live recording from the soul singer's two-night performance at London's Union Chapel was self-produced.

title: You Tell Me
info: This is the debut full-length release for the collaboration between Field Music's Peter Brewis and Admiral Fallow's Sarah Hayes.

title: Last Building Burning
info: The fifth full-length release for the Cleveland indie rock band was recorded over eight days with producer Randall Dunn.

title: Songs of the Plains
info: The second full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by Dave Cobb.

title: DNA Feelings
info: This is the second full-length release for the Swiss-born Nepalise-Tibetan electronic artist.

title: Twerp Verse
info: The third full-length release for the Massachusetts indie rock band led by Sadie Dupuis was mixed by Mike Mogis.

title: Neuk Wight Delhi All-Stars
info: The second full-length collaboration from James Yorkston, Suhail Yusuf Khan and Jon Thorne was self-produced.

title: Feel Infinite
info: The debut full-length studio release for the Canadian electronic producer features a guest appearance from How To Dress Well.

title: Unfold
info: The 19th full-length release for the Australian experimental jazz trio was self-produced.

title: Garden of Ashes
info: The sixth full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter was produced by Strat Barrett.

title: Good Luck and Do Your Best
info: The third full-length release for the British electronic producer was influenced by his visits to Japan.

title: Age of Transparency
info: The third full-length release for Arthur Ashin as Autre Ne Veut is the second part of a planned trilogy of albums.

title: Abandoned
info: The fifth full-length for the Boston-based hardcore band led by Derek Archamault continues its conceptual albums about a New Jersey blue-collar family with a focus on a Catholic priest who is having a crisis of faith due to his time in World War II.

title: Heartbreak Pass
info: The latest release from the alt-country rock band led by Howe Gelb was inspired by the Arizona desert and features contributions from Ilse DeLange, Grant-Lee Phillips, and Steve Shelly.

title: American Interior
info: The fourth full-length solo release for the former Super Furry Animal was inspired by his 18th century ancestor, explorer John Evans, who mapped the Missouri River.

title: Ultimate Painting
info: Jack Cooper of Mazes and James Hoare of Veronica Falls each wrote five songs on their debut full-length release together.

title: Hero Brother
info: The debut solo release for the violinist best known for her work with Arcade Fire and Bell Orchestre was produced with Nils Frahm.

title: Disarm the Descent
info: The sixth studio release for the Massachusetts metalcore band sees the return of original lead singer Jesse Leach, who had left in 2002.

title: The  House at Sea
info: The second release from the collaboration between Alasdair MacLean of the Clientele and Lupe Núñez-Fernández of Pipas was produced by Brian O'Shaughnessy.

title: In Focus?
info: The fifth release for the Japanese experimental pop artist was recorded by Tokumaru and mastered at Abbey Road Studios.

title: No Beginning No End
info: The R&B/jazz singer-songwriter's fourth full-length was co-produced with Pino Palladino and Brian Bender.

title: Mars
info: The second solo release for Ahmed Gallab as Sinkane includes influences from Afro-pop, funk, jazz, krautrock, and soul music.

title: Generals
info: Produced by Richard Swift, the second release for the music project led by Laura Burhenn is said to be both a concept and protest album.

title: The Marble Downs
info: The British folk band Trembling Bells collaborates with Kentuckian Bonnie "Prince" Billy.

title: Be Strong
info: Originally proposed as a three-piece with Metronomy's Joe Mount, Hot Chip's Joe Goddard and Raf Daddy went ahead with the idea without Mount to become The 2 Bears. After three EPs, the duo releases its debut full-length of original songs.

title: What Day Is It Tonight? (Trans Am Live 1993-2008)
info: The three-disc set contains live recordings that span the 15-year career of the rock trio.

title: BiRd-BrAiNs
info: This is the debut album for the Canadian singer-songwriter Merrill Garbus.

title: Little Hells
info: The fourth album for the Boston-based singer-songwriter was produced by Chris Coady.

title: Man-Made
info: The first studio album in five years for the Scottish rockers was produced by Tortoise's John McEntire.

title: Elk-Lake Serenade
info: A bit more upbeat-sounding than its predecessors, 'Elk-Lake Serenade' is the fourth studio disc for Toronto singer-songwriter Hayden Desser (who draws frequent Neil Young comparisons, and not just for being Canadian).

title: Youth & Young Manhood
info: This is the debut full-length for the Nashville-based rock band consisting of three brothers (the sons of a preacher) and their cousin.

title: Whoa, Nelly!
info: The debut album from Canadian/Portugese singer-songwriter Nelly Furtado is an ecelctic mix of musical styles.

title: So...How's Your Girl?
info: Producers Prince Paul and Dan "The Automator" Nakamura assembled a varied cast of collaborators, including Miho Hatori (Cibo Matto), Del Tha Funkee Homosapien, DJ Shadow, Sean Lennon, Josh Hayden (Spain), De La Soul, and, of all people, Father Guido Sarducci. The band's name comes from an episode of the Chris Elliott sitcom "Get A Life."

title: Nothing Was the Same
info: The third full-length studio release for the Canadian artist features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Big Sean, Jay-Z, and Majid Jordan.

title: No, You C'Mon
info: Recorded at the same time and released on the same day, 'Aw, C'Mon' and 'No, You C'Mon' are actually intended as separate albums, rather than two parts of a double album. The Nashville String Machine lends strings to each.

title: Miss Anthropocene
info: Climate change is theme for the fifth full-length release from the Canadian artist.

title: Tip Of The Sphere
info: The ninth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced with Dan Horne.

title: The Audience's Listening
info: This is the solo debut for the veteran turntablist / DJ / producer, formerly of Jurassic 5.

title: Power Up
info: The 17th full-length studio release for the Australian hard rock band was produced by Brendan O'Brien.

title: Get Color
info: This is the second album for the Los Angeles-based indie band.

title: Stainless Style
info: Boom Bip and Super Furry Animals' Gruff Rhys come together to release a concept album about the life of John DeLorean.

title: Drum's Not Dead
info: The third album for the now Berlin-based experimental trio includes a DVD with (count 'em!) three videos for each of the dozen songs on the CD.

title: Oh You're So Silent Jens
info: This CD collects tracks from the Swedish artist's most recent EPs and singles.

title: Show Your Bones
info: The New York trio's short but highly anticipated sophomore set--which features a mellower, more polished sound--was produced by Squeak E Clean and mixed by Alan Moulder.

title: Closer to Grey
info: The first releases in seven years from the Los Angles electropop trio is not the previously announced (and still unreleased) Dear Tommy, but a surprise release of 12 new songs.

title: No Burden
info: The debut full-length release for the Virginia singer-songwriter was recorded in one day.

title: Downtown Church
info: The latest album from the folk singer features gospel songs recorded in a church.

title: This Old Dog
info: The third full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was written after he moved from New York to Los Angeles.

title: May Your Kindness Remain
info: The sixth full-length release for the Arizona-born singer-songwriter was produced by Mark Howard.

title: Beings
info: The third full-length release for the British indie rock quartet was produced by band member Paul Gregory.

title: Velociraptor!
info: The British rock band releases their fourth album, featuring production by Dan the Automator.

title: National Ransom
info: Costello's second album with producer T-Bone Burnett is both reminiscent of his earlier work and experimental in sound, with a foray into finger-picking country and eclectic folk-rock tunes.

title: Prisoner
info: The 16th full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was influenced by his divorce from singer Mandy Moore.

title: Pale Bloom
info: The latest release for the Los Angeles-based composer features a three-part piano-based suite.

title: Real High
info: The fourth full-length release for the Los Angeles electronic artist was recorded over a period of four years with Cole M.G.N. and features contributions from such artists as Dâm-Funk, Droop-E, and Julia Holter.

title: Here
info: The Scottish alternative band returns after six years for its 10th full-length studio release recorded in France, Scotland and mixed in Germany.

title: Big GRRRL Small World
info: The second full-length release for the Minnesota-based rapper artist was produced by BJ Burton and features contributions from Bionik, Doomtree's Lazerbeak, Alex Nutter, N.A.S.A.'s Sam Spiegel, and Bon Iver's Justin Vernon.

title: Smote Reverser
info: This is the second full-length release for the Thee Oh Sees under its shortened name.

title: The Last Panthers
info: The score for the crime drama televsion series released on Canal+, Sky Atlantic and SundanceTV is the first for the British electronic producer.

title: The Crossing
info: This is the second full-length release for the instrumental soul group last heard backing Charles Bradley's 2011 album, No Time for Dreaming.

title: Make It Be
info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between R. Stevie Moore and Jason Falkner was recorded in two weeks in Los Angeles.

title: Shape Shift with Me
info: The seventh full-length release for the punk band led by Laura Jane Grace is said to be a relationship album.

title: The King of Whys
info: The eighth full-length studio release for the Mike Kinsella solo project was produced by S. Carey.

title: Head of Roses
info: The second full-length release for the Jenn Wasner solo project was recorded at her North Carolina studio.

title: Transparent Things
info: As their name suggests, Fujiya & Miyagi are an English trio who make German electronic rock. (OK, so maybe it doesn't suggest that.) 'Things' compiles some of the Brighton band's previously-released singles.

title: City Sun Eater in the River of Light
info: The ninth full-length release for the Brooklyn psychedelic folk group is only its second recorded in a real studio.

title: Arc
info: The second release for the British indie pop quartet was produced by David Kosten.

title: The Reminder
info: Canadian singer-songwriter (and Broken Social Scene member) Leslie Feist returns with her third album and major label debut. Jamie Lidell guests.

title: No Cities Left
info: They might sound Britpop (and at the very least, a bit like The Smiths), but this collective led by Murray Lightburn hails from Montreal, Canada. This is their second album and first U.S. release.

title: This Is Not A Test!
info: Missy Elliott reunites with producer Timbaland for her fifth album, which features vocal contributions from Nelly, Jay-Z, Mary J. Blige, Fabolous and R. Kelly.

title: Logic Will Break Your Heart
info: The Montreal, Canada-based quartet (basically, 2003's version of Interpol) follows its acclaimed, 80s-influenced EP "Rememberese" with this debut full-length. "Still In Love Song" is the only song from that EP to reappear here.

title: Good Mourning
info: The Chicago-based emo band returns with their fourth full-length.

title: About A Boy [Soundtrack]
info: Instead of a real follow-up to "The Hour of Bewliderbeast" (look for that later in 2002), Damon Gough returns with the score to the film adaptation of the Nick Hornby novel. The 16 new tracks here are split between short instrumental pieces and full songs.

Damon Albarn's breakup album (he split with his longtime girlfriend, Elastica's Justine Frischmann, prior to recording) was produced by William Orbit and features the singles "Tender" and "Coffee & TV" (although it failed to produce an American hit along the likes of the previous album's "Song 2").

title: Constant Image
info: The debut full-length release for the Washington, DC post-punk band was produced by Nicolas Vernhes.

title: Thankful N' Thoughtful
info: Craig Street produced the latest release from the R&B singer featuring songs originally made by The Black Keys, Bob Dylan, Gnarls Barkley, The Pogues, Sly & the Family Stone, Tom Waits, and Neil Young.

title: The Trials Of Van Occupanther
info: This sophomore set finds the Texas five-piece utilizing a 1970's classic rock / soft rock sound.

title: The Turning Wheel
info: The third full-length release for Chrystia Cabral as Spellling was self-produced.

title: Bicep
info: This is the debut full-length release for the London-based duo from Belfast, Matt McBriar and Andy Ferguson.

title: Rivers and Streams
info: The latest release from the Ukrainian pianist was inspired by a variety of waterways including The Amazon.

title: Tribal
info: Dr. John revives the Night Tripper persona for his new album Tribal, which features guest spots from Derek Trucks, Donald Harrison, and tunes by Bobby Charles and Allen Toussaint.

title: Subiza
info: The quartet from Spain releases its third album.

title: The Future
info: The third full-length release for Nathaniel Rateliff and his band was produced by Brad Cook and R.M.B.(Rateliff, Patrick Meese, and James Barone).

title: XOXO
info: The 11th full-length studio release for the Minnesota alt-country band was recorded over two weeks.

title: Book of Bad Decisions
info: The 12th full-length release for the Maryland rock band was produced by Vance Powell.

title: Republique Amazone
info: The debut full-length release for the all-female supergroup of African artists that includes Pamela Badjogo, Massan Coulibaly, Mariam Doumbia, Mamani Keita, Angelique Kidjo, Mariam Kone, Rokia Kone, Kandia Kouyaté, Nneka, and Mouneissa Tandina was produced by Liam Farrell.

title: Preternaturals
info: The third full-length release for experimental pop duo of Daniel O’Sullivan and Alexander Tucker

title: Agnostic Hymns & Stoner Fables
info: The latest album from the Nashville-based singer-songwriter was produced with Eric McConnell.

title: Teflon Don
info: Losing none of the momentum put in motion by his 2009 effort, Deeper Than Rap, Rick Ross keeps a very good thing going on Teflon Don, arguably his best album to date. You want rap-style luxury? Then Deeper is the better fit, but Teflon plays up the chilled and soulful elements of its predecessor, meaning Ross has graduated to a level where words like â€œorganicâ€ and â€œpoignantâ€ come into play. The former is best represented by â€œMayback Music IIIâ€ and itâ€™s swirling, â€˜70s-flavored dreamscape created by the J.U.S.T.I.C.E. League production team. Ross allows guests T.I. and Jadakiss to go first on the cut, then grabs his cigar for an uplifting story of ghetto triumph that goes from pushing to pleasing the folks (â€œParents never had a good job/Now itâ€™s black American Express cards"). When it comes to â€œpoignant,â€ the evidence is dotted throughout the album with the rapper reflecting on where heâ€™s been, and he often questions his own lust for fame. He chants the title to the opening â€œIâ€™m Not a Starâ€ as if it was a remindful mantra, but itâ€™s his new love of contrasts thatâ€™s really interesting, following Kanyeâ€™s swaggering on â€œLive Fast, Die Youngâ€ with â€œSeems to me we gettinâ€™ money for the wrong things/Look around, Maseratis for the whole team/Look at Haiti, children dyinâ€™ round the clock/Iâ€™d send a hundred grand but thatâ€™s a decent watchâ€. The familiar party and thugging tunes work too with â€œB.M.F. (Blowin' Money Fast),â€ â€œNo. 1,â€ and the mixtape favorite â€œMC Hammerâ€ -- now with added Gucci Mane verse -- all coming correct. Add all the Illuminati references in the Jay-Z team-up (â€œFree Masonâ€), a decent smoking song (â€œSuper Highâ€), and a track where Cee-Loâ€™s performance just might make you misty (â€œTears of Joyâ€), and itâ€™s obvious Rossâ€™ albums are no longer just vessels for his singles. ~ David Jeffries

info: The Florida-based quintet shows the influence of 1990s alternative and indie rock music on its debut full-length album.

title: Ultraviolet
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Georgia sludge metal band was influenced by a rough period of time for both Laura Pleasants and Phillip Cope.

title: Love Is Magic
info: The fourth full-length solo release for the former frontman of The Czars was produced with Midlake's Paul Alexander and Wrangler's Benge.

title: Formerly Extinct
info: The second instrumental rock release from the trio of Sir Richard Bishop, Ben Chasny, and Chris Corsano was influenced by Easter European and Middle Eastern music.

title: Tiger My Friend
info: This is the debut album for the London-based electronica duo, who blend their minimalist, experimental tendencies with more organic elements, including vocals (think of a more playful version of Mum).

title: Just Because
info: The second full-length release for the brother and sister duo of Barbara and Ethan Gruska was produced with Shawn Everett.

title: All I Intended To Be
info: The latest album for the country singer was produced by Brian Ahern with Dolly Parton and Vince Gill as guest vocalists.

title: Culture of Volume
info: The second full-length release for William Doyle as East India Youth was recorded at home.

title: COW / Chill Out, World!
info: The 14th full-length studio release for the Ambient techno duo was recorded while on tour.

title: I, Gemini
info: The debut full-length release for the British experimental pop teen duo of Rosa Walton and Jenny Hollingworth was recorded by Will Twynham in a former nuclear bunker-turned-studio.

title: The Calcination Of Scout Niblett
info: The latest album for the singer-songwriter was produced by Steve Albini and is her first with Drag City.

title: Convivial
info: Sasu Ripatti's fourth album as Luomo features Johanna Iivanainen, Sascha Ring (aka Apparat), Robert Owens, Sue-C, Panorama Bar's Cassy, and Scissor Sisters' Jake Shears.

title: Love Is Not Pop
info: The third album for the Swedish singer was produced with Rasmus Hagg.

title: Black Velvet
info: The posthumous release for the soul singer features songs recorded during sessions from his previous three releases.

title: Bonny Light Horseman
info: The debut full-length release for the trio that includes Anaïs Mitchell, Josh Kaufman and Eric D. Johnson includes new interpretations of traditional folk songs, many hundreds of years old.

title: Tenderness
info: The second full-length release for the Montreal duo Raphaelle Standell-Preston and Alexander Cowan was inspired by Standell-Preston's unrequited relationship with someone online.

title: Forgetting the Present
info: The third full-length release for the Scottish instrumental band led by Graeme Ronald was recorded by Tony Doogan.

title: The Shadow of Heaven
info: This is the debut full-length release for the Manchester rock quartet of Scott Beaman, Billy Byron, Charlie Cocksedge, and Jamie Lee.

title: Blue Moon: The New York Session
info: Jazz pianist Ahmad Jamal pays tribute to some of his favorite Broadway, Hollywood, and Great American Songbook classic songs.

title: Love You To Death
info: The eighth full-length studio release for the Canadian sister duo was produced by Greg Kurstin.

title: The Beast in Its Tracks
info: The seventh full-length studio release from the singer-songwriter was written after his divorce from his wife, singer Dawn Landes.

title: Ash
info: The second full-length release for sisters Lisa-Kaindé and Naomi Diaz was produced by Richard Russell and features guest appearances from Chilly Gonzales, Meshell Ndegeocello, Mala Rodriguez, and Kamasi Washington.

title: Sagittarian Domain
info: The one 33-minute track release from the Australian artist was recorded and performed by himself in one day.

title: All We Could Do Was Sing
info: The indie band based in Oakland, California wrote songs for its sophomore album while up in Alaska for the summer.

title: Sam Amidon
info: The latest full-length release for the singer-songwriter is a covers album and features a guest appearance from Beth Orton.

title: Five Roses
info: The debut album for the Canadian indie artist, who was nominated for the Polaris Music Prize in 2007.

title: Pick A Bigger Weapon
info: Audioslave's Tom Morello is among the musicians providing the framework for the politically-charged rap duo's first release in five years.

title: Exhausting Fire
info: The seventh full-length release for the Georgia sludge metal band features influences from New Wave, Americana, Eighties goth, and death rock music.

title: Becoming A Jackal
info: This is the solo debut for Irishman Conor J. O'Brien, a member of the rock band The Immediate who split up in 2007.

title: Some Echoes
info: This is the Ohio band's fourth album of jazzy prog-rock.

title: Black City
info: 1980's influences exist throughout the latest album for the Texas-born electronic artist.

title: Take Care
info: The second studio album for the hip-hop artist features guest appearances from Andre 3000, Birdman, Kendrick Lamar, Lil Wayne, Nicki Manah, Rick Ross, Rihanna, and The Weeknd.

title: The Sun Awakens
info: Ben Chasny returns with a follow-up to 'School Of The Flower.'

title: K.O.
info: The debut full-length studio release for the the Israeli dancehall MC was produced by The Bug.

title: Rock N Roll Consciousness
info: The fifth solo release for the Sonic Youth guitarist was produced by Paul Epworth with contributions from My Bloody Valentine's Debbie Googe and Sonic Youth's Steve Shelley.

title: Né So
info: The sixth full-length release for the Malian singer-songwriter was produced by John Parish and features guest appearances from  Devendra Banhart, John Paul Jones, and Toni Morrison.

title: Alone Together
info: Jazz, hip hop, electronic, rock, and funk are just some of the music styles influences on the debut solo 34-track release from the jazz drummer and hip hop producer.

title: O' Be Joyful
info: This is the debut release for the South Carolina husband and wife duo of Michael Trent and Cary Ann Hearst.

title: Coracle
info: The duo of Alessio Natalizai of Banjo or Freakout and Sam Willis of Allez-Allez releases its sophomore album.

title: Wasting Light
info: The seventh studio album from the alternative rock band has Dave Grohl bringing in producer Butch Vig (of Nirvana's Nevermind fame) for its latest release.

title: Haymaker!
info: The Austin, Texas band releases its ninth album.

title: Antibalas
info: The Brooklyn Afro-beat ensemble releases it first album in four years on new label Daptone Records.

title: Edition 1
info: Christian Fennesz is the first collaborator of a planned four part series of albums from experimental trio King Midas Sound.

title: MartyrLoserKing
info: The fifth full-length release for the New York rapper is a concept album about a computer hacker in Burundi features guest appearances from Emily Kokal and Haleek Maul.

title: Blackbirds
info: The latest full-length release for the R&B singer features songs sung by other female artists and was produced by Steve Jordan.

title: Ghost Notes
info: The first release from the Chicago indie rock band's original line-up since 1997's Eight Arms To Hold You was produced by Brad Wood.

title: Tragicomedies
info: The second release for the Berlin-based Scottish producer moves further away from the traditional electronic sounds of his 2010 debut.

title: Country Music
info: The latest album for the country singer produced by T Bone Burnett features popular bluegrass, country, and folk songs.

title: A Star Is Born [Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]
info: The soundtrack to the 2018 remake of the 1937 film features tracks written by Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper as well as Jason Isbell, Hillary Lindsey, Lukas Nelson, Mark Ronson, Anthony Rossomando, Justin Tranter, and Diane Warren.

title: Distractions
info: The third full-length studio release for the London electronic music producer features guest appearances by Andrea Galaxy, Jammz, Jessy Lanza, and Sweyn J.

title: Marigolden
info: The second full-length release for the Chris Porterfield-led folk band was produced with Robbie Lackritz.

title: At Mount Zoomer
info: The Montreal quartet recorded its sophomore album at Arcade Fire's church studio.

title: Double Night Time
info: The first solo album for the electronic artist in more than 10 years.

title: It's All True
info: The electronic music duo return with a new album, their fourth release on Domino Records.

title: Karma & Desire
info: The latest full-length release for British electronic artist Darren Cunningham as Actress features guest appearances from Aura T-09, Vanessa Benelli, Sampha, Christel Well, and Zsela.

title: Without Warning
info: The collaboration between 21 Savage, Offset and Metro Boomin features guest appearances from Quavo and Travis Scott.

title: Congrats
info: The fourth full-length release for the Canadian electronic band was recorded in a studio over three days.

title: Undertow
info: Produced by Ross Orton, the second full-length release for the British rock band formed by the Loveless brothers includes a new bassist, Ron Graham.

title: Zayna Jumma
info: The Western Sahara band that comprises Salmou Baamar's family releases its latest album of North African, Mauritanian, and Gnawa music.

title: Satanic Panic In The Attic
info: The band's sixth album is their first for Polyvinyl and sees them branching out, into "1970s Afro beat and '80s new wave" as they say.

title: Grown Backwards
info: This is not my beautiful opera. The Talking Heads most verbose member returns with one of his more eclectic solo albums to date (and that's saying something), featuring covers of Lambchop, Bizet and Verdi (we're talking arias, people) scattered amongst originals that range from African rhythms to doo-wop. The Tosca Strings and Rufus Wainwright guest.

title: Some Of My Best Friends Are DJs
info: Turntablist Eric San (aka Kid Koala) finally emerges with a follow-up to his acclaimed 2000 debut 'Carpal Tunnel Syndrome' after spending a few years touring, writing a comic book, and serving in the band Gorillaz.

title: Sunshine Hit Me
info: Frequently compared to the Beta Band, this equally eclectic Isle of Wight-based duo of Paul Butler and Aaron Fletcher literally recorded this debut album in their shed.

title: Read & Burn 01 [EP]
info: The groundbreaking English four-piece art-punk band has reunited (25 years after their debut) to record this 6-track EP, representing their first new studio output together since 1990's 'Manscape.'

title: Oxymoron
info: The major label debut release for the Los Angles rapper features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, BJ the Chicago Kid, Kurupt, Jay Rock, Raekwon, Suga Free, and Tyler The Creator.

title: The Prettiest Curse
info: The third full-length release for the Spanish indie rock band was produced by Jenn Decilveo.

title: Shadow of a Doubt
info: The third full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from Black Thought, E-40, Tory Lanez, Gucci Mane, Manman Savage, and Dana Williams.

title: The  Chronicles of Marnia
info: The fourth release for the New York singer-guitarist features new drummer Kid Millions of Oneida (replacing Zach Hill of Death Grips).

title: 10th Avenue Freakout
info: Andrew Broder's third Fog album reprises the song "Hummer" from a recent EP of the same name, and adds 12 new tracks. It's both more vocal-oriented and (at times) more electronic than earlier efforts.

title: All My Friends Are Funeral Singers
info: The Chicago rock band's latest album is also the soundtrack to the film of the same name.

title: Want Two
info: The singer's fourth album features the same producer (Marius deVries) and backup musicians as his previous outing, 'Want One.'

title: Carried To Dust
info: The sixth album for the duo from Arizona features Iron & Wine, Douglas McCombs, Amparo Sanchez, and Pieta Brown as guest musicians.

title: Toward the Low Sun
info: The trio from Australia releases its first album of instrumental rock since 2005's Cinder.

title: Cease To Begin
info: The Seattle band's follow-up to their debut album.

title: Tyron
info: The second full-length release for the British rapper features guest appearances from A$AP Rocky, James Blake, Deb Never, Denzel Curry, Dominic Fike, Mount Kimbie, and Skepta.

title: Trip
info: The latest full-length release for the alt-country band led by Kurt Wagner is covers album with each member selecting one song for the for the group to cover.

title: Rakka
info: The latest full-length release for the Finnish electronic producer Sasu Ripatti is his first credited under his Vladislav Delay moniker in six years.

title: What a Boost
info: The fourth full-length release for the London-based singer-songwriter was self-produced and features contributions from Sam Amidon, Chris Cohen, Jamie Whitby Coles, Neil Smith, Kate Stables, and Joel Wästberg.

title: Dungeness
info: This is the latest full-length release for the Scottish folk rock group led by Alex Neilson.

title: In the Magic Hour
info: The second full-length solo release for the Crooked Still member was inspired by memories of her Irish grandfather and was produced by Tucker Martine.

title: In Another Life
info: Produced by Adrian Younge, the fifth full-length studio release for the R&B/soul artist features guest appearances from Big K.R.I.T., Kimbra, and Kendrick Lamar.

title: Other Worlds
info: The third release for the Swedish singer was inspired by her trip to Hawaii and was co-produced by The Tough Alliance’s Henning Fürst.

title: Little Hell
info: This is the third album for the Alexisonfire lead singer's other music project, City and Colour.

title: Ma Fleur
info: Jason Swinscoe's first Cinematic Orchestra disc in five years is indeed a soundtrack... to an imaginary film.

title: Cannibal Sea
info: This is the third album of 60s-influenced tunes from the Brooklyn-based indie-pop band.

title: Saint Dymphna
info: The fourth album for the the Brooklyn, New York, experimental rock band.

title: Eternally Even
info: The second full-length solo release for the My Morning Jacket frontman was produced by Blake Mills.

title: Con Todo El Mundo
info: The second full-length release for the Texas trio of Laura Lee, Mark Speer, and Donald “DJ” Johnson adds influences by Mediterranean and  Middle Eastern music.

title: Happy Hollow
info: The Tim Kasher-led band has lost its cellist (Gretta Cohn) but added a horn section for its latest release, produced, as always, by Mike Mogis.

title: Paperwork
info: The sophomore album for the Chicago-area avant-garde rock band.

title: Devil's Halo
info: The latest album for the Grammy-nominated singer-songwriter was produced with Chris Bruce.

title: Cool
info: The latest full-length release for the Los Angeles indie pop artist was produced by Gordon Raphael.

title: Apple
info: The second full-length release in 2020 for the British electronic producer features contributions from Hannah Diamond and Caroline Polachek.

title: Undertow
info: The five-track release from the Detroit noise rock trio is its first on its own label.

title: Chills on Glass
info: The third release for the Chicago band led by Todd Rittman is its first on the Drag City label.

title: Relayted
info: The debut album for the indie supergroup led by Ryan Olson features musicians from such Minneapolis-area bands as Solid Gold, Megafaun, Rhymesayers, and Bon Iver.

title: Atlas
info: The third full-length release for the indie rock band was produced by Tom Schick and recorded at Wilco's studio in Chicago.

title: The  Follower
info: This is thee fifth full-length release for Swedish producer Axel Willner.

title: The Air Between Words
info: The third full-length release for the Washington, D.C.-based producer Martijn Deykers features collaborations with Kieran Hebden and Inga Copeland.

title: Sunbathing Animal
info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based rock band led by Andrew Savage follows the title track's 7-inch single release on Record Store Day.

title: Silence Is Wild
info: This is the second album to be released in the United States for the Swedish singer.

title: Trust Not Those In Whom Without Some Touch Of Madness
info: A 20-year veteran of the indie music scene, the former Come frontwoman returns with her second solo LP.

title: Fortune
info: Using a 2003 European tour as inspiration, the Athens, Georga indie-rockers recorded this sixth album as a series of narratives about both Americans traveling abroad and about recent immigrants to the United States.

title: Trey Anastasio
info: The official solo debut for the Phish head features 12 new Anastasio-penned tracks, with the guitarist backed by an eight-piece band.

title: Cala
info: The sixth full-length solo release for the Irish folk singer-songwriter was made in his hometwon of Bray.

title: Where the Action Is
info: The 13th full-length release for the British band led by Mike Scott was co-produced by Paul Brown and Simon Dine.

title: Prince of Tears
info: The fifth full-length release for British indie artist was co-produced with Ash Workman and features guest appearances from Jason Williamson of Sleaford Mods and Rose Elinor Dougall.

title: Different Creatures
info: The second full-length release for the British indie rock band was co-produced by Alan Moulder.

title: Jessica Pratt
info: The debut release for the San Francisco singer-songwriter is also the first album on Tim Presley's Birth Records.

title: Mayhem
info: The Dublin-based singer fuses blues and rockabilly on her rocking new album.

title: Supreme Balloon
info: The seventh album for the experimental band is promised to include many kinds of synthesizers.

title: I Was Born Swimming
info: The debut full-length release for the Boston singer-songwriter Ella Williams was recorded in New York City with producer Gabe Wax.

title: Wrecking Ball
info: Produced with Ron Aniello, Springsteen’s 17th studio album was inspired by the impact of the financial crisis and is the last album with Clarence Clemons, who passed away in June 2011.

title: The Expanding Flower Planet
info: The debut full-length release for the Dirty Projectors' bassist Angel Deradoorian was co-produced with Kenny Gilmore.

title: Cape God
info: The second full-length release for the Canadian indie pop artist features guest appearances from Mitski and Troye Sivan.

title: The Way Of The World
info: The first album in 12 years for the jazz pianist is his first on the ANTI label and was produced by Joe Henry.

title: The True False Identity
info: This is the veteran producer's first solo artist album in 14 years.

title: Seeking Thrills
info: The second full-length release for the British electo-pop artist features guest appearances by Maurice and Shygirl.

title: Boat
info: The debut full-length release for the Dutch indie rock band was recorded by Dave McCracken.

title: So It Goes
info: The debut full-length release for the New York hip-hop group that includes Wiki, Hak, and producer Sporting Life, features guest appearances from King Krule, Solomon Faye, and Wavy Spice.

title: Transistor Radio
info: The Portland, Ore. singer-songwriter's fourth album includes contributions from members of Rilo Kiley, My Morning Jacket, The Decemberists and Giant Sand.

title: Fordlandia
info: The latest solo album for the Icelandic composer is the second of a planned triology about technology and American brand names.

title: The Bake Sale [EP]
info: The second EP for the Chicago-based rap duo was produced by Evan Ingersoll.

title: Coming Home
info: The debut full-length release for the Texas soul singer was recorded live to tape with White Denim's Josh Block and Austin Jenkins.

title: Toy
info: The fourth full-length release for the Austin rock band was produced by Andrew Cashen.

title: Wabi Sabi
info: The second full-length release for the duo of Emily Cross and her husband Dan Duszynski was recorded in their ranch in Texas.

title: New Album
info: The third release in 2011 for the Japanese band was produced by Shinobu Narita.

title: Nine and a Half Psychedelic Meditations on British Wrestling of the 1970's and Early '80s
info: Haines has said that his motivation for writing this 30-minute, 10-song concept album about wrestling was his father's recent illness and how it caused him to reflect on childhood memories of watching the sport.

title: Taiga
info: The all-female Japanese experimental rock outfit led by The Boredoms' Yoshimi P-We returns with a fifth album.

title: Bottle It In
info: The seventh full-length solo release for the Philadelphia-based singer-songwriter was recorded over two years in a variety of location in the US while he was on tour or vacationing.

title: Meliora
info: The third full-length release for the Swedish metal band was produced by Klas Åhlund.

title: Who Needs Who
info: The third studio album for indie band was written while on tour and explores the emotions that came from the relationship band members Nona Marie Invie and Marshall LaCount had with each other.

title: American Saturday Night
info: The latest album for the Grammy Award-winning country singer was produced by Frank Rogers.

title: The Silver Gymnasium
info: Produced by John Agnello, the seventh full-length release for the Austin indie rock band was inspired by frontman Will Sheff's childhood in his New Hampshire hometown.

title: Swimming
info: The fifth full-length release for the Pittsburgh rapper features guest appearances from Dām-Funk, Dicaprio, Dev Hynes, Snoop Dogg, Syd, and Thundercat.

title: Escape From Evil
info: The third full-length release from the Baltimore indie rock band was co-produced by Chris Coady and lead singer Jana Hunter.

title: Terms of My Surrender
info: The latest release of acoustic blues from the veteran singer-songwriter was produced by Doug Lancio.

title: Impermanence
info: The debut full-length solo release for The Antlers frontman was influenced by a period of time when he was suffering from temporary total hearing loss.

title: Sincerely, Future Pollution
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Canadian trio was recorded in France.

title: Rub
info: The sixth full-length release for the Canadian electronic artist features guest appearances from Feist, Kim Gordon, and Simmone Jones.

title: Turtleneck & Chain
info: The trio led by Saturday Night Live's Adam Samberg returns with its follow-up to its 2009 parody debut album.

title: Hunting My Dress
info: This is the latest album for the California singer-songwriter, who started out as the nanny to Tom Waits' children.
