title: Crimson
info: Jerry Finn (blink-182) produced this follow-up to 'Good Mourning.'

title: Holding Hands With Jamie
info: The debut full-length release for the Dublin noise-rock band was self-produced.

title: Screen Memories
info: The first new studio release in six years for the experimental pop artist was written and recorded in his Minnesota home.

title: Raskit
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the grime artist features production from The Arcade, Cardo, Darkness, Deputy, Donae'O, Dan Farber, Heavy Trackerz, Valentino Khan, and Salva.

title: Revival
info: The former Creedence Clearwater Revival singer returns after three years with his latest solo album.

title: Das Not Compute
info: The Swedish garage rockers return with a sophomore LP.

title: Bows & Arrows
info: Although lumped in with the New York garage-rock scene, The Walkmen (which includes members of defunct bands Jonathan Fire Eater and The Recoys) stand out by incorporating a wider range of influences and instrumentation. (Plus, they own their own New York recording studio, which puts them about as far from an actual garage as you can get). This is the band's second LP, which follows their acclaimed 2002 debut 'Everyone Who Pretended to Like Me Is Gone.'

title: Hot Shit
info: The duo of Sam Coomes and Janet Weiss (Sleater-Kinney) return with their fifth LP.

title: Cellardyke Recording and Wassailing Society
info: The latest release from the Scottish singer-songwriter was produced by Hot Chip's Alexis Taylor and features contributions from such artists as KT Tunstall, The Pictish Trail, Hot Chip drummer Rob Smoughton, Fimber Bravo, Jon Thorne, and Emma Smith.

title: Marry Me
info: Polyphonic Spree member Annie Clark releases her debut album.

title: Honeymoon
info: The debut full-length release for the Chicago indie pop band led by Lili Trifilio was recorded with producer Joe Reinhart.

title: The  Devil You Know
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the Atlanta punk rock trio was produced by Nic Jodoin.

title: Until the Colours Run
info: This is the second release for the British symphonic rock five-piece (Adam and Brendan Sykes left the group in 2012).

title: Sound the Alarm
info: The multiple Grammy-winning R&B/soul singer returns to the Stax label with an album featuring guest appearances from such artists as Gary Clark, Jr., Estelle, Anthony Hamilton, Mayer Hawthorne, Luke James, Sheila E., and Vintage Trouble.

title: Purgatory/Paradise
info: The first release in over ten years for the alternative rock band is a 32 songs set with a book by singer Kristin Hersh.

title: Path of Wellness
info: The 10th full-length studio release for the Portland, Oregon-based alternative rock duo was self-produced.

title: Boy King
info: The fifth full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced by John Congleton.

title: I Love You
info: The second solo release for the now Portland, Oregon-based electronic artist was created while Urick was moving from Baltimore and dealing with his personal relationships.

title: Sainthood
info: The latest album for the twin singer-songwriters was produced with Chris Walla.

title: Nozinja Lodge
info: This is the debut full-length studio release for South African Shangaan electronic artist Richard Hlungwani as Nozinja.

title: Kollaps Tradixionales
artist: Thee Silver Mt. Zion Memorial Orchestra & Tra-La-La Band
info: The sixth album for the Canadian group is the first credited under the shortened name of Thee Silver Mt. Zion Memorial Orchestra.

title: Hey U x
info: The debut full-length release for the New Zealand alternative pop artist features guest appearances from Lily Allen, Bakar, Kenny Beats, Gus Dapperton, Flo Milli, Grimes, Mallrat, and Muoki.

title: The Nature of Imitation
info: The second full-length release for electronic producer Oliver Johnson as Dorian Concept was inspired by '60s jazz, '70s fusion, '80s neo prog-rock, and ‘90s electronica.

title: Nature
info: The third full-length release for the indie band led by Honey Owens is its first in seven years.

title: Nothing Important
info: The second full-length release for the British indie folk artist features two tracks over 15 minutes long.

title: Powder Burns
info: 'Powder Burns' is Greg Dulli's fourth album under the Twilight Singers name, and was recorded in New Orleans before, during (using generators) and after Hurricane Katrina. Joseph Arthur and Ani DiFranco guest.

title: Suicide Songs
info: The second full-length release for the British trio was produced by Charlie Andrew.

title: Tangier Sessions
info: The latest solo release from the former Sun City Girls guitarist was self-recorded in Morocco.

title: Color
info: This is the debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based electronic artist.

title: Live from the Underground
info: The Mississippi-born rapper's debut studio album was delayed from its original release in the fall of 2011 due to legal issues. The 16 track release features guest appearances by such artists as Bun B, B.B. King, Devin the Dude, Melanie Fiona, and Ludacris.

title: Heartbreaking Bravery
info: Spencer Krug's second album under the name Moonface was recorded with the Finnish band Siinai.

title: Change Becomes Us
info: Unfinished material from 1979-80 were the framework for the latest release from the British post-punk band.

title: Witching Hour
info: Jim Abbiss (Kasabian) produced this third album for the UK band, which finds them expanding slightly away their electroclash sound.

title: A Mad & Faithful Telling
info: The Denver, Colorado-based quartet known for its work on the "Little Miss Sunshine" soundtrack and score releases its latest album on the Anti label.

title: 'Em Are I
info: Jeffrey Lewis' latest album is his first to be credited with his backing band, The Junkyard.

title: Telling It Like It Is
info: The second full-length release for the side project of Iceage's Elias Bender Rønnenfelt features contributions from Choir of Young Believers' Sonja La Bianca as well as members of the Stargaze Orchestra.

title: Dry Food
info: This is the debut full-length release for Boston singer-guitarist Ellen Kempner.

title: Mirel Wagner
info: Acoustic guitar accompanies the debut album for the singer-songwriter from Ethiopia now living in Finland.

title: The Devil And God Are Raging Inside Me
info: The Long Island emo band's major-label debut was co-produced by Mike Sapone.

title: Made In The Dark
info: This is the third album for the English electro-indie rock band.

title: To Willie
info: Matthew Houck releases his cover album of Willie Nelson songs.

title: Up The Bracket
info: This debut disc from the hyped London garage band (deemed the UK's version of The Strokes by British music mags) was produced by The Clash's Mick Jones.

title: Frank
info: Amy Winehouse's debut album is finally out in the US four years after it was first released in the UK.

title: Sirens of the Ditch
info: Jason Isbell's first solo album since he left the Drive By Truckers.

title: S&M2 [Live]
info: The live album of the metal band performing with the San Francisco Symphony at San Francisco's Chase Center features songs recorded over two nights in September 2019.

title: Vermont
info: The debut release of the collaboration between German electronic artists Marcus Wargull and Danilo Plessow features guest appearances from Jaki Liebezeit of Can and Dominik Von Senger.

title: California X
info: This is the debut full-length release for the Amherst, Mass., rock trio.

title: Secret Walls EP
info: The latest EP for the San Francisco indie rock quartet was recorded at Louder Studios; its first outside the band's own home studio.

title: World's Most Stressed Out Gardener
info: The latest full-length release for the Canadian singer-songwriter includes instruments like a homemade lithophone and pipes from his basement.

title: Welfare Jazz
info: The second full-length release for the Swedish post-punk band led by Sebastian Murphy features production from Daniel Fagerström, Pelle Gunnerfeldt, Matt Sweeney, Justin and Jeremiah Raisen.

title: Friend Opportunity
info: This is the first album for the San Francisco experimental rock outfit since the departure of guitarist Chris Cohen.

title: Human Animal
info: The noisy, intense Michigan band returns with a follow-up to 2004's 'Burned Mind.'

title: Ghost Forests
info: The debut full-length release for the collaboration between Meg Baird and Mary Lattimore was recorded in Los Angeles with Thom Monaghan.

title: Your Hero Is Not Dead
info: The debut full-length release for the London-based singer-songwriter was recorded with Nathan Jenkins (aka Bullion) in Portugal.

title: Anxiety
info: The second full-length release from Arthur Ashin was influenced by the music of such artists as Laurie Anderson, David Byrne, Annie Lennox, Katy Perry, Lee "Scratch" Perry, and Rihanna.

title: Josephine
info: The latest album from the Magnolia Electric Co. is a tribute concept album for their deceased bassist, Evan Farrell.

title: My Love Is Cool
info: The debut full-length release for the British alternative rock band was produced by Mike Crossey.

title: P.T.S.D.: Post Traumatic Stress Disorder
info: The fourth solo release for the New York rapper is a concept album influenced by his own experience with depression and features guest appearances from Black Thought, dEnAuN, Talib Kweli, and The Stepkids.

title: Absent Friends
info: Neil Hannon returns with his first album since 2001's 'Regeneration.' Basically a solo effort (though retaining the Divine Comedy name), 'Friends' was produced and largely performed by Hannon, with Nigel Godrich handling the mixing.

title: Misery Is A Butterfly
info: 'Misery' is the first 4AD release for the noisy, experimental indie rockers, who have mellowed/refined their sound a bit to fit their new label.

title: The Wolf
info: America's favorite party animal attempts to move past the frat party/beer commercial sound of his hit debut album with this slightly more mature follow-up. Slightly.

title: Waiting For The Moon
info: The sixth studio LP for the distinctive English band is preceded by the EP "Don't Even Go There" (which shares one track with the album).

title: Antenna
info: This major-label debut for the Massachusetts alt-metal band finds the group willing to experiment with and open up its sound, adding more adventurous elements into the mix.

title: Jerusalem
info: The roots rocker tackles a variety of tough, contemporary issues on this latest release, perhaps his most political, issue-oriented album yet. Sheryl Crow and Emmylou Harris guest.

title: Burnside On Burnside
info: The suddenly-prolific 74-year-old Mississippi bluesman offers up a back-to-the-basics live set, recorded in Portland in January 2001 with two backing musicians.

title: Useless Coordinates
info: The debut full-length release for the British post-punk trio features contributions from Chris Duffin of XAM Duo.

title: Nobody's Smiling
info: The 10th full-length studio release for the Chicago rapper was produced by No I.D. and features guest appearances Jhené Aiko, Snoh Aalegra, Big Sean, Elijah Blake, Cocaine 80's, Dreezy, Lil Herb, and Malik Yusef.

title: Ex Lives
info: The Buffalo, NY, hardcore band's sixth album is its last with bassist Josh Newton, who left the band in October 2011.

title: FFS
info: The debut release for the collaboration between Franz Ferdinand and Sparks was produced by John Congleton.

title: Fort Nightly
info: The debut record for the New York quintet includes two drummers and a piano player.

title: Mura Masa
info: The debut full-length release for the London-based electronic producer features guest appearances from Damon Albarn, A$AP Rocky, Bonzai, Charli XCX, Christine And The Queens, Desiigner, Jamie Lidell, NAO, A. K. Paul, and Tom Tripp.

title: Clinging To A Scheme
info: The Swedish trio returns with a more pop sound for its third release.

title: Concrete Desert
info: The debut full-length collaboration from The Bug’s Kevin Martin and Earth’s Dylan Carlson was recorded in two days in Los Angeles.
The second full-length release for the band led by Tom Petty was produced by band members Petty and Mike Campbell with Ryan Ulyate.

title: Channel Pressure
info: Previously known as Games, Joel Ford and Daniel Lopatin release their debut full-length album under their new name.

title: Death Dreams
info: The second release for the Canadian rock duo of Benjamin Nelson and Paul Saulnier was produced by Matt Rogalsky and inspired by dreams Saulnier had while on tour.

title: Saltbreakers
info: The Portland, Ore-based singer-songwriter reunites with producer Tucker Martine (The Decemberists) for her sixth album, which is titled after her backing band.

title: Electric Cables
info: Former members of Teenage Fanclub Dave McGowan and Brendan O'Hare along with The Pastels' Tom Crossley, and Belle & Sebastian's Bob Kildea contributed to the debut solo album for Teenage Fanclub's Gerard Love as Lightships.

title: Face The Truth
info: Malkmus' third post-Pavement recording is his most "solo" effort to date (not to mention his weirdest), with only some of the songs featuring the full complement of Jicks backing him up.

title: The Life Pursuit
info: Tony Hoffer produced this seventh studio LP for the veteran Scottish indie-pop band.

title: Alvvays
info: The debut release for the Canadian five-piece indie pop band that includes Molly Rankin, daughter of Rankin Family member John Morris; former Two Hours Traffic member Alec O'Hanley; and Danks drummer Phil MacIsaac was produced by Chad VanGaalen.

title: Relax
info: The pop-rap experimentalists release its debut full-length album.
This solo debut for the Azure Ray member includes appearances from fellow Saddle Creek-ers Conor Oberst and Andy LeMaster.

title: Hit Reset
info: The second full-length release for the band led by Kathleen Hanna was mixed by Eli Crews.

title: Guero
info: This much-anticipated release for the eclectic performer--a return to the "fun" Beck of 'Odelay' and 'Midnite Vultures'--was produced by the Dust Brothers and Tony Hoffer.

title: End Of Love
info: The fifth album for Eef Barzelay & co. includes contributions from members of Lambchop and Crooked Fingers. Barzelay himself produced the entire disc.

title: I'm New Here
info: Poet, musician, and singer/songwriter Gil Scott-Heron is one of the most influential progenitors of hip-hop music. Such artists as Kanye West, Mos Def, Black Star, and Air have sampled his work. Now, the poet returns with his first album in 15 years released on XL Recordings.

title: Real Gone
info: Fans of his acclaimed 2002 pair of discs will have to settle for just one album this time out, co-produced by Waits with Kathleen Brennan. Marc Ribot and Les Claypool guest.

title: Reason to Live
info: The latest full-length solo release for indie artist who was a member of Dinosaur Jr., Sebadoh and The Folk Implosion, was recorded by Marc Seedorf.

title: The Bitter Truth
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the rock band led by Amy Lee was produced by Nick Raskulinecz.

title: Italian Ice
info: The fifth full-length release for the New Jersey singer-songwriter was co-produced with Ben Tanner with contributions from Seth Avett, Britt Daniel, David Hood, Spooner Oldham, Erin Rae, McKenzie Smith, and John Paul White.

title: What's New, Tomboy?
info: The latest full-length release for the singer-songwriter from Seattle was self-produced.

title: Swimmer
info: The fifth full-length release for the indie pop husband-and-wife duo of Alaina Moore and Patrick Riley was self-produced and mixed by Claudius Mittendorfer.

title: The S.L.P.
info: The debut full-length solo project for Kasabian's Serge Pizzorno features guest appearances from Little Simz and slowthai.

title: Equivalents
info: The 12th full-length release for Scott Morgan as Loscil was inspired by Alfred Stieglitz's photographs of clouds from the '20s and '30s.

title: Big Wows
info: The third album from the British trio features a variety of producers, including Marta Salogni, Andy Smith, Ash Workman, and Joe Wills.

title: Post Earth
info: The second full-length releases for the Los Angeles post-punk band was produced and mixed by Tim Green.

title: Widdershins
info: The ninth full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter was recorded over four days in Nashville and was mixed by Tucker Martine.

title: A Humdrum Star
info: The fourth full-length release for the Manchester-based jazz trio features elements of electronic music.

title: Ken
info: The 12th full-length release for indie rock band led by Dan Bejar was was produced by Josh Wells of Black Mountain.

title: 20 Years in a Montana Missile Silo
info: The 16th full-length release for the Cleveland rock band led by David Thomas

title: The Hanged Man
info: The first full-length released in seven years for the indie rock artist was funded via Kickstarter and was self-produced/recorded.

title: Cost of Living
info: The third full-length release for the Rhode Island punk rock band was produced by Greg Norman and Fugazi's Guy Picciotto.

title: Highway Queen
info: The third full-length release for the Nashville-based country singer-songwriter was produced with Jonathan Tyler.

title: Pas Pire Pop, I Love You So Much
artist: Avec le Soleil Sortant de Sa Bouche
info: This is the second full-length release for the Montreal kraut-funk band that includes Jean-Sebastien Truchy, Sebastien Fournier, Eric Gingras and, Samuel Bobony.

title: Ruins
info: The third full-length studio release for the British prog rock band was recorded in Devon, Isle Of Wight and London.

title: Do Not Disturb
info: The 13th full-length release for the British prog rock band that features Peter Hammill, Hugh Banton and Guy Evans.

title: Trick
info: The fourth full-length release for the British singer-songwriter was co-produced with James Dring.

title: Oddments of the Gamble
info: The second full-length release from the trio that includes Nils Frahm, Frederic Gmeiner and Sebastian Singwald features more tracks made from their early 1990s four-track recordings.

title: Contrepoint
info: The debut full-length solo release for the French electronic artist who makes up one half of Air was inspired by Glenn Gould's performances of Bach.

title: Of Course You Are
info: The latest solo release from the Guided By Voices leader was produced by Nick Mitchell.

title: Lost Property
info: The seventh full-length studio release for the British folk rock band was produced with Ali Staton.

title: Everything Sacred
info: The debut collaboration between James Yorkston, Jon Thorne, and Suhail Yusuf Khan features influences from folk, Indian, and jazz music.

title: Late Nights: The Album
info: The third full-length studio release for the Chicago R&B artist features guest appearances from  Jhené Aiko, Big Sean, J. Cole, Future, Juicy J, Migos, Twista, Ty Dolla $ign, and YG.

title: Riot Boi
info: The debut full-length studio release for the New York rapper features guest appearances from DonChristian, Devonté Hynes, House of LaDosha, Junglepussy, and Miss Geri.

title: Illegals in Heaven
info: The fourth full-length release for the Australian rock quartet was produced by Lawrence English.

title: Power in the Blood
info: The first new release in six years for the Canadian folk artist features production from Michael Wojewoda, Chris Birkett, and Jon Levine.

title: Skullsplitter
info: The latest experimental full-length release for the Toronto-based guitarist features four instrumental tracks produced with Radwan Ghazi Moumneh.

title: Acorn Man
info: The latest release from the British artist features influences from punk, garage rock, and pop.

title: Man It Feels Like Space Again
info: The sixth full-length release for the Australian psychedelic rock band was actually written before 2013's Hobo Rocket.

title: Nervous
info: The third full-length release for the Canadian band led by Colin Huebert features contributions from Colin Stetson and Owen Pallett.

title: SremmLife
info: The debut full-length release for the Mississippi hip hop duo of Slim Jimmy and Swae Lee features guest appearances from Big Sean, Jace of Two-9, Nicki Minaj, and Young Thug.

title: No Time
info: This is the second solo release for the solo music project from Cold Pumas/Faux Discx member Dan Reeves.

title: Strange Friend
info: This is the third full-length release for the Scottish six-piece indie group.

title: While You Were Sleeping
info: The fifth studio release for the singer-songwriter sees the addition of influences from rock music to his jazz, R&B, and soul sounds.

title: Psychic 9-5 Club
info: The first release for the Australian group since the death of founding member Sean Stewart in 2010 returns as as a duo with Nigel Yang and Jonnine Standish.

title: Blue Gardens
info: The debut full-length release for the Keysound contributor features guest appearances from Rebel MC and Sully.

title: Guzo
info: The Ethiopian pianist melds American jazz, funk, and his native music together on his debut release.

title: Moonshine Freeze
info: The fourth full-length release for the alternative folk rock project of Kate Stables was produced by John Parish.

title: Shrink Dust
info: The fifth full-length release for the Canadian is self-described as his country album.

title: The Western Lands
info: The UK indie rock group's fifth album.

title: Death Peak
info: The latest release for the British electronic producer features vocal/choral recordings.

title: Live from KCRW
info: The fourth live release for the rock band was recorded from two appearances at KCRW's Santa Monica studios in April 2013.

title: Playing The Angel
info: Borrowing a page from late-80s to early-90s DM in terms of sound (and possibly even quality), the Ben Hillier-produced 'Angel' is the first Depeche Mode album to feature some David Gahan-penned songs in addition to the usual assortment of Martin Gore tracks.

title: Discover A Lovelier You
info: Thom Monahan produced the band's fourth studio album.

title: Matangi
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the British singer/rapper features a guest appearance from The Weekend as well as production from Danja, Doc McKinney, Hit-Boy, Illangelo, The Partysquad, and Switch.

title: Lullabies To Paralyze
info: Only Josh Homme remains from the QOTSA's previous LP, and he's now joined by guitarist Troy Van Leeuwen (A Perfect Circle) and drummer Joey Castillo (Danzig). The band's fourth album also includes appearances by Brody Dalle, Shirley Manson and ZZ Top's Billy Gibbons.

title: The River In Reverse
info: The British musician teams with legendary New Orleans songwriter and producer Allen Toussaint for this mix of covers and new material.

title: Dream a Garden
info: This is the second full-length release for London producer Jack Latham as Jam City.

title: The  Rip Tide
info: The New Mexico-based band releases its newest album of indie rock, fusing world music with pop to develop a unique sound all of its own.

title: General Dome
info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn-based duo was self-produced and recorded.

title: Dressed Up For The Letdown
info: This is the second or third album (depending on how you keep score) for the Oregon-by-way-of-Los Angeles singer-songwriter.

title: South of Reality
info: The second full-length release for the experimental psychedelic rock duo of Les Claypool and Sean Lennon was self-produced.

title: Major
info: The second album for the indie rock band from Rhode Island is a follow-up to its self-titled debut.

title: Spirit Fiction
info: The first album on new label Blue Note for the saxophonist Ravi Coltrane features two different groups backing his compositions. One led by his long-time pianist Luis Perdomo, bassist Drew Gress, and drummer E.J. Strickland and the other led by trumpeter Ralph Alessi, pianist Geri Allen, bassist James Genus, and drummer Eric Harland who worked on his second album, From the Round Box.

title: Up Above
info: Asian instrumentation is highlighted on the Chicago minimalist, avant-garde outfit's sixth release.

title: Who's Your New Professor
info: 'Professor' marks the second solo outing for the Sea And Cake leader. He's backed by the same group of musicians that performed on his previous 1999 release, including S&C bandmate Archer Prewitt and Josh Abrams (Town & Country).

title: Christmas Everywhere
info: The Christmas-themed album from the country singer-songwriter features guest appearances from Daddy Cool & The Yule, Mary Kerr, Brennen Leigh, and Lera Lynn.

title: Painkillers
info: The debut full-length solo release for the lead singer of The Gaslight Anthem was produced by Butch Walker.

title: Chance of Rain
info: The second full-length release for the Brooklyn artist is a techno-inspired instrumental album.

title: Planet (i)
info: The latest full-length release for the indie folk/rock artist from Boston features contributions from Brooke Bentham, Jemima Coulter, Katy J Pearson, Tenci’s Jess Shoman, Tomberlin, her father and her two brothers, Nate and Jameson Williams.

title: Magic Mirror
info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles singer-songwriter was produced by Lewis Pesacov.

title: The Winter Of Mixed Drinks
info: The third studio album for the Scottish indie band produced by Peter Katis is its first with new member Gordon Skene.

title: Cassadaga
info: Conor Oberst & co. branch out into country and orchestral pop on their latest 13-track set, which finds them joined by guests Gillian Welch, Janet Weiss, and M. Ward.

title: Remember That I Love You
info: This is the fifth solo album of anti-folk ditties for the former Moldy Peaches member.

title: Loose In The Air
info: Steve Revitte produced the experimental Brooklyn four-piece's third album (and first for Matador).

title: Tween
info: Digitally released in June, the Baltimore indie duo of Jenn Wasner and Andy Stack collected and completed eight outtakes from its previous two albums for the band's fifth studio release.

title: The Power Out
info: The all-female indie-rock band from Brighton, England (who in the past have crossed Stereolab's love for vintage electronics with a more raucous sound) worked with producer Steve Albini on this second full-length, which incorporates vocals into the mix for the first time.

title: Cellar Door
info: Popular San Francisco-based indie producer and former MK Ultra frontman John Vanderslice returns with his fourth solo album.

title: Love Is Hell, Part 2 [EP]
info: Adams' 'Love Is Hell' 2-part album concludes with seven more tracks.

title: The Instinct
info: The Virginia band's sophomore disc has a more immediate sound compared to their trip-hoppy self-titled debut.

title: Busted Stuff
info: Even the most casual DMB fan knows the story by now: Dave & Co. record a dark, challenging album with producer Steve Lillywhite, those "Lillywhite Sessions" are leaked onto the Internet where the tracks quickly become fan favorites, and the band chooses not to release them, instead heading back into the studio with producer Glen Ballard to record 'Everyday.' The new studio LP 'Busted Stuff' does not contain those original tracks from the 2000 sessions, but nine of those songs (plus two new tracks) are here, newly recorded.

title: Handcream For A Generation
info: This long-awaited fourth album from the London-based outfit headed by Tjinder Singh and Ben Ayres is an even more eclectic mix of styles than previous efforts. The 13 new tracks include the excellent (and excellently titled) lead single "Lessons Learned From Rocky I to Rocky III," and a reworking of "People Power (In The Disco Hour)" from Singh and Ayres' Clinton side project.

title: Gold
info: 'Gold' is the second solo release for former Whiskeytown frontman Ryan Adams, and garnered a good deal of attention for the singer-songwriter in 2001.

title: Fugu1
info: French band Fugu mines the pop sounds of the Beach Boys and the Beatles, a la contemporaries Stereolab (who contribute to this album) and Apples In Stereo.

title: Dreamt For Light Years In The Belly Of A Mountain
info: Mark Linkous' first Sparklehorse album in five years includes collaborations with Danger Mouse, Christian Fennesz, and Tom Waits.

title: Surviving
info: The 10th full-length studio release for the Arizona alt-rock/emo band was produced with Justin Meldal-Johnson.

title: Made Of Rain
info: The first new full-length studio release for the English alternative rock band since 1991's World Outside was produced with Richard Fortus.

title: Gold Past Life
info: The seventh full-length release for Eric D. Johnson's indie folk-rock project was produced by Thom Monahan and is the first release on the Merge label.

title: HNDRXX
info: The second full-length release from the rapper in two weeks features guest appearances from Rihanna and The Weeknd.

title: The Fame Monster
info: The New York-born singer releases an eight track album inspired by her current fame.

title: Set 'Em Wild, Set 'Em Free
info: This is the first album for the trio since Ryan Vanderhoof left the band in the fall of 2007.

title: Lookout Mountain, Lookout Sea
info: This is the sixth studio album for the indie rock band led by David Berman.

title: Pretty Little Head
info: The singer/songwriter's sophomore set (delayed for a year due to an acrimonious split with her record label) includes collaborations with k.d. lang and Cyndi Lauper.

title: Leaders Of The Free World
info: This is the self-produced third album for the Manchester, England band.

title: The Life Of The World To Come
info: This is the latest album for the North Carolina-based band.

title: Kids In The Street
info: The seventh full-length release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Mike Mogis.

title: Meltdown
info: The veteran Irish trio return with a rock-oriented affair, their fifth studio disc overall.

title: Where Shine New Lights
info: The seventh solo release for the former Rodan bassist is her first on the Kranky label.

title: Emika
info: The Berlin-based ex-sound engineer releases her debut full-length album of electronic music influenced by dubstep.

title: World Painted Blood
info: Greg Fidelman and Rick Rubin produced the latest disc for the thrash metal band.

title: The Original Faces
info: The debut full-length release for the dream-pop trio led by Grouper's Liz Harris was recorded over several years with Scott Simmons and Jed Bindeman.

title: Occasion for Song
info: The fifth full-length release for the Ohio-based band is its first without contributions from the group's late violinist Noel Sayre, who drowned in 2008.

title: Habits & Contradictions
info: A$AP Rocky, Dom Kennedy, Curren$y, and Kendrick Lamar are some of the guests on the Los Angeles rapper's second album on Top Dawg Entertainment.

title: Parc Avenue
info: The debut album for the Montreal, Quebec-based indie rock trio.

title: Now
info: Soul singer-songwriter Maxwell returns with his third studio album, following 1998's 'Embrya' and his well-received 1996 debut 'Maxwell's Urban Hang Suite.' The disc includes a cover of longtime live staple "This Woman's Work" (a Kate Bush cover).

title: Flower of Devotion
info: The third full-length release for the Chicago trio was produced by the band's guitarist, Jason Balla.
The first new studio release in six years from the Danish art rock band sees the return of original bassist Johan Wohler and was produced by Michael Beinhorn.

title: Desire Lines
info: The fifth album for the Scottish band was recorded in Portland, Oregon with producer Tucker Martine and features guest appearances from Neko Case and Jim James.

title: Foreign Body
info: This is the debut album for the side project of Liz Harris of Grouper and Jesy Fortino of Tiny Vipers.

title: A Sufi And A Killer
info: Gonjasufi, who appeared on the Flying Lotus track "Testament," releases his debut album with producer Gaslamp Killer.

title: Transnormal Skiperoo
info: The fourth album for the Florida-based alt-country singer features the band Olabelle and was produced by Joe Pernice.

title: Everything Not Saved Will Be Lost, Pt. 1
info: The fifth full-length release for the British indie rock band was produced by frontman Yannis Philippakis.

title: Employment
info: Stephen Street (Blur) produced this debut disc for the Leeds, England five-piece.

title: Nurture
info: The second full-length studio release for the Atlanta-based electronic producer features a track Totally Enormous Extinct Dinosaurs.

title: Dead Reckoning
info: The third album for the Portland, Oregon, folk rock band was produced by Adam Selzer.

title: This Is the Sonics
info: The garage rock band from Tacoma, Washington, return with three original members and producer Jim Diamond for its first studio release since 1967.

title: The Golden Casket
info: The seventh full-length studio release for the indie rock band was produced with Dave Sardy and Jacknife Lee.

title: Ordinary Man
info: The 12th full-length solo studio release for the Black Sabbath singer features guest appearances from Elton John, Post Malone and Travis Scott.

title: DJ-Kicks
info: The latest from the DJ-Kicks mix series is from Glasgow-based DJ that was influenced by some of his first shows.

title: The Stimulus Package
info: On his first album with the Rhymesayers label, rapper Freeway teams up with producer Jake One.

title: Emancipated Hearts
info: The debut solo release for the Galaxie 500 and Luna frontman was produced by Jason Quever of Papercuts.

title: Yesterday Was Lived and Lost
info: Felix Martin and Al Doyle of Hot Chip along with Tom Hopkins collaborated on their debut album together as New Build.

title: Odd Blood
info: This is the second full-length album for the Brooklyn-based rock band.

title: The Fine Print (A Collection Of Oddities And Rarities 2003-2008)
info: The collection of b-sides and rare tracks contains songs from the "Dirty South" recording sessions.

title: Whiteout Conditions
info: The seventh full-length release for the Canadian indie rock band led by A.C. Newman does not feature Dan Bejar (he was working on music for a Destroyer album).

title: To Be Everywhere Is to Be Nowhere
info: The California alternative rock band return from a five year hiatus with its ninth full-length studio release produced by Eric Palmquist.

title: The  Nihilist
info: The third full-length solo release for the son of Crowded House's Neil Finn was recorded in Brooklyn.

title: Third Mouth
info: The latest solo release from the British singer is a blend of psych rock and ambient pop.

title: Revelation Road
info: After releasing two albums in 2010, the singer-songwriter returns with her 12th studio album.

title: Part II: The New December
info: Fol Chen continues to embrace mystery and avoid the obvious on Part II: The New December. As on Part I: John Shade, Your Fortuneâ€™s Made, the enigmatic band makes a virtue out of indirectness, sending songs through secret passages and tunnels that end in hooks some distance from where they were expected. Thereâ€™s a strong experimental streak in the brainy way Fol Chen takes what seems like a straightforward idea and twists it into something completely different; like the Dirty Projectors, the group flirts with and subverts mainstream pop ideas, and like labelmates Cryptacize, theyâ€™ve got a flair for the deceptively simple. The band goes even further down the rabbit hole than on Part I, beginning The New December with some of its strangest music. â€œIn Ruinsâ€ contrasts deep, whispered vocals with lively girlish ones atop busy keyboards playing busy, vaguely Eastern-tinged melodies; â€œYour Curtain Callâ€ begins with breathy beats and woozy flutes, expanding into bells and a drunken sax solo before pulling back again; and â€œMen, Houses or Beastsâ€ tiptoes so slowly that it almost sounds like it was recorded at the wrong speed. Fittingly for a band so committed to disguising its identity, some of The New Decemberâ€™s best songs deal with miscommunication and missed connections. On â€œThe Holograms,â€ a tale of forgotten names and words doubling into optical illusions, bounces along on one of the albumâ€™s catchiest melodies, while the excellent â€œC/Uâ€ keeps its lovers apart despite its almost perversely straightforward beat. Likewise, the band buries some of its best songs on the albumâ€™s second half: â€œAdeline (You Always Look so Bored)â€â€™s sharp-tongued chamber pop recalls St. Vincentâ€™s abundant musical and lyrical wit, and â€œThey Came to Meâ€ boasts rubbery beats that are just as danceable as they are strange, and could be heard at a club with a trampoline for a dancefloor. How exactly these songs fit together with â€œHolesâ€â€™ delicate plucking and the title trackâ€™s pixelated folk might be locked in Fol Chenâ€™s brains, but even if there are more pieces of their puzzle-pop missing here than there were on John Shade, Your Fortuneâ€™s Made, The New December is never boring. ~ Heather Phares

title: Trouble In Dreams
info: Dan Bejar, the New Pornographer member, releases his ninth album.

title: Juxtaposition
info: The third album for the Vienna-based electronica-infused post-rock trio was recorded partially in Austria and partially with John McEntire in Chicago.

title: Tyrannosaurus Hives
info: The Swedish garage-rockers return with their third full-length disc.

title: Hypnotic Underworld
info: The experimental/psychedelic Japanese collective returns with their first album in five years, with co-founder Taishi Takizawa re-joining the group as a member (in addition to continuing to serve as the band's producer).

title: stellastarr*
info: The New-York four piece makes its full-length debut with this 10-track effort that has drawn comparisons to the usual suspects (Joy Division, The Cure, The Pixies, et al) as well as to newer bands who also draw from the same sources (Interpol, Hot Hot Heat, et al).

title: Sleep And Release
info: The Glaswegian guitar rockers emerge with their second full-length album, an even more intense affair than their 2001 debut 'Story In White.'

title: Revelling/Reckoning
info: The normally prolific DiFranco hasn't released a new album since 1999's 'To The Teeth,' but now she returns with a vengeance: this 2-disc, 2-hour, 29-track collection of new songs. Ani goes solo on about half the tracks; the others feature members of her touring band. Guest musicians include trumpter Jon Hassell, sax man Maceo Parker, and guitarist Lloyd Maines.

title: Elephant Shoe
info: The third full-length from the Scottish outfit.

title: The  Seduction of Kansas
info: The second full-length release for the Washington, D.C. post-punk band was produced by John Congleton and is its first without bassist Taylor Mulitz (who left to focus on Flasher).

title: The Night is Young
info: The second full-length release for the duo of Joe Goddard and Raf Rundell includes guest appearances from Sbussio and Kwaito icon Senyaka.

title: Salon des Amateurs
info: Volker Bertelmann's latest album sees the composer creating house and techno music with help from violinist Hillary Hahn, Mum's drummer Samuli Kosminen, and Calexico's John Convertino and Joe Burns.

title: Omnion
info: The fourth full-length release for the Andy Butler dance project features guest appearances from Faris Badwan, Sísý Ey, Gustaph, Mashrou' Leila, Rouge Mary, and Sharon Van Etten.

title: Edge of the Sun
info: The latest release from the Tex-Mex band features guests such as Sam Beam from Iron and Wine, Ben Bridwell from Band of Horses, Neko Case, Gaby Moreno, Carla Morrison, Amparo Sanchez, Takim, and Nick Urata from Devotchka.

title: Tearing at the Seams
info: The second full-length release for the Denver-based band was produced by Richard Swift.

title: The Slip
info: Trent Reznor slips in another digital album release.

title: C.A.R.
info: The latest release from Chicago rapper David Cohen as Serengeti (he also releases albums under the name Kenny Dennis) was recorded with Odd Nosdam and DJ/producer Jel.

title: Ring
info: This is the debut full-length album for Cameron Mesirow as Glasser.

title: There Will Be No Intermission
info: The third full-length solo release for The Dresden Dolls singer was recorded in a month by John Congleton.

title: Fanfare
info: The second full-length release for the singer-songwriter features guest appearances from such artists as Jackson Browne, Mike Campbell, David Crosby, Taylor Goldsmith of Dawes, Graham Nash, Patrick Sansone of Wilco, Benmont Tench, and Josh Tillman.

title: Haunted Painting
info: The second full-length release for the solo project of Sadie Dupuis was mixed by Sarah Tudzin.

title: Honeymoon
info: The third full-length release for the pop artist was produced with Kieron Menzies and Rick Nowels.

title: We Were Dead Before The Ship Even Sank
info: 'We Were Dead,' the Isaac Brock-led band's follow-up to its breakthrough 2004 hit 'Good News for People Who Love Bad News,' is their first release to feature their newest member, former Smiths guitarist Johnny Marr. The Shins' James Mercer guests on three tracks.

title: Toujours
info: The debut solo release for Brazilian Girls' Sabina Sciubba was produced with Frederik Rubens.

title: American Football (LP2)
info: The second full-length release for the emo/indie rock band comes 15 years after its debut.

title: Alive 2007
info: The second live album for the duo features the June 14th, 2007 concert at the Palais Omnisports de Paris-Bercy.

title: A Healthy Distrust
info: The indie MC moves from Anticon to Epitaph for his sophomore release. Will Oldham, Danger Mouse, Alias and Saul Williams guest.

title: Lately
info: The fifth full-length solo release for the Nashville-based singer-songwriter was produced by Kate Haldrup.

title: Supernova
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter was produced by Dan Auerbach.

title: Breakers
info: The cello and piano duo from Massachusetts releases its full-length debut.

title: Night Music
info: The debut solo album for the member of the French duo Zombie Zombie was produced by Carl Craig.

title: I Can Feel You Creep Into My Private Life
info: The fourth full-length release for Merrill Garbus and Nate Brenner was mixed by Mikaelin "Blue" BlueSpruce.

title: Come Feel Me Tremble
info: Named after a recent documentary about him, Westerberg's latest home-recorded solo disc contains some of the songs first heard in that film, as well as new material. It was released concurrently with 'Dead Man Shake' by his alter-ego, Grandpaboy.

title: Possible Dust Clouds
info: The 10th full-length solo studio release for the Throwing Muses singer is her first on the Fire Records label.

title: The House That Jack Built
info: The third album for the Manchester, England-based singer-songwriter was co-produced with Shawn Everett, Blake Mills, and Tony Berg.

title: Bloom
info: The fourth full-length release for the indie pop band was produced by Chris Coady.

title: Mothertongue
info: The sophomore album for the New York composer is divided into three suites of music.

title: Best Troubador
info: Will Oldham's tribute album to Merle Haggard features contributions from Van Campbell, Mary Feiock, Emmett Kelly, Nuala Kennedy, Danny Kiley, Drew Miller, Cheyenne Mize, A.J. Roach, Chris Rodahoffer, and Matt Sweeney.

title: The  English Riviera
info: The third album for the electronic band was produced by its lead singer, Joseph Mount.

title: Run Rabbit Run
info: The string quartet performs Sufjan Stevens' 2001 album, "Enjoy Your Rabbit."

title: The Bride
info: The fourth full-length release for Natasha Khan is a concept album about a woman who takes her honeymoon trip alone after her fiance was killed just before their wedding.

title: Play It Strange
info: The third full-length album for the San Francisco indie band was recorded over a week.

title: Why There Are Mountains
info: This is the debut album for the New York rock quartet.

title: II
info: The second full-length release for the Canadian trio was produced by Graham Walsh.
column10: The four-disc set from the jazz trumpeter was inspired by the Civil Rights Movement.

title: Fetch the Bolt Cutters
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the alternative singer-songwriter was self-produced and features contributions from Davíd Garza, Sebastian Steinberg, and Amy Aileen Wood.

title: SMiLE
info: Well, better 37 years late than never. Originally intended to be the Beach Boys' 1967 follow-up to their legendary 'Pet Sounds,' 'Smile' was finally recorded as originally intended in April 2004 by Wilson and his current band, including co-songwriter Van Dyke Parks.

title: Van Lear Rose
info: It's been over 40 years since she released her first album (and four since her last, 2000's 'Still Country'), but the coal miner's daughter returns to the spotlight with this 13-track effort (all Lynn-penned originals), produced by The White Stripes' Jack White.

title: To Pimp A Butterfly
info: The third full-length studio release from the hip hop artist features guest appearances from Bilal, George Clinton, James Fauntleroy, Ronald Isley, Rapsody, Snoop Dogg, Thundercat, and Anna Wise.

title: Ghosteen
info: The 17th full-length studio release for Australian rock band is influenced in part by the accidental death of Nick Cave's 15-year old son in 2015 and is considered the third and final part of trilogy of albums that includes 2013's Push the Sky Away and 2016's Skeleton Tree.

title: Histoire de Melody Nelson
info: The US release of Serge Gainsbourg's 1971 album featuring Jane Birkin in the classic Ballade de Melody Nelson.

title: DAMN.
info: The fourth full-length studio release for the Compton rapper features guest appearances from Rihanna, U2, and Zacari.

title: Stankonia
info: Featuring the hit singles "B.O.B." and "Ms. Jackson," 'Stankonia' was a commercial and critical hit for the innovative Atlanta hip-hop duo of Dré and Big Boi.

title: Rough and Rowdy Ways
info: The first new studio release of new music for the singer-songwriter in eight years.

title: Black Messiah
info: The first release in 14 years for the R&B singer features songs co-written with Q-Tip and Kendra Foster as well as co-production from James Gadson, Pino Palladino,and Questlove.

title: Desire, I Want To Turn into You
info: The second full-length solo release for Caroline Polachek features guest appearances from Dido and Grimes.

title: Conflict Of Interest
info: The third full-length studio release for the British grime artist features guest appearances from BackRoad Gee, Dave, Giggs, Hamzaaand, Jaykae, Aida Lae, Miraa May, Pa Salieu, Emeli Sande, Moonchild Sanelly, Ed Sheeran, Skepta, Stormzy, and Wretch 32.

title: Skeleton Tree
info: Nick Cave's 15-year-old son died in an accident while he was working on the alternative rock band's 16th album. The recording sessions were filmed for Andrew Dominik's documentary, One More Time With Feel.

title: Savane
info: 'Savane' is the final album from the acclaimed guitarist from Mali, who died in March 2006 after a three-decade recording career which found him injecting American blues into traditional African music.

title: My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy
info: Breaking traditional mainstream hip-hop guidelines, Kanye West's latest release features epic raps and long instrumental variations for his most innovative album to date.

title: Motomami
info: The third full-length release for Spanish singer-songwriter Rosalía features guest appearances from Tokischa and The Weeknd.

title: Madvillainy
info: 'Madvillainy' is a collaboration between rapper MF Doom and producer Madlib.

title: A Crow Looked at Me
info: The eighth full-length release for the music project of Phil Elverum was written after the death of his wife from cancer in July 2016.

title: Room 25
info: The debut full-length release for the Los Angeles-based Chicago rapper was self-released.

title: Live At Reading
info: The entire performance by Nirvana at 1992's Reading Festival is released both as a CD and DVD.

title: Love And Theft
info: Picking up where 1997's resurgent 'Time Out of Mind' left off, 'Love And Theft' finds the 60-year-old Dylan self-producing the album's 12 tracks.

title: My Dusty Road
info: The four-disc set includes Woody Guthrie's recordings from the mid-1940s in a definitive collection.

title: On the Impossible Past
info: The third full-length release from the punk rock band from Pennsylvania is its first on Epitaph Records.

title: Supernova
info: The second full-length release for British rock duo Nova Twins was produced with Jim Abbiss.

title: Prioritise Pleasure
info: The second full-length solo release for Slow Club's Rebecca Taylor was produced by Johan Karlberg.

title: Lemonade
info: The sixth solo studio album for the singer premiered as an hour-long HBO special before streaming on Tidal. A physical release is set for May 6.

title: Ants From Up There
info: The second full-length release for the British post-rock band Black Country, New Road is its last with frontman and co-founder Isaac Wood, who announced he was leaving the band in January 2022.

title: Pull Up Some Dust and Sit Down
info: The Grammy-award winning musician returns with a concept album about corruption in America.

title: Sunbather
info: The second full-length studio release for the San Francisco-based black metal band formed by George Clarke and Kerry McCoy was produced by Jack Shirley.

title: Glow On
info: The third full-length release for the Baltimore hardcore punk band features a guest appearance from Blood Orange and was recorded with producer Mike Elizondo.

title: Orphans: Brawlers, Bawlers & Bastards
info: Unlike typical rarities compilations, this 3-disc set includes 30 brand-new recordings--in addition to the usual mix of covers, soundtrack selections, and other previously uncompiled material. It's like getting three new Waits albums at once.

title: Time Will Die and Love Will Bury It
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the British rock band was recorded and mixed by Lewis Johns.

title: Boy In Da Corner
info: This is the debut disc for the 18-year-old London-based rapper (born Dylan Mills), who has been heralded by (among others) Uncut magazine as "good as any MC currently active on Earth."

title: You Want It Darker
info: The 14th full-length studio release for the Canadian singer-songwriter was produced by his son.

title: Channel Orange
info: Love and life in Los Angeles is the theme of the debut release on Def Jam for Frank Ocean, who earlier this month posted online the liner notes for this album describing a relationship he had with a man.

title: The Satanist
info: The tenth studio release for the Polish black/death metal band was produced with Daniel Bergstrand, Slawek Wieslawscy and Wojtek Wieslawscy.

title: Elephant
info: For their major label debut (and fourth LP overall), the Detroit-based duo of Jack and Meg White offer up 14 new tracks, all recorded in London and (fortunately) showing absolutely no trace of major label production values. Meg White takes a rare turn behind the microphone on a couple of tracks, as does guest Holly Golightly on the closing "It's True That We Love One Another."

title: We're All Alone In This Together
info: The second full-length studio release for the British rapper features guest appearances from Snoh Aalegra, James Blake, Boj, Stormzy, and WizKid.

title: Titanic Rising
info: The fourth full-length release for Natalie Mering was co-produced with Foxygen's Jonathan Rado.

title: Carnage
info: The surprise release for the latest full-length collaboration between Nick Cave and Warren Ellis was recorded over a week.

title: Melodrama
info: The second full-length release for the New Zealand pop singer-songwriter was produced with Jack Antonoff.

title: Speakerboxxx/The Love Below
info: This Grammy-winning follow-up to their smash 2000 hit 'Stankonia' is an OutKast album in name only, as it is structured in the form of two solo discs: one each for Big Boi (Speakerboxxx) and Andre 3000 (The Love Below).

title: Set My Heart on Fire Immediately
info: The fifth full-length release for Mike Hadreas as Perfume Genius was produced with Blake Mills.

title: Red (Taylor's Version)
info: The new recording of Taylor Swift's fourth studio album features nine previously unreleased songs that include guest appearances from Phoebe Bridgers, Ed Sheeran, and Chris Stapleton.

title: Home, Like Noplace Is There
info: This is the second full-length release for the Massachusetts indie rock quartet formerly known as The Hotel Year.

title: Good Kid, M.A.A.D City
info: The official major label debut studio album for the Compton rapper features guest appearances from Dr. Dre, Drake, Jay Rock, And MC Eiht.

title: A Grand Don't Come For Free
info: Mike Skinner returns with the inenviable job of following up his genre-smashing debut 'Original Pirate Material,' which was an enormous critical and commercial hit in the UK and paved the way for the success of later acts such as Dizzee Rascal.

title: The Myth of the Happily Ever After
info: The latest full-length release for the Scottish alternative rock band was produced with Adam Noble.

title: Renaissance
info: The first new studio album for Beyoncé since 2016's Lemonade features contributions from 070 Shake, A.G. Cook, Mike Dean, Drake, Jay-Z, Labrinth, Skrillex, Tems, The-Dream, and The Neptunes.

title: Canto
info: The second release from the Latin-folk supergroup, featuring members of Los Lobos.

title: Grey Area
info: The third full-length release for the British rapper Simbi Ajikawo features a guest appearances from Cleo Sol.

title: Sex, Death & The Infinite Void
info: The second full-length release for the British punk rock band led by Will Gould was produced by Xandy Barry.

title: The ArchAndroid
info: The second full-length album for the singer born in Kansas City is a continuation of the story of Cindi Mayweather, the android introduced in the 2007 EP, "Metropolis Suite I of IV: The Chase."

title: Gold & Grey
info: The fifth full-length release for the hard rock/metal band is the first with new guitarist Gina Gleason (Peter Adams left the band in 2017).

title: Blue Weekend
info: The third full-length release for the British rock band was produced by Markus Dravs.

title: The  Guitar Song
info: Jamey Johnson's latest album is a 25-track double album with the first half, The Black Album, devoted to dark emotions and the other half, the White Album, devoted to more positive songs.

title: Is This It?
info: This is the debut album from New York indie-rockers The Strokes, who have been hyped by the British music press following the release of "The Modern Age" EP in early 2001. It almost goes without saying, but the group is frequently compared to the Velvet Underground, among others, thanks in part to singer-songwriter Julian Casablancas' Lou Reed-esque vocals.

title: We Got It From Here...Thank You 4 Your Service
info: Phife Dawg passed away in March 2016 before the final studio release for the rap group that includes guest appearances from such artists as Anderson Paak, Andre 3000, Busta Rhymes, Consequence, Elton John, Talib Kweli, Kendrick Lamar, and Jack White.

title: S.O.S.
info: The second full-length studio release for R&B artist SZA features guest appearances from Phoebe Bridgers, Ol' Dirty Bastard, Travis Scott, and Don Toliver.

title: From Here We Go Sublime
info: This is the full-length debut for Stockholm, Sweden trance producer Axel Willner.

title: Illinois
info: The folk singer-songwriter's ambitious attempt to chronicle all 50 states in song continues with this second installment, dedicated to the Prairie State.

title: Carrie & Lowell
info: The seventh full-length studio release for the singer-songwriter features contributions from Thomas Bartlett, Sean Carey, Casey Foubert, Ben Lester, Nedelle Torrisi, and Laura Veirs.

title: Jimmy Lee
info: The first full-length release of new material from the R&B artist/producer was inspired by his late brother's struggle with drug addiction and features guest appearances from Rob Bacon, Reverend E. Baker, Ernest Turner, and Daniel J. Watts.

title: No Cities to Love
info: The first release in ten years for the indie rock trio of Carrie Brownstein, Corin Tucker, and Janet Weiss was produced by John Goodmanson.

title: Eve
info: The third full-length studio release for the North Carolina rapper features guest appearances from J. Cole, D'Angelo, GZA, JID, Leikeli47, Mereba], PJ Morton, Queen Latifah, K.Roosevelt, SiR, and Elle Varner.

title: Punisher
info: The second full-length solo release for the singer-songwriter features contributions from Julien Baker, Lucy Dacus, Christian Lee Hutson, Jim Keltner, Warpint's Jenny Lee Lindberg, Blake Mills, Conor Oberst, Bright Eyes' Nathaniel Walcott, and the Yeah Yeah Yeahs' Nick Zinner.

title: Send Them To Coventry [Mixtape]
info: The debut mixtape from the British rapper features guest appearances from Mahalia, M1llionz, BackRoad Gee, Boy Boy, Eight9FLY, Lz Dinero, Ni Santora, Shakavellie, and Stizee.

title: Original Pirate Material
info: This is the debut album by the London garage (or in this case, bedroom) band, which consists solely of 21-year-old Mike Skinner. Whether or not this style of music (very English rapping over garage/house beats) will translate well overseas remains to be seen, but garage (and especially Skinner) is the current flavor of the month with the UK music press.

title: Candi Staton
info: This 26-track disc compiles (for the first time on CD) songs from the acclaimed soul singer's 1969-1973 Muscle Shoals period when she recorded for Fame Records--a period that netted her 12 consecutive Billboard R&B hits.

title: Alice
info: One of two Waits releases in May 2002 ('Blood Money' is the other), 'Alice' was originally written as an opera and actually performed live during an 18-month engagement in Hamburg in the early 1990s. However, this is the first recording of these 15 tracks, culled from recent studio sessions.

title: Funeral
info: The Montreal band founded by husband and wife Win Butler and Régine Chassagne make their full-length debut with this highly anticipated disc.

title: Holy Hell
info: The eighth full-length release for the British metalcore band is its first without Tom Searle, who passed away in August 2016.

title: London Zoo
info: The third album for the artist/music producer Kevin Martin as The Bug.

title: Jama Ko
info: The third release for Bassekou Kouyate introduces a new group of ngoni players and was co-produced with Howard Bilerman.

title: Sir Lucious Left Foot: The Son of Chico Dusty
info: OutKast's Big Boi goes solo with an album featuring guest appearances from such artists as Jamie Foxx, Janelle Monae, B.o.B., Gucci Mane, Too Short, and George Clinton.

title: Psychodrama
info: The debut full-length studio release for the British rapper features guest appearances from Burna Boy and J Hus.

title: Untrue
info: The second album for the London-based anonymous dubstep artist.

title: græ
info: The double album (released also as two separate EPs] for the experimental artist features a guest appearance from Jill Scott and elements of folk, jazz, indie rock, pop, and soul music.

title: XTRMNTR
info: Bobby Gillespie & co. expand on the harder-edged punk/electronica sound of their previous effort, 'Vanishing Point,' with their most violent effort to date, earning rave reviews in the process and perhaps matching the success of their classic 'Screamadelica.' Contributors here include David Holmes, Bernard Sumner, Kevin Shields and the Chemical Brothers.

title: Spaces
info: Described as a field recording, this latest release from the Berlin-based composer was recorded over two years at various locations with different methods including cassette recordings.

title: Z
info: For their fourth album, produced by John Leckie, the Kentucky band sports a new keyboardist and guitarist.

title: St. Vincent
info: The fourth full-length release for the indie artist was produced by John Congleton and includes contributions from Dap-Kings drummer Homer Steinweiss and Midlake's McKenzie Smith.

title: The Dusk in Us
info: The ninth full-length release for the Massachusetts metalcore band was mixed by the band's guitarist, Kurt Ballou.

title: Like a Rose
info: The second solo album for the Pistol Annies member includes songs co-written with such artists as Sally Barris, Guy Clark, Vince Gill, Lori McKenna, and Jon Randall.

title: RTJ2
info: The latest release from Killer Mike and El-P features collaborations with Travis Barker of Blink-182, Diane Coffee, and Zack de la Rocha formerly of Rage Against the Machine.

title: Rounds
info: The sample-based indietronica LP 'Rounds' is the third solo effort for Fridge's Kieran Hebden.

title: Neon Golden
info: This breaktrhough sixth album for the German band combines a variety of disparate elements, most notably moody indie rock and glitchy electronica (think Hood's Cold House), to great effect.

title: Since I Left You
info: This sample-driven Austrialian dance outfit scored a hit in its homeland with this, its debut full-length release (following three EP releases since 1997). The UK music press created a publicity avalanche for the band in the Spring of 2001, as the album picked up strong reviews (quotes from some appear below) and was featured in numerous articles. Packed with over 600 samples of recordings dating from the 1950's to the present (each one credited in the liner notes!) as well as original instrumentation, 'Since I Left You' is a varied and unique record.

title: Honey
info: The first full-length release in eight years for the Swedish  artist features contributions from with Joseph Mount of Metronomy, Klas Åhlund, Adam Bainbridge, Mr. Tophat, and Zhal.

title: Eternity, In Your Arms
info: The debut full-length release for the British punk rock band is a concept album about a paranormal investigator.

title: Kiwanuka
info: The third full-length release for the indie singer-songwriter was produced by by Danger Mouse and Inflo.

title: Modern Times
info: Dylan's first studio release since his 2001 hit 'Love And Theft' is his 44th album overall.
The latest full-length release for Japanese composer Ryuichi Sakamoto was written and recorded in Tokyo while he was recovering from cancer treatment.

title: LEGACY! LEGACY!
info: The second full-length release for the Chicago R&B artist features guest appearances from Jasminfire, Nitty Scott, Saba, Nico Segal, and theMIND.

title: Apex Predator - Easy Meat
info: The 15th studio release for the British grindcore band was produced by Russ Russell.

title: HoboSapiens
info: Produced by Nick Franglen of Lemon Jelly, 'Hobo Sapiens' finds the 61-year-old Cale still willing to explore new musical territory. Note that none of the 12 songs here were on the "5 Tracks" EP released earlier in 2003.

title: Miss E... So Addictive
info: This is the third album for Missy "Misdemeanor" Elliott, and it again features the acclaimed production work of Timbaland. Guests include Busta Rhymes, Redman, Method Man, Ludacris, Eve, Jay-Z, and Ginuwine.

title: Bloodmoon: I
info: The debut full-length collaboration between Converge, Chelsea Wolfe, Ben Chisholm, and Steve Brodsky began recording in 2019 but was completed remotely due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: RTJ4
info: Released a few days early (for free on their website), the fourth full-length studio album for the rap duo features guest appearances from 2 Chainz, Zack de la Rocha, DJ Premier, Josh Homme, Greg Nice, Mavis Staples, and Pharrell Williams.

title: Sawayama
info: The debut full-length studio release for the Japanese-British pop artist features production from Clarence Clarity, Nate Company, Bram Inscore, and Nicole Morier.

title: I Love You Jennifer B
info: The debut full-length release for London-based duo Jockstrap was created over three years.

title: Black Origami
info: The second full-length release for the electronic producer features contributions from William Basinski, Dope Saint Jude, Fawkes, and Holly Herndon.

title: Florist
info: The fourth full-length release for indie folk band Florist was created while staying in a rented Hudson Valley house in June 2019.

title: Heart Under
info: The second full-length release for the Irish rock quintet Just Mustard was self-produced and mixed by Audiobooks' David Wrench.

title: Bachelor No. 2 (or, the last remains of the dodo)
info: The third solo release from the former 'Til Tuesday leader finally made it to record stores in May 2000, after a long journey that saw Interscope refuse to release the album and Mann issue it on her own SuperEgo label (after selling it through mail order and at her live performances). All's well that ends well, though, as Mann gained widespread acclaim for her soundtrack to P.T. Anderson's film "Magnolia" and even better reviews for this album, which contains four of the tracks from the soundtrack as well as nine additional songs.

title: All Mirrors
info: The fourth full-length studio release from the North Carolina-based indie folk singer-songwriter features arrangements and production by Ben Babbitt, Jherek Bischoff, and John Congelton.

title: Natural Brown Prom Queen
info: Race, womanhood and relationships are some of themes on the second full-length release for Los Angeles-based violinist/singer Sudan Archives.

title: Feeding the Machine
info: The latest full-length release for British free jazz duo Binker & Moses was recorded by producer Hugh Padgham.

title: For Those I Love
info: This is the debut full-length release for the solo project of Dublin-based producer David Balfe.

title: Shortly After Takeoff
info: The final release for Brian Christinzio's "Manchester Trilogy" features contributions from Adam Dawson and Francesca Pidgeon.

title: Safe In The Hands Of Love
info: The surprise release from the experimental artist from Tennessee features a guest appearance from James K.

title: The Fade in Time
info: The second full-length release for the Mercury-nominated singer-songwriter was produced by Arthur Jeffes and Jamie Orchard-Lisle.

title: Hand.Cannot.Erase.
info: The fourth solo release for the British artist was inspired by a news article about the discovery of a young woman's dead body in her apartment three years after her death.

title: Coloring Book [Mixtape]
info: The third mixtape from the Chicago rapper (an Apple Music exclusive for two weeks) features gospel elements as well as guest appearances from such artists as 2 Chainz, Justin Bieber, Francis and the Lights, Future, Jay Electronica, Lil Wayne, Kanye West, and Young Thug.

title: Big Fish Theory
info: The second full-length studio release for the rapper features contributions from such artists as A$AP Rocky, Damon Albarn, Kilo Kish, Juicy J, Ty Dolla Signn, and Bon Iver’s Justin Vernon.

title: Ignorance
info: The fifth full-length studio release Tamara Lindeman project was co-produced with Marcus Paquin, who also mixed the record.

title: The  Order of Time
info: The fifth full-length release for the Brooklyn-based singer-songwriter features guest vocals from Norah Jones.

title: Fed
info: Originally released in Japan, the sophomore album for Liam Hayes as Plush is finally released wide.

title: Golden Hour
info: The seventh full-length release for the country singer-songwriter was co-produced with Daniel Tashian and Ian Fitchuk.

title: Chris
info: The second full-length release for the French pop artist features a guest appearance from Dâm-Funk.

title: A Seat at the Table
info: The third full-length studio release for the R&B singer features guest appearances from Nia Andrews, BJ The Chicago Kid, The Dream, Kelela, Lil Wayne, Q-Tip, Kelly Rowland, Sampha and

title: Last Exit
info: This is the first full-length release from the hard-to-pin down Canadian synth-pop trio led by Jeremy Greenspan.

title: Pink Noise
info: The third full-length studio release for the British artist features a guest appearance from Simon Neil.

title: When I Get Home
info: The fourth full-length album for the R&B singer is a surprise release.

title: We Are Not Your Kind
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the metal band was produced by Greg Fidelman.

title: The Idler Wheel Is Wiser than the Driver of the Screw and Whipping Cords Will Serve You More than Ropes Will Ever Do
info: The singer-songwriter began recording her fourth studio album in secret in 2008 or 2009.

title: Merriweather Post Pavilion
info: The ninth album from the rock group was produced by Ben Allen.

title: Songs For The Deaf
info: Stoner metal is back in the form of the third LP from Queens of the Stone Age, who are supplemented for this release (and supporting tour) by drummer Dave Grohl (Foo Fighters, Nirvana) and former Screaming Trees vocalist Mark Lanegan.

title: Bright Green Field
info: The debut full-length release for the British post-punk band was produced by Dan Carey and features a guest appearance from Martha Skye Murphy.

title: Wearemonster
info: Frankfurt, Germany IDM artist Rajko Mueller (who records under the name Isolee) drew critical acclaim for this, his second LP and first in five years.

title: Ali & Toumani
artist: Ali Farka Toure And Toumani Diabate
info: Recorded in 2005, this is the second album from Ali Farka Toure and Toumani Diabate, who won a Grammy for their previous effort together. Ali Farka Toure passed away from cancer in 2006.

title: They're Calling Me Home
info: The second full-length release from Rhiannon Giddens with Francesco Turrisi was recorded over six days in Ireland during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Hell Hath No Fury
info: This long-delayed second album for Virginia brothers Malice and Pusha T was produced in full by The Neptunes.

title: The Greatest Story Never Told
info: The long-awaited debut album by the Brooklyn-based rapper is produced by Just Blaze and features guest appearances from Q-Tip, Jay-Z and other notable artists.

title: Push Barman To Open Old Wounds
info: This 2-disc set collects 25 non-LP tracks that previously appeared on the band's early singles and EPs for Jeepster.

title: Riderless Horse
info: Produced with Steve Albini and Greg Norman, the seventh full-length release for singer-songwriter Nina Nastasia was influenced by her dysfunctional relationship with manager/partner Kennan Gudjonsson and his suicide in 2020.

title: Women in Music, Pt. III
info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles trio of sisters was produced with Rostam Batmanglij, Ariel Rechtshaid and Buddy Ross.

title: Same Trailer Different Park
info: After three self-released albums, the country singer releases her first major label debut produced by Shane McAnally and Luke Laird.

title: We're New Again: A Reimagining by Makaya McCraven
info: The final release of Gil Scott-Heron is reimagined by Makaya McCraven with contributions from Jeff Parker, Junius Paul, Brandee Younger, as well as samples from Agnes Zimondi and the Stephen McCraven Quartet.

title: folklore
info: The 16-track surprise release from the pop artist features contributions from Jack Antonoff, Bon Iver, William Bowery, and Aaron Dessner of the National.

title: Chutes Too Narrow
info: Phil Ek produced this sophomore effort for the Albuquerque-based group led by James Mercer (also of Flake), who wowed critics in 2001 with their 1960s-flavored debut 'Oh, Inverted World.'

title: Yours, Mine & Ours
info: Joe Pernice and company return with ten new indie-pop gems.

title: To Be Kind
info: The third release since the Michael Gira-led band reformed in 2010 was recorded by John Congleton and has a run time of over two hours.

title: Valentine
info: The second full-length release for the Lindsey Jordan's indie rock project was co-produced by Brad Cook.

title: War Music
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the Swedish hardcore punk band was produced by Martin Ehrencrona.

title: American Band
info: The 11th full-length release for the Southern rock band formed by Mike Cooley and Patterson Hood features songs about such topics as immigration, gun violence, politics, and race.

title: Hypermagic Mountain
info: The abrasive bass/drums duo of Brian Gibson and Brian Chippendal return with a follow-up to 2003's 'Wonderful Rainbow.'

title: Only Built 4 Cuban Linx... Pt. II
info: The Wu-Tang Clan-member releases his fourth solo album featuring such artists as his fellow Wu-Tang Clan members, Jadakiss, Beanie Sigel, Lyfe Jennings, Styles P, Busta Rhymes, and Slick Rick.

title: Memorial
info: The fifth full-length release for the Chicago post-rock trio features a guest appearance from Chelsea Wolfe.

title: Song for Our Daughter
info: The seventh full-length solo release for the British singer-songwriter was produced with Ethan Johns and Dom Monks.

title: Future Nostalgia
info: The second full-length release for the British pop singer-songwriter features contributions from such artists as Ghosted, Stuart Price, Shakka, Tove Lo, and samples INXS's "Need You Tonight."

title: The Witmark Demos: 1962-1964
info: The ninth volume from Bob Dylan's Bootleg Series contains the 47 songs he recorded in 1962-64.

title: Divers
info: The fourth full-length release for the singer-songwriter features the Prague Philharmonic Orchestra and arrangements by Nico Muhly and David Longstreth.
The first full-length release from Adele in six years features production from Ludwig Göransson, Inflo, Tobias Jesso Jr., Greg Kurstin, Max Martin, and Shellback.

title: 69 Love Songs
info: The title says it all. This 3-disc set indeed contains 69 love songs, all penned by Stephin Merritt (whose other projects include The 6ths, Future Bible Heroes, and the Gothic Archies). The Magnetic Fields have evolved into a real "band," including keyboardist Claudia Gonson (also Merritt's manager) and multi-instrumentalist John Woo, and Merritt alternates on vocals with Gonson and additional singers. Despite the almost encyclopedic variety of styles and huge volume of songs, there is surprisingly little filler here.

title: Caligula
info: The third full-length release for Rhode Island artist Kristin Hayter was mixed by Seth Manchester features contributions from Mike Berdan, Lee Buford, Ted Byrnes, Noraa Kaplan, Sam McKinlay, and Dylan Walker.

title: Ta Det Lugnt
info: This is the third album of psychedelic-rock tunes from Swedish multi-instrumentalist/vocalist Gustav Ejstes.

title: Long Lost
info: The fourth full-length release for the Los Angeles-based indie folk band features a duet with Allison Ponthier.

title: Loud City Song
info: The third full-length release for the Los Angeles artist was influenced in part by the film "Gigi."

title: Charity Starts at Home
info: The latest album for the rapper who also is a member of Little Brother and The Foreign Exchange features guest appearances by 9th Wonder, Big K.R.I.T., Evidence, Elzhi, and Pharoahe Monch.

title: Bad as Me
info: The latest album for the singer-songwriter is the first album of all new songs since 2004's Real Gone.

title: A Moon Shaped Pool
info: This is the surprise release of the ninth full-length studio album from the British rock band. A physical release is scheduled for 17 Jun 2016.

title: Masseduction
info: The fifth full-length release for the Grammy-winning singer-songwriter was co-produced with Jack Antonoff and features contributions from Tuck & Patti Andress, Thomas Bartlett, Rich Hinman, Greg Leisz, Jenny Lewis, Sounwave, and Kamasi Washington.

title: Accelerando
info: The third album from pianist Vijay Iyer with bassist Stephen Crump and drummer Marcus Gilmore includes several original compositions as well as cover songs from jazz, disco, R&B, and electronic music.

title: Saint Cloud
info: The fifth full-length release for the indie music project of Katie Crutchfield was produced by Brad Cook.

title: Dear Science,
info: The fourth album for the New York band was produced by Dave Sitek.

title: Sometimes I Might Be Introvert
info: The fourth full-length release for the British rapper was produced by Inflo and features guest appearances from Obongjayar and Cleo Sol.

title: Return To Cookie Mountain
info: David Bowie guests on the highly-anticipated second LP (and major-label debut) from the distinctive NYC band.

title: Call Me If You Get Lost
info: The sixth full-length studio release for the rapper features guest appearances from 42 Dugg, Daisy World, Domo Genesis, Brent Faiyaz, Fana Hues, Lil Uzi Vert, Lil Wayne, NBA YoungBoy, Teezo Touchdown, Ty Dolla $ign, and Pharrell Williams.

title: Sometimes I Sit And Think, And Sometimes I Just Sit
info: This is the debut full-length release for the Australian indie singer-songwriter.

title: Run the Jewels 3
info: Available as a free download, the third LP (not including cat-related material) from the duo of El-P and Killer Mike includes contributions from Danny Brown, Zack de la Rocha, Tunde Adebimpe (TV on the Radio), Boots, and Kamasi Washington. Originally scheduled for release in January 2017, it arrived as a surprise on Christmas Day in 2016.

title: Persona
info: The latest release for the British electronic artist was inspired by Ingmar Bergman's film of the same name.

title: POST-
info: The third full-length solo release for the Long Island singer-songwriter features contributions from Chris Farren, Dan Potthast, PUP, Laura Stevenson, and Antarctigo Vespucci.

title: Up In Flames
info: The second LP from Canadian electronic artist Dan Snaith is more song-oriented (and quite a bit more psychedelic) than efforts from similar artists, with Snaith even providing vocals on some tracks. [This release was originally credited under the name Manitoba before being re-released under the name Caribou after the name change]

title: Wicked Grin
info: Tom Waits produced the album and wrote 12 of the 13 tracks.

title: Stories from the City, Stories from the Sea
info: PJ Harvey's fifth, and possibly best, album sees her venturing away from the electronic experimentation of 1998's 'Is This Desire?' and returning to the purer rock sound prevalent on her early releases. Radiohead's Thom Yorke guests on the duet "This Mess We're In." Winner of the 2001 Mercury Music Prize.

title: Heaven to a Tortured Mind
info: The fourth full-length studio release for Sean Bowie as Yves Tumor was co-produced by Justin Raisen.

title: Alfredo
info: The latest collaboration between Freddie Gibbs and The Alchemist features guest appearances from Benny the Butcher, Conway the Machine, Rick Ross, and Tyler, The Creator.

title: Big Time
info: The sixth full-length solo studio release for indie rock singer-songwriter Angel Olsen was co-produced with Jonathan Wilson.

title: That's the Spirit
info: The fifth full-length studio release for the British metal band was produced by band members Oli Sykes and Jordan Fish.

title: Black America Again
info: The 11th full-length studio release for the hip hop artist features guest appearances from Marsha Ambrosius, Bilal, BJ the Chicago Kid, Tasha Cobbs, John Legend, PJ, Syd tha Kyd, and Stevie Wonder.

title: Destroyer's Rubies
info: Dan Bejar's seventh Destroyer record is as lyrically dense as ever, but marks a shift to a full-band, guitar-oriented sound after 2004's more eclectic 'Your Blues.'

title: Designer
info: The third full-length release for the New Zealand singer-songwriter was produced by John Parish.

title: Magdalene
info: The second full-length studio release for the British experimental R&B artist Tahliah Barnett features a guest appearance from Future.

title: Where Shall You Take Me
info: The fifth full-length for the Seattle-based singer-songwriter returns with ten new mostly-acoustic tales about America's heartland, including live favorite "Texas to Ohio."

title: Letter to You
